categories: ['Farmers Market', 'Specialty Food', 'Shopping', 'Fruits & Veggies', 'Ethnic Food', 'Meat Shops', 'Public Markets', 'Food', 'Market Stalls', 'Seafood Markets']
name: West Side Market
text: oh.  mah.  god.so I don't live here, but my boyfriend's family does, so over the holidays we trekked from fancy Chicago to peaceful Cleveland Heights.  "You must go to the West Side Market!" said boyfriend's mom.  "Harumph," said I.  "We are from the big city, where all the best food is.  What can impress us here?"Um.  The West Side Market can.  I was in LOVE as soon as I walked in.  We didn't spend much time in the produce section, so I can't speak to that - but GOOD LORD the meat, the cheese, the pastries!  It is heaven on earth and waaaaay more affordable prices than I expected!  If I lived here, I'd come here all the time.  Seriously like every day that it's open.  We bought some fresh pasta (tomato basil, and pumpkin sage) which was amazing, had some cannolis that were to die for, and nommed a huge apple fritter from a pastry stand.  They have cuts of meat you can't find elsewhere, fun exotic groceries that you wouldn't expect to see, and gorgeous, decadent desserts.  Go, and go often!  Way to surprise me, Cleveland!

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantDelivery': False, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False}
name: Rite Aid
text: I really like this Rite Aid.  It's sort of hilarious to me to rate pharmacies, but seriously, this one is nice.  They just renovated it so it is all shiny and clean.  They have a good selection of lots of things.  And one of the staff in particular - don't know her name - pretty young, wears glasses, she's super friendly and funny and will help you look for what you need, then have a silly conversation with you about it.We love having it right around the corner!  And they have parking, which we don't need, but you might!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantTakeOut': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Giant Eagle Market District
text: I was scared to come into this Giant Eagle since the parking lot looked like a madhouse, but then I found an easy place to park in the garage, hopped in the giant elevator, and walked out the door and into a land of awesomeness.My foodie boyfriend and I run into a problem all the time - we use both specialty ingredients like unique meats, cheeses, and produce, Asian ingredients, things like that...and we also want Tide, Bounty paper towels, Cheerios, cheap Barilla pasta, that kind of thing.  And up until now, I hadn't found a place where you could get both.In that sense, this Giant Eagle Market district is the bomb.  The bomb!!!  They had a huge bakery section, a surprisingly unique produce section (Thai chiles!  Kohlrabi!  Purple cauliflower!  Taro!  Jicama!), a fun gourmet cheese area that carried some very hard to find things (ricotta salata cheese in particular, I remember), a cured meats area where I FINALLY found Spanish chorizo after months of hunting, a little olive oil station where you can some pretty decent olive oil in a Giant Eagle jar for $5.99 and you can taste them first with bread and cheese, a huge Italian section, a decent Mexican and Asian selection, a butcher with some good cuts of meat (who chopped up some lamb shoulder into stew meat for us), a fish market area, some bulk spices at a good price, and lots of other fun delights.AND they have all the normal, national brands.  How cool is that?The normal stuff is as expensive as it is at regular Giant Eagles, and the fancy stuff is more reminiscent of Whole Foods prices.  Still, there are some good deals.  We still try to do as much of our shopping as possible at Trader Joe's, but if there's any special thing I need after a TJ's run, I might check this place out!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': True, 'validated': True, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Gameday Spirit
text: They have a good selection, but wow is this stuff expensive.  It pains me to buy $45 sweatshirts, but I guess that's not uncommon for college attire shops.  They were open until 9 pm on a Friday night (homecoming weekend) which was much appreciated, since I needed a long sleeved Illini shirt to wear under my hoodie.  We were going to start tailgating around 7 am, and it was about 40 degrees outside.  I needed another warm layer of Illini-awesomeness to shield me from the cold until the beer kicked in.  Done and done.  They have fitting rooms, which is good.  Not much else to say!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
name: CVS Pharmacy
text: I go to this CVS all the time, since I work in the neighborhood.  I'm not a huge fan of it - I go mostly due to convenience.  Their greeting card selection is kind of lousy - I don't think I've ever found a decent card here.  I keep trying, every holiday or birthday, but every section is just full of duds.  Also, a lot of stuff is locked behind panels that you need the employees to unlock.  Like, razor blades.  And body wash.  BODY WASH?  It drives me nuts that I need to ask someone to open that shelf for me.  It makes no sense.  Staff is hit-or-miss with friendliness.  Some people are cheerful, and some act like they want you to go away.Good things - I love their coupon rewards.  I guess that's for all CVSes, not just this one, but it keeps me coming back because I get mad style coupons like every other visit.  And I had a good experience getting a walk-in flu shot from the pharmacy from the friendly (and quite attractive) pharmacist.  I'm just not crazy about the vibe here.  It just seems kind of depressing, with the stuff locked up and the smallish store with kind of a blargh selection.  I would much rather go to other pharmacies, but you can't beat this one for convenience (for me, anyway).  And they have a parking lot, if that helps you.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Dalmo Optical
text: I came here for my first eye doctor appointment since moving to Pittsburgh.  A coworker and a coworker's husband both see Dr. Hirsch here, so I came for my annual eye checkup.  They took my insurance (Vision Benefits of America) so I had no copay.Dr. Hirsch is very thorough.  I told him my father had experienced a retinal detachment, and he told me what to watch out for in case that happens to me.  He ran a wide variety of tests, checking everything, dilated my pupils, gave me the "puff" test, looked at my glasses and contacts, confirmed my prescription.  His mannerisms are a bit unusual; he lacks the poised polish and smooth talk that so many doctors have.  So don't go in expecting to have small talk or make jokes.  But all your optical needs will be well-met, and that's really what matters.

attributes: {'Alcohol': 'none', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantTakeOut': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}}
name: Giant Eagle
text: I know it's bratty to move to a new town and complain about your neighborhood store, but I am not a fan of this Giant Eagle.  I mean, A+ for convenience (two blocks from my apartment), but that's nearly all it gets points for.  It's so small!  Quite expensive, I noticed, and the "Giant Eagle card" doesn't end up saving you much money anyway.  I think we'll try to only go here for brand items (Cheerios, etc) but get produce/meat/seafood/everything else in the Strip District.  Still, two stars for being open 24 hours and for being RIGHT THERE when I need something for dinner last minute.  And for the "local produce" being sold out front - it's actually pretty cheap!  Much cheaper than the produce inside the store.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'WiFi': 'no', 'OutdoorSeating': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantTakeOut': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Columbia Street Roastery By Herriott's
text: Colombia Street Roastery offers the ultimate coffee experience in Champaign, Illinios. We had the opportunity to take part in our first cupping experience here.Cupping is offered every third Saturday of the month and we highly recommend it. Being able to smell and taste different types of coffee next to each other is a great experience for any coffee enthusiasts.One unique stand out coffee for us was the bourbon barrel aged coffee. The smell is intoxicating and the taste is unlike anything we've ever had. They are also aging coffee in a chardonnay barrel that should be really interesting. We didn't get a chance to try that as it wasn't ready yet.This is the place to go for a great cup of coffee and to learn more about how coffee is grown, sourced, roasted and served.Metered street parking is available as well as a few spots in their lot.

attributes: {'RestaurantPriceRange2': 4, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': True}, 'BikeParking': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Shops at Crystals
text: Yes, its beautiful but do I really need to walk over here when almost every hotel has their own high end mall?

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Great Frame Up
text: I got my diploma framed here, and the lady who runs it is awesome.  The place has a great selection, and it is very clear that the owner came from a different business, probably running a serious supply chain.  She talked to me about how they have never keep an inventory to keep prices low, and they have a sophisticated JIT system.  Only business dorks will care about this, but long and short is the price was slightly cheaper than comparable places.In addition, they are nice, and people.  I came in asking about a special I had seen with a discount off of diploma framing for graduation, but it was like August.  She told me the special was over (and had been for months), but when she saw the look on my face, she gave it to me anyway.You can also save a few bucks by assembling the frame yourself, and the have facilities and tools to make it easy, even a stupid monkey could make it look okay with those tools.  Imagine what a smart monkey can do?  They are open late one day a week, I forget which, but that makes it easy for working stiffs to save a buck of hard earned cash in showing off their papers, if you know what I mean.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Great Frame Up
text: Great work on my frames: good selection and a neat software program that shows you what it will all look like when put together. A great choice when you are splurging for some real framing.Con: expensive.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Great Frame Up
text: Went in yesterday with a 60 year old sentimental painting.  Flowers.  Wanted to try and modernize it.  Was greeted by a very sweet high school girl.  She pointed to a wall of frames.  That was it.  How is a teenager going to help me think of fun ways to update an old painting? I attempted to get the attention of the two older folks working there - lady and man - but they were very busy with other things.  When I asked if the owner was available, the teen told me she was out of the store and wasn't sure when she'd be in.I went to the store solely based on Yelp reviews.  I also wanted to shop local.  But a frame shop has to be very very customer service focused.  These are works of art you're handling....  I think having a willing, experienced staff available on a Saturday is probably the right thing to do.So, this review is for an attempt to do business with Great Frame Up, not their framing service since I never had a chance to experience it.  We walked out and ended up at Peabody and I would send you there in a heartbeat.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Great Frame Up
text: I needed a number of travel posters framed and they worked with me to find the right frame at a very reasonable cost.  Also did an beautiful job framing a print I had picked up in Italy.  Very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful -- will go back there anytime I have framing needs.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Great Frame Up
text: I phoned several local framing stores, and Great Frame Up had the best price (although a longer wait).   My picture was done several days earlier than promised, and I'm very satisfied with the quality.  I'll be back for my next framing job.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Great Frame Up
text: This was a very odd experience for me. My boss asked me to get a couple of things framed for her because the people that gave her the little paintings were going to visit and, well, she didn't want them to see that they had been in their little plastic sleeves for the last two years lol.The woman who helped me was very nice at first, I handed her the sheets, and said "It's for my boss, she doesn't want to spend too much money on them". She went from all smiles to extremely condescending and aggressive. I think she was under the impression that the paintings were worth a lot of money because they were hand painted in India. Well they weren't. It's just something her relatives kids bought at some little stand when they visited that country. She didn't want anything fancy. I couldn't even explain this to her, she addressed me like I had insulted her by even considering NOT spending over $200 for each painting. Each!! And these were little sheets the size of a regular piece of computer paper. I couldn't believe the way she was talking to me. She could have just quoted me a price without going into this long winded speech. I told her "thank you" and as I was walking out she said "come back when you can spend at least $150 for each" It's not that my boss is cheap, she just didn't want anything special since the painting really didn't mean much to her. Furthermore, I was just the messenger, she didn't need to treat me like I was just some cheapskate looking to score a deal. I told my boss about their attitude. She had no idea they were even there, she would have most likely used them a lot in the future as she plans to purchase a few art pieces for her formal dining room, since they're so close. She said she would make sure to avoid them after hearing about how they treated me.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Great Frame Up
text: I got my diplomas framed here. They did an amazing job. I didn't really know what I wanted or how it should look. The lady who runs the place was really friendly and took the time to help lay it out. They framed my two diplomas, tassle, and chords in a single frame and it came out looking amazing. Worth the price for true craftsmanship, its definitely something that will last a lifetime.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Great Frame Up
text: I visited here again recently and would not return.  The original helpful staff were gone, and I was treated in a rather rude and condescending way by the apparent owner.  After delays, I was so disappointed in the matte produced (as well as the process) that I had the matte re-made at another store.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Great Frame Up
text: I've given them a few chances but the absolute abysmal service is not only unpleasant, but they are unreliable and shoddy as well.  We spent so much money there only to have things put in wrong frames, late and late again.  A collage was passed along to so many people that they couldn't find it and we went over items again just to have it done late and wrong.  What happened to the notes done twice and all the time?Our last and I mean last experience is dropping off two pictures they framed and asking them to be swapped out with similar pictures.  We'd have it in a week. It took a month and finally they said it wouldn't work to swap out the identical size pictures.  We went to pick it up and once again they were rude and non responsive.  The pictures were not wrapped, terribly dusty and worse of all, there is now a scratch on the frame!The owner begged us to give them another chance and all it did was cost me time and now money.  Don't make the mistake of entrusting your precious art or photographs with them. Aaron Brothers showed more care, courtesy and professionalism just framed my work posters!  They professionally wrapped each item that was considerably less than the original pictures The Great Frame Up had of ours.  Not one redeeming quality.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Great Frame Up
text: I brought items there to be framed, and was very clear that I needed it completed by a specific date, as was reflected on my invoice. Not only was the framing not completed, they never called to tell me that they could not get the frames and the items would not be ready. The owner did not appear to be concerned that she had not fulfilled the order nor could she do so on a timely basis. I do not recommend using this store.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Convenience Stores', 'Food', 'Shopping', 'Drugstores', 'Cosmetics & Beauty Supply', 'Photography Stores & Services', 'Beauty & Spa']
name: Walgreens
text: Yep, we got water here.This Walgreens is conveniently located between several hotel-casinos, including Treasure Island, Venetian, the Wynn, or the MGM Mirage. It's stocked as well as any Walgreens in a suburban area, and just as spacious. We stocked up on H2O, orange juice, and cranberry juice. (Uh, call us fruit juice enthusiasts.)You know you're in Vegas when you see a puddle of goo in an aisle, and you know exactly what it is. (Yes, I photographed it.)Anyone know if they carry liquor?

attributes: {'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Town Square Las Vegas
text: This is a huge cookie-cutter faux "town square" complete with chains.It's a decent spot to meet folks due to its location, which provides easy access from the Strip and other points, plus copious parking.Dining options are hit or miss, depending on how much you like places like Claim Jumper, Yard House, or Texas de Brazil. Plenty of places to drink, and plenty of places to shop.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': True}, 'BikeParking': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Forum Shops at Caesars
text: In case it wasn't obvious from dozens of reviews online, the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace is fancy and ginormous but still a glorified mall. It's full of premium boutiques (think Gucci, Fendi, Jimmy Choo's) and higher-priced stores (think Banana Republic).The Forum does provide an air-conditioned escape from the heat, and you can take it to get to Caesars. There's usually a crowd inside, but then again, there was a crowd outside, right? Shopping isn't my thing, but if it's your passion, it might be worth your while to check this mall out.By the way, the animatronic show (complete with a gaudy, absurd-sounding Caesar) caught me off guard and is FREAKING SCARY.

attributes: {'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'Open24Hours': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Fashion Show
text: Friends and I visited the Fashion Show Mall to kill time - a good thing too, otherwise I'd have been gambling!This three-floor mall is sizable, with a few anchor stores, including Macy's (last I checked), Neiman Marcus, and Saks Fifth Avenue. When I was there last month, the place was packed with tourists and holiday shoppers, so parking in their underground lot was a larger pain than it is usually.Its sole gimmick: spontaneous, random fashion shows. We caught one in front of the Apple Store. An elevated platform rose out of the ground (including the structure where the models change in and emerge from), banners lowered from the ceiling, glitzy lights pulsed, music thump-thump-thumped - it's ridiculous. Models advertised clothing from a local store, and shoppers snapped photos. (See the photos that I posted!)Besides the shows, this mall is like any other large mall.

attributes: {'Open24Hours': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantDelivery': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: English Garden Florist
text: For years I'd been sending my mom flowers from the same florist in Las Vegas. Last year they were rather unpleasant to work with on the phone. This year I decided I'd try somewhere new so I rang English Garden this morning. I was surprised they answered at just past 7:00AM. I explained to them my mom's preferences - bright pink, purple, no carnations, good smelling. About three hours later I got a delighted phone call from Mom telling me the flowers I'd sent her for her birthday were "very, very beautiful" and that I'd done a "good job" because they looked "great!"From now on,  when I need to send flowers in Las Vegas, I'll be calling on English Garden.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Jewelry & Minerals of Las Vegas
text: My BFF was looking for a wedding gift for his uncle and told me he wanted to buy him a geode, given his uncle's newly acquired interest in healing crystals. "Where are we going to buy that?" I asked incredulously. And he said he knew of a place but couldn't remember the name. Whilst he drove I typed "geode" into Yelp and the first hit was Jewelry & Minerals of Las Vegas.When we arrived the place was indeed stocked, not only with geodes but gems and minerals of all types. We found the perfect, gorgeous geode from Brazil for Uncle Mark after just one lap around the shop. I checked in on Yelp and my BFF was able to take advantage of the 10% off discount offered by the store. They shipped his geode selection to Mark's New York City apartment lickety split.On the hunt for a geode? This is the place!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
name: Co-te-rie
text: Las Vegas is certainly not short on selection when it comes to shopping but get yourself out of the malls and casinos (and the malls IN casinos) and come downtown to Coterie if you want a well-edited collection of clothes for men and women that you won't find anywhere else in the 702.I went with three (two men, one woman) friends and everyone found something. I scouted out two tops and one skirt all deeply discounted on the sale rack in back. I also saw a sage and leather etched mini dress from 12th St by Cynthia Vincent on sale and wished it fit me!Coterie closed whilst I was still in the dressing room and I didn't detect a whiff of annoyance from anyone working here. They kept the music going and made jokes while ringing up purchases. Some members of my party may have also been loud and rowdy and the staff handled these shenanigans with aplomb.I'm definitely coming back to Coterie.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantDelivery': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Di Bella Flowers & Gifts
text: I've been buying flowers from this shop for nearly a decade. Whenever I send my mother flowers, I call Dibella and they always get it right.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'HasTV': True, 'CoatCheck': False, 'NoiseLevel': 'quiet', 'OutdoorSeating': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'Music': {'dj': False, 'background_music': True, 'no_music': False, 'karaoke': False, 'live': False, 'video': False, 'jukebox': False}, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'BikeParking': True, 'Smoking': 'outdoor', 'Ambience': {'romantic': False, 'intimate': True, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}, 'BestNights': {'monday': False, 'tuesday': False, 'friday': True, 'wednesday': False, 'thursday': False, 'sunday': True, 'saturday': True}, 'RestaurantGoodForGroups': True, 'HappyHour': False, 'GoodForDancing': False, 'Alcohol': 'none'}
name: Adult Superstore
text: On my last night in Las Vegas before leaving for college, two of my friends took me here for a farewell of sorts (or maybe they just like to see me horribly uncomfortable?) At the door, a greasy troll checked my ID, and said, "Just turned 18!" with a nasty smirk that made me wince before letting me in.This place is no Good Vibrations, folks, but it is a Vegas institution. So if you find yourself in the 702 in need of smutty mags or a ginormous dildo, this is the spot.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': True}, 'BikeParking': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Forum Shops at Caesars
text: Loved it and loved all the shops in there. Kate Spade was one of my favorites.There are also some Restaurant in here.I don't think I'll repeat what everyone else has already said, but lil guy loved the half moon shaped escalators. He just wanted to go up and down and up again.OK I'm going to update this a bit as I guess even the old shopping area in Caesars is probably considered part of The Forum. So there is that "Atlantis" show too which we've seen a million times before, but lil guy never remembered those trips so this was all new to him. He got a bit scared when the fire started spitting out and I know this because he grabbed my legs when that happened. SO CUTE! I think he enjoyed it, but then when it was all over, he was running around the aquarium enjoying the fish. I'm so glad children find such joy in the little things in life.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Crocs
text: I absolutely LOVE Crocs. They are comfortable and washable and perfect during the summer months in southern California. I'm not out to make a fashion statement so I don't care if they're not the most attractive footwear.This store is pretty awesome since they carry a wide selection from children's to adults Crocs. They even sell those clip on thingies (dunno what they're called) for the kids' Mickey style Crocs.This outlet has a bigger selection than the store in Santa Monica on the 3rd St Promenade.

name: AG Jeans
text: I'd never tried on these jeans before and when a friend wanted to go into buy a pair of jeans, I followed. I asked to try a pair on. They were super comfy except it was pretty low cut and I didn't want a butt crack incident like that at Blackboard Bistro. The guy was really nice and found a few pairs for me to try on, but again they were a little too low for me.I got hubby to try some on and he also said it was comfortable. I ended up purchasing a pair for hubby. This outlet store sells the jeans at around half the price of that at the regular retail store. They're still pricey, but for that level of comfort and for how light these jeans were, I'd say they were worth it. Now, I don't have to have to lug hubby's 5 lb jeans in and out of the washer and dryer. If only he'll just switch 'em all to these lighter versions, then I'll be set. Or else, he could wash his own jeans.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Sephora
text: I'm reviewing the Sephora inside Desert Passage shops. I ran out of an eye cream so since we were right there, thought just to pop in to buy it instead of waiting to get back to CA and then drive to Sephora to get it.Is it me or are all the associates at this location just so much better looking than at other locations? Both the men AND women alike. WOW. Hmmm... very interesting.Service was fast and they were friendly. So nice not to have to wait too long to pay like at other Sephoras.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}}
name: Betsey Johnson
text: It was so funky to see Betsey Johnson's store here. Although I will never wear Betsey, I know lots of my friends do love her stuff. Funky colors, bold styles, everything a strong personality would love to don.I can't believe there is more than one store on the strip, but then again, this is Vegas after all.Friendly staff even if you're just browsing.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: kate spade new york Outlet
text: There are so many Kate Spade stores in Vegas. This is the 2nd Kate Spade outlet and luckily they had a better selection than the one at Primm. But the nicer designs were mostly picked clean while the gross, yucky designs were all abundant filling all the shelves.I debated upon getting a bag I saw, but they were down to 2 colors -- lime green and red and honestly, not what I wanted, but the price was so appealing I stood there a long time trying to decide if I should buy one. In the end, my practicality won over and even though it was really cheap, I didn't get a bag just for the sake of getting a bag. I'm proud of myself.The staff are pretty good here, weren't pushy at all.

attributes: {'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Miracle Mile Shops
text: I actually don't mind the Miracle Mile. Although if you're a clotheshorse, you probably won't like it as much as the Forum, but I like it cuz it has Sur La Table and Sephora in there! Of course if you're staying at Planet Hollywood, it just makes sense to go walk around here since it's attached to the casino area.You can still see the remnants of the old Desert Passage when the hotel was Alladin in the shopping are with its Mediterranean motif in the architecture.

name: Taryn Rose
text: Taryn Rose offers some seriously comfy shoes. I used to love looking at her stuff located at Santana Row in San Jose California. I had a quite browse in here but nothing caught my eye since I was on the prowl for handbags and Taryn Rose only had a handful on display.Staff don't hover over you but stand back and allow you to look around. However, they're ready to help when you need it. Centrally located at the Forum Shops .... you won't miss it ..... it's right by the service help desk!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': False, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Shopping', 'Cosmetics & Beauty Supply', 'Beer', 'Wine & Spirits', 'Food', 'Souvenir Shops', 'Jewelry', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Convenience Stores']
name: ABC Store
text: Boy, not only is Las Vegas the favorite tourist spot for Hawaiian travelers, but the ubiquitous Hawaiian ABC Stores are also dotted around Vegas. The merchandise is slightly different than in Hawaii because on top of selling the Hawaiian stuff such as chocolates, coffee, souvenirs, they also sell Las Vegas stuff such as CSI: LV merchandise.I guess you don't have to fly all the way to Hawaii to pick up some of your favorite island treasures anymore.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Matt & Nat
text: My first experience ordering online with Mat & Nat was a disappointing one. I bought my first purse from them on sale. First Issue: They seemed to just have lost my order. I emailed 15 days after ordering the purse because I had not received any notifications regarding shipment or delivery. (FYI by this time the purse was now listed as sold out on their website) I then got a notification the next day that my purse was going to be shipped, it arrived 3 weeks later.What arrived was a damaged purse that I'm assuming someone else returned as the purse was now out of stock.  It arrived with large scrapes and scratches on it. I emailed (with photo attached) to complain and was completely dismissed and  told ". This is a natural quality of the material and design in order to give it a "vintage" look - it will naturally wear in as the bag ages." Let me tell you that was over 7 months ago and the scratches and scrapes are still as visible as the day it arrived and there is nothing natural looking about it. I was too annoyed to make an exchange as it took over a month just to get the purse in the first place. I will never order from them again. Also their products used to be designed and made in Canada, now they are designed in Canada and made in China - not every sustainable or local. Also they are based out of Montreal so I'm not sure why there is a US address associated with this company/MATT & NAT800 Rue DeslauriersMontreal, Quebec (CANADA)H4N 1X1

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Matt & Nat
text: I can't say enough great things about this company, their product or their service. I've been a devotee for several years now. My initial reason for shopping the brand was because they made vegan handbags and accessories. Then upon further research I found that these guys not only spare our furry friends, they also save the planet. Who wouldn't want to support a company doing so much?!!Their purses look like leather but they are 100% vegan and their lining is made of recycled material. I get compliments all the time and when I tell people it's not real leather they always want to touch my purse (I'm glad they're so interested but I'm not a fan of foreign hands on my goods). I typically shop directly from their site but a few boutiques around town carry their line. The website gives plenty of visuals and detail so I'm always happy with the actual product matching my expectations.Behind this fantastic brand is a great group of employees. I recently lost a tiny decorative screw to one of the purses I carry often. I emailed customer service, let them know what my issue was and I got a response the same day. They asked me to send them a couple of images for reference and then they sent out multiple options and a hand written note.Everything worked out perfectly and I appreciated their attention to detail. Since I've owned the purse for a couple of years now, I never would have thought they'd be so willing to help. But these guys really want you to be happy. And as a result, I just had to buy a couple more purses (but I digress).So I have no problem promoting a company that does so much for their customers and the planet. It's proof that you can have beautiful things produced by beautiful ideas and deeds. I hope they all get rich doing this. And no, I am not getting paid to say any of this, I'm just that thrilled by my latest interaction.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Matt & Nat
text: Ugh, what a disappointment. I had been a customer for a while, and was going around telling everyone who would listen to get their bags. I loved them, and was getting my husband into their products, too.On a recent order (which was supposed to have free shipping to the United States), a UPS guy demands COD $55 for my bag. What? I contact UPS, and they said that Matt & Nat didn't pay their customs. What company doesn't pay customs?! I tried contacting M&N, but didn't hear back (auto message saying they're busy). So I messaged them on twitter. They said it's their policy that they don't pay customs. I explained how I've ordered from them before and never had to before. They said that they auto ship from Canada when there isn't stock in the NY warehouse, and made NO attempts to compensate me for this extra fee that I didn't know about in advance. This extra fee is never indicated in their checkout process, which is duplicitous. It never says "this may ship to you in a fashion that requires you to pony up the fee that *most* companies pay, themselves to ship". If they ever actually get customer service to email me back, I will have to demand they pay for the customs (which most companies do, without question), or give me a full refund.So, unless you want to pay possibly $50-$100 extra for shipping, don't order from these guys. It's a shame, but you can't do that to people!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Matt & Nat
text: Yet another sad Matt & Nat experience:I purchased a bag and wallet for a friend of mine through Red Envelope back in 2014 and everything was great.I finally decided to spring for my own Matt & Nat via the company's website, and shortly thereafter every good vibration I had about this company (not their product) disintegrated into funk and fumes. The ordering process goes well online and the money comes out of your account in a timely manner. The rest becomes a dicey game of craps. The shipping and delivery process appears to be the one thing Matt & Nat can't quite nail down. And! it takes them all day and a gently threatening email to even respond to your desperate queries. I ended up canceling my order (the very last thing I wanted to do).

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Matt & Nat
text: The only consolation in reading these reviews is that I realize I'm not the only one.  They have got to have the worst customer service ever which is terrible because their products are so cute.  PLEASE RESPOND TO MY EMAILS.  I JUST WANT TO RETURN TWO BAGS!  I even purchased a different bag that I'm keeping.  WHY CAN'T I RETURN THESE ITEMS???

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Ink Owl
text: InkOwl is making a genuine and much appreciated effort to be the customer service standard in the disorienting realm of bulk ink retail. I've been refilling my own inkjet and toner cartridges for decades. In the past 5 years it seams that the quality and consistency of 3rd party ink has gone from a joke to superior than OEM. It's also been difficult in the past to find a ink vendor that takes aim at a good price/quality balance. There are several older high end ink sellers who set their price point just below OEM ink, InkOwl costs less than 50% of OEM prices. I own several Epson wide format printers. I'm using InkOwl ink in an R800, R1800 and Pro 4000. So far the results are excellent on plain paper, a couple types of thick fine art paper and canvas. I've superficially measured color, their UltraChrome Hi-gloss shows a wider blue range than OEM and not quite as dense blacks. I haven't measured their UltraChrome K2 (it looks adequate). I'm happy enough to plan to start using InkOwl for all my refilling. I've purchased one set of (8) refillable cartridges, one had a bad chip and was replaced rapidly after one email. Their prices are competitive, their customer service is good and I'm very happy with the print quality.As a general note to those considering refillable cartridges vs a CISS... I recommend a 3rd option: Buy a printer that can use at least 50ml ink tanks (instead of the common 15ml or less) and get a couple sets of refillables.Oh ya and like the guys before me said refilling can be messy. For toner wear a mask and clean with a damp rag (not a vacuum). For ink be near a sink, have a bottle of glass cleaner with ammonia, a lot of rags and clean any stray ink immediately.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Matt & Nat
text: I really wanted this to work.  I placed my order on Monday with no issues; well that annoying little pop up that comes up whenever you maneuver through their web pages I can live without, but anyway - no issues ordering.  I used my bank card to make the purchase.  My billing and shipping address are the same and I placed the order from my work laptop.  Yesterday I decided to check the order; not sure why and low and behold I see that my order has been cancelled.  I received an order confirmation, but never received anything about  my order being cancelled.  I checked my bank account and the money is pending withdrawal from my account.  I email their customer service and they tell me:"I verified for your order # XXXXXX931 and unfortunately it was cancelled by our security company for the reason that the order was placed using a suspect proxy connection I suggest you check with your credit card company if there is any block on the card. Also make sure that your billing address is the same as linked to your credit card. I did notice that the payment was captured therefore, we will refund you the full amount. It does take 5 to 10 business days for the credit to be applied back to your bank account. Let me know if you place a new order and I will try to expedite the processing time. I apologize for the inconvenience and if you have any other questions, please let me know."I contact my bank they say nope no block on your card - obviously since the transaction is pending withdraw.I reply and tell them if their security can clear me so they don't have to refund and they can just process the order and they replied with the same damn answer, but they changed the font color... ummm okay? Such a bummer! I was really looking forward to my new vegan handbag and wallet. Argh!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Matt & Nat
text: I begrudgingly accepted that last order and paid the $79. My friend needed one of the bags for her wedding so I sucked it up. I ended up having to return a few bags from the large order because they looked terrible. I mailed them back and only after was I told that I needed a special tracking number for them to ensure it arrived. Well I didn't have that because I had shipped it already. I KNEW they would claim the bags never arrived and I wouldn't get my money back. I just KNEW it I was right. They claimed they never received the bags and refused to refund me around $500 for returned bags. So disappointing but honestly not even surprising at this point. All this coming from someone who is probably one of their best customers. I have probably spent upwards of $10,000, raved about their bags to LITERALLY every vegan I know and anyone who ever complimented my bag, and even requested my local Park Slope, Brooklyn shops to get some (they did and they are big sellers all over the neighborhood.) And they don't gaf. Cool. Bye m&n.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Ink Owl
text: Refilling my own for years but the printer companies have dried up retail sources like the office supply stores.  Tried ink owl ink and the quality was OEM.  The got their refillable cartridges for 2 different printers.  Had one defect and that was quickly replaced by pleasant phone staff . 3rd order from ink owl today for 3 different printers.  Can't get their site to link to PayPal, but phone order was easy and quick.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Ink Owl
text: I use the Ink Owl laser jet toner refills for my Brother 2040 printer. With the price of a new toner cartridge from Brother often exceeding the price of the printer itself, these refill kits at just over $10.00 a shot is a very reasonable way keep costs under control. If Brother were smarter, then would offer some of these refill kits to the consumer directly, but greed gets in the way apparently.  The Ink Owl procedure is straight forward. Wear rubber gloves as getting toner on your hands is inevitable and protect your surroundings with newspaper.  Getting the toner refill cap off may be difficult for some, but just use a long nose pliers and it does come off eventually. Product highly recommended!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
name: CVS Pharmacy
text: Located in the Epicentre Mall, this CVS Pharmacy turned out to be a blessing for me!I'm staying at the Omni across the street and, while I have a minibar in my room, I suppose the staff didn't deem me responsible enough to give me the key so I can access its contents.    Quite frankly, even if I were to access the contents, the prices are so out of whack that I wouldn't bother.    The first night at the hotel I opted for tap water and ice so as not to open the alluring $6 bottle of Panna water sitting next to be my ice bucket.Thankfully, the second evening of my trip, I found this CVS Pharmacy right across the street from my hotel and I stocked up on ice cold water, ice cream sandwich and a variety of snacks.   Woot!   The only thing I was bummed is I couldn't pick up any spirits, but I gather that's state law, so I certainly won't hold CVS responsible for that.   They do sell beer and wine, as far as I could tell.I must say I'm a bit surprised I'm the first person to review this place.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Fresh
text: All I'm saying is my wife and I with a whole jar of Brown Sugar Body Polish and Caesar's Palace in-room Jacuzzi bathtub was hours of entertainment!!!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Banana Republic
text: We were just above Barstow when I realized the gravity of my error.   We had started drinking way too early this Saturday morning, ingesting 2 Bombay Sapphire martinis before 1 PM even knocked around.   A friend of ours had serious sorrows to drown, and we politely followed his lead.   Someone suggested Las Vegas around 5 PM and we were at the airport not two hours later.Let's just say that by the time we got to the Venetian, around 10PM, the sorrow-drowner was so shitfaced he puked all over himself in his room.   Thankfully, my wife and I went down to Banana Republic and were able to pick up some clean new clothes so this guy could continue his crusade to obliterate his liver.Banana Republic's staff was very friendly and understanding and we were in and out in 5 minutes.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Huntersville Family Fitness & Aquatics
text: I am visiting family for the holidays and joined this gym on a trial membership for the duration of my stay.  They were very accommodating and the trial was very inexpensive.  $22 for two weeks.  This is a fairly large facility, with two pools, a full size gym for basketball, etc..  a small aerobics studio, and a cardio equipment room with approximately 15 elliptical machines, 20 treadmills, 10 bikes (aside from bikes reserved for spin classes), a couple of rowing machines, a variety of Freemotion resistance machines, a free weight area, etc.   There is also plenty of parking and a day care center.   The cardio and resistance machines are mostly new and state of the art and they all face a row of several tv's that are mounted in the middle of the room.  Each is tuned to a major station, (CNN, ESPN, ABC, etc)  has closed captioning, and there is a place to plug your headphones in on each machine - though I did not see if it actually worked.I do wish they would ban the use of cell phones during your workout.  We do this at many, many gyms in the Silicon Valley and it really cuts down on the annoyance factor.   I'm here to get away from business and other issues and have some "me time" in order to clear my head and to focus on my health.  You, Jabberjaws, should be doing the same.Other than that, there is a 60 min time limit on machines, and disinfectant spray with paper towels to clean the machines after use.    Great.  Though washable hand towels may be more ecologically sound. I chose this gym because of the abundance of classes, including the ones I take at my gym at home - which are Zumba and the Les Mills classes (Bodypump, Bodycombat, etc).    They also offer Yoga, Pilates, Spinning and a variety of other classes.I took the Bodypump class and it was fine in that you know what to expect because Les Mills classes are a franchise type deal - so the choreography is always the same.  However, I was disappointed that the class was held in the Gym.   Due to the high gym ceilings it was very echo-y and difficult to hear the instructor and the music.  In addition, half of the gym was curtained off and people were playing basketball on the other side.  The noise was very distracting on top of the poor acoustics and made it even more difficult to hear.   The equipment was also pretty run down - but useable.   I understand that the facility is run by the city so one thing at a time, I suppose.The instructor was good but not great.  I have *alot* of experience with fitness classes and am a professional dancer.   I can safely say that her counts and cues were slightly off... particularly compared to other instructors I have experience with.  But , she was very friendly, attentive, and helpful. I also took the Tuesday night Zumba class and the instructor was a substitute during Xmas.   She was good but not great.  She did not follow through on movements (ie: no extension in her arms and her steps were shortened) and her rhythm was slightly off.   But she was very nice and encouraging and she knew her routines well.  I have been taking Zumba for over two years now, with several different instructors back home, and I am used to mostly VERY difficult workouts. This was not particularly hard for me, but YMMV.   If you are experienced at all with Zumba or other aerobics classes, you'll likely know how make it harder on yourself, if needed.  I never did make it to the BodyCombat class, so I can't say how that compares but I would encourage anyone to try it.  It's generally an easy to follow cardio-kickboxing class that can be modified for all levels.  When I return next year for the holidays I will likely join this gym again.   Overall, it was helpful to keep me on track with the battle of the Xmas bulge.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 4, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Louis Vuitton Las Vegas Caesars Forum
text: I'm simply not a huge fan of LV bags etc, so I just can't bring myself to rate them higher...  but a good friend is... so I accompanied her on her shopping expedition.She picked up the LV dog tags necklace and I gotta admit, it's pretty damn cute.     The salesperson who helped my friend was top notch, even when an older, significantly hairsprayed, overly made up woman barged in... rudely interrupting my friends questions about her prospective purchase and yelled at the salesperson ....  "Excuse ME, I'm here to pick up my bag!"We all looked at each other in a brief moment of disbelief before our salesperson gently excused herself for a moment, was VERY polite to this obnoxious tart....finding someone to help her...   and then slyly looked at us upon return and said "yea, like I should know who she is."LOVE her.  Give that girl a raise.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Harris Teeter
text: A perfectly nice grocery store with some upscale options like fine tea, olive oil, chocolates etc. However it irritates me how they are always lacking in produce.  I can't say that I would make this a big shopping destination, if I lived here.   I would want more free range meats et al. (I'm from California, what can I say.)Service always has a smile...  that IS a nice thing.Plenty of parking, with a drug store and a liquor store (ABC) in the same location.  Handy since you can't buy hard liquor in the grocery store or on Sundays out here.  (meh)

attributes: {'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Birkdale Village
text: This is the closest shopping area to my parents home, and this year it was my go-to place for some last minute gifting.    I found that it was pretty easy to get in and out of and not overly crowded, even on Xmas Eve (this year anyway), which was a refreshing change from the norm.   The customer service here has also been very good, in my experience. Friendly, efficient, helpful.. Is it a particularly special mall?  Eh.. no.. not really.. it has all the usual mid-range clothing (Banana Republic, Ann Taylor Loft, Gap), book, bath and kitchen stores (Barnes and Noble, Bath & Body, Williams Sonoma, Pier One), a couple of Restaurant, a Starbucks and a movie theater.  Parking is good but not great - and it does get ridiculous at the holidays, as usual... so beware.  It is also an outdoor mall... so dress accordingly depending on the season.  I have to agree with M.Josephine... I wouldn't want to live above shops either.  I've never understood the draw.  But should you disagree, you can lease an apartment here as well.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}}
name: Williams-Sonoma
text: This is your standard Williams-Sonoma store with your standard Williams-Sonoma goodies (including a FANTASTIC chestnut pannetone and lovely Peugeot salt and pepper shakers, et al) but what stands out here for me is the staff.I am from out of town but I was here with the family, doing some Xmas shopping and I just found the customer service to be very helpful and polite.   Way above and beyond the call of duty.I would happily come back.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Cost Plus World Market
text: One of the best places to find a unique gift for someone at a fairly reasonable price, from glassware to snacks and beer/wine to jewelry and furniture.   It is one of my favorite places to pick up holiday ornaments and cards.Pretty much everyone I know has been to a Cost Plus at some point in their lives so I'll spare you the details and just stick with the fact that this location is fairly easy to find but parking could be better with a larger lot.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False}
name: BCBG Max Azria
text: This is the BCBG inside the Venetian shops.    It's large and has an enormous sale selection, as well as the usual new offerings but what was really intriguing to me was that they had two racks of runway items when I was there.I didn't see anything I couldn't live without but I thought that was pretty interesting, especially since all the items were more edgy and artistic.  Fun to browse if nothing else.   Customer service was great, as well.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Burberry
text: Fabulous.  I'm not usually a big fan of Burberry but their latest goodies are far more edgy.   And hell, even the shopping bag and tissue paper are high quality.     Customer service was excellent, as it should be if yer dropping a metric f*ck-ton of cash.Bought my Warrior bag (sans trendy metal crap... mine is plain black leather) and matching wallet here.   Happy birthday to me.Be aware that the Burberry in The Palazzo and the Burberry in Caesars can have different selections...

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Bj's
text: The equivalent of California's "Costco" warehouses ..but with a bigger produce and meat section and significantly smaller lines.   Wow... amazing!I can't sum it up much better than that.  If you are looking for family items in bulk (but please stay away from the unhealthy, processed foods, ok?) this is the place for you...

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 4, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Neiman Marcus
text: What??  No cafe?  Not even a small one?  No popovers??!(faint)Well... aside from that.This is a nice Neiman's...medium sized...with a pretty large selection of dresses.... so it seemed to me at the time.  Shoe selection could be better.  Bags were pretty standard. More denim would be helpful too.But no popovers.Sadness.For those who don't know, in store Neiman's only accepts it's own credit card or Amex.   So go prepared.   Online, you can use Visa/MC.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False}
name: The Wax Museum
text: Holy record nerdiness! If you're a music geek, this is definitely a collector's paradise. Beach music lovers take note...they carry everything under the sun in that genre. Apparently, the owner started this out of the garage of his house but it soon turned into the Wax Museum. The two guys that run this place love music and it shows. Please show them some love, especially if you're into records and tapes. They carry some CD's as well but records and tapes are kings here. They also have some vintage posters and other music memorabilia as well. I could spend a lot of time and money here. Records start at 99 cents and above. Next time I'll bring a list so I'll know exactly what I'm looking for. It's fun to browse here though too.

attributes: {'Alcohol': 'beer_and_wine', 'Caters': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantDelivery': False, 'RestaurantTakeOut': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}}
name: Harris Teeter
text: This is a pretty nice, well organized grocery store. The prices are pretty competitive. They're not quite as low as Aldi but they carry a lot more items so it's a good place to shop. The service is pretty good and they have everything you need when it comes to groceries.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': True}, 'BikeParking': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Forum Shops at Caesars
text: Lots of expensive shops here.  I can't afford to do anything except window shop.  If you're a fan of high end merchandise, chances are you'll be right at home here.  If you're a fan of Greek architecture I'd imagine you'd have hours of fun staring at the ceiling and Greek Gods and Goddesses staring at you from every corner of this place.  I'm taking applications for a sugar daddy though?  Let's go shopping here.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Bookstores', 'Flowers & Gifts', 'Cards & Stationery', 'Shopping', 'Event Planning & Services', 'Books', 'Mags', 'Music & Video', 'Gift Shops', 'Arts & Crafts', 'Jewelry']
name: Paper Skyscraper
text: This is a really neat shop filled with all sorts of goodies. Books, music, jewelry, gag gifts and more fill the shelves of this shop. There's so much too look at in here. The staff seem friendly and nice. If you're looking for a unique gift at a relatively reasonable price, Paper Skyscraper would be a good place to look. There's also parking in the back if you can't find any in the front of the lot.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Books-A-Million
text: Good selection of books here. The shelves are pretty organized. I was kind of surprised they didn't carry Wired magazine. They seemed to have every other magazine known to man though! The staff seem fairly knowledgeable and they offer coupons and discounts like most big chains. It reminds me a lot of Borders without the music section. They even sell old library books here for $3. It's your typical book store.

attributes: {'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Miracle Mile Shops
text: Now here's a place I can AFFORD to buy things.  It's like every other mall, except that it's in Las Vegas.  The Bettie Page store here is really effin' cool though.  This is for all the people who aren't high rollers with a ton of dough to spend.  I like it a lot.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Manifest Discs & Tapes
text: Music, movies and other cool loot, oh my. I could definitely spend hours here. The prices of music and DVD's are a little higher but they're a small chain so I'd expect to pay something in the range they price them. Go for the used discs if you're looking for more of a bargain. They had some really cool posters I hadn't seen before. If I wasn't traveling back to California, I probably would've purchased them because they were both just $10 each. I also spotted some Manga and comic book stuff as well. The staff seemed knowledgeable too. Music lovers will feel at home here. I know I certainly did.

name: Ten Thousand Villages
text: If you're looking for something unique, you'll love Ten Thousand Villages. Most things are home made and they're sold at fair market prices. I received some unique glass bangle bracelets here that were broken when I got them. I just stopped in and they exchanged them without a problem. There are all sorts of neat things to look at here. Even if you don't plan on buying something, I encourage you to stop in and see all of the different things on the shelves.

attributes: {'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': True, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: SouthPark
text: If you're looking for a fancy mall with a lot of different shops, you'll probably like this mall. The only place I purchased something was at a Dewey's kiosk to get some tasty Moravian cookies for the holidays. Let me tell you, they're really tasty. High end stores are mixed with some of the usual ones at this mall. There's no shortage of interesting kiosks as well. We saw one advertised for the electronic cigarette. Really? Not a bad mall if you're looking for some decent shopping.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 4, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Gallery
text: Dedicated to all things Chihuly, The Gallery is a sight to behold!All kinds of Chihuly glass from chandeliers, exquisite table sculptures, foyer sculptures, & bowls - ranging from small to gargantuanThe colors in these glassworks are absolutely amazing & the light refracts in such unique ways that it's like you're getting a different sculpture from every angle.This shop in particular also boasts some sculptures that are only found at that 1 store - so you won't see them anywhere elsePrice tags are what one might expect from such a famous artist & his team.  I think the small bowl we were looking at was something like $5500 and the next fav of ours - a double bowl sculpture - was something like $9800......a true collector's dream!But if your interest lies more in the learning & appreciation arena, there are also these really cool light-changing lithographs, DVDs, & books telling all about Chihuly's works & various exhibits......in fact, they have a video always running that showcases 1 of the Chihuly DVDs so you can see the glass being made, learn about the artist & get wowed ( like that's hard to do! )The woman who assisted us both times we were in this shop was attentive w/out hovering.  She gladly offered us info about the pieces we were looking at but there was no sales pressure at all.  If we ever decide to take the plunge & bring home 1 of these little beauties, we would make a point to purchase our lovely from this specific shop & seek this specific salesperson outBut no matter what, if you appreciate Chihuly & the lovely glassworks, this is a place to check out!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Hearts on Fire
text: Meh - WAY overpriced, even for Vegas standards.  If they moved the decimal place to the left, I could then appreciate the "quality" b/c to me, it was worth a fraction of what they were askingSaw some chandelier white gold / diamond earrings.  The diamonds were so small, I can't really say they were "proper" cut diamonds - more like chips.  Asking price?  $25,000!  They've got to be kidding!  White gold?  Not platinum??  And where were the diamonds?  These earrings looked more like a nice filigree w/ very little sparkleBut not to be outdone, also looked at some other rose gold & diamond earrings whose asking price was a mere $37,500.For those of you who have been sucked into the hype of Hearts On Fire, good on you.  Yeah, I've heard of the brand & I've seen many the sparklie with that cut & w/out it & at the end of the day, *you* have to be the one who's pleased w/ your rock....  I was not impressed & even less so at those asking prices.  For me?  I'd rather take that kind of $$$$ over to Cartier

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Marshall-Rousso
text: The perfect store to get your Vegas on!!Shops are located in most of the major casinos - MGM, Venetian, Harrah's, Caesars - to name a few........ & even the airport has a Marshall-Rousso!Lots of sparklie dresses, shiny dresses, shorty-short dresses, & cut-down-to-there dresses, like all the hipsters wear.  This season, there were tons of those "Mushroom" dresses - you know, the dress that is all flowy except for a tight band right after your butt so it's super short & bags out, & you end up looking like a mushroomALL the girly-girls were wearing these dresses!!  Marshall-Rousso is tren - deee!!!!Prices are extremely decent & a perfect way to step into Vegas -  celebrate a night on the town, pick up that studded, bejeweled, or sparklie shirt or cocktail dress to *make* the perfect eveningStrappy sandals, skyhigh stilettos & the like, pair perfectly w/ your new fun, party dress & now you're ready to hit the casino, a fancy-schmancy restaurant, or showMarshall-Rousso has you covered!

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': True}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Ben Gioielli & Co
text: Strolling around the Venetian, saw some nice earrings in the windows of Ben Gioielli.  Their shop says they are a vintage jewelry shop & looks like they had vintage & modern pieces alikeMaybe they are more like an estate jewelry shop - regardless, their selection is lovely!Tried on the earrings in question & it was love......but given we had just arrived in Vegas & had the whole day to play, we didn't want to commit to such a huge purchase right awayThe salesperson offered a large "discount" on the earrings, right upfront & advised us if we wanted to make a counteroffer, she would reach out to the owner on our behalf - this is what led me to believe they offer some pieces on consignmentSo we obtained the info & name of the person who helped us & left to think about the earringsA couple of days later, we decided to make an offer via email but didn't hear anything back for about a week - when a response finally arrived to advise us that unfortunately the owner did not accept our offer, however he did present a counterofferIt would have been great if the salesperson had acknowledged she received our message, so we weren't left wondering the whole week - or better yet, if she provided a status check to say she was in the process of contacting the owner & waiting to hear back......instead we were left in the darkWell, we were unwilling to meet the owner's latest asking price, so now we are back at the negotiating table.... or maybe we're not We presented a "final" offer & are still waiting to hear back.....and it's coming up on 3 weeks w/  no response or acknowledgement.....and we aren't going to beg to purchase those earrings & in fact, this non-communication has left me no longer interestedEven if the final, final answer is no, please follow up w/ your potential customers - when service is such a huge part of the overall shopping experience, have to say we've seen better

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 4, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: David Yurman
text: A whole store w/ nothing but David Yurman & I'm in love!David Yurman & John Hardy are among my fav jewelry designers & this store in particular was just lovelyEven though we were super-slobby in jeans & baggy t-shirts, we were treated like royalty....not offered champagne like the reviewer below but it WAS 10:30 AM so maybe they thought it was inappropriate??I tried on more than several pieces & ultimately found this peridot ring & necklace I just *had* to have......wrapped up in elegant ( & heavy! ) David Yurman boxes & I'm good to goBTW - prices were CHEAPER than what you'll find at the DY site or at places like Neiman & this is *including* the NV sales taxVegas is meant for splurging & David Yurman was there to help!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 4, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Christian Dior
text: Gorgeous Lady Dior bag caught my eye & upon entering the Christian Dior boutique, we were taken aback by the lovely setup.  Bags, clutches, wallets in the front, shoes to the left in the back & clothing on the rightWhile waiting for the bag to be brought over so I could take a closer look, saw more than a few adorable dresses & matching shoes in a nice pastel pink......this place is dangerous!Pumps, sandals & a few flats to boots, I was digging the color scheme of the seasonThe bag was a limited edition Lady Dior & the construction was awesome.  Combining a deep royal blue & black, this was very versatile & the size would hold more than your standard clutch.Alas, it was also $5200 & for a bejeweled bag that would't be appropriate for every day & was a little too large for an evening bag, I couldn't justify the indulgenceBut the staff was extremely nice & the stock is of course, outstanding.  Huge fans of Dior!

name: Borders Books Music Movies & Cafe
text: Ginormous Borders at this location & tons of good stuff to tempt you Had finished my only book while in Charlotte for the week on business so I knew I'd need something to hold me over till I got back home to SF. Luckily, I was seeing a movie at Regal Cinemas & this Borders is right beside the theater - score! They had all the Best Sellers; recommended authors; huge selection of science fiction / fantasy so I grabbed the newest Guillermo del Toro vampire book.....found a copy of World War Z and the book from the movie "Let The Right One In" After all, it was Halloween & vampires & zombies were more than appropriate! Staff was super-nice! 1 lady was singing & walking around the store helping customers & the person who rang up my purchase ever-so-kindly voided my original purchase when I remembered my Borders Club info too late.....never an eye roll or even a smirk. She happily assigned my Club info to my purchase & I was off on my merry little way!

name: Charlotte Olympia
text: Very sweet boutique of adorable, whimsical Charlotte Olympia shoes, boots, bags & clutchesBrand new inventory in the front & sales items in the back - there were lots of kitty flats, showgirl pumps, and they even had the Cinderella shoes that were especially designed for the movie......VERY COOL to see!The staff there were super-excited about their shoes & the fact they had recently arrived to the Forum Chops at Cesears.....and they were all wearing kitty slippers - yes, the men too!!Given they had just received this awesomely-80s pair of electric blue kitty boots, I of course couldn't resist......they were the only boutique to have these ( so far ) so I felt very fashion forward & very well loved by the staff at Charlotte OlympiaSee yall next time!

text: I checked out the new Stewart Haas shop this week and it was really nice. The staff was very friendly and they had a wide variety of merchandise to choose from. There are also a few really cool pics hanging up of old school Tony racing that I enjoyed seeing. Definetely worth checking out!!
