categories: ['Home & Garden', 'Juice Bars & Smoothies', 'Home & Service', 'Specialty Food', 'Restaurant', 'Sandwiches', 'Health Markets', 'Shopping', 'Grocery', 'Vegetarian', 'Building Supplies', 'Farmers Market', 'Food']
name: Berrybrook Farm Natural Foods
text: I have only been here once as I heard from a friend the veggie burgers were good and I typically don't get them in meat serving establishment, so I checked it out.It wasn't busy...which is good as parking is limited in the front of the place.  The space is small inside too with one having to take their food to go. As I waited for my lunch I looked around at all the products they sell though nothing that had me wanting to be a regular shopper here (though I probably should be).  A nice Vegan option.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Catalyst
text: So my last review of this place...I moved out this year and the exit process was very easy and the office/leasing staff made my entire time at this location a great experience.By and far the best apartment building in the center city.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Post Gateway Place
text: I've both rented and owned in this town.................and after spending a few  years in Chicago, I'm back in the Queen city at the height of the worst real estate market in US history (next to the depression of course) so renting was the only option I would consider.I wanted to walk to work (a bank...go figure) but some of the price in the middle of the city are Chicago.....and EVEN NYC prices?!?!?! WTF?So Gateway was a good compromise and Post properties were top notch in getting me set up.   They showed me a ton of units, helped me get enough storage in the building, plus additional parking for my convertible and a secure area along with a few discounts and very quick follow up on the first couple of fix it items I had when I moved in.Add in online rent payment capabilties and secure gated environment, it has been a great experience renting from these folks.  I'd highly recommend them.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Camden Cotton Mills
text: This was another potential rental I was looking at a while ago and like Post properties provide many things a renter needs like Washer and Dryers in the units, plenty of parking and secure access though I found their rents slightly higher in price probably due to the fact they are a little closer to town.The pool is unique as it isn't on the ground level but elevated above the parking deck.A more modern feel than other places I saw, you get the loft feel here.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Top Shoe Repair
text: Another pair of shoes that needed new heels and these folks took care of it in a reasonable time and affordably.FYI...they also cut keys

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'GoodForKids': True}
categories: ['Nightlife', 'Music Venues', 'Arts & Entertainment', 'Home & Service', 'Sports Clubs', 'Professional Sports Teams', 'Active Life', 'Stadiums & Arenas', 'Television Service Providers']
name: Spectrum Center
text: How long have the Bobcats been playing here? Last night was my first time to the Arena and my first basketball game! A friend from out of town (a Cavaliers fan, go figure) picked up some great tickets and asked if I would be interested. Heck, yes!Mild security at the gates with a few people running wands and checking for metal. And then a ticket check inside. No big hassle, but then we were an hour early to get to the amazing buffet that came with our tickets. Really good food, but I don't know if they do that often or what.From the Founders level, our seats were excellent, just over one of the corners of the court. We could see everything from there. I think that even the "nosebleed" seats would do pretty well here too.Signage is good and there are plenty of helpers around to point you to your section and your seats. I found the restrooms to be spaced out appropriately and the one I visited was pretty clean, even during halftime.Prices. Yeah. $40 for four beers. How does that happen? And these weren't premium pours. Just draft Budweiser in a 20 ounce plastic cup. Crazy!We took the Light Rail to get here. Awesome ride getting in, the Arena is right next to the station. Getting back, I would recommend you pop over to the Epicenter for a beer and let the crowds drain a little before getting back on board.Go Cats!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Pillar To Post Home Inspection
text: Very few Yelp reviews of home inspectors so I went offline to a friend (I know, shock!) who had recently purchased a house and asked him who he had used. He was very happy with Jim Matson at Pillar to Post, so I contacted them. They were fine with my desired appointment time (Saturday morning, 9:00 AM).And when I turned up early at the house to meet the inspector, he was already underway. Wow!Very helpful, very knowledgable. I followed him around with my own little notepad, capturing the answers to questions I asked as he poked and prodded (literally, prodded!) the house, climbed up onto the roof and into the attic. Extremely thorough.And the report, OMG, wow. Forty pages of text and pictures detailing every room in the house and supplying detail of anything that looked like it wasn't right. A fantastic list of things to take to the seller.Jim has a good background in construction and since he's lived in Charlotte for years, he remembers what was going on when. So he could give excellent detail about the house that a less experienced inspector perhaps could not.I'm extremely pleased and he earned each one of those five stars.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Tile Collection
text: My lovely wife has become quite the tile and grout expert, having redone the shower and the floor of the master bathroom. So now she's got her eye on a backsplash in the kitchen. But despite searching online and at the big home improvement stores, we simply can't find a tile that we really like. I mean, this stuff is going to last at least 15 years so let's do it right.I suggested that we hit up a tile shop and so Yelp brought us here. A little overwhelming at first, Teresa took great care of pointing us to exactly what we needed. I swear we weren't in the shop for more than an hour before we'd landed on the tile and the grout, placed our order and paid for it.I am very impressed with Tile Collection. Amazing selection, great knowledgeable help.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False}
name: U-Haul Moving & Storage at South Blvd
text: I booked a truck online at uhaul.com and after an email, a text and a phone call reminder, I arrived on time to pick it up. The person who helped me with the forms had a badge that said manager and he made it appear that this is something he's done a truckload of times before.Easy, pleasy. From the time I walked in until the time I drove off the lot with my rental truck was maybe 15 minutes.Now, if the trucks could be better, that would be awesome but I can't ding these folks for that. Maybe cruise control? Or a CD player? Or even a ventilated seat? When you're driving 1000 miles in two days, all of these things would be helpful. But at least the truck was clean and it was as comfortable as it can be, I suppose.Yay! I'm a fan!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False}
categories: ['Flooring', 'Home & Service', 'Nurseries & Gardening', 'Hardware Stores', 'Home & Garden', 'Shopping', 'Building Supplies', 'Lighting Fixtures & Equipment', 'Appliances']
name: The Home Depot
text: A quick pop in to the Home Depot for a can of WD-40 and some picture hanging hardware, I ended up also picking up an adjustable wrench and a small hammer. Oh, Home Depot, what do you have in the air that makes me want to buy so much of your stuff?I also took a nice wander down the air filter aisle (I need to get one of those, but I need to know the dang size first) and the storage aisle (large Rubbermaid containers!). Drooling, I managed to pay for my stuff at the self-service checkout before I ended up bankrupt.Good parking here and the store is like all HD's with wide aisles, good lighting, and helpful associates in their orange aprons who will cheerfully answer questions and they don't just point you towards what you're looking to find - they bring you to that aisle and make sure you're good. I like this.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Duke Energy
text: Duke has been my electricity provider since I moved to Charlotte in 2006 and they do a pretty good job of it. Sure, there are the occasional storms that cause me to run on battery for a little while but I live inside the city limits so it's rare that a power outage lasts very long.They're prompt with billing and they're prompt with taking payments. They seem to try hard to work with reducing energy usage by providing comparisons to neighbors but we're already quite efficient in that area.The Duke building in Uptown Charlotte is stunning. A massive tower of white stone and glass that stretches into the sky. The lights on the building are quite flexible so they can go with pink or blue or red or even a red/white/blue depending on the latest news or current event or political goings on that they want to support. FYI, it goes by the nickname "Voltron."Unfortunately, you need a sponsor to visit the building to get to the higher spots for sight seeing. Big bummer for that. Anyone work for Duke that would want to let me in? I'll buy lunch!I'm a fan.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Lowe's Home Improvement Warehouse Stores
text: Another day, another home improvement store. This time, I needed some of the plastic sheeting for covering windows in the winter time. It took me a bit to find it, only because I refused at least three very friendly offers of help from the folks working here. I just really like wandering the aisles and pretending that there is actually something I can do here without slicing my thumb open or suchlike.Prices are good. I don't know if they're any better or worse than Home Depot, but they certainly have a better selection than Wal-Mart though if Wal-Mart sells it, it's probably cheaper there.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Mobile Phones', 'Professional Services', 'Internet Service Providers', 'Home & Service', 'Mobile Phone Accessories', 'Shopping']
name: AT&T
text: I finally gave in and moved from my Verizon Crackberry "worldphone" to an AT&T iPhone. My purchasing experience was very pleasant, considering that I stopped in to the store at a very quiet time - I was the only one there on Sunday afternoon. This gave the salesperson (Courtney) plenty of opportunity to focus on me and my transaction. It took only about 25 minutes, which was pretty good considering that I knew exactly what I wanted. Porting over my number was easy!Parking here can be a small amount of trouble, but if Panera is busy, you can use the lower lot and just climb the steps.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Sparkling Clean Maid
text: Great work and a great price. It was a bit of a risk, because I never heard of them and there was no review, but I didn't have much choice. My first option had no available cleaners for the date I wanted and the second one never replied to the web quote form I submitted and they didn't answer the phone.When I called Sparkling Clean, it was a different experience. My order was taken by a knowledgeable person, a price was discussed and negotiated, and we confirmed the details. Exactly the way I expected it. When the time came for the appointment, a two-person team arrived EXACTLY on time and proceeded to clean my apartment. No wasted time and no missed spots, they did an absolutely excellent job, including the horrendously dirty refrigerator and all the kitchen cabinets.I was truly impressed with the work and I would absolutely use them again. You should too!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Lowe's Home Improvement Warehouse of Charlotte
text: I finally have all the fence bracket widgets I need for my yard after clearing out three different Lowe's shops in the area. This one was my last stop.Free wifi in the store works great and doubly so when you're using the Lowe's app to work out where in the store your item is located right down to the aisle and bin, including the quantity in stock and price. Awesome.Checking out was easy today as there was no queue at the two registers open.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Home & Service', 'Local Services', 'Telecommunications', 'Internet Service Providers', 'IT Services & Computer Repair', 'Professional Services']
name: Acn Inc.
text: Reseller of telecom (cellular, digital phone, land line, internet), home security and automation, satellite television, utilities (electricity and gas), merchant (credit card processing) services we all use every day. I love ACN!!+++ easy signup using their internet portals. No stores to visit or lines to wait in. ++ customer service by phone, chat or even text message! Cool!++ with their phone service I have a desk phone I can take with me anywhere there's internet and I have free international calling!++ with their phone service I have a mobile phone voip app I can use anywhere without international roaming and long distance. ++ pick from any of the three major USA cellular networks and they have a "white label" (private brand called Flash Wireless) on which you can get a great plan for yourself or your family. + cellplatinum.com is their partner for unlocked phones at great prices delivered to your door and ready for activation on whichever network you chose. ++ if you're a business owner they also have a credit card (merchant services) partner called Anovia. Easy to use and reconcile. They even have a dongle for your mobile phone if you're a small business on the go. XOOM ENERGYThrough their partner you can get electricity and gas on your terms.+++ fixed and variable plans depending on your savvy and interest+++ green power option too! Choose to buy only power from renewable sources if you want!!!BUT MY FAVORITE ISVIVINT HOME SECURITY AND AUTOMATION+++++ fully integrated and internet enabled home automation and security. Imagine...+++'get up at night and the motion detector senses you and turns the lights on. And then turns them off 10 minutes later!+++ unlock your front door (and disarm your system) when your maintenance man rings your doorbell after you speak with him through your mobile app and then watch him on your internal cameras, all from your hotel in Paris!!!+++ be notified by text message when your spouse or child returns home, or when they don't!!The possibilities are endless, and ACN Vivint's technicians spend all day with you to set it up and make your automation dream come true!WHAT'S NEXT??I love to think what acn will get into next. Car insurance? Banking? Personal Investments? I won't be surprised! They're always in touch with the hottest thing and the coolest phones. GOTCHAS:## over several years, I've had a very few bad customer service experiences. Just escalate and a manager will ALWAYS make it right.  Or ask Tor ACN Rep and they can help you get it fixed. ## if you're a utility customer, be savvy and get informed! To get the best deal you should watch rates and lock in when the price is low.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Lighting Fixtures & Equipment', 'Shopping', 'Home & Service', 'Home & Garden', 'Home Decor', 'Hardware Stores']
name: City Lights
text: This is where you go to find that obscure light fixture replacement that you just can't find anywhere.Yeah, you know the one. That old lamp your great aunt had that you kept because the shade was so retro. The one so heavy it could be a murder weapon in Clue. Yeah that one. The one with the g.e. bulb that was made the way they used to make them... to last for 10 years.What are you gonna do when that thing finally burns out? No chance in hell you're gonna find it in these days of eco-green compact-fluorescence walmart hell...Head to city lights.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Catalyst
text: We rented a room on the 25th floor this weekend and were floored by how awesome it was! My SIL lives in the building and six of us family members were coming to town to watch her run in the Charlotte Marathon. The spacious two-bedroom was decked out with amenities and was basically a really nice furnished apartment with everything we could ask for. It made family time so easy because we were all in the same space. The views were spectacular from that height and the sunsets were even better. Really, our stay couldn't have been better (okay, maybe if the marathon music didn't start rehearsals sooo early--but that's #westcoasterprobs). I'd stay there again and again!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Terra West Management Services
text: One of the worst companies I have ever had to deal with.  No one seems to know what is going on or what to do.  It almost as if they deliberately go out of their way to inconvenience and trouble you.Every month tenants have to mail in the HOD, no electronic payments allowed since you have to send in payment ticket and of course each payment ticket requires its own check.  Heaven forbid the accounting department do any bookkeeping or anything.  I received a notice that one of my monthly HOA dues was late, but the other was not, strange since I send them both in the same envelope and both checks were cashed on the due date.  I just figured they realized their mistake and waited for a letter telling me to disregard the first notice.  Well, after 4 weeks I decided to drop off my HOA dues...I was told I have a surplus for one of my accounts!.  After further inquiry and a call to the accounting department, it turns out the checks from the previous month were applied to the wrong account.  AMAZING...no one in the accounting department checked their work from the previous month.  If I hadn't went in person to the Terra West office, no one would have caught and corrected the mistake.  I really wish there were more choices in property management here in Las Vegas.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Roundpoint Mortgage Company
text: This company was able to deliver a good rate, 4.6% on a 20 year HARP refi, but terrible communication especially toward closing made it an overall terrible experience. It was so bad it felt as if they were trying to hide something.After turning in all the requested documentation I did not hear ANYTHING from them until one Wednesday I get a call saying my loan is ready to close, when can I do it, this Friday, this Saturday, or Monday? I told them I couldn't close on any of the days they offered nor could I do it next week as I would be out of town on work. Keep in mind, no one has called to review closing documents with me, to ask if I needed any explanation on the final costs, etc.The "closing coordinator" then informed me that my rate lock would expire next Friday and that she would have to talk to my loan officer, Bryan Partridge. That is when the high pressure, hard sales come into play. Bryan calls me and tells me that they would need to charge an 1/8 of a point if I wanted to extend the rate lock and that the rate lock had already been extended one week. WHAT?! I had never up to this point requested a rate lock extension, when did this happen?! "Oh, we [roundpoint financial] had to extend it one week because we made a mistake in the processing of your loan," Bryan tells me. If they had not required that extra week, I could have closed when I was not working, had plenty of time to review and ask questions about the closing costs and documents, but no, I need to accommodate them, no accommodation for the customer. Geez, I should have charged them an 1/8 point! I tried to explain to Bryan that I will be working next week, so I will be too busy to go over the documents, etc. He keeps on reminding me that the rate lock has already been extended a week and I have to keep on reminding him that I didn't request that extension. Bryan says he will need to discuss this and he will call me back. He calls back and says if he can get the closing documents to me for me to review by Friday would that be okay, because he "wants to work with me and accommodate [my] needs." Yeah what a crock of $h!t. Of course, he doesn't get me the documents by Friday, instead he gets them to me Monday evening. Of course the documents are as clear as mud. Different figures and sums in different formats (HUD documents vs roundpoint documents) so trying to figure things out was very difficult.I was working in AZ and I had to work past 3 pm everyday so by the time I got off work, roundpoint financial was already closed on the east coast, so no one to answer any questions. I would email my "senior" loan officer, Bryan, but if and when he responded, he would often not answer all my questions or answer them very vaguely, e.g. "we already discussed that." I did get a closing requirements letter from their closing coordinator. On that letter, it was clearly stated I had the right to rescind the loan after closing, this made me feel a little better. That didn't last long. When it came time to finally sign the documents with the notary, it was a hot, sticky mess. Supplemental documents that were initially given to me to review, were not in the actual closing documents for me to sign and vice versa. The notary wanted me to sign documents that were not initially given for me to review. I told the notary I could always rescind, but the she, the notary, has to inform me that I could not since this was an investment property. I think that is p!$$ poor when the notary, who doesn't know anything about the closing costs, has to explain the details of the loan to me. Overall, if you do choose to work with this company be very cautious and suspect of everything they do. Do not be afraid to ask questions, demand answers, scrutinize numbers, or even walk away. I would avoid Bryan Partridge. Even though he is a "senior" loan officer, I think that means he is good at high pressure sales and avoiding questions.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Camden Cotton Mills
text: A friend of mine used to live at the Cotton Mills and we used to love going to hang out at his loft-style apartment.  Everything looked so modern and retro (although having modern/retro furniture helped).  One night, we rented some space on the rooftop for a party where we had a counter, etc. to put our food and drink...and cake!  It was a beautiful evening and we had a great view of the city (although I hear the new Vue building is going to ruin that view; ironic, isn't it?).  The location of the Cotton Mills is awesome, too.  Walking to everything Uptown is a definite convenience.  The downsides?  The price, of course.  You definitely have to pay a premium to live right in Uptown.  And one of my friends had their car broken into in the visitors' lot of the parking garage.  The only thing that I didn't like about the loft apartment itself was that there were no doors between the bedroom and the kitchen and living room to which it connected.  There was just an entryway.  Nice if you live alone, but...   I guess that's what you get for a loft apartment, though -- everything's wide open.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: High Cotton Home Company
text: Furniture is a little bit of mystery to me. I mean, I have some, but I'm always impressed when I see friend's homes so gorgeously decorated with plush and comfy pieces, modern touches and fantastic accessories. When I heard that High Cotton Home was opening, I was more than excited to check it out! The space (previously EQ3) hasn't changed too much inside, so it's still a nice, long store with plenty of walking room and ample space to check out the wares. The furniture is fantastic - accessible and chic. These are the types of pieces I would love to have in my home when I move/redecorate. They're comfy without being worn, modern but not uber trendy and beautifully classic. While you won't find Rooms To Go prices here, these pieces are higher quality so expect to pay a bit more. However, I also saw a smattering of market samples - with sofas in the $1200-$1600 range for really great fabrics and styles. You'll find everything from lamps to dressers to beds to chairs to coffee tables - and each piece is really special and unique. Plus, the owners are incredibly nice people and more than willing to help you find whatever you're looking for to make your house a home. I'm definitely a fan of High Cotton and I imagine many others will be too.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'GoodForKids': True}
categories: ['Nightlife', 'Music Venues', 'Arts & Entertainment', 'Home & Service', 'Sports Clubs', 'Professional Sports Teams', 'Active Life', 'Stadiums & Arenas', 'Television Service Providers']
name: Spectrum Center
text: HUGE, clean, fun. Yes, indeed, those are three adjectives that accurately portray TWC Arena. I've been to TWC Arena for a few concerts and one Bobcats basketball game - and every time I leave there, I'm always saying to myself - wow, that's a really nice arena. The staff in every aspect have been great - nice ticket takers, kind will call holders, funny concession peeps and more. And, seriously, that's pretty amazing for this large of a venue. In addition, there are so many options for food & beverage. Granted, you'll pay for  - you'll pay a lot for it, but I'm pretty sure everyone knows that going in.Parking is pretty much a breeze, as there are tons of parking decks nearby that will lead you right to the arena. Plus, you can always take the light rail right into the city if you're drinking the Uptown parking haterade. Here's hoping that TWC arena will continue to bring great acts to Charlotte and always improve upon their facility!

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Interior Design', "Women's Clothing", 'Furniture Stores', 'Arts & Crafts', 'Home & Service', 'Fashion', 'Shopping', 'Fabric Stores', 'Home Decor', 'Home & Garden']
name: Cottage Chic
text: Cottage Chic is indeed chic. Beautiful bedding (shabby chic style). Delicious scented candles. Lovely and delicate jewelry. Pretty pretty handbags. Adorable baby items and sweet onesies. A well-selected array of clothing...jeans, tops, dresses, etc. It smells delightful in here, all zee time. This is most certainly an excellent place to nab a gift for just about any lady. Be aware that the prices are a bit steep but the products are lovely. And, if you're ever in town for their June tent sale...get there. You're welcome.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Alexander Scott
text: I've always wondered about the large, pretty white building right off of South & East boulevards. And then  I heard about a Tidbits launch party launching at Alexander Scott...a new interiors and home furnishings biz housed in that very building! First of all, it's huge. It's a very large building. And there is so much merchandise gracing every room. It's nicely laid out, if a bit crowded, with custom furniture, ready made pieces, candles, bedding, jewelry, cards, paintings, and beautiful home goods. I even spied some vintage chandeliers and suitcases in the mix! There are two levels to explore so be ready to spend a bit of time in the store searching through all the treasures. While I really enjoyed the beautiful furniture and fabrics, there were a few extra bright spots worth mentioning: -Alexander Scott has a great selection of jewelry. Very impressive and uber affordable. This was a shocker to me. Pretty cuffs from $25-$50, necklaces from $40-$100, etc. All sorts of styles, materials and tastes. -There's a fantastic collection of handmade greeting cards (on both levels). Many of these items are crafted by local and regional artists. My favorite? A card that simple read, "You are the Milli to my Vanilli. Girl you know it's true." Hell to the yeah. -The staff were welcoming and very sweet. No uppity attitudes here. If you're shopping along East Blvd., Alexander Scott is a fantastic stop...for your home, yourself or to snag a gift!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Mobile Phones', 'Professional Services', 'Internet Service Providers', 'Home & Service', 'Mobile Phone Accessories', 'Shopping']
name: AT&T
text: Besides my husband and brownies, my iPhone is one of the great loves of my life. Since AT&T is currently the only carrier to host service for my precious iPhone, I stopped by my local store to order up the iPhone 4. Now, sometimes mobile carrier stores can vaguely resemble used car dealerships. No, not because they sell used stuff, but because they can just be filled with jargon, slick sales pitches and mile-long contracts. Not so much at this AT&T store. It's purty inside, filled with tons of fun, shiny phones and accessories. The store is impeccably clean and there are some sweet flatscreen TVs near the back of the store that you can oogle while you wait. It's important to note that every employee we worked with was super friendly, helpful and courteous. And dressed so nicely, natch!While the salespeople may lean hard on the iPhone, I was there to order my iPhone 4 anyway no hard pitch needed. Hubs and I worked with Tyler and Malcolm to transfer my old phone to hubs, set up family plan and order my new, shiny iPhone 4. Both of these guys were super patient and helped answer all of my (surely irksome) questions that I had. This AT&T store is sharp and inviting inside and out. Regardless of my occasionally questionable reception, I plan to stick with AT&T...especially if they keep carrying Apple products!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Real Estate', 'Home Staging', 'Packing Services', 'Movers', 'Local Services', 'Home & Service', 'Self Storage']
name: Easy Movers
text: Packing up and moving your life across the country can be pretty hectic. This task lands on the bottom tiers of "things I enjoy." However, when it came time to select a moving company to transport the family goods from Charlotte to Chicago, Easy Movers was a fine choice overall.Since hubs did the front end work of setting up and negotiating with the administrative folks, the only piece I can really comment on is that they stay true to their word. Promises were kept and our household items arrived in Chicago on time and in great shape. The actual guys who moved our boxes and furniture were polite, funny and efficient. The items from our two bedroom townhome were unloaded into our new home in a half day's time. If you're moving in or out of the Charlotte area, Easy Movers is a solid choice!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Belk Shoe Repair
text: I love shoes. Sometimes I love them too much - and by that I mean I will wear the crap out of my shoes. You know what I'm talking about - the heel plug falls out or the leather starts lookin' oh so sad. That's what I love the Belk Shoe Repair - they put the life back into my shoez.As Chelsea mentioned, the folks here are honest. If they can't fix your sad soles, then they won't attempt it (or charge you). Hubs has taken his ridiculously pricey shoes here many a time and they come back looking fabulous. And my heels (albeit much cheaper) return to my closet with zeal. Whether you need a shoe completely resoled, non-slip pads added, a heel fixed or just a good ole sprucing up, you can trust your footwear here.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
categories: ['Home & Service', 'Mortgage Brokers', 'Banks & Credit Unions', 'Financial Services', 'Real Estate']
name: Bank of America
text: I probably step foot into a bank three times per year. Seriously....I'm more of an ATM kind of girl. So, it makes me all giddy inside to report that this Bank of America is not only clean and sparkly, but it's filled with really nice tellers, efficient services and a notary. Woot.I rolled up to this BoA to grab some cash (many ATMs outside and drive through, folks) and more importantly, to acquire a certified check. These are the errands that I truly despise, because past experience has shown that certified checks can be obnoxious and take a while. Plus, I also needed a notary. Another potentially laborious process. But guess what? The very nice teller took care of my certified check in 5 minutes and directed me to their notary just a moment later. And the icing on the cake? The notary service was free. Yeah - I should have known beforehand that banks provide their customers with free notary services, but, frankly, I never really thought about it. While I'll continue to be an ATM kinda gal, it's nice to know that folks inside this bank are getting the job done.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Duke Energy
text: Since I'm on the Home & Service and utilities kick, it's only fair to review Duke Energy! My comments are pretty straightforward, similar to the Duke bill I receive every month. I've only had to call customer service on one occasion and they were pretty quick to remedy my issue and address any other questions I had. They also send out a box of free CFL lightbulbs to ensure your home is more energy efficient. NICE! I also appreciate their social media involvement - they keep those Twitter feeds full of pertinent utility related information when a dangerous weather is a-brewing!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Internet Service Providers', 'Home Automation', 'Television Service Providers', 'Professional Services', 'Home & Service', 'Security Systems']
name: Spectrum
text: While I have yet to fall in love with Time Warner Cable, I absolutely feel that they deserve (and earn) another star because of my recent interactions with their Twitter handle and help group, @TWCableHelp. I wish the sales team was as awesome, efficient and helpful as they are. I was having a nagging problem with my Movies On Demand feature - it was freezing on me, then not playing, then not starting, then not buying movies at all. It was incredibly annoying that I couldn't watch my purchased movie! I used the @TWCableHelp handle and one of the support reps tweeted me back within minutes. After a few interactions, I direct messaged my account name and number to one of the support techs and they diagnosed the problem and assisted in a full restart of the system. Bam, movie back on, and I was able to play it continuously. If you have a more complicated issue that they can't handle remotely, they can schedule a tech visit with you over Twitter, too. Is this tech group going to change my entire opinion of TWC? No, but I'll tell you one thing, next time I have any sort of tech problem with my cable service, I'm going to tweet to their Twitter handle first before waiting on the phone for an obscene amount of time. Yay technology.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Cleveland Lighting
text: I got much of my new lighting from this establishment.  Reasonably friendly and helpful, and a fairly deep selection of lighting.  Conveniently located on Mayfield -- which is a plus.  The lighting is on the expensive side, so only go to shop if you're in the market for nicer lighting...

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Roadrunner Moving & Storage Cleveland
text: Note that my review was removed by yelp - as this business appears under multiple sites.  This was the Ohio based branch that made my move and is the one that I am reviewing.-------This review represents the culmination of several months of wrangling with one of the worst companies I've ever had the DISpleasure of working with, and one of the most painful customer experiences that I've ever had in my life here on earth. I will break the review into a couple segments for clarity.This is a painful review to write, and I will make sure this review goes to both Angie's List and Yelp as well as Movers.com.Bullet Points:Overpromise, Underdeliver. High Pressure Sales tactics. Poor customer service and follow up. I quote: "You'll be satisfied with our service. We'll make you happy. We're very proud of our Angie's list B+ rating"The Plan:Day 1: 8-12 am arrival, half day to pack.Day 2: Transport to target cityDay 3: 8 am delivery.Actual:Day 1 arrival: 4:30 pm. Stopped work at 10:30 pmPromised to restart packing at 8:00 am and finish by 10:30 the next day.Much wrangling with the operations part of their service who had very different sets of plans for us. Changes in pricing. Insurance offered. We ultimately took it due to the large numbers of disconcerting elements to the service. Call backs were not performed - we had to call them ourselves to finish conversations with the company. The team hadn't eaten all day, and were very fatigued upon arrival, so we fed them.Day 2 arrived at 8:20, finished packing 3:00 pm, after multiple push backs.My parents, in their 70s were to wait at target site. The personnel promised to be mindful of my parents age and assured us that they would update us if there would be further delays. At least to take care of my parents.Day 3: Texted to get information from personnel, and were told they'd be 20 minutes late since they had to get breakfast (reasonable). 9:30, still no arrival. Once they arrived, it became clear that they would not be able to complete the task themselves (these were not large, muscular workers) and we hired several additional workers to help them finish the job - with the help of building management.It is impossible to overstate how much we tried to inform the company the particulars of the new site, which were not internally conveyed to their moving team.Damages to several appliances and statues noted on arrival. Claims filed a little while after to their claims department. The claims were denied, but their email was sent to the wrong address and we never received follow up until we pursued the matter ourselves. They later told us they received a bounced email, but didn't bother to check the email address they had used to send to us.At any rate, all claims were denied as they don't cover appliances or statues - which was not made clear to us at time of purchase of insurance. What's the point of insurance if it doesn't cover anything?Phone calls from management were non-existent.Summary:Horrid experience. Lowest rating possible.Highly unprofessional.Avoid if at all possible.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'WiFi': 'free', 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Residence Inn by Marriott Cleveland Downtown
text: Definitely a good place to stay if you have certain expectations. This place is not fancy but the rooms are spacious and clean. The beds are comfortable and the rooms have full kitchens if you plan to stay a while. Pricing depends on time of year but the location is excellent. They include breakfast which although nothing special, it's nice to have an option in the morning without having to leave the hotel. Seems popular with people for sporting events.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'WiFi': 'free'}
name: Extended Stay America - Cleveland - Brooklyn
text: The friendly clerk at the front desk happily sent us to our room on the 2nd floor. We requested a non-smoking room, and unfortunately our room smelled like someone broke the rules! It was kindof a mess too - cigarette burns and wine stains on the floor. Must've been a party.We kindly asked to be moved to another room and we were moved to the 1st floor. We were SO excited to have a smell-free AND newly remodeled room! We enjoyed using our kitchenette and having a spacious room/bathroom.There's a flat fee of $4.99 for internet. Parking is a breeze, you're near the freeway, near fast food joints and not too far from the city [although our main objective was to stay somewhere between the city and Cedar Point :) ] We had a good experience and I hope they get to upgrade their other rooms so that everyone else can have a good experience as well!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
name: The Home Depot
text: The employees are sometimes helpful and sometimes lost... the challenge is that the lost don't try and seek assistance from the knowing... We ended up going to 4 different stores in 1 day to get the tile we needed for our kitchen remodel.  The person in the tile section of this store was the least helpful of the 4.On the up side... the counter top person is very helpful, and the cashiers funny and attentive... when we renovated the bathroom and garage back to back they joked with us during the 3 month odyssey and made the journey much easier.Don't use the Howe Avenue entrance to the parking lot... use the side street... unless you enjoy demolition derbies.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False}
name: The Home Depot
text: Items were on hold for us after another store called for a stock check.  The items were at customer service as promised and the staff was very friendly. This was our 4th Home Depot of the day so we didn't browse around the store and see how the department people were... but the service desk was great.Parking lot has some challenges. The easiest plan of attack is to make a right hand turn after coming down what looks like an access road filled with Restaurant and then use the side entrance closest to the contractor services. Crossing traffic makes it a challenge to get back out the way you came in... so exit the other side of the shopping center and try and get back to the main road from there.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
name: The Home Depot
text: The wonderful man in the lighting section was not able to find the part I needed to fix a pendant light in his department, and I thanked him for trying and went on shopping...  but still thought about my problem after leaving me and he remembered something in the discount rack that might work and chased me down in the hardware section after he found it. Great service!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Gift Shops', 'Interior Design', 'Home & Service', 'Arts & Entertainment', 'Shopping', 'Art Galleries', 'Flowers & Gifts']
name: Something Different Gallery
text: This is a little hidden gem of a shop in Ohio City. We were walking the neighborhood and just popped in. The shop owner is a delight! Very sweet woman and is wonderful to chat with. They have lots of items from local artists. We purchased an awesome clock for the wall. The prices are very reasonable as well. I'll be sure to stop in again next time we're in town.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'WiFi': 'free', 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Residence Inn by Marriott Cleveland Downtown
text: I stayed here for about 3 months a while back for business. :: Rooms ::The rooms are pretty spacious. The rooms I've stayed in had a kitchen with appliances, a sitting area with a L shaped couch that could be pulled out into a bed, and a huge Queen sized bed. The bathroom is decent sized with a shower-tub combo. The heating is a bit wonky and may or may not work as well as you'd like in the winter. The last week I was there, I was in a fireplace suite and that was pretty cool- the fireplace is gas powered. :: Noise ::The noise levels aren't too bad. Most people who stay here are on business so it is pretty quiet. If you have a room that faces the street (Prospect Ave), you may hear loud music and patrons from nearby bars- especially from the one across the street that doubled as a venue for salsa dancing.:: Food ::If you're staying for a while, they do have the complimentary grocery shopping. They'll just add the grocery bill to your room. In the mornings,  they serve breakfast buffet style on the 2nd floor. Items include coffee, tea, juice, water, cereal, toast, muffins, yogurt, fruit, hot oatmeal, eggs, bacon, sausage, and the like. In the evening, they'll serve different dishes everyday during their "social hour." They also serve alcohol including red and white wine and beer on tap (usually a domestic like Miller and a Great Lakes brew). They also have their 24hr marketplace in the lobby where you can pick up stuff.:: Laundry ::They have a laundry room on site. However, it was malfunctioning the few times I used it so I don't recommend it.:: Gym ::They do have a mini gym in the hotel. Not sure if it is still the case, but hotel guests were allowed to use the gym in the arcade/mall next door by showing their key cards. :: Parking ::This is one of the scariest lots I've ever encountered. If you're getting a rental, I highly recommend a compact/sub-compact/economy car as the spaces are REALLY TIGHT. Heck, the structural pillars make it even worse. In the beginning of my stay, it was about $8/day. Later on, the price jumped to $16/day.It may not be the glitziest hotel downtown, but it is affordable, spacious, near bars and Restaurant, near the sporting/concert venues, and near the freeway on-ramps.

text: I am not much of a gardener, but everyone knows I love to eat.  What am i talking about?  The fact that this place has approximately 289 pallets of herbs you can buy and plant.  This place has quite a bit of inventory for a small place; it is the right size to wander in for about 30-45min and then get the heck out with a good selection.The best part: the shopping carts are old, metal radio flyer wagons.

categories: ['Local Services', 'Home & Service', 'Home Cleaning', 'Dry Cleaning & Laundry', 'Laundry Services', 'Laundromat', 'Contractors']
name: Leo's Laundromat
text: Leo's LaundromatI saw a sign a few weeks back advertising free wifi. I needed to wash my comforter and immediately thought of this place. Lou K and I both brought our dirty loads (pun intended) here on a Monday afternoon. The interior is cute with a 50's vibe, including vinyl chairs and reproduced vintage kitchen tables. You don't need quarters here, just cash which you can put in the x-changer machine (yes, x-changer machine). The attendant knows the regulars and spotted me as a newbie immediately. She called me honey a dozen or so times and reminded me of a cross between my country grandma and a former coworker named Aida from my days at Subway in Wooster, Oh. We fit my bedding into one of the giant washers. I used two separate dryers for the next part. I believe the entire process cost about $6. It took about an hour, but I used the wifi while I waited. Is it the cleanest place in the world? No, which I can't understand because you would expect plenty of access to soap and water. Also, a lot of thought was placed on creating a comfortable environment when it comes to the free wifi and cute dxc3xa9cor. So why not spiff it up with a good detail? I wouldn't give this place 4 stars except that I've never seen a "nice" laundromat; I believe all of our expectations are lower for laundromats over other types of retail businesses. Warning: It is hot in there.

name: Something Different Gallery
text: I used to work with a designing-women type middle-aged man. You know, he was artistic, but classy with an eye for the traditional. I alwasy imagined his bedroom looked like a soap opera set...rich paisleys with matchy-matchy curtains. He was frugal but didn't mind spending more for something of quality. He would love Something Different. It really isn't my sort of store. It doesn't scream "twenty-something." Most gift boutiques do not.

name: Tower In the Park
text: There are not a ton of apartments to chose from that are close to B-W's campus. Berea has anti-student laws that prohibit students renting houses (although some still do it). As a result, T.I.P. is one of the more popular places for B-W students to reside. I have nothing against curries or other pungent SE Asian meals, in fact I love them, but I don't like my apartment to smell like it 100% of the time. I am not sure what they do at T.I.P., perhaps teleport the scents and aromas from simmering pots at a local Thai eatery directly into the HVAC of their building, but most of the interior smells of a spicy red curry. Also, a friend of mine is pretty sure she lived below a group of redneck, cowboy wicans. She thinks one of them vexed her while they were doing laundry together. I would only live here if I was looking for cheap student housing.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Waldo's Nursery
text: Need a fountain or a statue for your yard? Waldo's is the place to get it. Waldo's had a huge selection of large pots and planters, as well as fountains and statues. They also had a trellaced area with chains hanging down for hanging baskets. This doesn't seem like it would be off putting. But it was. Imagine a dark room with nothing but long chains haging...like 50 of them. It reminded me of something from a horror movie...like it was a serial killer's den. Tip: The driveway for parking is actually on the side of the building without a sign (east side). Don't try to pull in by the big sign.

name: Kal's Painting
text: A friend hired Kal's Painting and I was surprised how fast the work was done. In and out, without a drop of paint anywhere. Everything looked beautiful when he was done!

name: Gupta Permold
text: The Gupta Permold Corp. is the company that makes the diamondLife brand of garage organization and renovation products.I recently had my garage finished - from a raw, unfinished state, to a sharp looking, organized garage - and I utilized a number of items from the diamondLife brand to make it look great as well as be extremely functional.I ordered two 8 x 4 pieces of the Slatwall MX - in an alternating pattern of diamond plate and brushed aluminum, with black inserts for the slats, and aluminum trim end pieces; a 2 x 3 diamond plate pegboard (to hang hand tools), and a bunch of hooks and hardware to hang off both the Slatwall MX and the pegboard.All of the hardware they shipped looks sharp and the finished product looks even better in my garage. I now have my ladder, shovels, hoes, brooms, and a whole lot more neatly and smartly hanging off the walls.If you are looking to renovate and organize your garage, definitely check these guys out!You can view their line of garage gear here:http://diamondlifegear.com/

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Walnut on Highland
text: After some frustrating apartment hunting, I stumbled into the Walnut on Highland. Finally, something with new finishes, open layouts, high ceilings, a nice walk-able location, and still has some old-school charm and architecture.The staff is fantastic, friendly, professional and helpful. They've worked hard to ensure that I'm happy, and are quite responsive to issues. I had some noise problems with HVAC that required substantial trial and error, but they were persistent until it was resolved.The neighbors are friendly, fun, and... neighborly. Its nice that the management often has social events for the tenants so you can meet each other.Utilities are pretty inexpensive. I have a 2br, and the highest the heating/electric bill went (with Ethical Electric Green Energy) in January was 740kWh, about $100. Not bad! Water is fixed and included with rent as a fee.However, the building is not without some quirks and issues:* There aren't lights where there really ought to be - like in a dark, isolated hallway closet where you can't see your clothes.  Or above where the dining room table should go! * The floors aren't real hardwoods, they're cheap laminate. At least I don't have to worry about scratching them.* The paint on the walls somehow marks with the slightest scratch or brush up against it. Its like they put on a single coat, and the paint has carbon or something to show wherever it was touched.* The elevator has a beautiful glass wall in it, yet the windows to the exterior are covered in either bird poop or concrete droppings. Visitors are like "OOOOhhh!" followed by "Eeeeewwww". Its kind of embarrassing. * The place is locked up like Fort Knox. Its nice that it is secure, but holy cow, its super annoying if you're trying to host a party. You or somebody have to go down the elevator to let somebody in EVERY TIME. There is no way to buzz somebody up. Going from the lobby entrance to your unit requires at least 3 badge swipes. Garage to the unit requires FIVE badge swipes! (Garage entrance, garage vestibule, lobby vestibule, lobby, elevator). I curse out loud every time I have to walk in carrying something. Really, they need to make a real security desk in the lobby.* Lots of construction noises due to East Liberty Transit Center renovations. This usually starts around 7:30am every day. This isn't in the property's control, but something to consider about location. With East Liberty projects scheduled all around us, I don't expect outside noise to be getting better within the next few years.* The pet fee is insanely high. 1/2 a month rent for a cat?! I paid it, because I love my cat, but there is no way she could possibly do that much damage to an apartment for any amount of time. It isn't even refundable. Silly.Overall, I'm happy with the place and the problems above are most definitely "first world problems", but for the price premium that we pay for a luxury apartment, I expect a little more. Until The Odeon, Eastside III, and Bakery Square 2.0 projects are completed, this or a few private loft condos are basically your only option for a contemporary place in the neighborhood.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
categories: ['Shopping', 'Local Services', 'Movers', 'Packing Services', 'Junk Removal & Hauling', 'Home & Garden', 'Home & Service']
name: Culmer Moving
text: I could not recommend these movers. While the owner, JC was very friendly and helpful in setting everything up on the phone, and they were available the day I needed on fairly short notice, so many things went wrong and my move was extremely stressful. The movers arrived late. They used my tools to disassemble furniture, dumped a socket set everywhere, and didn't organize them. Packing went way over the expected time, past my management companies hours, at which point they were going to charge me extra. Movers started rushing, being careless. They left many items behind, completely didn't pack a closet. I ended up spending several hours moving stuff they missed. Movers got into a verbal altercation at the moving truck with each other. I had to walk away because I thought they may start physically fighting. They crammed stuff completely wall-to-wall in the elevator, knocked off the protective mats. At the destination, the movers tried moving the truck while the ramp was attached, and ended up hitting a neighbor's truck with the ramp. Amazingly, it didn't appear to cause damage. Again, I had to walk away because I just couldn't watch them. At the destination, the movers requested that I unload a wardrobe box so they could re-use it (seriously?) I complied, and when I came back downstairs, I noticed the strong smell of gas in the kitchen. One of the movers had bumped the knob on the range, left it pouring gas into the kitchen, and NOBODY NOTICED!? THE MOVERS NEARLY BLEW UP MY NEW HOUSE! Liquor bottles were packed upside-down, leaking everywhere. Water left in a kettle when it was packed - everything was wet. Original canvas paintings were placed in a wardrobe box, no protection from each other, and damaged due to the corners of each other. Basically all but one of my lamps were broken. Broken glasses, bowl, missing parts to my keyboard stand & coffee table, scratched my desk, damaged the apartment walls. A wall clock went completely missing. None of the boxes were labeled, so at the destination, everything ended up on the first floor except for wardrobe boxes - many of which didn't actually contain clothes. I was moving boxes up and down constantly during unpacking. On the plus side, I was reimbursed for the lost/damaged items. It took a month and a half to get the check, but I did. I've hired movers several times now, and unfortunately, this was the worst experience I've had. Sadly, I cannot recommend them.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: The Pennsylvanian Apartments
text: I stayed at the Pennsylvanian for about a month in one of the Corporate Apartments.  This place is old.  I believe it used to be a hub for trains and buses.The outside looks nice but the hallways to the rooms look a little dingy.  There was mildew on the floors of my bathroom and bathtub.  The washer and dryer was old.  There was rust on some of the door hinges.  The dresser, fixtures, coffee table, dining table, and dining chairs looked new and modern.  The carpet for the most part was clean.  The sofa looked old and was not comfortable.  The bedsheets had yellow stains on them.  I did not use the comforter and one of the layers.  The Pennsylvanian has a maid service option with 1 week or 2 week intervals.  I am not sure if they even changed or washed my bedsheets because they all had the same yellow stains?  wtf?The views from the apartment is nice, but the windows are hard to see through since the window screens are dirty.The kitchen is ok.  The corporate apartment comes with a fullsized fridge, dishwasher, coffee maker, silverware, platewear, pots and pans.  There is also an iron and ironing board.  There is also a 22 inch? CRT-TV with about 100 cable channels.  I had a router for internet but it was taken away from me 2 weeks into my stay.  The Pennsylvanian claimed Comcast took it away without even telling me.  They did not offer me a chance to pay for it.The fitness room was nice.  There are treadmills, elliptical machines, pullup bars, and other various machines.  There are even a few sets of dumbells.  I never used the sauna, so I cannot comment on that.There is a 24 hour concierge that is always helpful and friendly.  There is also an option to sign up for a dry-cleaning service, which is outsourced to another company.  You drop your dirty clothes into a room and pick it up a few days later after it has been cleaned.  This is rather expensive as well.  Everyone who has a dry-cleaning Key has access to this room.  Thieves could come in and steal your clothes.If I had an option, I would not stay at the Pennsylvanian again.

name: Residence Inn by Marriott Pittsburgh University/Medical Center
text: As much of a fan I am of Marriott properties, this one is a disappointment.  Management was great.  Breakfast was passable.  But the unforgivable discrepancy was in the bathroom.  Dirty towel hanging behind the door.  A used washcloth on top of the shower curtain, plainly visible to the naked eye.  Unacceptable.  I'd expect this at a by-the-hour trucker motel next to a Walmart.  Not at an urban Residence Inn and worst of all, at any Marriott property.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False}
name: Allegheny Valley Transfer
text: * Posting the same review as Allied because Allied was the parent company that I called in the first place.Any move to a new city is stressful, but hiring movers should make that process easier rather than more difficult. My move from start to finish was riddled with mistakes, some minor and some major, and it made my move from Pittsburgh to Philadelphia all the more stressful. Allegheny Valley Transfer (AVT; via Allied) was unprofessional, unable to communicate (with me or to each other), and unwilling to make things right when they made mistakes. The following is a detailed account of what happened.I first called Allied and explained to them that I lived in a 3-bedroom house but had roommates and the move would be one of the three bedrooms, that I had very little in the way of common area furniture and any of the things I had in the common areas were minimal and could be put in about 5 boxes max. They said great, they'd have people come to estimate what the cost would be, and we set up an appointment.The estimators come, and they seem surprised because they have been told that it was 3-bedroom house but none of the other details (Mistake 1). But otherwise, it's fine, they carry on and I point out all of things that are mine that I'm taking with me. I tell them I want all the bells and whistles: I want them to pack my things, I want them to move my things, I want them to unpack my things. The estimators also say great, and tell me that I don't even have to take things out of my drawers, they'll take care of all of that. The only thing I have to do is keep the things that are mine in the common area in one space so that it'll be easier for them to distinguish between what stuff is mine versus my roommates. Reasonable, of course, and I think great, that's what I want. They give me an estimate.They send me the paperwork the next day and ask when I want them to pick up my things, when I say, well how long will it take to be delivered? They say, ok tell us a range of days you want it to be delivered and we'll tell you when it should be picked up. I tell them Mon, June 19 - Wed, June 21. They say, we can do a 5-day spread instead, so Mon, June 19 - Fri, June 23. I say that's fine, and they say they'll pick up Thurs, June 15. Perfect, I say, and I book my flight accordingly (originally planned on Sunday night but decided Saturday night based on price).Two days before they're supposed to pick up my stuff, I realize there's no time window for pick-up, so I call and ask and they say they'll have the movers call me closer to then, but that the earliest it would be is 12pm because they have other pick-ups that day. Ok, that's a pretty big window but fine.They never called, but the night before my move, I stayed up late putting together some of my things from the common areas and planned to get up and do a couple more hours of work before the movers arrived. The next morning I woke up at 8:50am to pounding on my door. They were over 3 hours early from the earliest time they estimated (Mistake 2). Turns out they were also never told about packing my things so they had to scrounge up any boxes they had in the truck (Mistake 3) -- thankfully, I did not have much stuff for them to pack, but they moved incredibly slowly, at one point one of them even took a 10 minute phone call followed by a bathroom break (Mistake 4).Because a 5-day spread is a long time, I figured the movers would have a better idea of when they'd arrive by now, so I asked: Do you have a better idea of when I'll receive my stuff? Yes, they say, SATURDAY, June 17 in the morning (Huge Mistake 5)!! I had already booked my flight and my new apartment did not do weekend moves (issues with freight elevators etc.).By this point, I am livid, but after a ton of hassle and back and forth with my apartment building and AVT, I had to change my flight at my own cost so that I could arrive by the time the movers would; otherwise, I would have to wait 2 weeks to get my stuff! AVT was unapologetic and even unwilling to provide any discounts for the major inconvenience. Finally, I got the apartment building to ok a 4-5pm freight elevator time, and I called both AVT and the actual movers to make sure they would make it at that time.When I arrived in Philadelphia, I cleaned my place then went to Target, planning to buy some things before the movers arrived in a few hours. They arrived WITHOUT NOTICE at 1:20pm, expecting to be let in (Mistake 6). By the end of it, I was so fed up that I did not even point out that they were also supposed to unpack for me (Mistake 7).Also, it's been a week and a half and I have yet to receive a receipt (though I know my credit card was charged) and I have yet to receive a claims form (Mistakes 8 and 9), which I need because they broke my mirror frame (ha, Mistake 10).My entire experience with Allegheny Valley Transfer was miserable, and I wouldn't wish that on anyone. Beware.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
categories: ['Shopping', 'Furniture Stores', 'Jewelry', 'Interior Design', 'Real Estate', 'Lighting Fixtures & Equipment', 'Home Staging', 'Home & Service', 'Home & Garden']
name: Hot Haute Hot
text: This is SUCH a gorgeous boutique -- shabby chic furnishings galore! If you're in the market for truly unique, special furniture and live anywhere near Pittsburgh, Hot Haute Hot is the place you're looking for. I came here with my friend who had long been on a quest to find a new dining room table. The options here were so gorgeous I was immediately struck with envy. There are curio cabinets, amazing reclaimed ceiling tile mirrors, plush chairs, fantastic lamps and a bevy of side tables, wall hangings and of course, dining room tables. The service is impeccable -- sweet, helpful women who know every item in their shop and are just as excited to help you shop as you are to find perfect item. The taste level in this store is impressive, as well. As a bonus, they have a few displays of fun, affordable jewelry ranging from delicate to super funky. Take your time to pick through this shop and enjoy yourself while doing it -- I certainly did!

categories: ['Event Planning & Services', 'Home & Service', 'Hotels', 'Guest Houses', 'Hotels & Travel', 'Real Estate']
name: Friendship Suites
text: The Friendship Suites made my stay in Pittsburgh a breeze. Robert, the owner sent me detailed directions on how to reach the suites via public transportation. Rooms come as either singles or 1 bedrooms. I chose a basement suite and it turned out to be much more than I could have expected. A large comfy bed, flat screen HDTV with Premium sports and movie channels, a kitchen with all the amenities from Oven to Spatula, a full bathroom, and a small dining /work table. The suites are housed in a turn of the century victorian house converted into apartments and conveniently located off bus lines to Downtown. The best thing is supermarkets and bars are nearby, all which Robert gives you maps and descriptions of. Got Laundry? no problem, the suites have their own laundry room and each room has an ironing board, laundry basket, and iron. It's home away from home.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Strong Pro Movers
text: Efficient, reasonably priced, hardworking. I wanted a properly insured and licensed mover. Think they all are? Guess again. You need to go here to look up movers: http://www.cpuc.ca.gov/PUC/transportation/movers/So, I talked to Barry on the phone, and he got someone to send me a quote. It was reasonable, and similar to what was listed on the website, with reasonable upcharges for my upgrades. Wait, climbing a lot of stairs isn't an upgrade, is it? You know what I'm saying here. The manager (Alan?) was on it. Though I must admit that guys with neck tattoos scare the hell out of me. I mean. Neck. Tattoo. That like, hurt, right? Anyway....Alan had one. But hey, if he's tough enough to take a neck tatt, I guess he's tough enough to lift my crappy IKEA dresser. Also, bonus: there was no mocking of my IKEA crap. Unless you count MY mocking my IKEA crap. There was some of that.Anyway, as a previous reviewer commented, a three-hour delivery window is a little annoying, but it worked out and I ended up using that extra time to clean and up the odds of recouping my deposit!And once the guys got there, they just didn't stop. Boom, boom, boom, done.They also did not complain about a couple of little curveballs that came up. For example, some jerk complained about the location of the moving truck. It was in a perfectly fine location, and the only car blocked in was mine! And the elevator at my new place turned out to be annoyingly small. In fact, Alan's attitude was SO calm and positive, we tipped heavily, and I feel good about that. He rocked! And his crew rocked, too.This is the first move I've ever had where nothing got seriously damaged or broken. And seriously, I think you should just expect one thing to get thrashed in any move. This exceeded my expectations.I would definitely hire Strong Young Movers again. And I'd request Alan again. I hope his name was Alan, because it would be weird if some stranger named Alan showed up. Especially if he had a neck tattoo. Thanks guys!! And thanks to you Yelpers for helping me find Strong Young Movers!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'WiFi': 'free', 'DogsAllowed': True}
categories: ['Home & Service', 'Apartments', 'Real Estate', 'Hotels', 'Hotels & Travel', 'Event Planning & Services', 'Venues & Event Spaces']
name: Shadyside Inn All Suites Hotel
text: Update... Shadyside Inn refunded the charges from our stay.  They report they are adding staff and upgrading their facilities.In response to the manager's comments:  As I noted above, they refunded our stay.  The TV cabling is exposed... perhaps not as dangerous as exposed electrical wire, but not something to be particularly proud of if you consider yourself to be a business built on customer service and the impression of luxury. The "ongoing" repairs in the hallways were not touched during our (middle of the week) stay, so one must wonder about the urgency of those repairs.   The building we stayed in was not full.  Why did they put my family in the oldest, most dilapidated room? As far as moving to a different room, any one who has traveled with children would know how difficult  it is to move from one hotel (or hotel room) to another.  We arrived after a 3+ hour drive at 5pm in the middle of a thunderstorm with a very tired and cranky toddler.  Given the relative level of competence at the front desk at the time of check in, we weren't confident that any room we would be moved to would be any better.I stand behind my review.  If I could give the place zero stars, I would.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
categories: ['Home Window Tinting', 'Shades & Blinds', 'Auto Glass Services', 'Home & Service', 'Automotive', 'Car Window Tinting']
name: Sun Stoppers
text: They did a very good job with removing the old tint and putting on the new tint.  So far it looks good and the price was less than what they originally quoted me.  I did have to wait five hours before they even got to my car even though I had an appointment.  I'll also agree with the other posts about them leaving a little bit of a mess with the film remnants inside the car.  It wasn't a big deal for me because I needed to vacuum my car that day, but they should give the cars a quick vacuum after they're done.  They are very nice and honest here so I would go back.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Home & Service', 'Professional Services', 'Television Service Providers', 'Internet Service Providers']
name: DISH
text: There is no residential option for Time Warner Cable in York County and that is fine with me.  (Side note - Time Warner Cable and Time Warner have been completely separate, unaffiliated companies for almost four years.  Please don't insult the media company Time Warner by referring to Time Warner Cable as Time Warner).  Anyways, the only local cable option is Comporium, but their prices seemed high, and they also had a lot of additional fees when everything switched to digital.  We decided to go with Dish Network, and for the most part we have been happy.  It was my first experience with satellite, and overall, it's been better than cable.  The price of the service is reasonable, but there are some fees added onto the $29 offers you see (they are usually clearly represented though).  The lease of the DVR is free; however there is a $6 fee for the DVR service (usually waived for the 1st year or two as part of a promotion).  Regional sports networks are an extra $6 per month (Fox Sports).  However, even when everything has been added up, it's still slightly cheaper than cable.  The best thing however is that we have had it for 3 years and our rate has NEVER INCREASED!We had one issue where our DVR overheated and we lost everything recorded on it.  It was partly our fault as they are CPU's and need air circulation and we had some small items obstructing it.  They replaced it without and issue.  The service went out often at first but they came out and readjusted the dish and it's been fine since.  The customer service has been good.  Most often I have spoken to people in the US but occasionally will get an offshore rep.  We temporarily fell behind on our bills and they were very good about it.  On the few times I've had to call them I have not had to wait more than 5 minutes (and usually not at all).  As far as outages due to weather, they are few and far between.  It either has to be downpouring or snow falling (which accumulates in the dish and blocks the signal) for the signal to go out.  If you're worried about a 2 year contract, don't be.  If you are unsatisfied with the service, they are not holding up their end of the contract and you can cancel.  My main problem with Dish is that NBC Sports (formerly Versus and before that the Outdoor Life Network) is on their top tier.  It's a little too expensive so we don't get it.  Right now, however, they have a bunch of Starz and Encore movie channels for free for a year as part of an anniversary.Overall, we have been much happier than Dish than with cable.  I cannot compare it to Comporium, but we have them for internet and they are good.  I'm just not sure I'll ever go back to cable.
