attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Giles Plumbing
text: These guys are awesome. Had an issue with shower on a Friday evening that I could not fix. Called them at 8:30 and left a message with answering service. They called me back in ten minutes and said they could get here as their second stop on Saturday. They called when they were on their way, got here, had it fixed in ten minutes and for a reasonable price. They did not even mark up the price of parts too much - they were close to what they are at the big box hardware stores. I will not hesitate to use them again.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
categories: ['Local Services', 'Home Cleaning', 'Carpet Cleaning', 'Home & Service', 'Air Duct Cleaning', 'Damage Restoration']
name: Stanley Steemer
text: I did a lot of research before I decided to have our air ducts cleaned. The EPA says that regular cleaning of air ducts is not necessary in most instances, but can be beneficial if there is excessive dust and it is coming out of the vents.  They also state that it can be helpful if someone has breathing problems such as allergies or asthma.  I decided on Stanley Steemer because they are certified by National Air Duct Cleaners Association (and because I had a $349 Valpak coupon). The window for their arrival was between 12 and 3 on a Saturday. They called at 11:00 to let me know they were on the way and they arrived at 12:00. They cleaned EVERYTHING related to the HVAC ventilation system from the furnace to the vents to the air return. They used a powerful truck-mounted system for this with giant vacuum houses along with compressed air to loosen the dirt. The whole process took about 2.5 hours including setup and breakdown. I was not attempted to be up sold anything at all. The only minor complaint I have is that they left a little bit of debris on the floor and table that came out of the vents; not a big deal.It is too early to tell but I will let everyone know if this reduces the amount of dust in our home and if we can breathe better.

name: Lee's Heating & Cooling
text: When our AC wasn't working at the end of last summer, I noticed the coil was leaking Freon.  Lee's came out, gave me an estimate for replacing it and pumped enough Freon into the system to get us through the summer.  I thought the price for replacing the coil was a little high, so I called other places.  All of them were asking about the unit and none of them had seen it.  I knew it was ok and Lee's confirmed that.  I called Lee's back and they came out and replaced the coil.  There was also a bad capacitor on the unit that they replaced without charge.  They are nice people.  The prices are a little high, but they are local and they will not sell you anything you don't need.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Nascair Heating & Cooling
text: Three years ago I had a different company replace the coil on our AC system because it was leaking Freon.  I thought that company's price was a little high and I am unsure if they are even still around.  I really dislike calling the big AC places that have TV commercials because they often are commissioned and try to sell you unnecessary stuff,  It's the same reason I take my car to a local mechanic.  Anyway, our AC just did not seem to be working as efficiently as it should, so I gave NASCAIR a call based on Yelp reviews and a friend's recommendation.  They sent a guy out who checked the Freon levels, temperatures, main unit, and coil.  Everything was functioning normally and the Freon was only about a half pound low.  He said that the maximum temperature an AC unit in the Charlotte area can handle is 93 degrees and that an AC unit can only cool to a maximum of 20 degrees.  With the hotter than usual weather this summer, it was normal for our AC to be running constantly and not cooling below 80 degrees during the day.  Since the weather will be cooling soon, he said he could install the Freon (which is expensive) or wait until the springtime and have them check it again.  I chose the latter and will definitely be giving these guys a call.  Total price for this thorough service call where I was not even attempted to be upsold anything?  85 bucks.  If you need HVAC service, give this company a call.  It is great to know that places like this that don't have to put thousands of dollars into stupid commercials still exist.  Oh, and the price for the other company that replaced the coil before?  Not so bad considering the price of Freon at the time.

text: So I haven't had TWC in 3.5 years and have heard nothing from them (I live in area of SC that they don't service).  Today I get a collection notice from them for $48.  Stop spending money to name every arena in the nation and hire some people who know what they're doing.

name: Butterworth Tree Angels
text: First class tree service. Jim Butterworth and his crew are veritable tree surgeons! Just as a highly trained specialist expertly removes your appendix, the Tree Angels expertly remove just the right limbs to make your yard balanced and beautiful. They are Tree Angels because they have just the right equipment to fly high into your tree tops. After the operation, all is cleaned and swept. I highly recommend this company.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: The Stone Man
text: I have worked with many contractors through the years and The Stone Man is one of the best. My back yard project was unique and George and his crew lived up to my expectations. The Stone Man along with Blue Max Materials helped to create a great outdoor fireplace, buffet table/bar and walkway. The masons worked hard in the excessive heat and were always pleasant. George is very organized and makes sure that once his crew is on the job, they stay on the job. Other contractors I've worked with have juggled several jobs which has caused delays. Everyone was interested in doing the job right.There were a couple of mistakes along the way but they took full responsibility and gladly corrected the problems.I intend to use them again and I definitely recommend The Stone Man.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: You Move Me Charlotte
text: I will definitely use You Move Me again and will suggest this company to my friends. I was combining two small offices in to one. My move was organized into four stops. Kimi, Dustin and Mook took this all in stride and cheerfully executed my plan. One of the most difficult pieces was a four drawer lateral fire safe. HEAVY. Those guys dealt with it and got it up the truck ramp without damaging themselves! All three moved fast, were pleasant, had humor, were courteous and did a good job.  The reason I did not give five stars had NOTHING to do with the moving crew. There was some miscommunication from the person who took my reservation about arrival time. He told me they would arrive at 8:00 AM but what that meant was between 8:00 - 10:00. They arrived at 9:15. Once the crew got going, everything was fine.

The workers are always courteous, quick and efficient. I will definitely use their services again.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}

text: Jack Smith and his crew at SMI Paving just completed a job at my business park in Pineville. They repaired, patched, seal coated and re-striped two parking lots and driveways. In addition, they did some grading and brought in stone for a gravel parking lot on site. From the first contact, communication was very good. They did what they said they would for a reasonable price and to my satisfaction. I highly recommend this company.SMI also does residential work.Good people.

name: Creative Home Stagers
text: Today I met with Carol to discuss the sale of my home. She spoke quickly, I wrote quickly. Carol made the time with me count. I learned so much from her and I will implement her suggestions. I have no doubt that she will have helped me sell my house in a short amount of time - again, quickly!! I recommend Creative Home Stagers and I hope you will give them a call.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: A Finer Edge
text: Didn't show up for my appointment (that had been set and confirmed by him) and didn't call.

name: Gateway Fencing
text: First off, I'd like to address that 1 star review which I discussed at length with Gateway Fencing's owner Lamar Conner. That customer was not clear as to what part of the property she wanted fenced in. If you tell the crew one area on one day and then change your request to include additional area to be fenced in at a later visit the price will naturally change. It's not fair to hold the fencing company responsible for that. Now, on to our experience with Gateway Fencing, as actual customers. I'm currently in my third home with both preceding homes having been flipped with my husband and I serving as default general contractors. As a result, we have extensive experience with subcontractors. Browse my Yelp profile to see some of the horrific experiences I've had w/ fence companies. As a result of all of this, I know how to spot a good contractor, particularly a good fencing contractor. Lamar Conner is one of the BEST contractors in the Charlotte area, period. He is 100% ethical, honest, and honorable. We 1st met him about a year ago when we had 7 different fencing companies come out and quote us for a 6 foot wooden privacy fence to be put up around our backyard (1.5 acres, wooded at the time of quote gathering). Some of the quotes were absolutely outrageous (the worst being over 20K!). Lamar's quote was totally reasonable and my husband and I just got a good vibe from him...he's a super nice guy, you'll see when you meet him. Foolishly, we elected to go with another contractor who essentially made us a deal that was too good to be true (see my review for scam artist Mike Struble AKA Mark Williams of Splinters Construction AKA Vision Wood Works). We liked Lamar more and had a good "gut feeling" about him so we asked him if he could match the aforementioned lower quote. He did his best to match it but told us that going any lower would be virtually impossible, given supply costs, etc. He also warned us that Mike Struble may be a scam artist, based on the quote Struble had given us. Throughout this entire exchange Lamar remained friendly, helpful, and respectful. It was clear to us that he really just wanted the best for us. He told us to come back to him if we ran into any problems. Of course we did run into problems with Mike Struble who stole 6K from us. We used a credit card to pay Struble, so, after several months of investigation the credit card company gave us our 6K back and now they're suing Struble (yay!). We re-approached Lamar with this information and he graciously agreed to honor the original quote he'd given us! Just to be clear...Lamar Conner (owner of Gateway Fencing) agreed to a rock bottom price to install our fence...a quote that he gave us nearly a year earlier to compete with another quote that had been given by a scam artist. Lamar could have easily told us to buzz off and that the original quote was absurdly low and that he could not honor it, but he did not do that. Instead, he brought in his incredibly professional crew and built a masterpiece on our property. Lamar Conner and the crew of Gateway Fencing are artisans...true craftsman. They take great pride in their work and it shows. Our property was so difficult at the time of fence installation; essentially an overgrown forest (previous owner's idea of "landscaping"). Lamar's crew took down and removed medium sized trees, small and medium sized overgrown shrubs, and removed random blocks of cement left by the previous owner). There were a few scraggy old box woods not even close to the fence line that they took down and removed for us a courtesy just because we wanted them removed! We hired a tree professional to drop a a massive quantity of huge dead and dying trees (80+ feet tall) and Lamar's crew patiently worked around that project. They took weeks off when we requested and then came right back when we asked them to. To say that Lamar customized our job and provided us with concierge service would be an understatement! Our tree remover left the cut up (massive) rounds on our property and Lamar and his crew spent a day helping us remove them...just because! Lamar knew what a jam we were in with all this wood and literally devoted a full day, a big bobcat, and two excellent crew members to the task of removing about 15 tree's worth of wood from our backyard...at no additional charge. Because we worked with Lamar, his crew, and communicated with his office staff, over so many months we really got a chance to get to know them. These are the nicest people you'd ever want to work with and they're all so professional. These are absolutely the type of contractors/skilled workers you'd want to have on your property. Just recently, many months after the completion of our fence, Lamar's crew came out to answer a question I had about one of our gates. They don't blow you off after the check cashes...if you need Lamar to come back out for any reason he'll be there. He cares about building relationships. Hire Gateway today, do not delay!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
categories: ['Home & Service', 'Water Heater Installation/Repair', 'Building Supplies', 'Water Purification Services', 'Plumbing']
name: Building Trust Plumbing
text: Building Trust Plumbing is appropriately named...you CAN trust this company and that cannot easily be said of many home improvement and repair companies, sadly. Jason came out to our house and gave his honest opinions on multiple diverse plumbing issues. He is very well informed/knowledgeable, skilled, honest, and ethical. With each issue he explained all of our options from most affordable DIY to most expensive. We were thrilled with his repair of our very problematic toilet that several people had recommended we replace. There was absolutely nothing wrong with the toilet itself...the issue was in the pipeline as I had suspected. I am disappointed that other plumbers recommended only an extremely pricey toilet replacement (of course with toilets that they also sell at an upcharge) when the real fix was a five minute auger allowing us to keep a perfectly good (high quality) toilet. Jason and his associate Brian saved us several hundred dollars because they are ethical and honest. Additionally, Jason was the only person able to figure out the source of a mysterious underground leak that had puzzled several plumbers and home inspectors previously. He showed us the source of the problem and explained how to correct it free of charge within five minutes. Last but not least, these gentlemen are true professionals - they are a nice presence within the home; neat, clean, respectful, and pleasant to speak with. Communicating with Jason is super easy; telephone, email, text, online invoices/payment options.This is our 3rd home and we have loads of experience dealing with plumbers and plumbing problems and we can wholeheartedly recommend Jason and his company Building Trust Plumbing!!!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Nascair Heating & Cooling
text: Danny C. was out at our house today and we were really impressed. He literally spent the entire day making sure that everything was operational with our air conditioning units...even the random one we have in the garage. We have a large house with multiple zones of heating and cooling and he combed through all of them very carefully. I feel confident that we'll be in good shape going into the heat of the summer. He made the necessary repairs and the price was incredibly fair. We will definitely be calling on them again come fall to get a check up on our heating units and we'll be asking for Danny again :)

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Wash-It-Pros
text: I join the other five-star satisfied customers with praise for Andrew and his sincere, thorough, straight-up business.Andrew does the work himself.  He does not sub-contract to others, so he keeps the level of quality high to his standards.  And he is a very affable guy with an interesting background.He spent ten years flying regional airplanes all over the country.  Missing his family, he left the airlines to be an entrepreneur, starting this window washing and power washing business.  And he is doing so well.His prices are based on number of windows and is so reasonable and realistic.  He can charge less than others because he does the work himself, is very efficient and does not doodle around.  He chats with you but his arms are moving and he is like a human machine.  Love to see how easy it makes it look.If you bundle by also having your house power washed, both services are less.He did our 28 windows, inside and out and did all the screens.  Very fine.In the spring we will have him back out to spray wash the house and deck and then do the outside windows.  In the fall, inside and outside windows.Great guy worthy of your business.  You will be pleased as punch that you read this and called him.

name: Southern Paws Animal Hospital
text: We have switched our vet to Doctor Elizabeth Hill who owns Southern Paws.  The facility is currently located in the Harris Teeter shopping center outside the main entrance to Sun City.  It is an excellent veterinary practice for outpatient (is that right for pets?) as well as a full scale animal hospital with surgeries and overnight recovery facilities.  Being active supporters in getting the Lancaster Animal Shelter ship-shape, we met Dr. Hill and her staff.  Dr. Hill has volunteered to tend to the shelter once a week, maintains medications, vaccinations and treatments for us as well as administered them to sick animals. The do spay and neuter surgeries in the early mornings each Tuesday and Thursday.Her staff is wonderful, friendly, knowledgeable and talented.  And do they love animals!  Don't be surprised when a blue scrub attired woman comes around to pet and maybe hug and carry around your pet while you are waiting to see the vet.  Very genuine and caring.Dr. Hill is one of four or so vets in the Lancaster - York county area and is a net-worker among those professionals.  They share in work and in problem solving and if some facility is too busy they arrange to lighten the load to accommodate customers.Great people doing great work to care for our collective animals, strays or those in your homes.  Very please with Southern Paws that is in the process of building a new, larger facility with more space in Lancaster County, so stay tuned.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Sherwin-Williams Paint Store
text: Good guys/professionals who know their stuff.  When we moved in, the red entry and most of the common rooms needed to be redone.  You know...nesting.  If you don't you probably are not married.They really work with you, in my case with my wife who can distinguish 64,000 shades of mauve, to get the right color tint for you.  They also can talk with women like my wife at the detail level that generate satisfaction.Lots of email sales come up and they honor them all, even if the sale has recently expired.I, in particular, like how they label the cans of paint so you clearly know what it is and later can have more made.  I further use a marker to designate which room or walls have this paint.  Nice as you know, just know, that you will be tagged to "touch up" something.Need paint or simply advise?  This is where to go, paint-wise.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Splish Splash Pressure Washing and Steam Cleaning
text: You will see that I love to write reviews and most of my low stars are for bad customer service.  I can't say that about this company.  When I contacted them for a quote, they were quick and responsive to come out and give us a quote at a time that worked for us.They were the only ones that had to come out to give us a quote, all others could do it over e-mail as most do it by the square feet of your home.  I believe Splish Splash does as well as I told by Jackie in person I wasn't quite positive of our square feet, but she said she would adjust the quote for the correct square footage.  I think they want to come out to give you the quote so they can be nice and friendly and reel you in.  That's fine, but do your homework.As I did not use them, my review is on the cost.  Cost goes along with the job and customer service, and I contacted 6 companies, all of which had great yelp, google, and BBB reviews, including SS.  I'm not sure what high horse SS thinks they are on, but they were outrageously more expensive than the others.  Keep in mind this is for the size of our home, but one was below $200, the remaining four were in the low $200s, and Splish Splash was above $350.I'm sure they do a fine job, but you can get great customer service and a great job cleaning your home (as evidence by the other companies reviews) with the industries average cost companies.  I did and you can see my review for the company we did use - see my before and after pictures, not some companies pictures!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Porch Life
text: I am going to assume my project was not big or good enough for these guys.  I e-mailed my interest of adding a small covered patio to our existing patio and the response was:"Brian and I reviewed your request and feel you would be better served by another contractor at this time.  We wish you the best with your upcoming project and hope to have an opportunity to work with you in the future."Didn't really care for that response.  Why would I care to work with you in the future if you didn't want to work with me now?  Yeah that makes sense.  I'm sure it is the standard business response, but it could be much better.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Talley Properties
text: Time for an update.  I will say we had no problems with this company when renting, paying our rent, and living peacefully with no contact as we had no problems with the rental property.  However, this company is very shady.We knew our lease was expiring at the end of April, and had a feeling they would go up on rent as they always do each year.  Luckily we were smart and decided to look for a new place early on in the event the rent did go up.  This is where the shady part comes in.  You have to give Talley a 30 day notice (March 31 for us) your intention of how you would like to continue your lease by either extending another year (at a higher rate) or extending month to month (yet an even higher rate).  Or you have to give Talley a 45 day notice if you intend to vacate (March 16 for us (a weekend date which they are not open)).  They did not send us the letter of their intention on how or if they were going to increase the rate until the week of March 10, so we actually did not receive it in the mail until Wednesday, March 12.  So if you wanted to move out, whether you could afford the new rate or just did not want to pay their new rate (later for us), you had 2 days to make a decision.  Like I said, since it is their thing to increase rent each time, we were ahead of the ball and knew if they increased, we would leave.  If they expect renters to give them proper notice, they should be a good company and give us proper notice to make our decision.We left and now the property is listed for rent at the price we were paying (so they couldn't give us that price as good tenants, instead they would rather let it sit and wait to be rented), they could have had us for another year, plus.  The only positive I can say from this is that we moved out and received our deposit back in a timely manner.  Out of all the rental properties and companies I have dealt with, Talley is my least favorite and I would steer clear from them.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Garage Door Mechanix
text: We were having issues with our garage again, and called a different company.  They came out and gave us an extremely high quote, so we decided to order the part and replace ourselves.  Well the part came and we installed, but we still had the same issue.  My husband originally wanted the company to come back out and not charge us again to diagnose the issue.  They agreed but could not come out until 5 days later.In the meantime while my husband was venting, I was e-mailing Michael who was quickly responding (on a Saturday).  I told my husband if the other company didn't know what they were doing and were price gauging us, why should we trust them this time again?  He agreed and was willing for me to find someone else.  Michael had already agreed to come out the next day, but my husband wanted to confirm he wouldn't charge extra for a Sunday.  He did not, so we booked!Michael came out on Sunday as promised and met with my husband in the garage to discuss our issue.  He fixed our issue at a very reasonable price.  My husband was with Michael the entire time of the repair and enjoyed the conversation, which just goes to show how personable Michael is, on top of being knowledgeable with garages.  I personally did not meet Michael, but just based off of his quick responses to my e-mails and my husband trusting his ability, I would highly recommend you use him for all of your garage door repairs.  We will use him again in the future.  Hopefully not for awhile!PS - I would really rate him 1 star if this were a review for who he cheers for in football ;)

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: R&B Climate Control
text: Our air went out on Monday and my husband tried to search things to do to try and fix it, but we were not having any luck.  After a night of tossing and turning in a warm bedroom (luckily we have not even come close to summer heat!), we decided to call someone.  I actually attempted to call another company with 5 star yelp reviews, but I received no response.After having no response, I went back on yelp.  I was not to thrilled with Naren's review, still left me a bit skeptical, but I saw that R&B had 5.0 reviews on google and another site as well as 0 BBB complaints, so I decided to call them up.  I received an immediate answer, told them what was going on, and they would have someone there that day between 4-6.Keith was our technician, and he called me close to 3, stating he was running early and could be on his way.  I told him I was still at work, but I could leave.  He told me not to worry, just continue and we could still plan on 4.  Perfect!  I was able to leave work as planned, get home at 4, and Keith was actually pulling in right before me.  Keith was able to quickly diagnose the problem, let me know it was an electrical switch issue, and the cost (which was reasonable!).  I had him fix it there on the spot and I used one of their online coupons for a discount.  I'm glad that we were able to trust R&B with fixing only what was necessary and not try to say more was there or that we need a whole new system!  The only thing he tried to sell me was their yearly check up (which I think is twice a year), but I declined and he did not push it after, perfect! I would definitely recommend R&B and I will be using them in the future as I trust their work!  Thank you!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
categories: ['Automotive', 'Home & Service', 'Home Window Tinting', 'Car Wash', 'Auto Glass Services', 'Auto Parts & Supplies', 'Vehicle Wraps', 'Auto Customization', 'Auto Detailing']
name: Exclusive Detail
text: I will not be back, and I'm sure Brian won't miss me or care about it, probably would prefer it to be that way.I went here in November after I bought my altima to have my windows tinted.  I was living in SC and was planning on moving into NC after the new year.  Well I recently went to have my car inspected and it did not pass for the tint being too dark.  I immediately called Brian and he asked that I bring it in to have a look.  When I got there, he wanted to drive me to work, drop me off, and take my car to have it inspected himself.   Uh yeah, that is not happening, so I drove us to one of his friends places to have the tint inspected, but his tester did not have working batteries, he just told Brian it would be too dark.  If Brian does tint, why does he not have his own tester??  As we were going back to the shop, he explained how it was not his fault and that he would give me a deal to not charge me for the removal, just the new tint.  While that's great that I'm getting a "deal" and I appreciate that, it would have been nice to know about the NC/SC differences before when I was originally getting it done as I would have gone with NC tint to begin with and I would not have to worry about a "deal".I make an appointment for Friday morning and show up with my car.  He tells me I am going to have to bring it back another day.  Really??  Well this is inconvenient for me!!  His response: "How so?? Did you ever think about why you need to bring it back? I have two cars that are taking longer than expected and I have 7-8 cars waiting to be taken care of."  Okay and?  A simple, yet customer friendly courteous response would have been, "Megan, I'm sorry for then inconvenience, I overbooked.".  Oh no, it's too much for Brian to take any responsibility or blame, an appology would have gone a long way. I took my car back yesterday to be done, not any kind of friendliness, apology for last week, thanks for your business (or me sending him business in the past), etc. from Brian.  I'm glad it is all done as I will never go back.  Work is okay, but customer service goes a long way with the work, and frankly, he doesn't have it.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Just Inspections
text: Love this place.  I have been going here for a couple of years.  This year I went at the end of the month and during a late lunch break, they were way too busy for my break.  I asked when was the best time to come and I was told at the end of the day.  I returned after work on the same day and sure enough no one was there.  Got in and out 10-15 minutes later.  Great speedy experience with a nice inspector.  Will be back next year!

name: Legacy Fence Company
text: I write bad reviews usually for bad service, this is no different.  When I was looking for this company to review, a couple came up on google and yahoo, both with not so great reviews - either bad workmanship or guess what - bad service!I e-mailed Legacy Fence for a quote to expand our fence.  It also possibly needs to be redone anyways, but I was just wanted a quote to get an idea and figure out when and what we want to do.No response, so I follow-up.  Their response was along the lines of We only do full installations now, but if you want it done later I can contact them back, thanks and good luck.  I find that response pretty poor, just give me the quote as I asked for one, and just simply say that you are booked at the time, but can get to me in the summer as we would love to take care of this for you!  Instead it implies, yeah we aren't interested in your small job, go somewhere else.If this is the kind of company you want to work with, go for it, but they will never get my business.  Again, look at reviews elsewhere, they are not recommended.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Rudy Cools
text: As an update to my review yesterday, I will say my situation was an unfortunate one.  Within a matter of under an hour of writing my review, I received a call from Rudy Cools.  I also received a message from the owner here.  They take full ownership of the glitch in their phone system and acknowledge my calls.  Since they did come around with customer service after my complaint, I do have to give them props and up the stars in my review.  I still can't say anything about their services and ability to repair, but maybe in the future, I can call them up and give them a 5 star review then!  Hopefully that is not for a long time though!  Thank you for reaching out to me after my review with hopes to gain my business.  It does show you do care about your customers.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Carolina Garage Service
text: I don't like when I have to go from 5 stars to 1, but sometimes it just has to happen.  I highly suggest for you to not use this company!  Turn around and look at others.We had the same exact issue happen 8 months later.  We called on Memorial Day holiday as our garage would not close, it would just come back up.  The only good thing from this, is we received a call shortly after we left a message and set up an appointment for the next evening.Spencer, did not come out this time and sent out a guy who was not competent to do the work.  He clearly did not know what he was doing, and even called up Spencer while he was there to see what he should check out.They said it was our logic board that needed replacing, and it would cost $350.00.  Well we decided to wait, and paid them the $40 fee to come out and check things out.My husband decided to look up this information, and after reviewing multiple websites, he was not satisfied that the other guy that came out knew what he was doing as he did not check out multiple items that should have been checked out (at least according to these websites).We however, decided to go with their expertise, and bought the logic board ourselves.  $80.00, and they wanted to charge us $350.00?  That means they wanted to make $270.00 for a 15 minute job, which is $1,080.00 per hour.  Dang, I'm in the wrong business!At any rate, our logic board was quickly received, my husband switched it out with no problem in 15 minutes, but it did not help or do anything with the issue.  I called Spencer up on Saturday to schedule him to come back out, not his bad helper, which he agreed to come out on Wednesday evening.After thinking about it, we decided we did not want to go with someone we could not trust.  Someone who could not properly diagnose an issue and then wanted to charge us an absurd amount.  We called someone out who could come out on Sunday with no extra charge, no charge to diagnose or let us know what is going on, and was simply amazing!I cancelled with Spencer and e-mailed him stating he should really not cash my $40 check or at least reimburse me for it if he already had.  The response back was that it is for inspecting and not just diagnosing, they do their best to diagnose.  Well obviously his worker doesn't know how to inspect or diagnose, and the proper business thing would be to waive it this time.  He called me up at my work number and wanted to explain how it was inspecting and travel fee.  Whatever it is, it is absurd and we should have not been charged for the fact that you cost us for sending some guy who is young and inexperienced.  He also mentioned that the $350.00 was just an estimate, he didn't know what garage type I had or how much the logic board would be.  Okay, in that case, say I will return with your quote, rather than it is going to be $350.00 to repair.  I was not going to argue with him while I was at work, so I hung up on him.  But there was never an apology, just an excuse for everything.Luckily, we are not out $350, we are only out $120 ($80 for the part and $40 for their fee to check things out).  There is no trust anymore in Carolina Garage Service to properly do things and do it at a reasonable charge.I will be glad to refer you to someone who will not charge to figure out what is going on, will charge you the proper amount, and has a great business personality to deal with. You've been warned!

categories: ['Financial Services', 'Mortgage Brokers', 'Banks & Credit Unions', 'Home & Service', 'Real Estate']
name: Bank of America
text: Bank of America in Belmont, NC is the big bank with the small town atmosphere and customer service to follow suit. I've been familiar with this location for many years and even thought they don't know me by my first name, they're accommodating, helpful for the most part and sometimes willing to go the extra mile.I'm not one to have a love/hate relationship with BOFA, so I tend to accept them at face value, however there is a competitor bank that is across the street that seems more customer centric and knows clients on a first name basis. When it came to a recent mortgage application, I found BOFA to be average or below average but their competitor who I won't name right now has been superb and dedicated to the customer. So, currently I am with the competitor for my mortgage and other loan needs even though I still bank at BOFA. A word to BOFA, name recognition is great but if you don't have the customer service and willingness to be the best at all times you will not keep many clients.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'GoodForKids': True}
categories: ['Nightlife', 'Music Venues', 'Arts & Entertainment', 'Home & Service', 'Sports Clubs', 'Professional Sports Teams', 'Active Life', 'Stadiums & Arenas', 'Television Service Providers']
name: Spectrum Center
text: Welcome to the premier destination for sports, music, family attraction in the Carolinas. Time Warner Cable is a modern coliseum designed to bring the action and excitement to you regardless of where you're sitting. I had the great fortune of recently attending a Charlotte Hornets game recently in the Hardwood Club and it was VIP service from the moment you enter the loading dock to the Hardwood Club Lounge to being center court front row action. The customer service is truly above and beyond what I've experienced at other coliseums around the U.S. and they made sure that all my requests were handled in a professional and courteous manner. Everyone I encountered seemed like they wanted to be there, wanted to make your experience memorable. In the Hardwood Club, the food was very good considering it was buffet style and the seating was intimate but not crowded or loud. And if you want to spend a little quiet time there you can and still watch the game on the 50in televisions. I will definitely be back here soon to do again because its truly an experience not just a game. I will also say my experiences are just related to my recent visit but a culmination of all my visits whether it was a concert, the circus or basketball game.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Sherwin-Williams Paint Store
text: Not being one to go to the big box home improvement stores, I wanted to check out what a "real" paint store was like. When we just moved into our new home, one of the first things we wanted to do was paint over the hideous looking ocean green color in the owner's suite. To be fair, this is the closest Sherwin-Williams Store to our home (about 5 minutes) and I've haven't been to any other Sherwin-Williams stores. As soon as I walk in, I'm greeted by the associate and he asks if there's anything he can help me with. I respond by saying my wife need this particular color and he say's no problem. In my opinion, he went above and beyond when he explained the different types of paints they have, such as quality, texture, warranty and how to not void the warranty by using proper care and maintenance.At the end of the day, I feel more informed and somewhat well versed in paint speak, and when I painted the owner's suite, the paint performed exactly as the associate told me it would. Now, since they've earned my loyalty, I've been here on many occasions to buy paint, ask questions and get their opinions on what type of products would be best for certain situations. And, this Sherwin-Williams is an all in one stop shop, they have all the supplies you need and also, they offer a service to paint for you if need be, but I haven't used that service because I am a DIY type of person. I'm definitely a fan of Sherwin-Williams expert knowledge and customer service.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Lowe's Home Improvement
text: Love me some Lowes in Belmont.  The associates are always helpful and accommodating. The selection is vast and the prices are competitive and if they don't have it then most of the time they'll let you know when they'll be getting a new shipment in. Also, if you're not able to install certain items, Lowes will come out to install for you at a nominal fee. Did I mention how helpful and courteous the associates are? Home Depot has nothing on Lowes except higher prices and unhelpful associates.

categories: ['Professional Services', 'Television Service Providers', 'Home Automation', 'Internet Service Providers', 'Security Systems', 'Home & Service']
name: Spectrum
text: This location services a wide area of cities and people and that shows when you walk in. There is always a line of people and there are only 2 customer service agents there to help you out.  The times that I've been there the customer service agent has been friendly enough considering the constant stream of customers standing in line.  Did I mention the long lines.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False}
name: Lowes
text: This Lowes store can be hit or miss sometimes with their spotty customer service and who you're dealing with. There's one customer service associate at the customer service desk who does just enough to get by and can be rude and indifferent at times. However, I don't want to condemn the entire store because overall there is decent customer service, the store is clean, nice selection of home improvement needs and you can pick up orders placed online.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Home Decor', 'Home & Garden', 'Interior Design', 'Home & Service', 'Furniture Stores', 'Shopping', 'Furniture Reupholstery', 'Local Services']
name: Cowbridge Furniture
text: This local shop contains high quality furniture that you are not going to see anywhere else. Name brands will be mixed and finding an extraordinary piece of furniture is the norm here. If you didn't find what you were looking for the first time your probably find it the next week or so since their stock changes out regularly. Lisa and Scott are inviting and humorous to talk to. Take your time get to know them and they will be on the look out for what you are looking for in furniture.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Belk Shoe Repair
text: ok... This is an awesome place. They are on the fourth floor of the Belks department store in the SouthPark mall.I dropped off a pair of cowboy boots to be re-healed.They just didn't add new rubber to the heal, they removed and rebuilt the stack, replaced the rubber heal. Then they repaired some minor damage on the upper heal of the boot. And I got them back in the same week! All this was done for a VERY fair price. ( I wonder if they allow tipping. )I liked the job they did on my brown boots so much I dropped my black pair of boots for a little more extensive repair.Thanks guys!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Keys & Locksmiths', 'Shopping', 'Contractors', 'Automotive', 'Home & Garden', 'Printing Services', 'Home Decor', 'Local Services', 'Auto Repair', 'Home & Service']
name: Lock Monkeys Locksmiths
text: A friend called for an emergency lockout.The type of lock was identified and price was agreed upon up front. George showed up and confirmation of residence was given and he opened the lock in a couple of minutes. No muss no fuss.George knew his craft, period!This is what a professional locksmith does!Yes call these folks if you have a lock out!!!!Less scrupulous locksmiths will:Never give you a up front priceWill tell your lock is unpick able Will damage your door and lockCharge your a "trip" fee if you choose not to use them, when you didn't sign any paper work.Will always be expensive!!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Paradise Home Improvement
text: A sales person (owner? See picture of business card) used strong arm tactics to sell overpriced windows to an elderly relative. Nice guy - he even arranged financing for 8 years at 17.99% interest. She has excellent credit, so that wasn't the reason for the high interest rate. After many calls and contacting an attorney, we were able to cancel the contract. Mark showed up less than an hour after we cancelled trying to talk us into re-signing. Predatory.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False}
name: Ken' Furniture Repair
text: I wanted to have some minor repair work done to a coffee table and end table. I found Ken online, he was super quick to respond to my email. I sent pictures, he provided a quote quickly and set up an appointment for the following week. The work was done at my home. Took him about 30 minutes and looks as good as brand new without completely stripping, sanding etc. definitely recommend Ken if you need this type of work done.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Air Central Of The Carolinas
text: Very quick to respond to a service call on product they installed in a renovated home I purchased. The 3 man crew were very nice, seemed knowledgeable and efficient in resolving the issues. They also answered my questions about the unit, checked the filter, and even flipped the vent cover to make it easier for checking and changing. They came out in the afternoon of a Friday and I wasn't expecting them to be able to come until Monday.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Johnathon Brown Electric
text: Discovered them through the Nextdoor app. Came out the same day, left to get parts and back in under one hour to take care of the small electrical need. Reasonably priced. Or at least it seemed reasonable to me especially since I needed it done by a licensed electrician. Definitely recommend them and will use them in the future. Matthew, the tech, answered all my questions and relayed all relevant information to me.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Island Tree Service
text: Island Tree Service is as good as it gets! A small business with around 3-4 employees, They were able to come to my house, give me a quote, return within 3 days to do the job and uncut the prices of all the other tree services available!I had about a 60-ish foot weeping willow tree right next to my house, other well known tree services in the area took 4 days or more to call me back with a quote in the $1500.00 - $1800.00 range!When I called Island Tree Service, the owner answered right away, made an appointment to come give me an estimate within 24 hours and scheduled the removal for the tree within 72 hours! I was prepared for the worst when it came to the price, however Island Tree Service's price was only $1200.00! Truly the best price around!Without using a crane they were able to limb this tree, have it all fall straight down without damaging my deck which was within 5 feet of the tree!After the tree was down, the clean up was awesome, they separated and stacked some limb wood for me as I like to have back yard campfires, and loaded their truck up with the rest and hauled it away! They even carved my family's last name into the stump with the chainsaw!I highly recommend everyone to call Island Tree Service before paying any other local/well known tree service

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Island Tree Service
text: Poor business practices. These people decided not to show up. No phone call, nothing. Not dependable at all. Horrible experience! Don't get!

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Island Tree Service
text: Did a great job taking down a massive Linden on our place on Isle La Motte!  It was a busy season, but they kept us up to date on when they were turning up and did an amazing job of getting it down and cleaning up afterwards.I'll definitely use them again!

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Home & Service', 'Furniture Stores', 'Fashion', 'Used', 'Vintage & Consignment', 'Flowers & Gifts', 'Gift Shops', 'Home & Garden', 'Shopping', 'Antiques', 'Home Decor']
name: Pieces Unimagined
text: Very cool vintage shop. Good mix of furniture, typewriters, electric and industrial antiques, records, as well as some new makers pieces, like letters sawed out of old books. Things seemed fairly priced, and there was an employee on duty, fixing things, not hounding people. Although I kinda wish he had hounded the older lady who thought it was okay to sit on a couch and have a loud personal speaker phone call for 30 minutes (not related to buying a piece, or anything). For sure worth a stop!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
categories: ['Shopping', 'Interior Design', 'Home Theatre Installation', 'Arts & Entertainment', 'Mattresses', 'Furniture Stores', 'Art Galleries', 'Home & Service', 'Home & Garden']
name: Rubin's Furniture
text: This place is a ton of fun to visit. They have a main floor with their furniture and then an outlet on the second floor with discounted furniture. They have a lot of super fun furniture, the staff is friendly, and the deals upstairs are pretty damn good. I enjoyed my time here greatly. Oh, and they have free parking behind the building!!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
name: Quality True Value Hardware
text: Three times.  That's my personal record for how many times I've been in this store on one Saturday. Good thing it's only a few blocks away!  They pack a lot of stuff in this small-ish store, it's perfect for picking up that "oh-my-gosh-I'll-never-finish-this-project-without...." sort of item. I've almost always been able to find everything I need when I pop in. Their hours are pretty much daytime hours during the week (7am-5pm) and they close by 4pm on Saturdays. You better make a list of what you need for your weekend projects so you don't miss your chance because they're not open Sundays!Family-owned and it shows, the staff are always super-helpful and friendly.  If you live in the neighborhood they'll even give you a near-neighbor discount! With all the development on Park St., I really hope this place sticks around. It's great!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Shopping', 'Home & Service', 'Hardware Stores', 'Wholesale Stores', 'Paint Stores', 'Building Supplies', 'Home & Garden', 'Nurseries & Gardening']
name: North Side True Value
text: Excellent hardware store on the north side. It's quite big so it's very likely they'll have what you need. Staff are usually quite helpful and easy to find. Prices are decent, I've never felt like things are dramatically different from the big-box stores. They actually set up a hoop house/ greenhouse  in the parking lot in the spring so they are able to stock a number of plants. I felt like there really was a decent selection this year!  Not as much as a full nursery, obviously, but a fair amount of plans and at reasonable prices. No need to head to a big-box store by the mall when this place is so close!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Real Estate Agents', 'Home & Service', 'Real Estate', 'Real Estate Services']
name: First Weber Group Realtors
text: We had a wonderful experience working with Alex Saloutos.  I second what Jason H. said, Alex really does go above and beyond.  As a first time home buyer I had a LOT of questions (and then a few more...and just one more...) and Alex was very patient in answering all of them.  He was very responsive with emails and phone messages too.  Alex's patience also extended to touring homes, sometimes more than once, as we hemmed and hawed our way all around town.  Another very important thing for me was his lack of pushiness.  He really took the time to understand our needs and helped us think through some decisions that we could have made quickly (and been wrong about) had we not had his guidance.   I really felt he genuinely was looking out for our best interest instead of just trying to push us into the first thing that fit.  Genuine and patient, I'd recommend Alex highly.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
name: Bruce
text: We bought a dozen bushes (Yews, to be exact) here over two years ago. We were fairly picky about the size / shape we wanted and staff accommodated us by ordering more of the particular kind we liked. We then got to pick out the ones we wanted from the shipment that arrived (that was more than we needed). I was worried that they would suffer after two harsh winters but even the bushes that were the hardest hit bounced back in the spring & still look great!

name: Mistwood Apartments
text: 72 hours until November 1st.  Do you know where your heat is?  No?  Neither does Mistwood Apartments.  Repeated calls to the office, to property management, to corporate...to no avail.  If you want to write out a check for a deposit, prepare to have your down sleeping bag in your other hand, because you'll most likely need it at night.  Even your 90lb dog will need to be under the covers here.  Clearly if they can't respond to major concerns (i.e, heat) I don't even really need to waste my time going into detail about how the management responds to more minor concerns (i.e., trash removal, insects, etc.).  Details.  Consider yourself warned.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Full Compass Systems
text: Recently rented speakers and microphones for an event and was very pleased with the service and quality. I emailed Full Compass, described my needs, and received a prompt response with a quote (within a couple hours). Easy pick up during regular business hours. I was showed how to use the equipment and it was loaded into my car. Equipment was easy to set up during our event and the sound quality was great! Quick and simple return. Will definitely use them again!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2}
categories: ['Automotive', 'Hardware Stores', 'Glass & Mirrors', 'Home & Garden', 'Auto Glass Services', 'Auto Parts & Supplies', 'Shopping', 'Home & Service', 'Windows Installation', 'Home Decor']
name: Martin Glass
text: I recently called Martin Glass to replace a broken window in my apartment. I called and they were able to schedule a time to come out the next day. Martin Glass came to my apartment, prepped the window, measured, cut the glass there on-site in their truck, and replaced the glass without removing the window frame. This entire process took only about 20-30 minutes and it only cost around $85!!! They called the next day to get my credit card number and I paid over the phone. Super friendly staff, quick, and stress-free process. I would DEFINITELY recommend Martin Glass to anyone!!!!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Home Theatre Installation', 'Home & Garden', 'Lighting Fixtures & Equipment', 'Furniture Stores', 'Home & Service', 'Shopping']
name: RLifestyle
text: I recently purchased a gorgeous leather chaise lounge in a rich shade of chocolate-brown at Rubin's and had a great experience.I had first entertained the idea of purchasing said chair a few months ago and went in to see their selection. Prior to going in, I had found a 10% off coupon in the Reader, so the incentive to purchase from Rubin's rose proportionately.They had a vast selection of modern contemporary furniture on 2 levels. I had a hard time deciding exactly what to select, but after perusing the inventory, I made up my mind.The salespeople were very friendly and helpful, and not at all pushy. The particular chaise I ordered wasn't in stock and had to be ordered from their warehouse in Madison, WI and would take approximately 8 weeks. I was disappointed to have to wait so long, but good things come to those who wait.I got my chair about 3 weeks ago and I absolutely love it. It's comfortable as well as stylish.Can a piece of furniture be sexy? Absolutely. And I just ordered a second chair.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Home & Service', 'Home Network Installation', 'Computers', 'Web Design', 'IT Services & Computer Repair', 'Local Services', 'Shopping', 'Data Recovery', 'Professional Services']
name: Computer Repair Las Vegas
text: Wowza: this business is possibly the most responsive of any I have ever known and I am 66 years old! I have a 2009 Mac Book Pro and recently noted that the trackpad was not responsive and my new software update caused the login page to lag... I sent a note to the office and within minutes I had a response from Adam which explained what he thought I had going on. I have lived here since June 2015 and never got a computer expert in Las Vegas. I put in some automatic Yelp messages to other computer specialists who happily also responded quickly with a welcome and contacts.  I went with this office because though they are furthest away, I just had a good feeling.  I brought in the computer after work yesterday at 4:30 or so and Adam went over the diagnostics with me to let me know what to expect. I saw that he charges wholesale for parts, and he was going to be able to get me a solid state drive which would speed up my Mac. The price sounded great.  I got text messages through Yelp through the afternoon and evening and knew today I could run over at lunch time and pick up my computer. I am so impressed! DJ was at the desk when I went in today. They give you back your hard drive so that any confidential material you have is not compromised. They also don't ask for your iTunes ID and let you download that later too so as to keep your computer private as possible. Also just now at 4:15pm I had to call DJ to ask about my track pad as I have never been great with controlling the mouse and touchpad since it had not worked in a while. DJ walked me through getting started on the System Preferences and I was good to go.  I can wholeheartedly recommend this wonderful business. Prices are very reasonable and now my Mac will probably outlive me for not that much $$$. I will not go anywhere else. Quick, economical, smart and capable is the way to go.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: AT&T
text: Anticipating my trip to Madison to see my grandson i had no idea I would be in the AT&T store at all, having bought my new phone, charger and auto charger... and shipped them online to my home.Well I had issues which were a little complicated to explain about low battery power when using the chargers, and I was so pleased to find Derek who had a great listening ability and was able to explain what he thought I had going on within a matter of minutes.  He troubleshot for me and got me up and running by testing my wall charger as well as my auto charger. I also was able to get some phone cases cheaply which were being discontinued.I was so pleased to have a great store nearby, helpful people like Derek and Jeff and the young woman who helped me with the cases...Thanks to this great team for my new found phone health!!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
categories: ['Home & Service', 'Internet Service Providers', 'Television Service Providers', 'Professional Services']
name: Cox Communications
text: Well anyone who knows me understands that if I must review customer service for a corporate brand I am certainly appreciating how hard the regular people work to get the service rolling for new residents.On Saturday of last week we moved to Las Vegas and made an appointment to have the internet and TV configured.Alex was our serviceman and he worked very hard for 3 hours. He was helpful, polite and knowledgeable.The weather was stifling hot but he never lost his cool and he remained positive and gracious.Alex is a great representative for the company.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Brew & Grow
text: I found the staff to be engaging and friendly, unlike some of the other reviewers. They periodically asked if I needed help or had any questions, and were more than happy to give me advice about growing starters. They also carry Seed Savers heirloom seeds! If you are looking for potting soil they probably won't have it but they've got a pretty great selection of all the stuff you would need to do homebrewing (including wheats and malts by the pound in the bulk section). They also have cheesemaking kits and mushroom growing kits. The inside of the store does look a little industrial warehouse-y so that might be a little off-putting.

name: Mounds Pet Food Warehouse
text: My dog and I love going to Mounds for different reasons. Marnie loves "cleaning up" spilled treats and dog food from the floor, and I love their great selection of treats, toys, and any pet-related accessory. I load up on dog biscuits from their bulk section on the regular and I can always find affordable animal parts for my dog to chew on (they have everything from pig ears to kangaroo organs). The cashiers also offer your dog a treat (and a Mound bar for the humans) at checkout :)

name: Ace Hardware Center
text: I came in the store looking for a shelf support peg that I wasn't sure if they would have. Little did I know, it was a very common part. The friendly employee helping me pointed me in the right direction and I found what I needed. They have everything from lightbulbs to screws to gardening stuff. And they also have parking in the back. Win.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
name: Ace Hardware
text: I'm sure this is true of any Ace Hardware store but the customer service cannot be beat. You are greeted as soon as you walk in and you can always find an employee willing to help you match a screw that fell off your cabinet or mix paint or tell you what kind of light bulb you need. They also allow friendly dogs in the store! Very convenient for when you need a couple of things for a home improvement project.

name: Block Systems Cleaners
text: Had a men's dress shirt laundered here and they got the sweat stains out really well. Also dry cleaned a cashmere sweater and was satisfied with the quality ($2.25 to get a men's shirt laundered and $6.25 to dry clean the sweater). A button fell off my shorts and they sewed it back on (although they used a different button) for less than $2. They did the repair in about an hour. Very friendly service and quick turnaround.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Accredited Home Inspection Services
text: When you buy a house there are two overwhelming feelings that fight for space in your psyche: excitement at the prospect of a new house and fear that you're getting screwed at every turn. Did you offer too much for the house? Can you find a lower interest rate? Should you try to negotiate the origination fee? And of course you need to have the house you want to buy inspected. So you ask your friends who they used (since Yelp has very few inspector reviews) but chances are they can't really remember anything about it. So you make a call.  $400 for an inspection!!! It's outrage! One more opportunity for you to get screwed!! But you make some more calls and determine that is in fact the going rate in Madison. If you find yourself in this boat, you should just call Jon at Accredited Home Inspection. I asked about 4,000 questions when I first talked to him on the phone and he never made me feel like he was trying to get off the phone with me, and he was just really nice. A real person. He only schedules 2 inspections a day (which is unusual, most inspectors do many more) so he can spend more time on each one and can spend more time writing up your report. He walked me through everything at the house I was buying and gave me a sense of how important each issue was (note: inspectors write up every single thing that's wrong: never have a house inspector over for dinner, they will see every flaw in your house). He answered all of my asinine questions and never rolled his eyes at me. His full report came through within 3 hours and was very detailed including pictures. Cross the home inspection off your list of things to worry about when buying a house. Just call Accredited Home Inspection. Now go find movers who aren't going to charge you extra for moving a big screen TV. When you find them, let me know.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'WiFi': 'free'}
name: Residence Inn by Marriott Madison West/Middleton
text: A more than acceptable place to stay in Madison, and there several points that I liked.1)  The room is nice.  It feels more like an apartment than a hotel, because FOR A CHANGE, the bathroom is located near your bedroom.  When you wake up, you pass your sink, jump in the shower, and a quick 180 degree turn from your sink is the closet.  It's a refreshing design that makes you feel at home, instead of having to go all the way to your front door.2)   There is a pretty spacious kitchen in each room, with a microwave, fridge and sink.  I'm not really sure people want to cook a meal in their hotel rooms, but I were the kind of person that wanted to reheat restaurant leftovers, or microwave popcorn, this setup is ideal.3)  A breakfast buffet is included, and they rotated the food every day!  It was shocking, in a good way.  One day was breakfast burritos, the other day was eggs benedict, and yet another day was a egg McMuffin kind of breakfast sandwich.  I never saw the same food twice, and I liked how juice, coffee and water were all self-service.  If I want another orange or cranberry juice, I don't necessarily have all day to wait to find one.  I'd rather just get it myself.This Residence Inn is convenient to shopping and a few Restaurant, and I would gladly stay here again!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Madison Property Management
text: After renting this place remotely (although a friend did go and check it out), I was in for a shock at move-in. The place was incredibly dirty, even though I moved in two days after my lease had started. There were cobwebs everywhere, so much dust that I started coughing, dirt and other particles all over the floor, and of course, the actual structure and appliances were in disrepair. The tubs and sinks were peeling, there were rusted out drawers in the kitchen, soap scum that would not come out of the bathroom fixtures, and lights that were not operational/rusted over. It was shocking, but I wrote to the property manager and they agreed to compensate me. However, it was a negotiation, and the property manager told me there was no way that the place required 8+ hours of cleaning at their professional rate stated in their lease.Turns out, my upstairs neighbors had the same issue and moved into a filthy place. They were compensated double what I received.Then, it was an uphill battle trying to get the owner of the property to fix anything inside. They said it would cost too much money and they needed the place to be empty and to raise rent before they could fix anything. (Funny thing is, I moved to a place in the same neighborhood for the same price that is MUCH newer, cleaner, etc., and it is the same price!) Therefore, I was left with many of the issues I mentioned above, but with no effort on the part of the owner to fix anything.On top of that, their maintenance staff was usually very kind, but there were some times when they (or people they contracted to fix things) would come in and track mud around the apartment and/or damage my belongings. I had to have MPM pay for a new trash can because they broke the lid!In addition, once October rolled around and they started asking about renewing the lease, MPM began their showings. Other landlords in Madison (like my current landlord) try to schedule their showings in fairly short increments (30 mins or so) and on the same day/time period. MPM would block off hour-long periods at inconvenient times (e.g. 5:45pm on a Friday, 10am on a Saturday) and on consecutive days instead of one day (for instance, the company I currently rent with seems to go to certain properties on certain days of the week). It was incredibly difficult to feel like you were living in your own home. There were also incidents where a misunderstanding with the person showing the home led to unpleasant situations; this was mainly due to problems that MPM had with their keys to the place. In response, I would be asked to keep certain doors unsecured so staff could conduct showings, etc. It was incredibly frustrating, since this was an issue that was out of my hands.Finally, after move-out, I was told that the apartment required 7 hours of professional cleaning at the rate of $39.50. This was after I cleaned the apartment extensively over the course of three days; I estimate that I spent about 10 hours at the place Swiffering, vacuuming, getting on my hands and knees to use wood cleaner for the baseboards, floors, doors, shelves, etc., thoroughly cleaning the kitchen and bathroom appliances, and even using the wood solvent/cleaner on the windowsills and inside of the windows. The truth is, the place is incredibly old and dust keeps on accumulating; in fact, pieces of the ceiling/walls seemed to continually break off a little at a time and land on my furniture. I also noticed that dirt was being tracked in during showings, which were consistently happening while I was in the process of cleaning/moving out. However, they were convinced that they would charge me for 7 hours of professional cleaning.When I compared the photographs I took of my initial move-in, I could see a lot of similarities to the kinds of problems they photographed (e.g. a scratch on the wooden floor, yellowing of the tiles on the wall, dirt on the outside of the window -- which isn't the tenant's responsibility since it is on the outside of the building, etc). They were unwilling to admit that I needed 8+ hours of cleaning and did not compensate me fairly at move-in. In fact, my building manager specifically said my documentation did not prove that the apartment required 8+ hours of cleaning. However, the photographic evidence presented at move-out, which they claim amounts to 7 hours of cleaning, is definitely nowhere near as bad as the state of the apartment at move-in. The amount of cleaning supplies used (one big packet of Swiffer wet wipes, almost an entire bottle of wood cleaner, multiple rounds of emptying the vaccum, a whole box of wipes, about 2/3 of a bottle of all-purpose Windex, 2/3 of a pumice stone for the toilet, a substantial amount of bleach and bathroom cleaner, oven cleaner, multiple Magic Erasers, etc.) makes me skeptical about their claims.I hope to contest this with MPM and find a resolution that is amenable to both parties. We'll see what happens. Next step: contacting Wisconsin DATCP.

name: Discount Cab
text: Why do those 6 am flights always seem like a good idea while you're booking them?  I think I finally learned my lesson, especially since I'm still tired from my 6 am flight 2 days later....so not a good idea!  My lovely host, Gabi K, let me stay with her during my brief trip to Phoenix. In an effort to be a good guest and let the gal sleep I called Discount Cab the night before my insanely early flight. I got my ass (quite sore from my pinnacle peak hike) out of bed at 4 AM and waited for my cab service to arrive....and waited....and waited.  After 10 minutes of no cab I decided to give them a call and make sure they were on the way.  The woman who answered the phone informed me that they had canceled the cab service because they didn't have a zip code for my address? No, I had not given them a zip code (which I should add they didn't ask for), but they did have my phone # so they were quite capable of calling and asking for the zip code. And did I receive a phone call...ummm, not so much!  I asked for another cab and she told me it would take at least 20 minutes....I did the math and realized the 20 minutes would cost me another day in Phoenix, which probably wouldn't have been so bad if I had known the cold Chicago weather that was awaiting me.  I did end up making my flight, but with no thanks to Discount Cab.  Gabi K was a real trooper and jumped out of bed to take me.  Thanks Gabi! And shame on you Discount Cab!!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Walmart Supercenter
text: I have actually never been to a Wal-Mart Supercenter before. I'm actually really jealous that they don't have these in the Bay Area. I know, I know political reasons and whatever Wal-Mart is bad. Hey, I have a husband who hasn't had a job since February. I have to save every chance I get. You can buy grocery's and a sensible work outfit all in the same store. This trip I got: Volumizing Shampoo & Conditioner A Watermelon A Birthday Card for my Grandpa Work Gloves as the present for him A 500 piece puzzle to put together with my Grandma A new case for my glasses ( my other one broke on the drive here) A board game called Apples to Apples to play with my Uncle A new hair brush (this also broke in my suitcase) They had free samples  for everyone around the deli area. I had a sample of Sweet & Sour Chicken and a piece of steak cooked on a George Foreman Grill right there on the sales floor. It wasn't crappy at all and the girl cooking it agreed. The self check out line was Re-God-Damn-Diculous! Give a monkey a type writer and it will eventually write a novel. Give a self check out stand to a bunch of elderly, red necks and if I wasn't mistaken there was a real alien from outer space in line also, you will have a cluster Fu**.I swear to God I think there was something from the bar scene in Star Wars buying pampers and a loaf of bread. Other than not calling the X-Files I like this store and wished I had one.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Dr. James F. Ganem, MD
text: I like and trust Dr. Ganem and intend to continue with him as long as I am in the area or at least as long as he is on my insurance.He has a relaxed yet direct and honest communication style that is very refreshing.  In my several visits with the good doctor and his staff I have had overall good experiences and I would recommend him.At this point I am docking from 5 stars based on what can best be considered a glitch in the administration of prescriptions and samples as executed through the support staff at the practice.  This resulted in my taking medication with undesirable side-effects...a medication which was apparently not the first choice for my needs.
