text: While the Dowd is less than 1.5 miles away from the Uptown location, I imagine this particular YMCA is super convenient to the folks who work Uptown. Yes, durr. But, I do prefer the Uptown Y over Gateway for a couple reasons....not only because its closer but...because:-This Y has a nice variety of mid-day group classes, granted they can be pretty crowded at times with all those bankers workin' up a sweat before they head back to work-There is a nice variety of weight equipment and cardio machines arranged in a half moon fashion around the basketball courts (these courts are nice, too)-If you're a swimmer, this is a convenient spot to get your laps done-And I just realized that there is a running track upstairs...who knew?!-Free parking in the Hilton garage - just make sure to park in the correct spots and validate your ticket on your way out of the gymSo, while I typically hit up the Dowd, the Uptown (Childress Klein) location is a nice option if I prefer to run to the gym or catch a specific group class. *FYI: If you're interested in the group yoga classes, go to the front desk first and get a pass. The actual yoga room is down the last elevator bank and through the glass doors. You need a pass to get through security.

attributes: {'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}}
name: Exhale Healing
text: Exhale Healing is now my go-to spot for a hurts-so-good massage. With the fab deal they're running through Yelp right now ($65 for 1.5 hour massage) I couldn't pass up an opportunity to try them out for some massage therapy.Conveniently located across from Park Rd. Shopping Center, Exhale Healing is four floors up in the brown brick building off of Park Rd. Easy peasy parking! When I walked into their suite, I was greeted by the smiling faces of Olga and Erin. Hubs wanted a relaxing Swedish massage and I was looking for more of a deep tissue, kick the crap out of my muscles kind of massage. I was placed with Erin and when we entered the massage room she evaluated my posture, spine and overall range of motion. Let me tell ya, 1.5 hours of myofascial release massage (deep tissue) is both fantastic and to-the-limit intense at the same time. I felt straighter, taller and more balanced overall. If you have a stiff back, soreness or just need a relaxing massage of any kind, check out Exhale Healing. Their massage therapists are top notch and they definitely offer a great value for any length of time!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Re Salon and Med Spa
text: Gorgeous space, talented staff...what more could you ask for in a salon & spa? Jesse is the man when it comes to haircuts. While he's adept at all lengths, it's the short lengths where he really shines. He updated my cut to an edgier version that I'm loving. As for color, I visited Autumn for a partial highlight...and was very impressed she focuses on balayage as her technique. The application looks soft and natural and I loved the gloss she applied afterwards. Next time I'll be going a bit darker, though. Price points for both cut and color are mid-range to a touch above.  The space is a stunning, remodeled fire house full of really friendly, educated staff. Whether you're looking for a salon service, facial, mani/pedi or a more medically backed option like fillers, re Salon should be on your to-try list!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Greenapple Sports & Wellness
text: When you work or workout too hard, this is the place to go in Charlotte. Whether it's a chronic aching back or a small muscle tear in your shoulder from overuse (ahem, me), I fully recommend visiting Dr. Evan Kahn. I snagged his card at Ultimate Crossfit (the gym where I work out) as I couldn't really move my shoulder too much. Oh, and it hurt like hell. The ladies at the counter greeted my happily on the phone, scheduled my appointment and greeted me again when I walked through the door. The ladies also looked into my insurance to pull more details of how many sessions are covered, co-pay/deductible amounts, etc. That I really appreciate! I also think it's awesome that when one of the ladies answers the phone she says, "Greenapple Sports & Wellness, I can help you!" The office is nice, conveniently located and super clean. Dr. Kahn assessed my injury started treatment that same day and after a few sessions I'm on my way to a normal, functioning shoulder. As other reviewers have stated, whatever kind of injury you have, it's definitely worth a visit to these guys. They're honest, helpful, to the point and trustworthy - exactly what I want out of any doctor!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'GoodForKids': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Gyms', 'Local Services', 'Active Life', 'Health & Medical', 'Child Care & Day Care', 'Fitness & Instruction', 'Weight Loss Centers']
name: Gateway Village YMCA
text: In comparison to the other nearby YMCAs (Dowd, Childress) Gateway is a bit dwarfed. However, as Tm has pointed out, if you're looking for a quick, no fuss workout, this is a perfect place to go. Expect a fair amount of cardio equipment and a decent share of weighlifting machines - all clean and in good working order. You'll also find a small selection of benches and hand weights and a small area to stretch.While I haven't made it to a class here as of yet, it's mainly because the Dowd is closer to my house. Parking can also be a bit difficult, so take heed of the restrictions & meter rules around here! If I'm in the area and need to fit in a fast, efficient workout, the Gateway Y is a great option!

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: eyecarecenter
text: I originally chose this office for my contact exam as it's very close to my home. Overall I was really pleased with my visit. Every staff member is very nice and they have a decent selection of frames. Dr. Bailey is very knowledgable and is easy to talk to about your eye needs. Don't be too deceived by the exterior - it's a nice office!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Beauty & Spa', 'Eyelash Service', 'Eyebrow Services', 'Permanent Makeup', 'Nutritionists', 'Hair Removal', 'Health & Medical', 'Waxing']
name: Simply Bare
text: Jessica is awesome!! I've gone to her for all my waxing needs for about 5 years. After I've since left the Valley and moved to Texas, I still fly over to Phoenix for her to do it. I'd always wanted to get a Brazilian wax, and just never got around to it. I recommend going to someone who's really good with that for your first one, and good at conversation, very easy to talk to, and excellent at setting you at ease--so trust me when I say Jessica is all that! I wasn't sure what to expect with this particular wax, but she is great at conversation which helps take my mind off of it (it makes it go by faster!). She also gave good pre-wax advice for my very first time. Her prices are reasonable. I'm very happy with the results month after month. Jessica has other services as well, and she is all you need for your waxing. Her location is now in the nice new salon studios on the SWC of Indian School Rd and 32nd St.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Downtown Phoenix Dental
text: Well, I've done pretty well in finding some good spots in Phoenix after moving here from NC. First I found a good general doctor, then I found a great hair stylist, and now I appear to have done well on the dentist pick. I found Downtown Phoenix Dental because my office, when I choose to use it, is downtown. Walking to the office one day, I passed the dentist office's sign out by the corner. Good advertising! I checked out their Yelp reviews, which looked pretty good, and made an appointment. The office is rather hip and modern looking, kind of open. They file everything with your insurance company first, and then let you know if you have a balance of any kind to pay. If so, you can pay them online or in the office. They send you an email to confirm your appointment, and they've been really cool with me when I've needed to reschedule. Ask for Stephanie the dental hygienist!! She's awesome.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Day Spas', 'Restaurant', 'Gyms', 'Medical Spas', 'Active Life', 'Health & Medical', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Fitness & Instruction']
name: Tocasierra Spa and Fitness
text: My sister and I visited Tocasierra Spa while on vacation in Phoenix (we were staying at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak, which this spa is a part of).  We scored facial and pedicure appointments with little notice, and were very impressed with the spa facility and the staff.  I still contact this spa (from North Carolina!) to mail-order their sugar butter body scrub and lotion -- it is the BEST!  If you are in Phoenix and need spa services or just a manicure/pedicure, I recommend calling Tocasierra.  At the time we were in Arizona, we read that Tocasierra was rated one of the top ten spas in the state so you may be better off getting an appointment instead of hoping for walk-in luck.  We probably got lucky with our appointments because we were staying at the hotel.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
name: GNC
text: This GNC was convenient when I was searching for a juice cleanse recently. The store seems to be a bit smaller than others I've seen. The guy working on this day was helpful. He greeted me as soon as I walked in the door; after I showed him a picture on my phone of what I wanted, he walked me over to exactly what I was looking for. I like this location better than the one on Camelback in PHX. It seems to be cleaner and the folks more helpful.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Spectrum Eye Care
text: Dr. David Wichnoski was my eye doctor in Charlotte for several years before I relocated to Raleigh.   He has two locations, this one near Quail Hollow at the intersection of Rea and Colony Roads, and another location uptown in the BB&T building (Overstreet Mall). Dr. Wichnoski is very personable and thorough, and very good at explaining things in laymen's terms.  His staff is friendly, which is a big deal for me.  I still have and use a pair of dark red-framed Nicole Miller glasses I LOVE, which one of his staff members helped me choose the frames for, which I have no desire to replace.  My contact lenses always arrived in 3-4 days when they ordered them. If you're in Charlotte, I definitely recommend Dr. Wichnoski.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Central Phoenix Eye Care
text: Once again, Yelp did not disappoint when I needed to find a new doctor. Having just moved to Phoenix from across the country, I needed a new eye doctor (and new contact lenses!). I made an appointment and brought paperwork from my previous eye doctor. The ladies at the front were very friendly and welcoming.  I saw Dr. Frank -- the exam was thorough and he patiently answered incessant questions from a Phoenix newbie. My new contacts arrived way earlier than I expected. They even offered to tighten up my existing glasses! What service! I definitely recommend this eye care practice! They could use better signage out by the road in front of their building. They're in a taller building on Seventh Street, on the east side, just south of Bethany Home.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Charlotte Dentistry
text: One-star reviews are extremely rare for me (this is only my second one), and I don't do so lightly.  I went to this dentist for years when I lived in Charlotte, from 1996 to 2009.  They seemed to be okay, though I had a few issues here and there. Once one dentist left me so long that the numbing for a small cavity filling wore off before he got back. Had to re-inject me and wait again while that one took effect. Another dentist (no longer works here) and the dental hygienist talked in a foreign language for a few seconds while they were working on me...and you know what that means as far as what (who) they were talking about...very uncomfortable... I've been blessed with pretty good teeth -- have only had two cavities that I remember, and those were tiny...one didn't even require numbing, and the other was borderline so I opted for it (the aforementioned absentee dentist).  I also had a couple of "clean and seals" where they grind out a soft spot in your enamel and then seal it to prevent it from becoming a cavity. I've since moved to another city and had to get another dentist here locally. On my first visit it was quickly determined that my new dentist would have to re-do everything that this dentist's office had done.  One of my (tiny -- hello?! this shouldn't have been hard!) cavity fillings had since fallen out, unbeknownst to me, and the seals were both poorly done and were leaking.  One of the seals was so bad that decay had formed under it and was starting to get bad -- nothing the new dentist couldn't clean out and fix up, but -- SHEESH!  My new dentist blasted out both seals, cleaned the decay under the one tooth, and redid the seals properly.  He also replaced the now-missing filling on the tiny cavity.Needless to say, I just dropped $300 (my out-of-pocket after insurance) to have this dentist office's work redone.  Not happy.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Providence Eye & Laser Specialists
text: My experience with Providence and Dr. Mozayeni was fantastic. The journey that brought me to laser eye surgery has been a long one. I finally had enough with hard contact lenses, glasses, and waking up pretty much blind. Every step of the process was easy and painless..I mean, except for the part where they shoot lasers in your eyes to cut a flap in your cornea, if you're thinking about LASIK, you should already know about this part. The staff was wonderful - efficient and friendly each and every time I went into the office. Dr Mozayeni is one of the most patient and knowledgeable doctors I've come across and I felt like I was in competent hands throughout the process. He's one of the best in the industry and I wanted nothing but the best for my eyeballs. I can see clearly now..the rain has gone. I can see all the obstacles in my wayyy.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Cotswold Medical Clinic
text: Best clinic I've ever been to. Receptionists are super friendly and quick with paper work and getting you checked in. Nurse is knowledgeable and also very friendly, I feel like an old friend every time I come in. And Dr. Ibe is the most thorough, patient doctor I've ever had. She answers all my questions, makes sure everything that can be done onsite is done (x-rays, vaccinations, other scans, etc.), and is quick about it all without making me feel rushed. She's both a general practitioner and ob-gyn, so that makes things easier.Appointments are easy to make, but may sometimes take more than a day. However, I've walked in before and haven't had to wait a terribly long time. Definitely my #1 recommendation for clinics in the area.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Southpark Oral Surgery
text: Dr. Bond came to my rescue in a big way and for that I'll be forever grateful. I had been experiencing mouth pain for about a week which I thought was just an injured gum, but after getting it checked by my dentist I found out it was an impacted wisdom tooth. I had an upcoming medical procedure scheduled that would prevent me from having the tooth extracted for another 2 weeks, so I had to get the surgery within the next few days. My dentist explained the situation to Dr. Bond and he fit me in that very same day. Not only was he incredibly accommodating, but the extraction itself went very smoothly. It seems that pulling teeth is not has painful as they make it seem. His bedside manner was fantastic and his front office was easy to work with. All in all, it was the best dental experience I've ever had. I'd recommend him to anyone in need of solid dental surgeon.

name: Cotswold Family Medicine
text: Cotswold Family Medicine has a severe case of Dr. Jekyll & Mr. Hyde.  On one side you have caring, knowledgeable doctors who make an effort to connect with their patients. On the other side you have a management and front office that goes out of its way to make your visit experience as hellish as possible.  I've been going to these doctors since '04 and these shifts in culture only started within the last couple of years.We've had cancellations of appointments (that were made months in advanced) for no reason and at the last moment.  I've had their coordinator schedule back-to-back appointments between specialists and my doctor only to have them attempt to refuse seeing me because of my tardiness (which was expected and had been noted in the appointments by the coordinator herself).  They even fired a phlebotomist who had been with them for over 12 years and was the best damn phlebotomist I had ever encountered.  Not even small, rolling veins could stop this man from painlessly drawing blood from you.The straw that broke the camel's back for me was their "new" policy on prescription refills.  If I had run out of refills and needed a doctor's approval they no longer gave it to the pharmacy if it had been over 30 days since my last visit.  In essence, I would have to schedule a doctor visit every 30 days to continue receiving a medicine that they had already been prescribing me for YEARS.  This blatant attempt at boosting their revenue sickens me.  It doesn't improve your quality of care and penalizes those with limited or non-existent medical insurance.  Would you think it fair to pay out of pocket for a visit (minimum 80 bones and upwards of 150+) when all you need is a refill of your 10 dollar medicine?I will greatly miss the wonderful doctors of this facility, but the hurdles management has put in place are more than I care to go through anymore.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Premier Smiles
text: Snagged a Living Social deal for this place.  Friendly staff and nice doctor.  She was very easy to chat with and answered all my questions thoroughly.  Good teeth cleaning as well.  Only drawbacks were that the place was difficult to find (their signage needs updating) and one of their dental chairs was defective.  The neck rest kept sliding down into my back which made it uncomfortable to sit in.  Also, the constant readjustment of the neck rest killed the flow of my visit.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: CVS Pharmacy
text: This CVS/pharmacy is located on East 9th Street one block or so down from the Hampton Inn. If you are staying at the hotel, it's convenient for picking up snacks and drinks, toiletries, or other supplies you have forgotten or run out of.The store is very run down and grungy. There were out of a lot of products and the store was in disarray. I was looking for a single serving of bottled tomato juice or V-8 juice - they were totally out. I picked up some bottled water and toothpaste here.The place is need of a major retrofit. Get rid of the carpet!

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': False, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Marc's Stores
text: Marc's has lots of crazy stuff.  Woody Hayes dolls, Eddie George nesting dolls, and other good Ohio State/Cleveland Browns stuff for all the kids and family.  It's also a supermarket.One downside, they only take the Discover card.  So get cash before you go.

name: Hudson Elms Nursing Home
text: Rehabilitation Services Review - this standard bearer of elderly care is going through some challenges in letting go of past practices.My mother checked in today for a 6 week stay while she recovers from her latest knee surgery.  She will be leaving tomorrow.  While they do offer wi-fi, which may seem like a luxury to some seniors but has been part of my mother's daily life for over 10 years, they do not offer a phone.If you wish to get a phone you have to call the phone company and have it installed as if you were... renting an apartment? She is not in the permanent care portion of the facility.  While other competing providers in the area do not provide wi-fi... this is the only one that does not offer a phone.She is in a semi-private room and there is only one television, and no remote. Her room mate has the curtains drawn and prefers privacy, which is fine, but this means my mother is at the whim of this other person's viewing choices and hours.  She has to have help even getting in a wheel chair right now so not having a remote to mute a TV when a phone call comes in... oh wait... no phones... I guess that's why no remotes?Lastly, there is no choice of food.  My mother hasn't eaten fried food in years... tonight it is either tater tots or no "vegetable" to go with the sloppy joes. With the 4 different antibiotics she is taking all she asks for is simple, salt free, baked or broiled.This was the last straw for her... she contacted another facility in the area and scheduled a transfer.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Cleveland Clinic - Hillcrest Hospital
text: Had an episode while vacationing in Cleveland - before you ask what was I thinking vacationing in Cleveland - let me finish.Had an episode while vacationing in Cleveland, checked myself into the ER at Hillcrest that led to a 24 hour stay up in the main tower. Therefore, I got the full experience - ER, overnight stay, pre-op, and eventually operations room. Every person in my aid were tremendous, which made my stay as comfortable as possible. Superb nursing staff, nursing aids, and physicians.Hospital food is notorious for being terrible, but I thought the food here wasn't bad here at all. And beds had the inflatable air mattress that adjusts with weight shift.Not that I'll ever look forward to another ER visit, but just wanted to share my wonderful experience with those in need of medical attention in Cleveland.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Lakewood Family Health Center - Cleveland Clinic
text: The staff here is very professional; there is a lab on site so you don't have to worry about making an extra trip to a hospital.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Marc's Stores
text: Where I am from, we don't have Marc's. Therefore, I was terrified to go to one through most of college. I had it in my head that it was "discount food." Think about that...who wants to eat old food? or "cheap food?" It brings images of old, moldy produce or green meat. I was pleasantly surprised when I went to my first Marc's in Strongsville. It was clean and organized. The Lakewood Marc's is not that Marc's. Try to avoid weekends or shopping after quitting time. I prefer Aldi's on w.117th for my bargains. However, the only place I know to buy kick-A $1 wigs around Halloween time is Marc's. $1 Halloween wigs is worth a trip to this crazy, scatterbrained discount store. I always feel completely stupid when I am here because I only speak 1.1 languages and everyone else here seems to bilingual.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Lake County Family Practice
text: I've been coming to see Dr. Taylor here at Lake Family Practice since I was a wee little Cara. Honestly, I can't say I would ever consider going to someone or somewhere else unless I was forced to. These folks are beyond caring and nice. They're always busy but can always get you in with a day or two, sometimes within hours! And yes, I will drive all the way from Ohio City to go see my favorite doctor all the way in Mentor. It's well worth the 35 minute drive. And yes, I do realize that folks are bringing their families here. But hey, I'm 26 and I'm sitting in the waiting room with all the little kids--I don't care. My parents and my sister still come here, too! You don't have to be a baby to come to a family practice, you know. I also love that I have a medical professional familiar with the health history of not only myself, but my family as well. I know I can come in with questions and get all the answers I need. I also know that Dr Taylor accepts and realizes my ridiculous hypochondria and worry. *Sigh* I almost feel like he deserves a metal for dealing with me. But he's always smiling and nice, so I don't think he minds too much. Anyways, if you're looking for a great family doctor, try looking here at Lake County Family Practice. It's worth the drive, trust me.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Abrams Eye Center
text: Last update for Abram's Eye Center--promise! My eyes have gotten better! Yes, better! In the three years I've been going to Dr. Abram, he's gotten me on track with taking care of my eyes and put me in contacts that are much more breathable. Because of all this, my vision has improved, prescription has lowered and the overall health of my eyeballs is much better! Can't get much better than that! Highly recommended!

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Marc's Stores
text: I was harassed in the parking lot by a uniformed attendant, since i had unknowingly parked in the lot and grabbed a snack from robeks nearby before heading back to marcs. I understand it was a policy, but I'm from out of town and was only there to buy a six pack for a family party. It was Saturday morning at 11am, the lot was less than half full. The attendant would not disclose the owner's name or even her name. If anyone knows the property owner's information, please let me know, I'd like to write them a piece of my mind.Also, no credit cards at marcs (except discover, but who has that except for grandmas and poor college kids?) The rest is good I guess, but I was left smoldering from being berated by a mall security cop in the parking lot.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': False, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Marc's Stores
text: Marc's has some of the cheapest groceries you're going to find in Parma.  That's why I shop here.  I figure, 'you could pay more, but why?'Pros: low prices, interesting selection of random, non-grocery items like furniture, paintings, ice scrapers, ink pens, you name it.Cons: Limited payment options.  Accepts cash, check, Marc's gift card, Discover Card.  Sometimes the gift cards don't work, which blows my mind.  Inconsistent in-stock condition.  One week, they'll have a product, the next week, they won't have it.  Marc's doesn't have a 'great' selection, but they usually have what you need.  Slow checkout.It is obvious that Marc's management does everything humanly possibly to cut costs, which is great.  They take it a step too far though, in my opinion.  I understand cutting costs to reduce operating expenses and then passing those savings to customers.  But can't they at least update the registers?  I mean, I have to buy gift cards from my daughter's school (screwy part of her tuition agreement) because her school gets kickbacks for selling so many dollars worth of gift cards each month.  When I go to use my Marc's giftcards, the cashiers usually can't figure out how to scan them in the system.  I guess the scanners suck or the gift card bar codes are too thin.  Anyway, this function needs improvement.Overall, Marc's is good, but nowhere near as good, or expensive, as Giant Eagle.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Cleveland Clinic - Main Campus
text: I gotta hand it to the Cleveland Clinic for professionalism.  It's strange to be treated like you're at a 4-star hotel when visiting the Clinic, at least, that was my impression.  My father-in-law is in town from Puerto Rico.  He needed a procedure done pretty quick one day.  So I called the clinic's scheduling phone number and was able to get an appointment in an hour!  This isn't to say that everyone would get an appointment in an hour, so I guess we were lucky.  I was on the phone with an Alan, who told me where to go and what to do once we get there to ensure we get to the appointment on time.  He recommended valet parking at the Intercontinental Hotel, which we did.  That saved us at least 15 minutes.  Once we were in the clinic, we were able to find the doctor's office pretty quickly.  Since my father-in-law is considered an international patient, he had to register as an international patient, which took only 10 minutes.  Then, a worker from the international patients registration desk took us to talk to the finance guy, who basically took the credit card information.Finally, we were escorted to the office where the appointment was.  First, on floor 7, they took my father-in-law's vital signs and cleared him for the next step of the process.  We then went to the 8th floor where he was screened with questions.  Once we passed that test, we went to the 9th floor where the actual procedure was performed by the doctor.  Unfortunately, the doctor recommended surgery as a result of the procedure.So about a week and many follow-up visits later, my father-in-law had surgery and recovered at our home.  We were also assigned a very nice interpreter, not that we needed one.  Instead of interpreting, she was really there to comfort us and answer any questions we had during the process.  She would simply show up each time we had an appointment and she visited after the surgery too.This whole process left me in awe, not only of the physical monstrosity that is the Cleveland Clinic, but also of the superior level of service that they strive for to provide every moment of every day.I'm going here from now on for my appointments.Totally recommend!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Case Western Reserve University
text: We had a volleyball tournament at CWRU this weekend and the recreation facility was very nice. The bathrooms were clean and they had a snack bar selling food to those who needed it. They also sold T-shirts for the volleyball tournament, which was a nice touch.The two gyms can accommodate seven volleyball courts, but only five were in use. The facility had plenty of bathrooms and drinking fountains and places to camp out. Also included was free WiFi. There was a huge windmill outside spinning quickly due to the strong winds. It's good to see electricy being produced at very little cost and with minor impact on the environment. This was my first close up visit to CWRU and it seems like a wonderful school.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Bright Now! Dental
text: My daughter got Invisalign braces from Bright Now Dental recently and they are so much better than braces. So far, she has had no issues. According to my daughter, Invisalign is more comfortable than braces (no wires stabbing her mouth), more aesthetically pleasing than braces, and removable. She has to wear Invisalign 20 hours per day. She removes the brackets while eating and replaces them after. You can't take braces off to eat! Additionally, the brackets provide support similar to a mouth guard, which is great because my daughter plays sports.She visits the orthodontist every six weeks to get three new sets of brackets. She wears the brackets for two weeks before replacing them. Overall, she will go through 32 sets of brackets before her treatment is complete.Dr. Sebastian Baumgaertel is very knowledgeable and friendly as is the entire staff at Bright Now Dental. They offer favorable financing options. I am glad we switched to Bright Now Dental!I've been having a billing issue, however, which, unfortunately, is taking months to resolve. Minus one star for slow customer service.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}}
name: LensCrafters
text: Stopped in to LensCrafters for an eye exam and I was able to make a same day appointment.  When I arrived, they quickly accepted my new insurance plan and I met with the optometrist.  The optometrist was very courteous, professional, and he answered all of my questions.  I only had to pay a $5 co-pay and my insurance covered the remaining $145.With the lenses that he prescribed, I get 20x15 vision, which is better than normal.  I don't like wearing glasses, but having above average vision with my glasses makes me happy.  I can see signs from further away than my wife who supposedly has 20x20 vision.I had a great time!  I never buy lenses or frames at LensCrafters, but the optometrist and his team are great!  I get my lenses and frames for about 1/2 the price elsewhere.Recommend the optometrist!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: UH Rainbow Babies & Children's
text: I was at CWRU for a volleyball tournament recently and there wasn't any decent food at the recreation center. So a hunting we went. We came across Rainbow Babies & Children's Hospital and we visited the cafeteria. I found a salad bar, which had tempting, fresh offerings. I scooped up some spinach, broccoli, cauliflower, tomatoes, cucumber, dried cranberries, sunflower seeds, and boiled egg and put them into my salad dish. I also added light ranch dressing.My salad was excellent and I will keep this healthy option in mind next time I'm in the neighborhood.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
name: Vision Yoga & Wellness
text: Vision Yoga is so great! I've been coming here for several months now for Fri yoga classes. The owner, Theresa, is great - she recognizes and knows all the regulars and is well-known in the W 25th area among other retailers, restaurant + store owners. She also cares a lot about health and well-being and is willing to offer programs to address them.I've been to Theresa's classes mostly and once for Caressa's. They are both great instructors, albeit with different styles. I appreciate how much instruction they give, and Theresa always seems to choose poses that address the areas I need to that week, and changes up the challenges depending on who is there + their level of expertise. I leave feeling refreshed and like everything in my body is straightened out. The ambiance is also great - great wood floors and a quiet space with lots of natural light, especially during morning classes! I'm a regular here and it's great!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Comfort Zone
text: I discovered this place yesterday in Beachwood Mall! I really appreciate acupressure and never thought I would find a place like this in the Cleveland area.I am really starting to feel the whole "I'm getting old" thing, so this type of massage feels more therapeutic than pure relaxation. I elected to try the 10 min acupressure neck/shoulder massage for $12 and it helped to release some of my shoulder strain that I've been feeling.I also tried the 30 min foot reflexology massage - they definitely use strong hands and got some good relief on my calf muscles. They also give you water and a towel to cover your face so that you don't have to awkwardly sit there and watch them. They have a range of options, anywhere from 10-60 min for neck/shoulder, foot, or full body. No need to make appointments - walk-in is fine. I'll definitely be back if I need a massage!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Heavenly Healing Hands Massage Therapy
text: Very unprofessional. I received two groupons as gifts. Heavenly Healing Hands does not do phone bookings; you need to book with them (namely, Donna) online. After a few email exchanges, I got an appointment. I liked my masseuse and it was a satisfactory massage until I found out that the groupon doesn't cover the tip and tax of $20. I had to run out to the bank because they took cash only- no check or credit card. I asked the massage therapist (who was not Donna) about this policy since it was the first that I heard of it. She told me there was an email sent that morning. When I checked my email later, it was sent 20 min before my appointment when I was already on the road...I received a second groupon as a gift. I tried emailing, and I received a long response telling me the companies policies, that booking was hard, and to email with my preferences. They emphasized daytime appointments, so I offered daytime appointments. When I didn't hear back from them, I sent another email. Donna replied personally asking for my preferences again... And so I sent them again. That was a month ago.I sent an email today following up and expressing dissatisfaction. Usually, this is a sign to business owners that you should probably so something if your customers are unhappy. Instead, I got a long auto response email back about how groupon has been bad for business owners like Donna, that only male massage therapists are available, and that she is injured. In the email, she asks for patience, but she should have at least answered my email from a month ago explaining the situation. It's impossible to schedule an appointment with this company, and their practices are unclear and shady. I still cannot believe that you can't call to talk to the business owner. I certainly hope no workers and customers are being taken advantage of in this situation.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Hirsh Dermatology
text: Although this is Hirsh Dermatology, home of Drs. Fred and Alex Hirsh, there's another doctor in the mix - Dr. Laura Kwasniak. I see Dr. Laura monthly for alopecia treatments. While I wish I didn't have to undergo these treatments, Dr. Laura makes my visits as painless as possible. Unlike many doctors, she treats you like a person, and not just a social security number on a chart. She really listens to what you have to say and is great about answering all of your questions before you leave the room. As an added bonus, the reception and nursing staff is also very friendly. Just be prepared to walked into a packed house when you have a visit. It always seems like the place is hoppin' when I go in. (and the average age of patients is 75 or so, but...)If you're in need of a dermatologist, I highly recommend Dr. Laura.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Johnson Michael A DDS
text: 5 stars for a dentist? I know...I'm surprised, too. But you really get 5 star service at this office. From the receptionist, to the xray tech, to the hygenist...everyone is nice, professional...and treats you like a human being, not just another set of teeth.Scheduling is a breeze. There are even text reminders in case you schedule way far in advance. Another thing that impresses me? Dr. Johnson has photos all over his office of him performing dental work on children in third world countries. I tend to sit on my couch when I'm on vacation...but this guy is out there making a difference.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Cleveland Clinic - Sports Health Center
text: As an accident prone "athlete" I'm a big fan of Cleveland Clinic's sports health facility.  They offer same day appointments for sports injuries, which is good when you know you're seriously injured and don't want to have to deal with the hassle of going to the ER or urgent care. Why wait multiple days when you can get an on the spot diagnosis and treatment plan?  There are a variety of doctors on hand any given day of the week to treat whatever body party you may have injured.  They also have on-site x-rays and MRIs to help expedite the diagnosis/treatment process.Depending on when you're there, you might just see one of Cleveland's athletes waiting for treatment, too!

attributes: {'RestaurantTableService': False, 'Alcohol': 'none', 'Caters': False, 'HasTV': False, 'RestaurantGoodForGroups': True, 'NoiseLevel': 'quiet', 'RestaurantAttire': 'casual', 'RestaurantReservations': False, 'OutdoorSeating': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'RestaurantDelivery': False, 'Ambience': {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'classy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'touristy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': False}, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}}
name: Eden's Market
text: Aw - I love this place and I'm excited to write the first review for it.If you're looking for gluten free, sugar free, dairy free, unprocessed snacks and food - come to Eden's Market.Eden's Market carries a wealth of exceptional gluten free goods, organic beauty finds, supplements, and much more.The owner is a Celiac - so he in invested in making sure that not one of the items in his store contains gluten and he is passionate about spreading awareness about whole and healthy foods. The owner is often at the store and if you have any questions in regards to health or about any of the products in the store - he is extremely helpful and offers invaluable personalized service in helping you find what you need.I was beyond impressed at the selection at Eden's Market and found the selection to be more substantial and more affordable than most San Francisco health stores.I picked up a couple of packets of Brad's Raw Veggie Chips, some Kale Chips and a number of other coveted finds here. I wanted to buy everything in the store.Mount Lebanon obviously knows what's up when it comes to healthy local gems such as Eden's.Trust.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
name: CVS Pharmacy
text: The times I've been here, its been an OK experience. However, their store hours are absolutely terrible. Closing at 7pm basically means they're never open when I would need to go there. Despite this being more conveniently located, Walgreens and Target end up getting most of my quick-shop business, simply due to late hours at night when I need to cook, clean, realize I'm out of toothpaste, have a headache, need a last-minute birthday card or whatever.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Massage Heights Bakery Square
text: As someone who travels weekly for business, including working long hours and bringing all luggage via carry-on, it takes a toll on my body, and I also tend to hold all this stress in my shoulders and back. While I was initially staying at the Marriott Springhill Suites at Bakery Square, I saw this establishment and called to inquire and make an appointment back on October 16th. I scheduled a 90 minute deep tissue massage with Jessica. Including tip, I paid $89.98. Great price for a first time visitor special!However, though I was happy with both the facility and the price, I found Jessica to be rather cold and short - no matter what I did to make small talk, build rapport, and/or explain my pain points in order to best mitigate. I almost felt as though I was the customer service professional providing the service, rather than the reverse - this was how far I had to go to establish a bond, and even then I felt more judged by Jessica than the reverse. Her attitude and demeanor were not something I'd want to experience again, and this is unfortunate given her chosen profession - helping people relax and feel comfortable.Also, the massage was decent - good when she got to my back, but the front leg and arm and neck massage was slightly awkward and uncomfortable, I recall. Also, though she asked about aromatherapy, I found it weird that she called it something like "smelly stuff" - unprofessional. Also, I wish I'd been offered hot stones, as I would have (and had planned to) happily add that to my service. All in all, I wasn't too impressed or pleased, but it wasn't terrible.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Paul B. Gabriel DMD
text: "Please be advised that I will no longer be able to treat you as a patient.  To get the type of dental care you are looking for, I feel you would be better served at another dental office.  The termination of our physician/patient relationship will be effective 30 days from the date of this letter.  The office will be available for emergency treatment only, so that you have adequate time to find another dentist." The above verbiage is the entire body of the letter I received from Dr. Gabriel's office last month.  I also scanned the letter and uploaded it as a photo.  The letter is dated 10NOV2014, and I received it in the mail on 22NOV2014.  So much for those 30 days, huh?I don't know why I was essentially fired as a patient; this is a first for me, and I certainly didn't see this coming.  The letter offers no explanation, so stating the following is only speculation...* Perhaps the Front Desk didn't appreciate my calling out the lack of proper privacy policy in my original Yelp review.* Perhaps they weren't fond of my challenging the charge for "fluoride varnish," which apparently is rarely covered by insurance companies and which wasn't brought to my attention prior to application. * Perhaps the hygienist didn't like me much.  I got that impression during my cleaning but opted not to reference the hygienist's grouchy--that's a relatively nice word; another word comes to mind--disposition in my first review.* Perhaps I'm too high-maintenance of a patient.  This office may just prefer patients who quietly come and go and don't ask questions.Who knows.Also, not long before the letter was received my husband called and scheduled his first appointment at this office.  We have a unique last name, so I can't help but think the Front Desk knew about my situation and yet let my husband schedule his appointment anyway.  Needless to say he cancelled and won't be a patient here.  Nor will the other individual I referred.I sure will "be better served at another dental office."Will I be filing a formal complaint through my insurance provider?  You bet.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Acqua Blu Medical Spa
text: In recent months I've visited Toni at Acqua Blu Medical Spa for an IPL photofacial and microdermabrasion, both at significant discount courtesy of Groupon.First things first, have no fear, the building's interior is much nicer than the exterior.  I have to admit that when I pulled into the complex (Acqua Blu Med Spa + Premier Plastic Surgery & Dermatology) for the first time I was speechless when I saw that, well, this building is hardly the nicest or newest in the area.  And the gray-as-gray-can-be sky didn't help.In December I treated myself to a photofacial to remove or at least minimize some small capillaries on my nose and some light sun spots on my cheeks.  I'd been interested in a photofacial for years, so when the procedure only took about 15 minutes--application of gel, 2 passes of the laser (once to treat red areas, once to treat brown spots), and application of moisturizer with SPF--I was disappointed.  Turns out I didn't really need a photofacial after all.  My results were basically non-existent; perhaps those with more significantly damaged skin would benefit from this procedure.  Most of all and as stated previously, I was disappointed in how short the treatment lasted.  It would have been nice to work in a facial massage, masque, or something similar to increase the bang-for-buck.  Had I paid full price I'd have felt taken advantage of.My microdermabrasion in February, on the other hand, was really nice--a great boost for my winter blah skin.  I thought the process was gentle, and I experienced no discomfort or redness or irritation at all.  My skin was softer, clearer, and looked brighter and refreshed for several weeks following the microderm.Definitely wouldn't recommend spending full price at Acqua Blu.  There seems to be Groupons, LivingSocial deals, and/or website and email specials literally all the time.I plan to have additional experiences here but for now think I'll limit my review to 3 stars.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True}
name: Relis Benjamin I DMD
text: I have waited fifteen years for the advent of social networking to write this review. In a word, run.  In two words, run quickly.This is a long story but trust that it is worth reading. I saw the same dentist from the time I was 4 till I was to 22. Same dentist my family saw, highly trusted, wonderful man. At 22 I moved from Murrysville to Pittsburgh to finish graduate school. Picked Dr Relis because he was closeby- naively, I figured any dentist is as good as the next (mistake #1). Got a cleaning, learned I had a between tooth cavity. Returned for filling (mistake number 2). Drilling for filling took ages. I began to worry.I expect my teeth to be a little sensitive after a filling but I felt like someone was trying to pull my teeth out of my head after he was done. Worse, days later my teeth still hurt like mad. At this point I realized...I'd perhaps made a mistake in selecting this dentist. So I went back to my childhood dentist in Murrysville and explained what was happening. He looked at my teeth, then at my x-rays from six months earlier. He removed his glasses, bowed his head, and rubbed his eyes with his hand. This is never a good sign. Then he looked up and said, pretty much verbatim: "Your cavities were not that deep, if you had cavities at all. That area showed no decay six months ago. You have virtually no tooth left- it is just enough to hold the filling. Go back and see what he can do- if the guy offers you a root canal, get outta there (alternately he could fill my teeth with a sedative). I don't know how this guy sleeps with himself. "I went back, and lo and behold Dr Relis did offer me a root canal - in fact, insisted I NEEDED one right away, and began putting my chair back so he could begin his work (apparently he just happens to have this kind of availability in his schedule midday). You see... root canals are very, very costly. As are the crowns that often follow them depending on the level of damage to the tooth, which in my case was, well, rather severe. Apparently the good dentist prefers to keep such work in house.Of course I left.Montage: Two sedative fillings courtesy of my childhood dentist, two root canals and two crowns through an endodontist he recommended, one visit to a lawyer (did I have a case? absolutely. would I recoup my $$ after paying him? never.) and about 7k later, I finally had comfort in my teeth. Lucky I had charged the initial bill on my credit card and was able to ensure that absolutely ZERO dollars of that went to Dr Relis. I could say much, much more about the desire to break legs and what have you, but I think that breaks Yelp TOS.In a nutshell: Choose your dentist very carefully. Drive far for a good one. And for the love of all that's holy, don't let this guy near your teeth.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: MedExpress - Bloomfield
text: In lieu of waiting 8 hours in an emergency room I decided to try my luck at this emergent care facility.  I am so happy that I did.  The wait was minimal and the associates were not crazy, mean, or apathetic. I never did actually get to see the doctor, but the physician's assistant was very attentive to everything I said. I already knew what my issue was and knew the course of action that had to be taken to get the desired results; I think my forthright plan of action, full disclosure of history, and detailed descriptions of the current situation were things none of them were used to. The surprised looks on their faces said as such.Overall it was a good experience and I would definitely return here over an emergency room if the situation dictated. I hope more people will use these facilities rather than go to emergency rooms for non-emergency issues and stop clogging them up.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
name: CVS Pharmacy
text: I go to this CVS all the time, since I work in the neighborhood.  I'm not a huge fan of it - I go mostly due to convenience.  Their greeting card selection is kind of lousy - I don't think I've ever found a decent card here.  I keep trying, every holiday or birthday, but every section is just full of duds.  Also, a lot of stuff is locked behind panels that you need the employees to unlock.  Like, razor blades.  And body wash.  BODY WASH?  It drives me nuts that I need to ask someone to open that shelf for me.  It makes no sense.  Staff is hit-or-miss with friendliness.  Some people are cheerful, and some act like they want you to go away.Good things - I love their coupon rewards.  I guess that's for all CVSes, not just this one, but it keeps me coming back because I get mad style coupons like every other visit.  And I had a good experience getting a walk-in flu shot from the pharmacy from the friendly (and quite attractive) pharmacist.  I'm just not crazy about the vibe here.  It just seems kind of depressing, with the stuff locked up and the smallish store with kind of a blargh selection.  I would much rather go to other pharmacies, but you can't beat this one for convenience (for me, anyway).  And they have a parking lot, if that helps you.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Dalmo Optical
text: I came here for my first eye doctor appointment since moving to Pittsburgh.  A coworker and a coworker's husband both see Dr. Hirsch here, so I came for my annual eye checkup.  They took my insurance (Vision Benefits of America) so I had no copay.Dr. Hirsch is very thorough.  I told him my father had experienced a retinal detachment, and he told me what to watch out for in case that happens to me.  He ran a wide variety of tests, checking everything, dilated my pupils, gave me the "puff" test, looked at my glasses and contacts, confirmed my prescription.  His mannerisms are a bit unusual; he lacks the poised polish and smooth talk that so many doctors have.  So don't go in expecting to have small talk or make jokes.  But all your optical needs will be well-met, and that's really what matters.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Healing Hearts Pediatrics, PLC
text: We love these people. Enough said. My daughter is almost 5 now, and we were originally recommended to Healing Hearts when they opened to go see Dr. Makenna. The night my daughter was born Dr. Khurana was on duty. We were a little hesitant for all of a minute. Khurana came in, went through everything with us, talked to us, checked out the baby, and was wonderful. We worked with her daily for a week with a few health concerns for our daughter and she was attentive, compassionate and perfect. She'd call us personally at home and everything.We later did see Makenna and she was just as nice and wonderful, but we stuck with Khurana because we already had a bond. Somewhere in the first months we also met one of their PAs, Nikki, who became our regular person we see when we go. We adore Nikki. She's funny, smart, attentive to our daughter, works with us, is level headed, and always knows when to call a doctor into the room if she's not sure of something.The practice has grown this past year to another office farther east but we've not been there. They also added more people including Dr Ray, who we really liked, too. Our daughter's not as sick as she was when she was younger so we're not there weekly like we'd been, but this place is very comfortable, safe, and I would trust any child with this staff.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Tranquil Massage
text: I love working with small business owners and supporting local people. I worked a four day shift recently and was so darn tight, so I was glad I had scheduled an appointment (the online scheduling system is so awesome!) I went into the new offices (this office used to be off of Osborne and Scottsdale) and loved the set up. It's so calming and serene. The office manager is a really top notch guy who always answers my questions via either email or phone; he's respectful and keeps things running smoothly. After yesterday's 60 minute massage, I immediately scheduled my next one massage and also scheduled one for my 10 year old daughter for next month. I've been having Megan massage me for over a year now, and it's awesome. Give Tranquil Massage a shot.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Tranquil Massage
text: My girlfriend has been going to a massage therapist in Scottsdale for a few years and suggested I give it a try. I have never had a massage in my life and I was very nervous, but I was willing to give it a shot. The price was right, and I had my first massage this past week. I was booked with Megan, the owner, for Wednesday after work.The website was easy to use and looked very professional. The three therapists on there had brief bios that made sense to me. I was very surprised by other reviews who seem to not know the difference between Rene and Renee. HE even says in his bio that HE is a MAN. (To clarify this, perhaps a head shot of each employee with his or her bio be used.) I snagged the address and map from the website and found it quickly near the edge of Old Town Scottsdale near Olive Garden. The business is small. If you expect some huge salon place, go elsewhere. Tranquil Massage is for the personal, small business touch so missing in today's consumer market. There is a similar business that shares some office space, but everyone was very nice and it was very calm.I entered the front office where I was met by Megan who asked me to fill out a simple form detailing my health history (just the basics) and any meds I may be on. Then she led me into a smaller, clean room with a heated massage table, crisp, clean sheets and tranquil, quiet music playing. There were no outside sounds from other rooms or the road. Megan was very professional and went over the sheet with me before and explained, in detail, what would happen during my massage.She stepped out before I disrobed and got into position on the table. She came back in after a few minutes and began working on my body in the manner she explained beforehand. The music played lightly, some instrumental and with vocals, I could not hear the street noise or anyone outside of the room, and Megan and I chatted through the hour I was on the table for my Swedish Massage.  She was very personable and friendly. Afterward, she explained that I needed to drink lots of water and that I should take a few minutes to relax before dressing. She excused herself at that point.A few minutes later I went out to the lobby where she gave me a sealed bottle of cold water to drink. Another massage therapist, Rene, came through the door. I was introduced to him, and he seemed very nice, too. I confirmed my next appointment time and left. I did read all of the other reviews on this page recently, and I was floored by some of the negativity. One person had written that she'd never been there, but she had the gall to leave a review. I think that's against Yelp's policy. That reviewer said she didn't like Megan's responses to reviews, so I read them closely. I saw a professional, small business owner directly addressing every single concern every reviewer had on Yelp. Yes, this is a small business. I think there are four employees. It's in a shared space, too. Yes, Rene is a man. It says that in several places on the webpage. The online appointment system clearly has the information including address (I love online email reminders!). Tranquil Massage was wonderful, and I will be back in a few weeks for my next massage.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Forney Stevan K, DDS
text: When we moved to the valley almost a decade ago now, we needed a new dentist. My DDS when I was young was my dad's best friend, and I was really worried about a new one. Then I met Stevan Forney and Cheryl. WOW!!This is like family all over again. My wife and I have been going to see Dr Forney now since about 2001, and they always treat us right. We don't get over charged, over diagnosed or anything. Cheryl runs the front office and we love her. She rocks. Since we began going we had our daughter go see Forney, my wife's coworker, her boss, and her bosses boss. These men are intelligent administrators who were quite happy with our recommendation as well. Go see Dr Forney, Cheryl, MJ and the rest of the staff.  You won't regret the decision at all!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: MedExpress - Upper St. Clair
text: I'm in PA for the summer from the west coast.  Got sick and looked for an Urgent Care near my parent's house. Found this one and it didn't seem to be a UPMC affiliate (which is good) so off I went. They're open 7 to 7 every day (no matter was the voice mail says). I was there Sunday at 8:21am. The lady's out front seemed pretty cool. Ran my out of state insurance quickly, and then the PA called me back. She checked my throat and nose but not my ears (even though I expressed concerns about them as well). Listened to my lungs and told me it was probably viral, but then she gave me antibiotics anyway just in case. Felt like a pretty stock answer to get me moving along, but I didn't care much because she did give me meds. The ladies out front were cool and they could fill the meds right there, so I walked out with them. I was there for maybe half an hour total.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: James Lieber, MD
text: A few years ago I needed a new PCP and my daughter's pediatrician recommended Dr. Lieber. He was close to the home, took our insurance, and was recommended. I went for an initial consult and really liked him. He was quite thorough (without over doing it) and they even do their blood work right there in office. I would suggest Lieber. The only reason he didn't get 5 stars in because I've only been a patient for two years.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Eye Center
text: I was looking for a place close to home. This place is between my kid's school and our house. I started seeing Dr Stacy three years ago and he seems pretty cool. He can get really chatty and it takes awhile to get through the appointment sometimes, but I'd rather chat awhile than have some impersonal idiot. Been there three years now, and the ladies out front are cool, too.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: NextCare Urgent Care
text: If you need medical assistance, do not go here.Last year my daughter had some constipation issues and was pretty sick. My wife and I were worried and brought her in to get her seen. She was also dehydrated, so we wanted an IV of fluids. We waited in the waiting room for 2 1/2 hours (I am not kidding) to be seen, after we told them her problems and signed her in. We finally got a room, they asked some questions, and told us they didn't do IVs. They said the doctor would be in soon to see her. We waited and waited. There was literally almost no other patients in the entire place. None. We didn't see anyone who didn't work there. I even opened the door and kept it open so I could wait for someone and they didn't forget us. After another hour of not being seen, my daughter was really cranky. One of the employees came over and told us we had to close the door because she was too disruptive. They said the doctor would be in. We already paid our $50.00 or we would've walked out. The reason she was cranky was she was hungry so we finally fed her one of those kid nutrition bars. After another half an hour the doctor came in and said that they only thing they could do for her was an abdomen x-ray. We weren't too happy, but we agreed. They did the x-ray and after another half an hour (it's pushing 4-5 hours now!) the doctor came in and told us she had a mass in her abdomen that was larger than she'd ever seen! She had already called our pediatrician who immediately called our cell phone and told us we needed to get her to Children's Hospital downtown immediately. We were terrified and so was out doctor. We drove up there really fast through the rain; they took her in, sedated her, gave her an IV (something Urgent care should be able to do!), and ran a CatScan. After the doctor came in to read the results, he asked if she'd eaten recently. Of course, she had. After hours of waiting for an urgent care doc. The mass the stupid urgent care doctor saw was her food bar she'd eaten! She was fine and went home. We have never been back.Then this past weekend our friend's son split open his knee at his sister's birthday party, and the mom immediately took him to urgent care. I wasn't there yet, or I would've stopped them from going to NextCare. But they went down to NextCare for stitches. Two hours later they called us and told us they'd just gotten into the room. A half an hour later they called back and told us the NextCare does not do stitches and they were sent to the hospital. I can't believe it. What good is an Urgent care that can't see patients quickly, can't sew up an incision, can't use IVs, and can't tell the patient to leave before taking their money. The receptionist should be able to tell someone not to bother paying $50 and wasting hours to be told to leave anyway. It's robbery, and I hope people read this and don't go there!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Rajiv Parikh, MD
text: When I first moved to Arizona, I needed a PCP. I checked out who took my insurance and such but couldn't get a recommendation because I didn't know anyone. I began seeing Parikh because he was close to my house. The first thing I noticed here was that no one spoke English. The receptionist barely seemed to either and would rather talk to all the loud mexican mothers in the lobby than pay attention to me. I should've left then.I stay with him for three years. The only real reason was because I had no where else to go and didn't get sick too often. Mostly I went when I had a cold. He'd shove some antibiotics in my hand and send me away. A few times they just called a script in and didn't bother checking me out.The receptionist who was still there until I ran screaming was always a b*tch to my family and was always mean. She had no customer service experience at all. If you go see Dr Parikh, plan to spend the ENTIRE DAY WAITING IN A LITTLE ROOM!!!! I have literally waited for hours to see him. My wife was in tears once she had to wait so long, and I've been stuck there for over three hours with a toddler in tow!Eventually he moved into a nicer office and got some PA person who was always  nice. I eventually left and tried to take my wife with me but for some reason she still puts up with thier crap.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Beauty & Spa', 'Fitness & Instruction', 'Massage Therapy', 'Gyms', 'Active Life', 'Medical Spas', 'Day Spas', 'Massage', 'Health & Medical']
name: The Oaks Massotherapy & Botanical Spa
text: I enjoyed a much-needed spa day here. My husband had gotten me a rather luxurious gift card, wait for it -- over a year ago, and I finally got the opportunity to go!The service here is outstanding. First of all, I called on a Wednesday, and they were able to get me in for that Friday. They worked some stuff out and arranged the schedule so they could accommodate me.The receptionist was probably one of the nicest people I have ever met. Seriously! Everything I had done made me feel amazing. A little chattier than I am used to, but that is ok. I usually end up mirroring the personality/talkativeness of the person I am with, so if they start to talk, I do as well and then the conversation goes from there. Being that I spent so much time there I guess it would have been awkward if I kept quiet the entire time.I got several services, but my favorite was probably this really cool skin brushing/sea salt exfoliation and seaweed wrap. They put hot towels on me and then did a scalp treatment and it was so relaxing.In general, a bunch of really nice people work here. I would recommend this spa to anyone! Thanks for the great day!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Studio 11
text: Yay Studio 11.  Yay for me getting to roll out of bed and walk a block and a half to go to Yoga!But it's worth making the trip to Tremont, because the feel in this studio is so welcoming.  My friend introduced me to the studio, as well as to many instructors, and now the ones whose classes I frequent greet me by name.  So nice!I have gone to the following classes:Shanna's Monday night Kripalu class (focused, powerful breathing and meditation along with intense stretching and strengthening - not sure if that's the definition of "Kripalu" but that's what I've experienced)Tiiu's Pilates sessions downstairs - they are awesome, and I had never done Pilates before and now go often!  She is a lot of fun and you feel it in your core for like 3 days afterward!Deanna's "Skinny Bitch" workout on Saturday mornings (sometimes this class is with other people; for example, Meg teaches it for this month b/c Deanna is tending to her family's apple orchard in Iowa).  This class is so much fun, a hybrid of yoga, dance, martial arts, and a Biggest-Loser-esque workout without Jillian yelling in your face.  Meg's class last week was a basic, but challenging, yoga class without the other stuff usually in "Skinny Bitch," but I still got a major upper-body workout.They are also always introducing new classes, like a kids' introductory self-defense class (and one for women too), Capoeira, and Carib-Funk.  Something for everyone.This studio has its regulars, and it's a great feeling to be new to a city and a neighborhood and have people say hi to you.  I go here at least once a week.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Cleveland Clinic - Fairview Hospital
text: Simply incredible! I gave birth to my daughter at Fairview last weekend. Not only is the facility organized, sparkling clean, well-maintained and run like a well-oiled machine, but it also houses some of the friendliest medical professionals I have ever encountered.They employ extremely gifted doctors, nurses, and staff who are great at what they do but do it with such ease that you forget how brilliant they all are. They make you seem like you're the only one receiving care in the hospital! I've heard this hospital referred to as "Hotel Fairview..." now I know why!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Urban M Picard, DDS - Suburban OMS Center
text: Helpful from beginning of consultation to end of procedure and beyond. I had all 4 wisdom teeth taken out today. As an adult who has been avoiding this for years, this could have been traumatic. Dr. Picard and his extremely helpful staff made me feel at ease and explained things in detail so I could make the best decisions about my care. I ended up going with just a local anesthesia and it was more than fine. They did everything you'd expect from an oral surgeon's office, sending me home with a bag of gauze, instructions, when to call, etc as well as a new soft toothbrush. The receptionist even called me a few hours after I got home just to see how I was holding up. Classy and appreciated!The address is on Madison, but it's actually best to park behind the building (between Morrison and Carabel) and enter that way.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: America's Best Contacts & Eyeglasses
text: Totally fine. I scheduled an appointment online for the next day, and went in and didn't really have to wait long. Everyone was expedient and friendly. They explained all the options without trying to make me go broke from getting the most expensive lenses. They gave me advice on frames without being pushy.I admit that the wait was rather long to get the glasses, but they called within the expected window and they look and feel great. I also went back within 30 days and got 50% off a third pair so I could have some prescription sunglasses. That time, they did not call and it had been 2 1/2 weeks. I called on Friday, and they said they were in, so I went and got them after work. No biggie.FYI, they don't just give you your prescription to take with you unless you request it (which I did). You should also ask for your PD (pupillary distance) too if you want to order glasses online. Being new to the eyeglass scene I hadn't realized this was a big component of crafting the glasses but after doing some research I found that it was.Overall, very good value (free exam with 2 pairs of good quality, but not overly expensive, glasses). Would recommend.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Independence Family Health Center
text: I've been frequenting this Cleveland Clinic location as my primary "go-to" center for general internal medicine (Dr. Schall); OB-GYN (Dr. Clark); and Pediatrics (Dr. Wasserman). My husband and I have also seen doctors in other departments in this same facility once or twice, including Gastroenterology, Allergy/Immunology, and Otolaryngology (try saying THAT one aloud--it's basically an ear/nose/throat department).They have a lab on-site, which makes things easier, as well as an Express Care service which takes walk-ins on weekday evenings and all day on the weekends. That came in mighty handy a couple of times.I also like their cafe--"Beans and Greens"--although it's a bit overpriced.You can also catch some local artist selling cool stuff almost every day in the lobby, including scarves, jewelry, and kitchen stuff.At every visit, the doctors, nurses, and receptionists are always great and efficient while still being personable and making you feel comfortable. Even the security guard is awesome--he helped me look around for a while after I lost my wallet (I thought I left it there).Parking is great, and it's not congested or confusing like Main campus. It's one of the reasons it's better to go to see the doctor in the suburbs!
