attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'GoodForKids': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
categories: ['Education', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Fitness & Instruction', 'Yoga', 'Massage Therapy', 'Nail Salons', 'Massage Schools', 'Specialty Schools', 'Day Spas', 'Pilates', 'Active Life', 'Health & Medical']
name: Verve
text: Awesome pedi. I had Kat and I loved her. We joked about my leg hair and I appreciate her not judging me for it. I am not from Pittsburgh so our concierge suggested Verve and called to book our appointment. They had same-day openings and we were greeted very warmly. They have coffee, tea, water, even wine!You can also get your hair done, do some yoga, even get chiropractic work done here. A really cool place.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Marc's Stores
text: I was a Marc's virgin until about a week ago*, when I wandered in to the Warren location to get some 2-to-3 outlet converters. Neither the discount section nor the pharmacy/drug store area had 'em. Oh well. I spoke to a couple of not-so-disgruntled folks who at least attempted to steer me in the right direction.I was pretty impressed by the vastness, cleanliness, and overall layout/flow of this store. If I want to save some time and money, I may come here to pick up a couple of things when I'm in the same plaza.*Actually, I take that back. I went to the Marc's in Coventry very briefly about 2 years ago when I needed to get change of a dollar for parking. They wouldn't do it without a purchase, of course, so I bought a 3 Musketeers.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Obermeier Adelstein And Associates
text: For those interested in this dental office, they have recently moved locations (new address on review pending). They are now at 3609 Park East Drive in Beachwood, not far at all from the other office.The new location is schmancy! The waiting room is twice as large and has a Keurig coffee maker. The exam rooms have great views, vibrating chairs, and flat-screen TVs. Staff is as wonderful as ever.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Healthquest Chiropractic
text: Located downtown, call Dr. Greg and he can get you in that day, sometimes within the hour.  He's a cool guy, very friendly, and not a new-age, hippy, sales-y doctor like some of the other chiropractors that I've been to.  Accepts insurance & FSA...if you work downtown, I recommend him.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Atlas Dental Specialists
text: Dr. Duncan-Friedman is pretty awesome.  Let's face it, most of us don't really enjoy going to the dentist, but it's a fact of life that every responsible adult should go.  Kathy runs a very professional business.  She has the latest equipment, and knows her stuff, going to conferences yearly to learn the latest industry trends.  She has a team of 4-5 hygienists and assistants, so she can always get you scheduled, though they are generally very busy.  If you miss your appointment, you'll need to wait a week or two to get back in unless it's an emergency.I can honestly say she's the best dentist I've had in my 30 years.  If you need a dentist, go here.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Novant Health Presybeterian Medical Center
text: We have had our son here many time in the Orthopedic hospital for surgeries so my review is purely based on the experiences as a parents in with pediatrics.First the Orthopedic Hospital Surgical part. check ins are usually very quick. the patient holding area is fairly nice and each room does have a TV to keep you occupied while waiting. There is usually a steady entering of people coming to discuss your procedure and answer questions so write them down before you get here, because if you are like me it quickly escapes your memory when they ask if you have any questions. The waiting room is very large and has regular size chairs as well as a few small benches. If you have other small children accompanying you then this bench is great for sleepy children. the lounge area has 2 tables with chairs if you would want a table for eating or computer. also one table has a few electrical outlets for recharging your cell battery or computer laptop.  They have a free machine that can make different kinds of coffee, hot tea and even hot chocolate. There is also a TV in this area.The bathrooms are very large but are single file type so gotta wait if in use.the cafeteria downstairs is renovated and I am sorry that I cant tell you about the food there because it closes at 2pm! after lunch SO if your procedure is scheduled around lunch time then people who are allowed to eat should keep this in mind!ALSO keep in mind parents that if you are being admitted to HEMBY you may want to move your car from the orthopedic hospital parking deck to the main hospital during the time your child is in surgery. I get lost trying to maze my way through the hospital so I have to walk around the outside. And if you are by yourself at the hospital then you will be walking with your child to their room.the recovery room is typical, except that the pediatric "cubbies" are right next to the automatic door which is very loud when people come in and out.NOW onto the main hospital:We have usually always been admitted to HEMBY, which has its own elevator near the parking garage entrance to the hospital, take note that the entrance to the cafeteria is also near here.Hemby is a very nice place, there is a lot for your kids to do if able, playroom, birds to look at in there little glass houses. the rooms are typically adorned with a DVD player and movies are available to borrow. a fridge and microwave in some rooms too. which is great if you have a small one you cant leave.Now on this visit we were actually in the NEW Hemby overflow which is accessed by the B elevator located directly behind receptionist in main lobby. These rooms are large and have the sleeper sofa, but down fall is no fridge or microwave. but there is a TV of course with a vcr/dvd player. The food service person will visit you on the next food serving time and get your order for the next meals. The menu they give you is the one you will be making choices from for you stay. There is a lot to choose from. and as a parent I enjoyed that I didn't have to leave my child to go hunt food.the nurses have been awesome and respectful of listening to my instructions for how to care for my son. They are helpful to make sure his pain is under control and get whatever I need. FOOD Room served: not so bad! let me say that condiments help a great deal and this hospital uses mainly Kraft products (BBQ sauce, dressings, mayo) in the cafeteria you can get hot sauce, tartar sauce, creamers (flavored). of course salt and pepper.the mac and cheese is surprisingly great! just a little salt and pepper! The salads are filling. the chicken fingers remind me of Arby's breading. The flank steak with baked potato was edible, a little dry on the meat but hey it was free. The baked herbed chicken breast was also a little dry but very good. Breakfast was the best I think, I had eggs, bacon, sausage and grits. Cafeteria- salad bar is paid for by WEIGHT so keep that in mind. they now have sushi available, fruits, pastries and the hot section is per item unless you get the special. (like bacon is 49 cents a slice!). burgers are OK, i usually hit it with some of the seasoning salt used for the fries. which are great when first made. They have pizza, soups and sandwiches and this place opens late hours also. Gift shop has a lot to offer, snacks, headache meds, stomach meds, chap-stick. perfume, flowers, nice gifts, books, magazines. and extremely helpful staff.ATM is located on the first floor but the cafeteria and gift shop do take credit/debit cards so if your card is NOT signed be prepared to show ID, it is their policy! So if you should be admitted to the children's sections of the hospital I hope you a speeding recovery and a pleasant experience like I have received many times.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Levine Children's Hospital
text: absolutely one of the best child hospitals I have been in with my special needs son. we were only here for one night but they were so eager to make sure I had everything I needed. The rooms are quite large and comfortable. There was a long desk table alond side the  window side of the room and also a couch/bed and a recliner chair. I did do some rearranging of the furniture to accomidate my son's wheelchair and the needs for me to get around. They supplied me with sheets and blankets and pillow for the bed along with towels etc to shower. What was amazing was that they provide you with breakfast (it was a little cold) and 2 meal tickets each day. now the meal tickets are worth $5 each and it is easy to go over that so be prepared to pay the extra. but it does help defer costs.there is also a small fridge in the room so you might want to have someone bring you some sodas or snacks to keep around. there is a kitchen available with microwave and various snacks, ice cream, soda, juice, baby food, crackers, popsicles etc. the tv has a great variety of channels including on demand movies. there is a keyboard like a computer has for kids to choose different options on the tv like video games or movies etc. they have a DVD player in the room to select DVD's to watch. i did not go into the childrens play area but it look huge and inviting.you must have your ID badge on you at all times so that you can get back on the ward and so that you can gain admittance to the 3rd floor large cafeteria.the infusion therapy section is very nice there are 4 rooms that are enormous with 2 chairs one is a extra large very comfortable recliner. a swinging flat screen tv to adjust at most comfortable angles and community bathroom. the nurses are so great! and you are given as a parent a meal ticket and they will order a food tray for the child. they also have the cutest "drug train" that goes around. it is a self driving cart that looks like a train with a conductor. it carries meds to the different floors, it opens doors and calls the elevator too! so neat to follow him around

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: OrthoCarolina
text: I love the pediatrics doctor Dr Casey. she is wonderful and her nurse is so funny. I have been bringing my son to these doctors for 13 years. They have perfomed many surgeries on him and have always done a great job. They have him in the greatest interest for his continued health.they are on the 3rd floor of the Randolph rd office. check in has always been quick. receptionist always pleasant and speaking in a low tone as she verifies address and phone number. which is nice since I dont like it when everyone in the waiting room can hear where i live and how to find out if I am home or not!x-ray techs were very nice, although one guy would not heed my instructions that if he wanted my son not to move during the x-ray he needed to be a whole lot FASTER, I understand he was instructing the other person on how to get this type of x-ray but MY son is not the person to learn on since my son does not understand don't move!my only real gripe would be parking! out front there is a horse shoe drop off area and on the exit side is about 4 parking spaces, i think they should be for oversized handicap! the parking garage is a LOW clearance garage. and my vehicle is 7 foot 11 inches! so i had to drive around for about 10 minutes until a small compact car left the front handicap parking spacesUPDATE:  if you have a tall vehicle like mine. the first floor handicap is high enough. you can even enter more easily nearest the orthopedic hospital and exit in front of the orthocarolina building. there is even a covered walk way from the garage to the medical building. there is not a great deal of handicap parking in this small section, but maybe you will get lucky

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Carolinas Medical Center
text: The Levine Childrens Hospital is the best! what a wonderful place. All the nurses I dealt with were over the top. There was always someone stopping by to see if I needed something, parents get breakfast for free in the room, then 2 meal tickets per day. I had the fried chicken and mac n cheese in the 1st floor cafe is OMG the best I have ever had from a hospital! The chicken parmesan sandwich from the 3rd floor cafe- YUK, good thing I didnt pay for it. The patient rooms have a small refridgerator and are pretty big, I love that the tv has movies and games on  it or you can get movies for the DVD player in the room. There is a "drug" train that goes by often tooting his horn as he travels the halls taking meds to nurse stations, he opens doors and calls the elevator too! The parents kitchen is pretty packed full of snacks and stuff that should satisfy any child. i love this place!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Re Salon and Med Spa
text: PRAISES to the massage therapist Brian Cole for helping my disabled son before his surgery.Brian uses Myofascial release techniques that helped my son be prepared for his surgery and I could just kiss him at this point. it has made a huge difference in his post op so far. Love ya Brian! also I think I could adopt and keep you for working on my trigger points at the Yelp event and again a little during the appointment for my Boy!You are great! and I will most definately need you again once he has mended fully to get rid of my knots! The salon is absolutely gorgeous inside, the staff are all amazing people who made me feel at home each time I was there. Stylist Jane cracks me up- she is someone I could easily see myselft hanging out with on a daily basis. What a fun girl, and being curly headed myself I think she knows her stuff.I will be coming back here, but not sure when.my ONLY negative is that the upstairs is not wheelchair accesible, and I know this was a former fire station so why would there be a elevator! right! but that is my only negative because we had to carry my son up the stairs- again praise you Brian! hugs for all you did, I greatly appreciate it.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Novant Health Imaging Center
text: very friendly staff. professional and pretty  good on getting you in and out. Radioologist is pretty good about explaining things if further tests are needed.

name: Mackey Family Practice PA
text: i love this office for the children's clinic. I have never had to wait very long at all and Dr. Cruz is a great lady!

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Novant Health Southeast OB/GYN

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
name: 9ROUND
text: I've only been twice but I'm super psyched about my experience at this 9Round. I've been to another boxing gym before (Title) but never 9Round. I've been seeing them spring up rather rapidly all over town and, at the same time, thinking I should check out a boxing/kickboxing gym. After checking out the website I went in for my free trial.They don't do your free trial any different from a normal session here. You come in and are instantly swept up into the circuit-style workout. Yes, it's basically a circuit. But you won't be using funky machines with weights and pulleys. It's more realistic. Using your own body and weight, jumping, squatting, crunching, lifting, punching and kicking to name a few. I'll admit I was overwhelmed. Apparently the day I'd chosen to come it was some kind of "kicking cancer" promo. It's a small place and it was packed to the brim.The website makes it seem like you'll have a trainer following along with you the whole time but you won't if it's packed like this. They bounce around from "round" to "round" (what they call each stop on the circuit). They may come by with a few words of encouragement to push you harder or even come by with an unexpected modification to the standard workout on the wall at each stop. Maybe they'll hold mats for you to kick or punch. Maybe they'll add a kick to your sit-ups.I decided to sign up for the two week promo at $30 to see if I'm still interested after that. For 6 months, at the time of writing this, the cost is $500. That includes a pair of boxing gloves that are yours to keep (and use here of course). So, in about two weeks, we'll see if I'm still interested in the seriously intense workout they have here.I can't finish this review without making the shout-out to Craig, the owner. He was very attentive from the moment I came in. He's encouraging but won't necessarily go easy on you. He takes your fitness goal seriously, and he seems to never forget your name. If you leave here without breaking a sweat though, it's on you!

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Sports Wear', 'Sporting Goods', 'Yoga', 'Nutritionists', 'Active Life', 'Fitness & Instruction', 'Fashion', "Men's Clothing", 'Health & Medical', "Women's Clothing", 'Shoe Stores', 'Shopping']
name: Gumbo: The Store
text: Yoga and workout clothes are one type that makes me jealous of the many colors and styles women get. However, Gumbo is a place that kinda helps make up for that. Sure, they've got any number of women's tights in twice as many colors and styles as the big stores out there. But at least the same can be said for their menswear too.The vibe this place throws off is seriously chill. I spoke to Hal, one of the shop keepers, and he talked at length about chi-running/walking and how you can get a free course for it at their partner place next door (Okra) when you buy a pair of their shoes here. This guy was the epitome of modern day hippie (I hope that classification won't offend him, it's a compliment in my book). Very chill! You are also greeted with their perpetually running essential oil diffusions that fill the air with something to put you at ease.Returning to what they've got, they are purveyors of all things yoga, most things running and a few other lifestyle knick-knacks and hygiene/body related stuff. The shoes are certainly a unique selection focusing more on minimalism/barefoot-feel and therefore a stronger bond with the Earth. They range from gym to road and trail running shoes and include some ultra-minimal flip-flops (just when you thought they couldn't get any more simple). Clothing includes, as mentioned above, tights, sports bras (not my thing), shorts and pants, super-soft shirts, excellent athletic socks with zero-cotton options, head/hair bands and more. You've got all manner of rollers and trigger point balls for the runners out there trying to soften up post-run stiff muscles. Lots of essential oil scents to choose from, face creams, candles, etc. And a personal favorite of mine: a retractable lint roller - genius design!I promise, one day soon I'll actually be willing to look beyond the price tag and spend some money here on a few things.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
categories: ['Cosmetic Dentists', 'Dental Hygienists', 'Prosthodontists', 'Periodontists', 'General Dentistry', 'Dentists', 'Endodontists', 'Pediatric Dentists', 'Health & Medical', 'Oral Surgeons']
name: Southlake Family Dentistry of Fort Mill
text: I moved down to the south side of Charlotte a year ago. I was looking for a new dentist and got turned away from a few full clinics. My coworker recommended Southlake because it's been her dentist for many years and I can see why. My experiences here have been the absolute best.I had my old dentist forward over my dental records and it all went smoothly. I don't have any dental issues (thank god) to complain about coming over to this new clinic. So really my experience has been for the 6 month cleanings so far. They have 7:20 AM slots open on some weekdays which means I can get into work usually right after 8:00 AM and not have to make up much time.On my most recent visit I had some chips in my front tooth that got repaired (just like a previous reviewer). Had a run-on with a fork and...well I lost. Dr. Sloan did a quick epoxy patch on the cracks and it's really amazing. You can't tell there was ever a problem. He finished this up in less than 30 minutes. Out the door it was about $55. Of course the biannual check-ups are covered by my insurance so no expense there.The waiting room here is super cozy with some leather chairs that practically eat you alive when you sit in them. There's a TV in the waiting room and one in each exam room where the hygienist will quickly offer you a remote to put on whatever you want. (Usually I just want to turn it off, haha!) As you can imagine this will be my new long term dentist of choice!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Carolina Sports Clinic
text: I have seen a rep from CSC at two different events now in Charlotte. Most recently it was at the Charlotte 10 Miler in Balantyne. But the most memorable time was back in the summer at the 24 Hours of Booty ride in Charlotte. One of their doctors(?) was on site doing massage, stretching and perhaps mild adjustments and giving some consultation advice. I felt thoroughly pleased with the service and took a card swearing I'd be into the clinic to have a full review of my physical well being. Well being is perhaps not the best wording to use though, as I'm physically just tense and broken everywhere.I've been to a very basic chiropractor before. By basic I mean they churn you out like you're on an assembly line. Wait in a waiting room, they say "next", you come in, crack your neck and back and send you away in about 10 minutes or less. That's it. But that's not CSC. Here they go above and beyond "basic chiropractor". Before you get an adjustment you'll go through an orientation of sorts where they analyze how you're standing or sitting or whatever you're doing wrong to hurt yourself. They'll give you a list of exercises to do when you're not in the clinic getting adjusted or stretched. In the clinic they will do a light sort of massage to loosen up and stretch out your tense muscles prior to performing an adjustment on you. After a thorough adjustment you will be attached to some electrodes (I'm not sure specifically what the device is called) which vibrate your muscles to help relieve a bit of the potential pain after your adjustment. At least in my case they applied some KT tape as a "gentle reminder" to maintain my proper posture to prevent the pain from recurring so frequently.They're very friendly and accommodating and have an almost communal layout here for the physical therapy/chiropractic functions. I do pay quite a bit more than I did with my previous chiropractor ($65/visit here) however I'd say it's worth the improved quality of the treatment. As I loosen up more and build up the courage I may try some dry needling to see if that works too. But really, I'm just learning more about my body's "bad habits" and ways at this point - they do an excellent job of sharing that. By the way, this is my shout-out for Dr. Torres as she is the one I have been seeing.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: OrthoCarolina - Pineville
text: So, I've been in here twice now over the past month and I've decided it's time to write a review. I went to have a cyst removed on my hand. For a separate appointment to have the bunions on my feet checked out and ask some plantar fasciitis questions. I know, I'm 29 and I'm already falling apart. Thirty here I come!Initially I thought my regular doctor set up one appointment for both. That's not on OrthoCarolina - my regular doctor screwed me over. That ended up meaning two separate appointments and (naturally) twice the price. I also found out the doctors specialize so the guy that does hands won't do feet and vice versa. Something to keep in mind. Appointment #1 went smoothly. I immediately got an X-ray done. The doctor talked kind of fast and used words I don't understand. In short it meant: you have a cyst in a common place and we usually stick it with a cortisone shot a few times before resorting to surgery. I got the shot - feels weird - and now it doesn't hurt anymore but the cyst is very much still there. That's kinda weird. They said "give it 6 weeks and it should go down". So we'll see.Appointment #2 for the feet went about the same way. My plantar fasciitis has been gone for a couple weeks but it was bad before. Bunions are genetic for me and surgery is inevitable. They took a lot more X-rays (my feet look pretty neat on the inside). The doctor talked fast and said a lot of things just from looking at the X-ray, some of which I don't really agree with. But who am I? Not the doctor! "Plantar fasciitis is not usually weight related." was the one that stuck out to me. After losing 10-15 lbs I can't imagine it's coincidental that the PF is gone. But whatever. Surgery was put on the table as an option for the bunions - it would make a difference.The one key point here is they leave the decision up to you, the patient. They don't insist ever that you need surgery or a shot or other treatment. Simply: Does it hurt? Does it impact your daily life? If the answer is yes, here are your options... My bunions aren't killing me. Surgery isn't imminent. The cyst definitely needed a cortisone shot though. Like with other doctor's offices, I wish the prices were not so hidden or vague. It would be nice to get a treatment estimate coming in here. Just like if you went in for surgery or brought a car to the shop. I have to imagine there isn't a single price for one X-ray or ten. It probably goes up for each image. Last suggestion: doctors should slow down and give patients time to process what they're hearing and share the background of their situation more. Otherwise, office staff in particular are super friendly and helpful!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Hand & Stone Massage and Facial Spa
text: Despite living near this place and often seeing their ads, I just recently tried it.  I have always been leary of chain massage places after hearing stories of pushy up sells for memberships that override the importance of the actual massage.  At a recent Yelp event, my wife won a gift card for a 50 minute relaxation gift card.  She gave the gift card to me since she has yet to use a massage gift card I gave to her for another place.  Apart from fearing the chain massage locations, I have almost always received awesome massages from independent therapists and local massage businesses which is another reason I was hesitant to try this place.  Hand and Stone is a nice place.  The lobby is mostly inviting and relaxing, but the placement of products for sale deters somewhat from the relaxation experience.  The rooms are nicely equipped, clean, and smell very nice.  This is one of those reviews where the cliched "I want to give 5 stars  but..." comes into play.  Was my massage decent?  Yes.  Have I had better massages?  Yes.  I left relaxed, but not feeling like jello s I usually do after a massage. Would I go back here?  Maybe, based on proximity and atmosphere.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Eden Therapy & Massage
text: This is a very nice place with several good therapists offering a variety of services.  It's not a large chain, or a chain at all for that matter.  The owner is one of the therapists.  I would patronize them more if I lived a little closer.  Last time I went, Crystal gave me an amazing deep tissue massage.  Those aren't always relaxing and can be temporarily painful, but after walking the streets of NYC for a few days, I really needed it and it didn't hurt at all.  I am not sure if she still works there, but there also was another girl named Jennifer that was very good too.  The waiting area is very calming and relaxing too.  If you're in the South End/Dilworth/Uptown area and need a good massage at a reasonable price without pressures of a membership, I would definitely recommend Eden.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Novant Health Steele Creek Family Practice
text: I found this place around the time my previous doctor's office closed and SCFP was pretty much brand new at the time.  I almost always see Dr. Mendelsohn and concur with the previous review by Tre.  Dr. Mendelsohn is very knowledgeable, and takes time to ask questions so that he can try to figure out what's wrong.  He will do whatever it takes to make things right and always makes patients feel as comfortable as possible (for being in a doctor's office anyway).The office had some staffing issues at first as some of the front desk staff were less than friendly and unwilling to help, answer questions, or return calls.  Thankfully, these have been resolved (likely due to patient surveys).  The staff currently there are very nice and always eager to help and answer questions.Another good thing about this place is that my eye doctor moved next door at around the same time.  Come to think of it, that may have been how I found out about SCFP.

text: New doctor was totally not thorough and did not get my prescription right or my wife's. I have worn glasses for 35 years and have never had a prescription screwed up. I'll miss her.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Glaza Chiropractic Center
text: My husband has been coming here for many years, but hasn't been here in a little over a year for an adjustment. After filling out some updated paperwork he was good to go and able to see the doctor. The receptionist was super friendly and the waiting area is nicely decorated and included a tv to watch while you wait. Several customers were coming and going right after 8am, so they must offer early morning appointments to fit your work schedule. They are located right off the highway in an easily accesible parking lot behind the Auto Bell. I cannot review the actual appointment since it was not for me today, but my husband said he feels better already and plans to get back to regular appointments!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Charlotte Dentistry
text: The sign out front says "Charlotte Dentistry", so don't drive past it.  Well I've got some mixed feelings about my visit.  On the positive side, the staff here is like, ridiculously friendly and accomodating.  The receptionist on the dental floor has one of those rare pleasant and genuine demeanors that inspire immediate comfort and confidence.  My hygenist was also very sweet, kept me comfortable with her chatting and not too rough with the tools.  I mentioned that I was thinking of going to Charleston soon for a trip and she called over another hygenist who is a frequent visitor, then proceeded to take diligent notes for me while I was in the chair.  The dentist I saw was also for the most part pleasant, but that's where the mixed feelings come in.  See, the hygenist asked at the beginning of my visit if I was "happy with my smile".  I mentioned a couple of things that I might look into fixing and she left it there.  But the dentist went ahead and pointed out some things - not health issues, mind you, I wouldn't have minded that, but sort of little cosmetic things, like a small line I have on one tooth - that left me with a bit of a furrowed brow.  Yeah, I was aware of those things but I'd already talked about the things that I wanted fixed.  Perhaps sales factor into the equation, but if I'm already thinking of getting some work done it seemed a bit unnecessary to point out other, non-health related things.  On the other hand it may have been a "well you might as well get these taken care of too" kind of thing.Not offensive, just brow-furrowing.  Overall I have to recommend the place through.  The rest of the staff were great.  I may update in a couple of months after my orthodontic consult - yikes!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Rankin Women's Center
text: I was referred to Rankin by my general practitioner when I got that great big plus sign.  My OB here was Dr. Yavorski, who was sweet, encouraging and calm at all times - well, except for my last appointment when it seemed labor was imminent (it was) - then she was appropriately excited.  If you are going to Rankin for prenatal care and delivery, there is a team of 7 doctors (although I think one of them only practices at the Ballantyne location) and you will be encouraged to meet all of them as any one of them could be on call when you deliver.  I will say that I felt comfortable with all of the doctors.  They all exuded calmness, which was important to me.  Dr. Palermo actually ended up delivering me and her deadpan wit was the perfect thing to get me through the process.  I'd planned on an unmedicated birth, and the doctors were all supportive.  It wasn't until I went into labor and had a personal change of heart that I went for pain meds and they were supportive of that too.  I never felt like I was bullied or strong-armed into making a choice, and whenever I had questions they were answered to my satisfaction.  My pregnancy was pretty uneventful so I never really got to see them work in a crisis though. These doctors deliver at Presbyterian hospital, which is state of the art.Well after everything I came out a healthy mom to a healthy baby boy, so I'm at least a fan.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Carolina Community Maternity Center
text: I haven't used this center for its primary purpose, which is as a birth center.  I have been attending classes here to learn pain management techniques for my own upcoming, hopefully drug-free hospital birth.  But I still feel comfortable being a "fan" because I support their mission and what they do.This is a place in-between hospital and home births that follows the midwife model of care.  It is staffed by midwives and it supports/features a natural birth model.  You can have a water birth, you can roll around on a birthing ball, you can squat and shout and nobody will try to drug you.  Of course, if there are complications they will arrange for you to get to a hospital so you aren't being held captive here either.As I mentioned before, besides births and prenatal care, they host classes for moms-to-be.  They host Lamaze, Bradley and Hypnobabies classes for birth, they host FREE breastfeeding classes, a prenatal yoga class and a postpartum support group.Anyway if you're thinking of having a natural birth, you may want to check out their website at least.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: EyeOptix Vision & Laser Center
text: The number one reason why I like them is because they offer a glaucoma screening technology that does not require trying to keep your eye open while a jet of air is blasted at it.  I think it costs more but depending on your insurance you may not have to pay for the privilege.Service is friendly, doctors are nice, glasses are cute. Or you know, serious and intellectual if that's your thing.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Orthocarolina
text: My mother recently went through knee replacement surgery and this facility was her primary care. I wanted to leave one review so I waited until her physical therapy was complete. I came with my mom to discuss potential knee replacement surgery option. I did my research online and I was ready to ask all the questions which I had prepared ahead of time. I pretty much ask all type of questions I could think of and I was pretty impressed with doctor's willingness to educate us on the whole process as well as details. We were satisfied with doctor's response and confident on performing the surgery. We scheduled our surgery in uptown CMC where we were told that same doctor would perform the surgery. They even provided a translator for my mom during her consultation and stay at the hospital. The whole surgery took about 45 minutes and doctor came out after the surgery to provide an update to me personally. Again, giving my detail oriented nature I asked few questions and he was able to explain me in detail. After the surgery, she had to complete physical therapy to ensure her knee would function correctly. This office helped us schedule her physical therapy which was little closer to our house in different office.  Through out the whole process, we were pretty happy with doctor's creditability and friendliness. I would have given 5 star review but there was one incident where a nurse was not very friendly with my sister when she asked couple of questions. I think even the front office staff could use a little training on how to be friendly with their customers because at the end of the day, best marketing is referral.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 4, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Northpoint Eye Studio
text: I came here with my daughter to get her eyes checked for the first time and we had a great experience at this doctors office. I called here couple of times to book an appointment for last minute but they were always booked so one time I decided to schedule it ahead of time by scheduling to WFH so we can complete her eye exam. We arrived at the facility on time and we were greeted with smile and warm welcome. The lady at front desk was very friendly and polite, she offered coffee and soft drinks while we wait for her turn. We chatted for a bit until my daughter was called in. We went inside and the nurse  explained to my daughter what she needed to do so she can take pictures of her eyes. She was moving a little so it took her a while to get her steady but nurse was courteous to help her. Than we went to see the eye doctor who also was friendly and explained her what she needed to do for her eye exam. I think we had a great experience not only at the front desk but also with nurse and with the doctor. I would definitely recommend this place.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Charlotte Eye Ear Nose & Throat Associates, PA
text: I took my five year old here to get her hearing checked since she didn't pass the basic pre-screening at the pediatric. I was very impressed with the nurse's friendliness and professionalism of the doctor here. First visit, we came here and we waited about fifteen minutes before we were called in. The doctor started conversation right away with my daughter and my daughter was able to talk to her very comfortably. The test took about thirty minutes or so and throughout the whole process, it was very playful for my daughter and she didn't feel like she was at doctor's office. She still had cold during this visit so the doctor suggested a follow up visit once her cold was gone.Second visit, we arrived here and my daughter was excited to come here. That's the first time she was excited to be at doctor's office : D We waited for about the same time (fifteen minutes) and were called in. Again, the test took about twenty minutes and this time she passed the hearing test YAY! We were on our way out, we checked out and that's when my daughter reminded me that she needs to get a sticker!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: ClearChoice Dental Implant Center
text: I saw their advertisement on TV so I figured let me check it out. I made an appointment online and I got confirmation via email right away. I also received multiple voice mails about reminder of my appointment and I received a regular mail along with the paper work I need to fill out so my check in process. I arrived at the facility right on time. I checked in and it was pretty painless process. I waited for about fifteen minutes where a lady called me for consultation. We entered into an office where she explained what they do and what I was interested in as far as procedures they offer. I told them, I am interested in getting dental implants and she quoted me price. Per my consultation with lot of dentist in and around Charlotte area, these guys are the most expensive. Infact, their prices are 3 times more than normal dental implant procedure would cost. I told the lady that they should really publish this information on their website that way people don't have to drive 45 mins just to get their which is waste of their time, money and schedule.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Carolina Family Dentistry At Lake Wylie, PLLC
text: Best dentist in the area. Laura is fantastic. Dr. Vargas is so down to earth. They really know their patients. They also make the insurance process seamless to the patient.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Fort Mill Dermatology
text: Dont get over the counter skin care. Go to the Dr, especially this practice. Great docs all around. Head to toe checks, great bed side manners and they can give you suggestions for much better skin care treatments that will save you money. Vs all the junk we spend money on at sephora! :)

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Charlotte Eye Ear Nose & Throat Associates
text: My family and I have been seeing Dr. Heavner for years, great doc. He has done surgeries on my husband and daughter and done an excellent job. I woke up with a horrible eye infection on a Sunday. I also am allergic to sulfa eye drops. Dr. Saunders came in to see me on Sunday! He got me the steroid drops I needed. So kind! Thanks Doc!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
categories: ['Massage Therapy', 'Home Health Care', 'Local Services', 'Couriers & Delivery Services', 'Health & Medical', 'Massage', 'Beauty & Spa']
name: Massage 2go
text: First time customer. Just like other reviews here; the process was simple, call or text the number and they will send someone to you. The coordination was simple enough and quite honestly drama less. I coordinated a time, but later on it was changed by the office or scheduler, with my concurrence of course. However, the lady showed up at the original time when I was not at the hotel. After a bit of confusion, she set things up in just minutes.I got a wonderful and respectful lady by name of Elena. She was fantastic, very profesional and knew what she was doing. I asked for a deep tissue and wish she would apply a bit more pressure, but none of the less, I was enjoying the massage. I could have told her, but I was so relax that I decided to simply enjoy and fall asleep. I would recommend Elena and this business to anyone looking for a profesional and legit business while visiting Vegas. I'll be back..

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'GoodForKids': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Planet Fitness - Fort Mill
text: Great place to workout, the staff is very friendly and keep the place running like a clock. My only complaint is they are not open 24 hours. I posted photos with operating hours including 2014 holiday hours.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Valeriano Orthodontics
text: I am now post-braceage after about 18 months. Dr. Valeriano and his well educated staff are just amazing. They made me feel at ease about my treatment the entire tenure, never hesitating to take care of any issues that may have risen.They really spoil you when the hardware comes off ... between the compliments, sugary goodness and photos you'll certainly feel as if you're on a pedestal!Definitely the most friendly and knowledgeable group in Charlotte! "Go See Doctor Vee..."

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
name: Zen Massage Charlotte
text: Rub-a-dub-dub, one man on a massage table. Wait, what?First timer! Girlfriend got this for me as a Valentine's Day gift so we could enjoy a couples massage. As instructed we arrived several minutes before the appointment so I could fill out all the required medical forms. We were met by our therapists right around our appointment time and walked to the house next door. I was hoping to have my lower back worked on, but she asked if I had any areas of concern and I stated my lower back. She completely stayed away from my lower back - so I guess her question meant what areas should she not touch... duly noted! First timer error!All in all it was an incredible experience. Professional, respectful therapists help make it worthwhile. I did not feel out of place, at all! Wow. I will definitely go back.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Piedmont Urgent Care Center
text: One star is required to write a review, otherwise this would be ZERO stars or negative stars!!Where do I start? First off, I am not normally sick but the crud was going around during the holidays and I picked up something bad. I had a cruise coming up soon so I had to do something. The CMC Urgent Cares were all booked up and yet this Piedmont location still had openings. Now, I know why!I had always heard really bad things about Piedmont hospital in Rock Hill - but against my better judgement I set an appointment for after work to get checked out. It was thirty minute plus wait, which is definitely not one of my issues. My issues comes with the diagnosis part. This "Doctor" Kelly guy seemed like he had no idea what was going on.. oh, because he didn't!A 15 minute flu and strep test took almost 30. He asked me 4 times if I was allergic to anything. After he gave me a script, he mentioned that ones of the items had a warning to not swallow but his instructions were to go ahead a swallow a little bit. Uhh, what?He could not tell me what was wrong and asked me several times what I think it was and what I think should be done to fix it... and I still ended paying over $300 I guess that's why they call the medical field a "Practice." Quack, quack. Never again.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Spa Alexis Massage & Bodywork
text: Alexis is very knowledgeable and very professional.  Great location.  I have visited several times for treatment for a very specific issue and Alexis has been helpful each time.  I highly recommend her.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Spa Alexis Massage & Bodywork
text: Excellent massage with firm strokes that provides a magical cure for aching backs, arms and knees. Alexis is very, very skilled at her work and I really like the fact that she goes to work straight on the area requested instead of spending 50% of the time on other areas. The one issue - she is comparatively pricier  than almost everyone else that I have seen in Houston.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Spa Alexis Massage & Bodywork
text: Alexis is amazing! Over the years I have been to a few different massage therapists and she is by far the best. She is the only one in her office, so it is always quiet and her focus is on you. Most massages I've had feel great during, but then I leave basically feeling the same as when I walked in. With Alexis, this is not the case. She really listens to you and massages what you need her to, instead of other places where they just go thru their typical 30 min massage and kind of ignore whatever you tell them is bothering you (or at least that has been my experience ). She is a little pricey, which is probably the only thing that keeps me from going every week. Parking can be difficult - I always have to park across the street and cross Sage to get to her office. But it is definitely worth the money - trust me. Best massage therapist hands down.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Spa Alexis Massage & Bodywork
text: Parking is a bit difficult but I was much less pleased with her attitude and  treatment towards me than anything else. We had a  misunderstanding about the massage I was requesting, which I was willing to let go, however she kept defending what she claimed to have said as opposed to just letting it go as a misunderstanding. Despite knowing I very specifically asked her twice (I had to ask her twice because what she was saying about extending the massage seemed to contradict her saying there was no need for it) if extending my massage time to 90 minutes from 60 minutes would allow the entire time for lymphatic massage and her answering yes I was willing to go with the flow. She did however offer to do the entire thing lymphatic. I agree, go to the bathroom, come back to fill out the paper work and she is being abrasively pushy about INSISTING I sit down instead of stand. It was just word and very hostile. I do sit down and mutter "wow" to myself.After this she did suggest we just not go through with it free of charge so I appreciate that as good business.  However I would've been much happier to have just been able to get a word in edge wise without feeling like she was talking down to me and defending what I had decided to chalk up to a misunderstanding. She made it a much bigger deal and worse experience than it needed to be by feeling the need to prove she was right.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Local Services', 'Education', 'Health & Medical', 'Community Service/Non-Profit', 'CPR Classes', 'Blood & Plasma Donation Centers', 'Specialty Schools']
name: American Red Cross
text: I've been donating blood for decades. It's one of the few morally unambiguous things you can do these days. In addition, I have many friends who cannot donate for a variety of reasons so I try to take up the slack. I usually donate at work but, because of the summer, they skipped a cycle so I checked at the ARC to see about walk-ins.West Madison's ARC center wins the prize for the quickest donation EVER! Granted, it was slow day over there and I know the ropes but, I was out in 45 minutes! After quick, friendly and professional attention, I was sipping OJ, eating a cookie and walking out with a free loaf of Panera bread (on Thursdays and Fridays) under my arm in less than an hour.I won't suggest that you'll get through that quickly but, if you can, donating blood should be a thing. Do it. Save lives!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Wisconsin Fertility Institute
text: Overall, I can't say I had a positive experience here. The prices are competitive which is likely what draws folks in, along with the fact that most OB-gyns in the area seem to refer here. Regardless, I felt like the prognosis I was given varied dramatically from one month to the next and subsequent recommendations were not based on actual testing I ever underwent. I sought a second opinion, ended up going elsewhere & I'm very glad I did.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: University Medical Center
text: My husband had experienced a severe and sudden episode of dizziness in September 2016 and so we started at an urgent care near home, but as the condition persisted, we went to the ER at UMC.We were fortunate to go in early morning as this is one busy facility which gets very busy as the day rolls on.We had to remain in a room in Trauma 1 for over 12 hours. Because he is in his 50s they needed to rule out stroke, etc. The nursing staff, techs, and doctors were very caring. We could see that there was so much going on trauma-wise so it was understandable that since we had a stable condition, we had to wait. I am a registered nurse and have been one since 1972. I also have taught customer service and medical assistants. Believe me, I am used to finding fault when a doctor's office or facility doesn't meet my high expectations, so I was pretty amazed and thrilled that my husband and I received great respect.People who came in with drug related conditions, or those who had to be accompanied by law enforcement also were treated well.You can hear everything while seated behind a curtain!My husband got a bed on the 4th floor and remained there for a few days.Everything was good: staff were helpful and very good at explaining any delays regarding testing or doctors' visits.This RN did not expect the calibre of care at UMC. We had only been in Nevada for a year, so we hardly knew where to go.We have insurance with my job, and one may think that there could be a different treatment for those who have coverage, or who speak English, or seem to understand what is going on, but every individual I saw was given the utmost respect. Of course there were direct conversations and admonishments to those who made crazy life choices, or had two cops in the cubicle, but each interaction was dignified. I was so impressed.Dr. Wangsuwana, the neurologist, is a dream come true: he dove into a medical history with many issues but translated what was going on very clearly, and found errors which had been made by doctors out of state. We subsequently visited Dr. Wangsuwana just to have him become my husband's neurologist. Dr. Wangsuwana is brilliant but his manner is caring and he treated us very well.This was a great experience. UMC is a fine facility as evidenced by its wonderful people.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
categories: ['Family Practice', 'Hospitals', 'Doctors', 'Drugstores', 'Diagnostic Imaging', 'Shopping', 'Diagnostic Services', 'Medical Centers', 'Counseling & Mental Health', 'Health & Medical']
name: UW Health Northeast Family Medicine Clinic
text: My daughter and son in law take my wonderful 6 month old grandson Ansel to this clinic.I had always recommended using a family medicine office so as to avoid the long lines and mechanical pediatrician offices when my children were little, and so now my family uses Northeast and just love it.They have been treated so well by the staff at this center.They make the family feel very welcome and that you are doing a great job at parenting.Ansel loves to have books read to him.  They especially like that the child receives a book at each visit. Ann O. and Jennifer E. are wonderful.  The nurses are affectionate and incredibly capable with any questions we have.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Ohriner Mark OD
text: My husband and I just got our health insurance and this clinic is close to home.We both appreciated the instructions from the staff and Dr. Ohriner. I sincerely appreciated the welcome I got when I made our appointment. We were pretty much taken right away possibly because it was 4:30 pm.Dr. Ohriner helped my husband with his questions and appeared knowledgeable about his genetic condition and when it was my turn he talked me off the cliff when I resisted my first bifocals.I am a proud matriarch and so did not want reading glasses.He made it very easy to choose my new reading glasses based on his great explanations.I got the feeling that he gives information and time to each client.Staff were helpful and though it took a while to get all the glasses and measurements, we got the answers and products we need.

name: Comfort Dental Care
text: A couple of weeks ago I saw this office and since we moved here seven months ago, and I need a new dentist, I set up an initial visit.On the day I noticed the place, I met Cathy at the front desk. Her warm welcome made this dentally challenged and fearful 66 year old feel excited to interview my first dentist since our move. I had fallen at age 13, had a deadened nerve which was stabilized in the 90s but again darkening. I had a large family growing up, so our parents identified a crazy dentist who practiced in a dreary office and never, ever, really let our novocaine numb us. That was always traumatic.My trust level in finding a dentist was zero.I had an initial visit with Dr. Nguyen who listened to my concerns, asked me some questions, and set up for my exam.The office looks small from the outside, but it is bright and warm inside- with a big fountain and music to relax patients.While Cathy processed my forms and set up, I was almost drowsy!Dr. Nguyen did my evaluation and it went very well even though I have not maintained the best possible mouth.I came back for a deep cleaning one week later.The management of novocaine is now enhanced with topical gel that numbs you before the needle comes. I swear I have had 2 good dentists in my life- and Dr. Nguyen is the most concerned of them all- he checks on the patient frequently to be sure you are not feeling anything.I highly recommend this office for many reasons, but when I found out that for major procedures, Dr. Nguyen focuses on 1 patient and does not have others zooming around in the office, I was happy. This is a very good feeling for me. The peace and quiet adds to my calm.When I told Dr. Nguyen he cannot ever leave, he updated me that soon his daughter, also a USC grad, will be working here too!Dr. Nguyen has established a very capable office and I, for one, am going back!!!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Fingerprinting Pros
text: I needed to get an additional out of state RN license and the requirements include several documents to be notarized and fingerprints to be sent to the state. This office does both the notary and the fingerprints part. I arrived probably at 11 o'clock in the morning on Monday (today).I was seen immediately at the front desk. I didn't have to sit down before my notarization was completed and then I turned around to the booth where there was a smiling young lady waiting to take my fingerprints. They perform the fingerprint ink and place everything in the computer and relay it to the correct office, and they hand you back the original card with the fingerprints on it to transmit with your payment to the board of health.From start to finish I was probably there 11 minutes and everyone is extremely helpful. This is definitely an office I would use again for these services.it is super convenient between Desert Inn and Sahara on the eastern side of Maryland Parkway.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Isthmus Eye Care
text: The opticians and optometrists at Isthmus Eye Care are so friendly and helpful. I recently had an eye exam and contact fitting here, and it was a great experience. Not a huge fan of having my pupils dilated, but they put some drops in afterward which was supposed to help the dilation go away faster. Dr. Maursetter was very nice and explained the purpose of all the tests she was running. It's always helpful when a professional is explaining what they are doing instead of just doing something and leaving you wondering why they are doing it. She gave me some daily contacts to try since I had complained of dryness with the two week contacts. After wearing those for a week, I decided I did not like them so they gave me a different brand to try on. They are very accommodating of your needs, and ordering contacts from them is quick and easy.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: SEE
text: SEE is an amazing eyewear boutique that just opened up on State Street. My boyfriend and I stopped to look at some frames because the other optometrists on State Street were closed. The staff was super helpful in suggesting frames and letting you know if they thought it worked for your face shape or not. They really encourage you to try on all the frames you want. The sticker price also includes the lenses, so what you see is the total cost (not including tax, I think). If you do not have a prescription, they have a doctor there on Tues and Thurs who can do an eye exam for $39. There are so many cool frames in all sorts of colors and shapes, if you wear glasses or sunglasses you should definitely check it out.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: SolEscape Healing Arts
text: I had a 30 min massage appointment on Oct 11 with Kirsten Martin for muscle soreness and tension in my neck and shoulders, which I let her know about. During the massage, Kirsten used a lot of force to the point where it was very painful at times. I didn't speak up at the time because I thought this was normal, but speaking to colleagues and friends afterward about my experience, they told me that massage shouldn't be painful. I left last night feeling some relief from the muscle soreness and tension, but woke up this morning feeling worse. My neck, where she focused a lot of pressure, is tender to the touch and I am feeling soreness moving my neck around. I felt worse after the massage than I did going in.I emailed SolEscape with this information/feedback on Oct. 12 and they never responded.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Associated Physicians
text: I have been a patient at AP for the last couple years. When I got pregnant I was referred here from UHS and could not have been happier with my experience. (I had moved here from Milwaukee and hadn't gotten hooked up with a new OBGYN yet). My OB was Dr. Weidel, but I met all five doctors who had been in that practice, and Dr. Dickmeyer delivered my son. However, about a year ago, four of the five OBs from this practice left AP to start their own women's health clinic, Madison Women's Health. Now they have four new OB-GYNs at AP, and presumably new nurses, PAs too. I followed Dr. Weidel to MWH and I would really strongly recommend this new practice. It is very nice and the doctors are great. They are concerned about comprehensive women's health so there's more emphasis on overall health and well-being, not just OBGYN-related sort of things. Since my son was born he has seen Dr. Heather Rainwater in the peds department at AP and we have also been very happy with everything in that area. The nurses are really nice, they are pretty quick with everything, and the doctors seem to enjoy their work.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Rejuvenation Spa
text: My old stylist referred me to Rejuvenation when I moved to Madison. It's an Aveda salon so you kind of know what to expect since they're usually pretty much the same.My hair always looks great when leave here, regardless of whether I'm getting a touch up, highlights or just a hair cut. It also seems much less expensive than it should be. The only thing I don't like is the chairs at the shampoo station. They're really uncomfortable and I always feel like I somehow get my collarbone wedged between the chair and the sink (don't spend too much time trying to visualize that).But it was a great relief to find a new stylist I can trust as soon as I moved here. No need to look any further!

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Robertson Cosmetic Center
text: Medspa offering laser/light services, injectables, peels, skincare (Obagi, etc).  Had an intense pulsed light ("laser") skin treatment and was pleased with the results.  Staff seems knowledgeable and I like that there is a physician integrated with the practice should an issue arise.  I did appreciate that the RN performing the procedure was able to remove a milia while I was there, yahoo!Summary: Competent medspa, I would trust the staff here to give good advice on skincare and do procedures well.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Dental Health Associates of Madison
text: This place is a dental machine! In a good way.  Super efficient.DHA is a large dental practice; this area alone has multiple DHA locations on the same corner.  So, if one needs general or specialty dental care (orthodontics, periodontics, , etc) it's all under one roof.I like the practice because they are always on time, polite, and get the job done.  My dentist is Dr. Grode, and although my interaction with him has been rather minimal (not many problems), he is very polite and efficient.  Getting into a cavity filled, from walking in the door to walking out only took about 30 minutes.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Community Pharmacy
text: I have never used the pharmacy services but I've purchased stuff from the retail area. They mostly focus on natural/organic/homeopathic stuff but they also have a few conventional choices to choose from. They have a very large supplements section, shampoo/body care section, and sexual health section. A great place to shop if you're interested in natural & herbal products.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Midwest Dental - Madison
text: Yay to Dr. Ena Lee.  Nay to  Dr. Michael Spiewak.FYI, they do a new patient visit and then schedule you for a dental cleaning so you can't get it done same day. Saw Dr. Lee for my first appointment.  They do a full set of x-rays here which I find a little annoying because I really think that a full set is unnecessary if no problems are found.  Anyway, Dr. Lee was nice and I liked her.Then for the cleaning, Dr. Spiewak was the attending dentist (had teeth cleaned by hygienist). My dad is a dentist and I have chosen not to get my wisdom teeth removed  because they are impacted but not coming in crooked but they are just hanging out under the gum.   The dentist freaked out when I said that I wasn't removing them for now and he was like "OMG there's bacteria festering under there if you were my daughter I'd tell you to do it!!!"  I've read the scholarly journals.  There's not significant evidence that getting wisdom teeth out as a preventative measure is helpful.  I've gone here for another cleaning and yet again Dr Spiewak has harassed me about the wisdom teeth.So  overall, I liked Dr Lee but not the other dentist.  If you choose to go here, consider saying that I referred you!  We both get $20 gift cards if you're referred.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: WomanCare Clinic
text: UPDATE: This clinic will soon become a UW Health clinic (in case y'all are curious about insurance networks and whatnot)

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
categories: ['Beauty & Spa', 'Health & Medical', 'Massage', 'Tai Chi', 'Fitness & Instruction', 'Active Life', 'Massage Therapy']
name: Premier Bodywork
text: Massage therapy at Premier has helped release discomfort in my arms and shoulders  from computer usage (curse of the modern age).  Robb can customize therapy to focus on specific areas of concern, or just to alleviate  stress. The office  is located in the Quarry Arts Building, where you can just about throw a stone (from a quarry, maybe) and hit a bodyworker's office. Only street parking is available but you can easily find a nearby spot. Flexible appointment times and online scheduling is available, as well as occasional discounts when there's a sudden opening in the schedule. Fortunately, in addition to stress relief, my sessions tangibly reduced upper body discomfort so I can resume Yelping in style.

attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
categories: ['Beauty & Spa', 'Health & Medical', 'Massage', 'Tai Chi', 'Fitness & Instruction', 'Active Life', 'Massage Therapy']
name: Premier Bodywork
text: I met Robb after competing in the Ironman in early September.  They were offering free 15 minute massages for athletes post race, so I took advantage!  Even though I didn't have Robb at the time, he  gave me his card.Three weeks later I finally got around to scheduling an appointment, and I'm glad I did!  Robb was nothing but professional, and helped me understand what my body was going through.  He was a positive person to be around, and has great passion for what he does.  Even though it was my first full massage, I could tell he did an awesome job.I would definitely recommend Robb and Premier Bodywork to anyone.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Madison Optometric Center
text: I have been going here for 2 years straight and have nothing but positive things to say about Madison Optometric Center. As someone who sleeps with her glasses on, I often need readjustments which are always done by incredibly polite people in the front.  During both eye exams, the optometrist took the time to answer all of my random questions.  Seriously, go here if you can. Waaaay better than the chain stores.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: LensCrafters
text: I will write of my experience at this Lens Crafters and emphasize that I will NEVER set foot in this store again.  I had an evening appointment and I had just finished a day at my job of office monkey.  I had changed into a t-shirt because being in full office gear for 3 more hours was seriously going to chafe my morale. This meant I had minimal make up on, hair styled about 10 hours ago, and khaki pants.   I was asked no more than 3 times if I was over 18 years old (uh I'm out of college). I ended up volunteering to have the receptionist examine my driver's license!  Oddly everyone but the optometrist had some comment to make about my age or my appearance. (how effing rude, just look at my eyes and get me through the herd, yo)Next infraction... the REFUSAL to explain FEES upfront.  I had asked how much the exam would be and I explain I am there for both glasses and contacts.  AFTER I finish the exam -- I am curtly told that if I want contacts the fitting fee is an additional $80. (um I did want contacts and I did tell you that.)  I ask them to reduce the fee and am told to call back in the morning.    Third infraction... after bringing in my YEAR old glasses to get the lenses replaced, I am told that the frames are too "cracked" to receive new lenses.  Funny how the next optometrist I went to didn't have that problem.Fourth infraction.. After getting quotes from 3 other eye care facilities, I end up calling the next morning to ask about receive a reduced fee for a contact fitting.  I am told that the "fitting" they provide is superior service to all others in Madison and refuse to give me a reduced price, even after I explained that I was not fully informed of the fees.  (and EVERYWHERE is is between $30-40 less)This Lenscrafters is an abomination to all others. The staff is way too rude considering they're trying to rip you off.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: First Choice Dental
text: I'm a graduate student with no dental insurance, who had the unfortunate experience of having a (grain of rice sized) chunk of her tooth fall off.  The good news is that there was no pain; the bad involved my experience at First Choice Dental on South Park Street.  I am only giving a rating of two stars because the receptionists were extremely polite and kind.  I spoke to one of them on the phone for at least 5 minutes as we tried to arrange a time for me to come in.  After my interactions with them the politeness stopped and the bullying began.  The dental assistant was more interested in fixing her computer monitor that was crapping out than the patient. She crammed the X-Ray machine in my mouth and basically told me to tough it out while she fiddled with another computer for at least 2 minutes. (which is a really long time when some huge machine is chafing your effing mouth)  The dentist explained to me that I would need an expensive crown for about $1600.  He tried rationalizing it to me that it was "mere pennies a day" as this crown was going to last me 20 years. Additionally, the dentist (thinking that I was one of those uninsured eccentric millionaires) suggested that I get 4 of my other fillings replaced too as they were cracking.  Both of these people seemed to not hear me say at least 4 times, "I'm not insured."  I requested a temporary filling for the problem tooth no less than 3 times in which the dentist flat out refused.  At the end, I was ushered into a room where they discussed finances with me, and suggested that perhaps I ask my parents for help in order to get a crown or maybe I could take out a loan from a bank that they endorsed.  I hope it was that they just hate poor people, and they treat insured people better. (who probably have no choice but First Choice)

name: Slick Nails
text: I've been looking for a good nail technician since moving to this side of town & I finally did in Tina at this salon. Let me first start by saying in no way is it fancy in decor so I was a bit skeptical when I first walked in but I was welcomed with a smile & Tina immediately started my pedicure. I am very picky and I focus more on shaping, scrubbing of the feet & most important the attention paid to tending to my cuticles. Tina didn't rush in the least bit & did a excellent job on my pedi, I think I dare to say the "best ever" & I've had a lot of pedicures. She spent the time massaging & using salt scrub, hot stones & towel, it really gave me time to relax. Next she did a gel manicure & the polish was perfect, she asked me how I wanted them & executed perfectly, I have been back 2 more times since & Tina is & will be my go to person from here on out. I am thankful to have finally found a place I have confidence in to make my nails look good & last the time frame expected.
