name: Star Foot Spa
text: Very nice spa in China Town, rooms are private but did have a slight smell of smoke. If they offered aromatherapy it would have completely taken that slight smell out of the air but massage made up for it. I had James for 90min full body massage. He had great hands, dug into my muscles where he saw they were tense, used his skills to actually massage me & not just rub oil into my skin. He did some great stretches and pulls on my legs & neck. I was very happy and will go back and request him. Overall great experience especially to have done a walk in on a Sat evening. Check them out!!!!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Autumn Hair & Nail Spa
text: I went in on Sunday around 10:15 am to get gel mani & deluxe pedicure. The lady doing Deluxe pedicure was finished in 16 minutes flat, I asked her to re-do my polish on big toes because she rushed & it was very messy. I have no clue why she was speed racing thru my pedicure because there was only one other person in shop & someone else was doing her nails. Now on to the gel manicure. Allen did my nails, I chose a basic purple/pinkish color with one glitter accent nail, simple. By 6:00pm that night I had 2 nails with chipped gel polish!!! I called the shop to complain but they were already closed. By the next morning 3 more nails had polish chipping off!!! I was horrified I had just spent my money for this crisply nail job. I got in touch with Allen on Mon & of course he says come in to fix. That sounded good until I got there after work & he pulls out the polish & literally was going to just polish over the chips in nails & put back under lamp, I stopped him & said that is not going to work, they will chip even faster, he started getting aggressive grabbing my hand to drill polish off saying "he got it & he knows what he's doing". We got into a slight argument because I'm trying to ask him what is he going to do different because obviously what he did the 1st time didn't. Long story short he drilled (not soaked) polish off of 5 chipped nails, quickly re-polished nails & guess what?!?!? By Wed (not 48 hrs later) 3 more nails have chips. I will call today to demand refund, I'm sure they will do the right thing & make this right ;) I'll hold my breathe. Thank you Allen for worst quality gel manicure ever!!!

text: Worst experience ever!!!! They have printed that polish change is $10, then they charge my card $12!!! Owner starts yelling at me when I questioned charge but it is printed on the wall, told me to never come back, very unprofessional & completely wrong how they treated me for questioning, this treatment made me go off on them!!! Plus the nail tech paint on French manicure is horrible!!!! Less than 1 STAR!!! I paid the $12 but will never go back, don't waste your time money!!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Cosmo Nails & Spa
text: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! I've continued to give this place chances over the last 1 1/2 yrs, also referring many friends to go as well.  I have experienced problems with my nails several times where I had to call go back in for repair which has been a irritant but continued to go because of location.  This last time I had the worst experience EVER. I did not have a appointment on this day but when I went in for nails & pedi, instead of telling me that it would be over a 3 hour wait, they shuffled me to the pedi chair, after 30 mins I received a less than average pedi & was then told to wait for the next 2 hrs for nails.  Once I got in the chair for nails, my nail tech LISA, proceeded to get up to wax someone else's eyebrows (that came in after me) and then do nail designs on someone else nails.  I said something to her about this being it was 8:05 pm & she stated her husband Vince would do my nails, he came over & aggressively started scrapping the polish off my nails & I stated to him that I don't understand why he is now doing my nails after I have waited for all their appts & walk ins to get taken care of and now I am being put off again.  LISA started yelling over his shoulder to me what she was doing, which was completely unacceptable!!! I always pay & tip very well at this place but LISA & VINCE are rude & tried to justify why I was still not being taken care of at 8 pm.  I watched several clients come in & ask for services that DID NOT have a appt, along with the ones with appts, but she wanted to argue with me that all of them had appts, which was a flat out lie. I got up & left, letting them know that I would never return & will let everyone know of their lack of customer service, especially to a long time client.  Lisa then wanted to start a text war with me, arguing back & forth for the next hour through the phone.  An apology means nothing when all you had to do from the beginning was say "we won't be able to get you in today" instead of having me there for 3 hrs & leaving with my nails half scrapped off with polish.  They are greedy & time management is horrible.  If you simply tell someone up front what the wait time will be this would have never happened, but to yell at me once I said something about it will never fly in my book.  They lost a great client due to lack of professionalism & customer service. LISA also then wanted to talk about me to 2 of my friends that go there as well, again VERY UNPROFESSIONAL.  We all talk to each other silly lady!!!

categories: ['Beauty & Spa', 'American (New)', 'Day Spas', 'Hotels', 'Event Planning & Services', 'Health Retreats', 'Restaurant', 'Hotels & Travel']
name: Hotel Valley Ho
text: I'm almost embarrassed to tell people where I'm staying based on the horrible name, but it's one of my favorite hotels when visiting Phoenix for work.They take good care of their guests. In fact, when I arrived this time they informed me they had upgraded me to a lovely room with a huge bathtub in the middle of the room. Ah- if only I had time for baths on work trips (or baths at all!). I've stayed at The Valley Ho enough times to know that my directionally challenged self will get lost trying to find a room outside. Instead I asked them to instead find a nice room in the tower.  Forget the fancy bathtub (although a shower would be nice!).I just wanted a close room that was clean and somewhat spacious. And I got just that for the little time I actually spent in the room. I probably spent more time getting work done in the lounge. Speaking of, the tomato burrata salad was pretty tasty.If I was headed to Phoenix for vacation I'd likely stay elsewhere (Montelucia* has proved to be a good option for this in the past), but will continue to visit "The Ho" for work travel.* http://www.yelp.com/biz/omni-scottsdale-resort-and-spa-at-montelucia-paradise-valley

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'WiFi': 'free', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Hotels', 'Hotels & Travel', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Day Spas', 'Event Planning & Services', 'Venues & Event Spaces']
name: Firesky Resort & Spa
text: Kimpton does it AGAIN...this time with the Firesky Resort and Spa.  I think they teach a course on how to be nice to people here because all their employees are SO nice.  And not even in a creepy too nice way....they actually all seemed genuinely interested in how cold it was back home in Chicago and how I was I enjoying my stay. And how was I enjoyed my stay? Very much so! Thank you for asking.My room was spacious, clean, full of l'occitane products (I'm guilty of stealing some...shhhh), and there was a fruit basket waiting for me in my room.  My room overlooked the enticing pool that I never had time to use- drats.  Also never had time to use my 25% coupon (given to me at check-in) at the spa- double drats.Just 2 little complaints:1) The free internet service was spotty, which can drive a workaholic like myself absolutely insane.2) They changed their security system while I was there, which meant none of the original room keys worked. I walked ALL THE WAY to my room to discover my key didn't work and then had to walk ALL THE WAY back to the lobby to see what the deal was. Couldn't the nice man who greeted me when I first walked in the lobby warn me about the key problem?  OK, it wasn't really that far, but I was spoiled by all the fabulous treatment I got there!But those itty bitty complaints won't keep me from returning from Firesky. And next time I'll be sure to make some time for the pool and spa.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Gainey Village Health Club & Spa
text: "Don't you worry...I don't do a lot of chest exercises since I have implants"Only in Scottsdale would the fitness instructor respond with that statement after I told her I had to skip all chest exercises because I had stitches. And no, my stitches are not from implants, but from getting a tiny little mole removed. Not nearly as exciting as what they've got going down there in Scottsdale.So yeah, Gabi K was sweet enough to invite workoutaholic me to her gym while I was in town. Apparently Charles Barkley works out here (oooh la la), but he was absent for my visit.  Lots of cardio and weight machines so I made myself at home on the elliptical machine before our hour long weight lifting class.  There is also a nice basketball courts that isn't my cup of tea, but may appeal to some of you sporty yelpers.As for the class...it was just ok.  The instructor talked a bit too much and I didn't feel like I got the best workout, but there's good, bad, and medicore instructors at every gym.  But only the instructors at Scottsdale gyms tell you about their implants right off the bat!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Fitness & Instruction', 'Day Spas', 'Hair Salons', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Trainers', 'Sports Clubs', 'Swimming Pools', 'Yoga', 'Pilates', 'Gyms', 'Active Life']
name: Camelback Village Racquet & Health Club
text: The Village member, Gabi M, was nice enough to get me a day guest pass so I could work out with her at the ungodly hour of 6:30am. Even though I was technically still on Chicago time it felt early...really early. She had signed us up for Heidi's TRX class, which isn't included in the membership ($15/person). We don't have to pay for TRX classes at my gym at home, but apparently it's a new class here. When we first checked in they told us the class was taking place on the rooftop of the gym. We headed on up and realized it was outside. Being a Chicagoan I feel silly being worried about being cold in 60 degree weather, but we did hesitate taking the class due to it being outside.  Ultimately, we decided to give it a shot and hoped Heidi would get us warmed up quickly.  Heidi did just that and within minutes I was loving the temps, not to mention the opportunity to be outside in January. Amazing!! Rumor has it Heidi is a popular instructor and I can see why. She's challenging, motivating and focused on form so you know you're actually doing the moves correctly.  If I lived in the area I'd likely sign up for this class on a weekly basis....or...maybe Heidi's classes that are a bit later in the morning. The rest of the gym was absolutely packed. There were very few pieces of cardio equipment empty. I guess people in Phoenix have to get up early for workouts when they can't hid behind their coats all day like we do in Chicago.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'Alcohol': 'full_bar', 'Caters': True, 'HasTV': True, 'WiFi': 'free', 'RestaurantReservations': True, 'OutdoorSeating': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}}
categories: ['Beauty & Spa', 'American (New)', 'Day Spas', 'Hotels', 'Event Planning & Services', 'Health Retreats', 'Restaurant', 'Hotels & Travel']
name: Hotel Valley Ho
text: My only complaint about the Hotel Valley Ho is that I spent just a single night there.There are a lot of reasons to love this mid-century modern boutique hotel in downtown Scottsdale, here are a few of mine:GYM The gym's open 24/7, perfect if you find yourself jet-lagged and in need of a run at 05:00AM. They stock the gym with spa water, towels and ear buds so you need only bring yourself.RED FLOWER BATH AMENITIES I've loved this New York brand since I first discovered it at the Harmony Hotel in Costa Rica so I was excited to see that my room was stocked with their Icelandic moonflower scented soap, shampoo, conditioner and body wash.BATHTUB After a 05:00AM run it's super nice to settle into a big bathtub (especially a fancy oval one designed by Philippe Starck) for a soak. My room came equipped with a huge tub in the middle of the room and from the moment I spotted it, I couldn't wait to jump in.PARKING ATTENDANTS In the morning, as I waited for Gabi to fetch me, the parking attendants were super sweet and offered me water (which you should drink a lot of when in the dry desert). As I always say, it's the little things. . . If my travels ever take me back to the Phoenix area, I am definitely staying here.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'Alcohol': 'full_bar', 'Caters': True, 'HasTV': True, 'WiFi': 'free', 'RestaurantReservations': True, 'OutdoorSeating': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}}
categories: ['Beauty & Spa', 'American (New)', 'Day Spas', 'Hotels', 'Event Planning & Services', 'Health Retreats', 'Restaurant', 'Hotels & Travel']
name: Hotel Valley Ho
text: Man, this place has got style and history going for it. It's been refurbished, but righteously, so all those classic mid-century touches (think: clean lines, low-rise, fab colors) still are present and accounted for.Back in the '50s, this was evidently the "in" spot for the well-heeled set. Imagine Bing Crosby and Tony Curtis. Ted Williams and Roy Rogers. Janet Leigh. They were all here in full swing, like something out of a Shag (http://www.shag.com/gallery.html) painting.When I popped in last night, the place was sadly not in motion (it was a Tuesday night), but you could still get a sense of the vibe. Cafxc3xa9 Zuzu is their bar, complete with retro booths and counter-style seating, and there's seating by the o-shaped pool. Trader Vic's is also connected to the hotel, and while you might not spot Harry Belafonte (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6AjovHGK-TA) hanging around, I can see how the tiki appeal works its way in (I think the Scorpion Bowls and Navy Grogs help with that as well!).I'm actually staying at the serene Firesky ( which is itself so far fantastic) during my visit to Old Town Scottsdale, but I gotta say, I'm definitely hip to the Ho next time around!

name: Firesky Resort & Spa
text: Ok, sorry...it took me several days to collect myself. 1. Best service I've ever received in a hotel. EVER. 2. A fish named "Tierra" was in our room. Cool. They said I requested her...but I know for a fact I did not, as I did not realize that fish requests were accepted. Now I know. 3. Arizona has an unfair advantage. The weather is stellar. 4. Two pools, a hot tub and a lagoon. A sand beach pool. Comfy couches, chairs, chaise lounges, tables, etc. None of this cheap plastic stuff up in here. Pure relax mode. 5. Patio room. Free Wifi. Great restaurant. Beautiful. 6. Comfy bed. Clean room. VERY clean. Tastefully decorated. Can I please go back now? Tierra needs me.

categories: ['Beauty & Spa', 'American (New)', 'Day Spas', 'Hotels', 'Event Planning & Services', 'Health Retreats', 'Restaurant', 'Hotels & Travel']
name: Hotel Valley Ho
text: Valley HO! I dig. Picture this. A cooler version of the Brady Bunch decides to buy a hotel in Scottsdale. The kids get to decorate the rooms and design the pool. There are cabanas, retro furniture sprawls about, everyone is friendly (I mean for real, like JUMPING to get you stuff) and the beds are like little patches of poofy clouds. I stayed in a "Cabana King," which was just splendid. Outdoor seating right by the pool, a bathroom with a separate soaky tub and rain shower, and oh.my.GOD. Did I mention the bed? I NEVER sleep that well in hotels, but this was like a little lullaby. MMM, a good night's rest. PRICELESS. The retro vibe is hardly understated. In fact, it's just WAY over the top, but it works well. Every detail is taken into account, nothing is overlooked. Each font, color, piece of furniture, accessory, fixture, paint color, staff member: CHECK PLUS. SO, why the 4 stars? Room service is a bit ridiculous (add a 20 percent gratuity, AND the food was not so great. An omelette with burnt bacon and WAY too much soft cheese for a normal person to consume). I'd skip the restaurant. It tries hard, but falls short...The beds and the pool are where it's at, FO SHO...Valley HO! I'll stay again.

name: Arizona Biltmore
text: Well, you could have knocked me over with a paper towel, triple-ply, when I discovered this luxurious, circa 1929 hotel is not a Frank Lloyd Wright-designed masterpiece. The architect of record is Albert Chase McArthur, who was once one of Wright's draftsmen and obviously he was heavily influenced by his employer and mentor. In fact, Wright consulted McArthur for a few months in the textile block construction which is one of the hotel's architectural trademarks. But let's get real. As talented as McArthur was, the owners knew Wright was the one with the marquee name and have played up the connection big time ever since its construction.To reinforce the same misconception I had, they added a signature Wright-designed stained glass in the lobby (photo: http://bit.ly/2wOrfC5) and the familiar Japanese-influenced stone sprites from Wright's Midway Gardens project in Chicago (photo: http://bit.ly/2fpJ7AJ), as well as naming the three onsite Restaurant after Wright, including one that celebrates the actual architect, Frank & Albert's - even though poor McArthur gets second billing (photo: http://bit.ly/2horLVx). Driving here at night from Camelback, I couldn't tell how close I was getting to the hotel until I saw a small sign at a creek crossing (photo: http://bit.ly/2xBj9kg).The entrance was designed in the familiar prairie style accented by intricately designed blocks (photo: http://bit.ly/2ylbQu6). The low ceiling of the expansive lobby is covered completely in gold leaf, and the lamps, rugs and couches are all typically Wright in their angular and orb-focused design (photo: http://bit.ly/2xoc6Mi). Strolling outside to the back terrace, I saw more sprites and sat on a Morris chair that served nicely as a lounge seat. The hotel has changed hands a number of times and is now part of the high-end Waldorf-Astoria collection. Hell, I didn't stay here but rates start at $265 per night for a standard guest room to around $800 for a villa. Well worth a stop and a stroll even if you're not a guest.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Life Time Fitness
text: This place is definitely geared towards kids and families. No question. and if that is what you are looking for, fantastic. four stars. but they should highlight that, and not try to fruitlessly pitch themselves as a gym for 20- and 30-somethings who are looking for a well-rounded/cross training experience. Unless of course you only want aerobic machines. they have those in spades.However... if they DID want to make this place serve that population, a) you need to have a TRX station that allows the straps to hang down and for people to work out below the anchor point. and if you aren't, you need to have enough space away from the anchor point such that you aren't right in the flow of foot traffic or nearly hovering over a machine. I love they you guys have TRX, but you gotta give it some room to breath.b) the climbing wall is definitely for kids (5.6 - 5.10a). I think there is one 5.11 (guessing 5.11a) and it's not very tall but they have the ability to set some routes (don't need many, one or two would be great) that really challenge people. Also, the flooring material is not a mat but rather that shredded rubber which for bouldering is almost asking for a sprained ankle.c) make the more unique items (Bosu balls, medicine balls, bands, etc.) more accessible and give people much more space to use them. even the personal training space isn't very large. which would be frustrating if you paid for PT and had to wait to use equipment.Don't get me wrong, the pool is fun and the outdoor option is great, but definitely geared toward kids. shame they couldn't put in long lap lanes but waterslides are pretty popular with the 10 and under crowd.

name: Open Up Therapies
text: I have had massages from several therapists all over the country but when I was introduced to Patricia over 6 years, I knew I'd found the best!  Patricia has helped my body work through the physical strain of both my pregnancies, not to mention the everyday pressures and on-going physical ailments from past car accidents.  She not only understands my bodies muscular and skeletal structure, she understands the emotional impact on my body.  I do, without hesitation, recommend Patricia!

name: Open Up Therapies
text: For the last 9 months, I have been dealing with severe sciatic pain, caused by a herniated/slipped disc. I have two rounds of P.T.,had Chiropractic care, gotten regular massages, done pilates, had two injections, and acupuncture. I went from being very active, to barely being able to walk up and down the stairs (I am 47). I have spoken with a surgeon, who recommends surgery. In a last ditch effort and on the recommendation of a friend, I booked an appointment with Patricia. The first time I met her, I was immediately drawn to her nurturing, loving spirit, her desire to know exactly what was going on in my body, and her belief that she could help. And amazingly, after 9 months of often times excruciating, breathtaking pain, I am starting to feel a lot better. She, as a person, is just a beautiful, loving, kind, nurturing spirit, professionally, she is a master at her craft. If you are in pain, stressed, or just need some TLC, book an appointment with Patricia. You will not be sorry and your body will thank you.

name: Illuminati Tattoo
text: I went in yesterday to get my nose re-pierced. I had gone to another place three weeks ago and had it pierced, but wasn't crazy about the location of the piercing on my nostril. After deciding that I didn't want to go back to the original shop, I started researching other places in Vegas. I first contacted another piercing shop, but they were out of jewelry. What?! Then started reading reviews on Illuminati. The reviews were all good, so I made the decision to go there. Met Dras, who explained the piercing process, where the piercing needed to be placed symmetrically on my nose, the cleaning process, and answered all my questions thoroughly, with kindness, and patience. The piercing was over quickly (I have had three c-sections, so I always rate pain by that. :D) and while it did hurt, it wasn't up there with recovering from major surgery. The final result is that I am so much happier with the new piercing, where it is placed on my nose, and have a much better understanding of how to care for it. Thanks Dras! Very happy with the results!

name: The Signature at MGM Grand
text: It's your standard upscale Vegas hotel, but much more quiet and private since it's set back from the strip.  The tunnel connecting to the MGM casino area is a bit of a haul... a necessary evil.The staff at the Signature couldn't have been better.  Front desk friendly and helpful, a staff member who brought us extra towels and winked over our extra guests (we were cramming five into a two-person room) AND gave us a ton of extra water bottles for the room (free).  The location was perfect for us, with the Hofbrauhaus a short (for Vegas) walk east of the hotel, across the street from NYNY for the roller coaster, and obviously attached to MGM for our fave casino action.

text: Michelle and Michael are the bomb! I've gone to countless places in Chicago and I always look forward to coming back to my hometown just to stop in here for a no-chip. My nails hardly grow and are so brittle that they usually chip within days, but not here! Plus, my heels get so messed up from running and after a pedicure here I leave with my feet looking normal again. Definitely can't recommend this place enough!

name: Walgreens
text: Store review:This is so far the best location in Champaign to shop. I can only base it on one experience. The cashier was super friendly and accepting of valid coupons. Instead of scrutinizing at other stores she actually went ahead and scanned and if the computer accepted the coupon we were good. The store was well stocked and I could find everything that I needed.Pros: Friendly fast staff, accepts couponsCons: Some items are expensive compared to the super storesHidden deals:You can use one coupon per itemRegister rewards and walgreens points help add to the savingsSign up for the walgreens cards to get savings on purchases

name: Walgreens
text: Store review:When will I learn to completely trust Yelp? Soon enough. I went to this location based on proximity and as I walked in, I saw the reviews and was wondering it can't be that bad. All the prior reviews spot on! First of all limited inventory, I luckily grabbed the last 3 packs of TP. When I went to check out, the cashier had to slowly pull out her glasses check each individual item and read the fine print of the 4 coupons I had for my 4 items. Um... how about you focus on checking out faster so the line doesn't have to be as long. This was rather annoying and made you feel like you were doing something wrong. With that, another place in Champaign that I am adding on my DNV (do not visit) list. Pros: walgreen salesCons: poor customer service, read the other reviews and my review. Limited inventoryHidden deals:1. Use walgreen card for additional savings2. 1 coupon per item, always check online for coupons before purchase3. Earn points and register reward with certain items

text: Great selection of Christmas items (all Walgreens have really great clearance on Christmas stuff after the holidays are over) with good pricing even though it is before the holiday. A nice selection of gifts at various price points. Good coupons (in both their weekly add and monthly coupon book).  Helpful coupon codes were even provided at the photo printing booth.  Good selection of Black hair care items. Super friendly and helpful staff.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Rod Sickler Salon & Spa
text: I can't believe I missed reviewing them. I have visited this salon/spa twice. Both times were for eyebrow waxes. It is wonderful that I can schedule the same day for this service. And usually they have multiple openings. I did have quite the hiccup on my first visit. The person that was supposed to do my wax was nowhere to be found. I waited around for a while wondering what was happening after I checked in. Then I had to wait more until they could find someone else to do my service. Luckily, the girl who did was wonderful. Oddly, we did not go back to the waxing room. She did my wax at one of the shampoo bowls. She gave me some great advice about lip waxing. She said that I should try a cold wax since I blister. They offer this service there and if I had asked for this far enough in advance, they could have done it. I haven't found a spot in Atlanta that does this yet.On my second visit, there were no issues and I was scene quickly. The girl again was very nice and did a lovely job on my brows. This time, we were back in the waxing room. In the end, I don't think it matters much where it is done since I am not getting anything private waxed. Overall, the staff are nice. Last minute scheduling is no problem. A bit pricey for eyebrow waxing- I pay more here than I do in Atlanta surprisingly. But since I don't have to use their service too often, I am fine paying for the convenience.

text: I have been going to Wingard since the day they opened.  My stylist, Debbie C,. does such a fantastic job that I would never consider going to any one else.  She knows all the latest hairstyles, trends & products.  She is fun & easy to talk to.  She even likes to go to church dinners!!Wingard is a modern,  professional upscale salon. They make you feel very welcomed when you walk through the door and the decor is very chic. Debbie C. is totally awesome!!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: BJ Grand Salon & Spa
text: Boys need spa days too.So, for my birthday my sister got me a Men's Spa package at BJ, and from beginning to end, I was thoroughly impressed and pampered. Now I see why women do it.The most impressive part of the service was that they were so willing to re-arrange my entire booking when I opened my surprise present and wasn't in Champaign that day! They were also willing to tailor the package to me, and completely change the services even though specific things had been booked.The deep tissue massage I had was my first, so I had nothing to compare it to, but I felt completely comfortable, and she worked very hard on my back.My sensitive skin (heehee) facial was also amazing. I've had so many comments on my skin since I had it done, I am completely addicted.Once I got over the self-consciousness of being a man in a spa (there WERE other guys there, by the way) I had a blast, and highly recommend this place.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Sport Clips Haircuts of Champaign - Old Farm Shops
text: I was in town visiting family and my nephew needed a haircut so I volunteered to take him. His regular place was closed for the day so as usual, I turned to Yelp for life advice. This place was close by (then again, for this Miami girl, everything is close by in a town like this), had decent reviews, and wasn't going to break the bank. We walked in and were told it would be about a 30 minute wait, which was no problem since we were a walk-in on the weekend. Upon checking-in, Yelp offered me a free MVP upgrade. I'm still kind of confused as to what this means, and the employees were very confused about my check-in offer, since literally no one had ever seen it before. Plus, they said, "all our new clients automatically get the free upgrade". We just needed a regular haircut, but I guess we were getting the MVP upgrade which meant a shampoo, hot face towel, and shoulder massage.The stylist did a great job and was very personable. She chatted with my nephew and made sure he was happy with the end result.The problem came to when we paid and were charged for the upgrade which was supposedly free for first timers, plus I also had the Yelp check-in offer. Nope, those were just for the upgrade on the upgrade, or something of the sort. So I took my 15 year old nephew to a sports-themed supercuts for a basic haircut and ended up spending $30 for bells and whistles that we didn't expect or even need. He doesn't care about a warm towel on his face! His regular place charges $8, I wish they would have been more clear from the beginning. Again, the haircut was good and the stylist was friendly. We'd probably keep this place as a backup in the future.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Resorts', 'Hotels', 'Day Spas', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Hotels & Travel', 'Casinos', 'Arts & Entertainment', 'Event Planning & Services']
name: Green Valley Ranch Resort & Spa
text: This place is an oasis just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip.But this place provides plenty of hustle and bustle of its own.The hotel:My friend and I were lucky enough to get a comped suite overlooking the pool. This room was absolutely incredible. The beds were superb. Luxurious bathrooms. Great room service. The casino:Ohmygod we had so much fun with everyone we met at the 3-card poker table. My friend's the gambler, I just sat by her side talking to everyone at the table and drinking. We were at this table for hours. In fact, we were so wired - we didn't go to bed until after 5am. Good times. And good people.The rest:Exccellent dining. Beyond the food court offerings, of course. Sushi + Sake: excellent! Il Fornaio: gnocchi and salads were delish!Whiskey Bar: we were there early but the layout was pretty cool. Fun bartenders.I'll never forget the 24 hours we spent here.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'HairSpecializesIn': {'coloring': True, 'africanamerican': False, 'curly': True, 'perms': False, 'kids': False, 'extensions': False, 'asian': False, 'straightperms': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Ippatsu Salon
text: The hip, go-to hair salon.Stylists who know what they're doing and listen to what you want (but will still give you honest advice).I got a cut and there was something just alittle "off" - no problem because my stylist said she would make any adjustments for free within the first two weeks. I had friends that would make the drive from Chicago just to get their haircut here. And I think that says something...

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
name: Pizzazz Haircutery
text: I love a barber where I can walk-in and get immediate service. Something to note is that the owner, Madeline, does have summer hours where she closes at 4:00pm rather than the usual 5:00pm. Even though I arrived at 4:00pm, she was more than happy to service me. She's a great conversationalist and gave me a wonderful haircut at a low price of $10. Something to note is that you need to park in the right parking spot since the owner of Sister Curls will come out and force you to exit her parking space if parked in the wrong space.

name: Supercuts
text: This place is pretty nice. I asked them to be creative with my hair but they didn't do anything too fancy with it. I believe there's a student discount here. Also, first-time customers get a small swag bag which is pretty neat.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Shopping', "Men's Hair Salons", 'Cosmetics & Beauty Supply', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Hair Stylists', 'Hair Salons', 'Barbers']
name: Supercuts
text: Quick and efficient. I never know how I want my hair to be done seeing as how I'm bad at visuals. I mean, I would love my hair to be like those cool dudes in anime, but I know those don't exist in the real world (Life's hard). Whenever I go to a barber, I tell them to be creative with my hair and to cut it short. And that's what my barber did; she cut it a bit shorter than I would have wanted it, but I definitely appreciate the fast service. It cost me $17.50 including tip.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Gene's Barber Shop
text: This is a no nonsense type of barber shop. I usually like people to be creative with my hair when they cut it but you won't get any of that creativity here. Haircuts cost around $18. The place can be a bit hard to find since it's behind a shopping center.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}, 'WiFi': 'free', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Hotels & Travel', 'Casinos', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Hotels', 'Day Spas', 'Event Planning & Services', 'Arts & Entertainment']
name: Red Rock Casino Resort & Spa
text: When thinking of casinos off the Strip, there's a temptation to think of them as modest, and merely meant for locals. Red Rock's luxurious facility both surprised and impressed me - there's a lot to do!This casino resort has a cornucopia of features, including a bowling alley, spa, food court, multiple Restaurant, and conference center capabilities. Their hotel lobby lounge features a 32-foot long chandelier, draped by an elegant staircase. There's a few stores, and a Starbucks overlooking the lobby. The casino's decor is sharp, and the Restaurant lining it mirror that theme. The nearly 3,000 slot machines can confound if you're trying to find people, so pay attention to your surroundings.We had a spacious suite near the spa, with a view of the Strip and top-notch amenities: modern decor, huge soft mattresses, a comfy couch, a widescreen plasma TV, and a convenient bottle of Patron (costs extra). Loved the bathroom, and the luxurious shower. The toilet had a phone by it, and the marble tub, a TV. Besides hearing wind whistling one morning (it was crazy windy out there), Red Rock's hotel, casino, and lounges all had a fit and finish that made our dollars feel well-spent.Hotel service was stellar. When I needed help late-night, both Tanya (at the front desk) and a bellhop assisted. When we needed a random feminine hygiene product, not only did room service stock necessities, a staffer delivered the goods to our door minutes later. When hunger hit, concierge Stephanie pointed out some nearby Thai Restaurant.If you're planning on heading to the Strip, keep in mind that Red Rock is off-strip. If you're content with hailing a taxi, or are a local, this shouldn't be an issue.My single regret from my stay at Red Rock? Not playing bingo in their huge bingo hall.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}

name: Walgreens
text: Yep, we got water here.This Walgreens is conveniently located between several hotel-casinos, including Treasure Island, Venetian, the Wynn, or the MGM Mirage. It's stocked as well as any Walgreens in a suburban area, and just as spacious. We stocked up on H2O, orange juice, and cranberry juice. (Uh, call us fruit juice enthusiasts.)You know you're in Vegas when you see a puddle of goo in an aisle, and you know exactly what it is. (Yes, I photographed it.)Anyone know if they carry liquor?

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Sephora
text: I'm reviewing the Sephora inside Desert Passage shops. I ran out of an eye cream so since we were right there, thought just to pop in to buy it instead of waiting to get back to CA and then drive to Sephora to get it.Is it me or are all the associates at this location just so much better looking than at other locations? Both the men AND women alike. WOW. Hmmm... very interesting.Service was fast and they were friendly. So nice not to have to wait too long to pay like at other Sephoras.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': False, 'RestaurantTakeOut': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}

name: ABC Stores
text: So glad to find an ABC Store right when I needed one. I had not been feeling 100% and my stomach felt weird so when I saw one of these stores, I rushed inside hoping to find some li hing mui to calm it. They really had a poor selection when compared to Hawaii, but what do you expect? The fact that I found some was a miracle in itself, but I knew I could count on a trusty ABC Store to stock it.I got a packet of the li hing mui and it helped ease my nausea quickly. Unfortunately I only got one small packet and before long hubby had finished the entire packet.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'WiFi': 'free', 'DogsAllowed': False, 'GoodForKids': True}
categories: ['Hotels & Travel', 'Event Planning & Services', 'Casinos', 'Day Spas', 'Hotels', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Arts & Entertainment']
name: South Point Hotel, Casino & Spa
text: We were surprised at how nice this hotel was. It's far and off the strip, but it's new and clean. The casino area was sooooooo bright that even at 10pm when you walked inside, you feel like it was daytime. I'm actually considering staying here the next time we come, but like I said, I'm considering it.They have a kids daycare center just like at The Orleans so it would definitely make things very easy if we wanted to go play in the casino for a while without lil guy. However the down side to staying here would be that it is definitely very far from the strip and if you don't have a car, that would totally suck.

name: ABC Store
text: Boy, not only is Las Vegas the favorite tourist spot for Hawaiian travelers, but the ubiquitous Hawaiian ABC Stores are also dotted around Vegas. The merchandise is slightly different than in Hawaii because on top of selling the Hawaiian stuff such as chocolates, coffee, souvenirs, they also sell Las Vegas stuff such as CSI: LV merchandise.I guess you don't have to fly all the way to Hawaii to pick up some of your favorite island treasures anymore.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Truefitt & Hill
text: This is listed as a barber shop, but let me tell you, this ain't just a barber shop. If you want to pamper the man in your life, send him here. I'll bet after a lovely session, he'll never go back to just shaving himself ever again.This is a shave shop/barber shop in the old style. They lather your face up and then shave you with a straight edge blade. This establishment has been around since 1805 and started in England (surprise, surprise). Not only do they offer services but they also have a line of products for sale ranging from shaving brushes, creams, lotions etc.I guess this is to men what cosmetic lines such as Shiseido, Clarins, La Mer is to women. I don't get it, but then again, I doubt hubby gets it either when I buy shit for my face.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Pure Foot & Spa
text: My girlfriends and I found this place on Yelp and called up to make an appointment for the 3 of us. When we called, we asked how much it was for a session and were told $38, and asked us how we found out about them. When we said Yelp, they said that it will be $34/hour. When we got there, we were ushered into a dimly lit room with comfortable armchairs to sit in. A big wooden tub is brought out with a plastic bag lined and filled with hot water to soak our feet in. My masseuse was Anna who immediately went to work on my back and shoulders. After about 10 mins on my upper back, I felt myself relax and slump over the cushions she had placed on my lap.I've had Chinese foot massage before but they've always hurt me so badly I couldn't go about my daily duties for a few days. There was none of this here. Anna exerted enough pressure, yet, was not torturing me with pain.My friend wanted a 75 minute treatment so all 3 of us did as well. We had a good 30 minutes of back, neck and shoulder massage and then she moved onto your head, scalp and ears before doing the arms, hands and fingers. When that was finished she started working on my feet and toes. I actually fell asleep can you believe it? I've NEVER fallen asleep during one of these before.She then massaged my legs and then laid 3 ottomans together so we could lay on it face-down so she could work on my back. Throughout the treatment, I was drinking the herbal tea they had provided -- I suggest you do this because it will make you go and pee to flush out all the toxins in your body.When it was all over, I stood up and was wobbly. I lost my balance slightly because I was so relaxed. I'm going to give them 5 stars for the treatment, but am taking off a star because I didn't realize until later, they never gave us the Yelp discount. We received 15 minutes of extra treatment and were charged $48. We were told the Yelp discount would make the one hour treatment $34, so an extra 15 minutes should not cost 14 extra dollars. Still, I will return here again when we go to Vegas next and I hope Anna is still there when I return! It's so rare to find a good Chinese food massage person -- lord knows I've tried!

name: South Point Hotel, Casino & Spa
text: I hate to hate, but who designed the hideously unflattering cocktail waitress uniforms? They are just...no. I can get past the outdated decor with the random floral paneling, but I was just depressed by the whole cocktail waitress situation. They clearly weren't happy to be wearing those abominations, and I wasn't happy to be seeing them. Nobody was happy.But if you can get past that, The South Point does have countless movie theaters, an equestrian show, a bowling alley, a bar where all tequila drinks (including sizable shots of Don Julio and other premium tequilas!) are $2 at happy hour, and most importantly, $5 blackjack and craps.Translation: If you don't mind being away from the Strip, get drunk and gamble here. It's a good time.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': True}, 'WiFi': 'free', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: The Platinum Hotel
text: I stayed here again for my second go-around in Las Vegas. For $139.00 per night, I made a reservation for a Princess Suite. However my room was on the sixth-floor (out of 24 floors). I didn't get the great view of the towers of hotels of Circus Circus and the needle of the Stratosphere like I had from my first visit. All I get a view of the pool side (located one floor below) and deserted Koval Street. Other than the lack of the glamorous view from my first visit, my suite is pretty much the same. I did get a washer and dryer in my suite, plus a hair-dryer that I didn't get from my first visit. The hair-dryer was hanging in a bag inside the closet. The hair-dryer: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/XwV2-lISDp_5Acy72bA8Qg?select=BlFNHSFqfw08KKC4TciaEAThis time around, I was able to walk around the hotel and check out the pool area. Also, I finally found the hotel's gym, located on the fourth floor. I needed to make room for the great food in my belly, and I had two awesome and intense one-hour morning run on the treadmill. I had the gym all to myself on both workout sessions. The gym: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/XwV2-lISDp_5Acy72bA8Qg?select=ppIqFxTO5RmoBsO_n1jTQAThe hotel-lobby also has a canteen filled with a refreshing citrus-infused water for all guest. The entire hotel staff were very friendly and accommodated my needs. Oh yes, there are many hotels along the touristy Las Vegas Blvd. strip, but I still love and will continue to stay at the Platinum Hotel.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Pure Foot & Spa
text: ORGASMIC, TOE-TINGLING, BLISSFUL, and HEAVENLY are just a couple of words to describe my experience at Pure Foot and Spa. As prevalent as foot massage establishments are becoming, I have to admit I was a Foot Massage Virgin until 2 months ago. And, I can say hands-down, the second time around at PF&S blew my first experience at SF's Wonderfoot Health Center out of the water!Although I love wearing stilettos, they do not love me and no matter how many GG shots I take to numb the pain, I end up wearing them as bracelets by midnight. As we were planning our Vegas trip, Nicole S. found PF&S and after seeing the 4.5 STAR rating, we knew we had to go there during out trip. Come Friday, 3.5.10, our feet were already sore from the previous night at Tryst, even though I had my shoes off half the time. *SIGH* If we (I), intended to survive the next 2 nights, we (I) needed a foot massage, and needed one badly! APPOINTMENT:Walk-ins are welcome. However, just to ensure they could accommodate me and my gfs, Nicole S. called at 3 PM for a same-day appointment at 3:30 PM.LOCATION:PF&S is in Chinatown and is located in one of those Asian Plaza's similar to the ones in the San Gabriel Area of LA. It's approximately a $13 cab ride (10 min) cab ride from the strip. EXPERIENCE:1) We were warmly welcomed in by the staff and seated in leather recliners side-by-side each other.2) I received a cup of rose tea while Anna, my masseuse prepared the footbath.3) While my feet soaked in the footbath, I sat on the ottoman while she worked on my head, face, neck, shoulders, upper and lower back. It was by far the BEST non-oil massage I've ever had! Anna used trigger point therapy on my head, temples, and neck and I could feel the pent up stress just melt away. On my shoulders and back, she used a combo of acupressure and long strokes to knead away all the knots I had. I especially loved it when she used her entire forearm and went back and forth against each backbone...it felt so good, it made my EYES-ROLL-IN-BACK-OF-MY-HEAD!4) After 25 minutes, Anna dried off my feet, and had me sit back on the recliner and gave me a hand and arm massage which consisted of acupressure, kneading, and strokes. The hand massage was blissful and brought me back memories of my rave days!5) After 5 minutes, Anna went to the best part....the FOOT AND LEG MASSAGE! She put a balm on my feet and calves that felt a mixture of cream and shea butter. It was velvety smooth and intensified the effect of the massage even more. She started with trigger point therapy on certain parts of my feet, and then followed it with long strokes on the arch of my foot. I have many problems with the balls of my feet, so when Anna went to town on this part, it was Ahhhhhhhh, ORGASMIC!6) The last 2 minutes, ended with a thigh massage where Anna kneading my thigh with her fists. SERVICE:The staff at PF&S are very friendly, professional, and can speak conversational English (so there shouldn't be any awkward laguage barriers). Anna was very sweet and asked several times if I was ok and if the pressure was good. The pressure was perfect; it was gentle yet firm on the knots that needed to be worked out. PRICE:The decal outside the window stated $28 for 45 minutes, but we did the $38 for 1 hour. The staff at PF&S works hard, so please be mindful and tip accordingly. :)AMBIANCE:No frills establishment w/ a very simple and relaxing atmosphere. There are two flat LCDs on the Chinese CNN channel (muted) and Chinese classical music playing in the background. There are two rows of leather recliners; 10 total. We'll definitely be back on our next Vegas trip in 3 months! Vegas was a blast as usual and I definitely accomplished one of my goals: Happy Ending @ Vegas....CHECK! No pun intended of course...

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': True}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': False, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Hair Salons', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Gyms', 'Active Life', 'Health & Medical', 'Nutritionists', 'Day Spas', 'Fitness & Instruction']
name: Canyon Ranch SpaClub - Las Vegas
text: Ohhh, the wonders of STEAM!It's never a good sign when security is on your cell phone at 5 AM talking with your friend because you're KTFO on the wrong floor in the hotel. I guess that's what I get for Waking Up In Vegas...As you can imagine, my debauchery from the previous night left me severely hungover so after getting a bite to eat at Grand Lux Cafxc3xa9, my friend suggested that we all go to Canyon Ranch Spa Club for some "Steam Therapy".  On Saturday, 2.19.11, we (party of six) came to CRSC at around 1 PM. There are two employees at the front desk. It took about 10 minutes to check-in and pay. There's a women, men and co-ed section in the spa. We stayed at the women's only section. FEE$40/day pass to use the gym and spa facilities. HOWEVER, it's only $20/person if your hotel room (Palazzo or The Venetian) is charged with a resort fee. If it's not, I highly recommend you paying the $17.95 one-time resort fee at the spa because it will cover everyone in your party. My friend paid the resort fee, so we ended up saving about $17/person. LOCKER ROOMYou will be provided a magnet key wristlet to access your locker. Your robe will be provided in your locker. TIP: BRING YOUR OWN SLIPPERS/FLIP FLOPS! TRUST ME!The pressure point slippers that's provided are the most UNCOMFOTABLE slippers ever! With each step, it felt like I was walking on pebble stone pavement. EVERYONE was complaining about how painful they were and that we were better off wearing out 5-inch stilettos from the previous night...no joke! I hated those slippers so much, I wanted to BURN mine after leaving!AQUAVANA THERMAL ENVIRONMENTSVarious aquathermal environments that are designed to help with muscle relaxation, increase oxygen flow and most importantly RID YOUR BODY OF TOXINS! The perfect "morning after" remedy after a night of copious drinking!ROOM #1: IGLOOExactly as the name says, it's basically a big freezer. My least favorite of all the rooms because of the cold temperature. ROOM #2: JACUZZ WITH HEATED LOUNGERSThe jacuzzi (bathing suit optional) could accommodate about 8-10 people. I LOVED the heated loungers (there were 6). They were made of some type of Styrofoam material that was firm yet soft. The loungers were so warm and comforting that I could have slept on it the whole day.ROOM #3: HERBAL  LACONIUM (WET STEAM ROOM) - HANGOVER CURE!!!!!If you're not use to humid heat, the Herbal Laconium room may be too much to handle in the beginning. HOWEVER, after several minutes, your body will adjust to the heat and it will become very bearable.  As I closed my eyes, breathed in deeply and exhaled, I could feel my body releasing all the tequila and goose through my pores and my pounding headache becoming fainter and fainter.  TIP: Drink plenty of water beforehand and pick up an iced towel (to cover your face) in the Jacuzzi room which will make it much easier to breathe in the steam room.  ROOM #4: Finnish Sauna (Dry Heat Room)Not a fan of dry heat rooms as I feel like I'm stuck in a charcoal bbq minus the charcoal. ROOM #5: Crystal Steam Room (Aromatherapy Steam Room)Saving the best for last! The aromatherapy steam room is less intense than the Herbal Laconium room and the fragrant floral scents will enhance your mood. THE QUIET ROOM/LOUNGEEnd your Aquavana Session at the quiet room where you can lay on plushy oversized sofas while reading trashy magazines and munching on fresh apples, bananas and oranges. It was so quiet and serene that I ended up taking a 10-minute power nap. I woke up refreshed with my pounding headache all gone!SHOWER/MAKEUP ROOM*10-15 private showers with shampoo, conditioner and body wash in each one*Personal sink area with lotions, deodorant, hair care products, hair dryer, combs, brushes, etc*If you need a curling iron or flat iron, you can get it at the front deskTIP: If you need a razer, shower cap, and/or towels, make sure to grab them before getting into the shower room. They're located near the entrance way to the showers.OVERALL LAYOUTThe CRSC is BIG and I didn't even know how big until I got lost and ended up on the men's side. It's confusing to say the least and it was like a maze to get out. If you suffer from "Waking Up In Vegas" syndrome like I always seem to, I highly recommend coming to the CRSC to get you out of your funk!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Good Foot Spa
text: Ummm, did I come to the correct place that Yelpers were raving about???Ever since my first euphoric foot massage experience in January 2010, I've become a total addict and try to get a foot massage every 2 weeks. I'm no stranger to pain and enjoy deep pressure massages, so Chinese foot massages/reflexology are right up my alley b/c done right, a  "good" pain releases all the pent up tension. So with most of the reviews boasting how awesome Good Foot Spa was, I decided to pay them a visit during my Vegas trip.My friend and I came to GFS on Friday, 7.30.10 at 4 PM. We had made an appt one day prior.There's a standard process for a Chinese foot massage/reflexology. First, you're brought warm tea and crackers. You feet is then soaked in plastic lined bucket of warm water while you're given a head, neck, shoulder and arm massage. Your masseuse then massages your calves and feet and finishes by flipping you over on the recliner and giving a back and butt massage. So, it's actually a full body massage (clothed) and the foot massage portion is about 1/3 of the massage time.Although the process at GFS was similar to other massage places, the overall feeling and results were NOT.I wasn't able to get my masseuse's name b/c she didn't speak English. When I asked her in Cantonese if she understood, she replied back, "I speak 'Chinese' ". Uhhh, ok...1. Instead of getting a head massage, my masseuse placed lotion onto the palm of her hands and rubbed it into my scalp. She then repeatedly SCRAPED MY SCALP WITH HER NAILS for 20 minutes. Needless to say, I was cringing in pain the entire time. 2. The neck and shoulder massage was probably the highlight of the entire massage. It lasted for about 10 minutes and strong kneading was used to release the pent up tension.3. My masseuse then massaged my arms for 10 minutes, which I can't even call it a "massage". She didn't bother to put lotion on my arms which resulted in my skin stretching and pulling (aka Indian Burn) as she forcefully ran her thumbs up/down my forearm. 4. Afterwards, she gave me a foot massage, but mainly concentrated on my calves. What little she did to my feet did nothing to relieve my sore feet. She used her thumbs to rub up/down my arch several times and cracked my toes. When she massaged my ankle, she dug her thumbs into it, which made my flinch in pain. 5. Finally, she flipped me over and gave me a back massage. She ran her forearm along my spine back and forth. I like strong pressure and although she used a lot of force, something about it just didn't feel right. PRICE:$38 for 60 minutes. CC's accepted, but they appreciate tip in cash. Oh yah, btw, I mentioned Yelp for the 10% off and they had no clue what I was talking about. I tried to explain that I saw a promo on their Yelp page and they thought I was looking for a person named "Yelp". :XAMBIANCE/Dxc3x89COR:GFS is clean however, it's very dark inside. There are about 4-5 small cheesy pink painted rooms w/ about 3 recliners in each. For the novice, it may look a bit shady. However, as with most Chinese foot massages you're paying for their services and not the ambiance, so a bare boned dxc3xa9cor w/ mix matched walls, linens, and furnishings is typical. I think we were the only ones there at the time, so it was pretty quiet except for the occasional exchange btw my masseuse and my friend's masseuse. However, as an fyi, when these foot massages places do get busy, the environment is not serene. WHY I WILL NEVER RETURN:I've been to about 7-8 different foot massage places in SF, LA, and LV and this one is definitely on the bottom of my list. Why? 80% of the time, my massage was uncomfortable and painful. I know the difference btw "good" and "bad" pain and my pain was the latter. I left with an itchy scalp and oily hair. And, 2-3 days later my inner right ankle became sore and bruised and my arms were tender to the touch.Oh, Yelp...what happened??? *Sigh*We should have went to Pure Foot and Spa down the road instead...http://www.yelp.com/biz/pure-foot-and-spa-las-vegas#hrid:oku3HsB2aq967SMqkPWD2A

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: True REST Float Spa
text: The idea of floating in a pod filled with water and 1200 lbs of Epsom salt in dark silence for 60 minutes wasn't on the top of my bucket list, but with online deals bringing the price down to the equivalent value of a massage, it sounded as a good time as any to give it a shot. Several friends raved about the experience with such remarks as "opening up the Google search of your brain" to "feeling like the 1 hour mark after 'shroom tea" to "mentally going to Mars".  Their levels of sobriety ranged from stone cold to having smoked an ounce in the parking lot.  I was somewhere in between.      The friendly attendant, John, clearly explained what to do and how to operate the pod.  Being a first timer, I also watched a 6 minute video on how to maximize my float time which offered some helpful suggestions (body position, breathing) while glazing over some new age, self improvement stuff.  John also informed me to hang in their relaxation room upon finishing since many feel disoriented and extremely euphoric afterwards.  Uhhh..what??  So I get out of the shower, put the ear plugs in, get in the pod....."And I'm floating in a most peculiar way"I initially found the whole thing a bit comical.  Here I am...naked, in a dark and confined space, lying in 93.5 degree water...isn't this a torture method in Guantanamo Bay?  But after I got over the initial weirdness, things got interesting....   "And the stars look very different today"It definitely felt like drifting in outer space.  My mind darted through a billion thoughts before I was able to end up in a kind of neutral, semi-conscious, relaxed zone.  I could not believe I was in the pod for only an hour as it felt much longer than that.They claim health benefits like the improvement of memory/sports performance/sleep quality, alleviating PMS, helping with creativity, softer skin etc.  Let me tell you....my PMS was fuckin loooong gooooone!!!  :P  I don't know about this experience helping with all that, but I definitely left in a prolonged state of relaxation.  This is a great alternative to a massage or spa treatment.  I'll be back for sure.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Siems LASIK and Eye Center
text: My wife got her LASIK surgery here in December 2011.  After being sick of contacts and glasses for 15+ years, she finally wanted to get it done.After some research and speaking with a few facilities, it seemed like the best choice was either here or Lasik of Nevada.  We chose Siems based on our talk with the consultant, price for the exact same treatment and also their proximity to our home.  My wife didn't want to schlep it all the way to Henderson for follow ups.  Dr. Siems made us feel comfortable right away upon the first meeting.  His office is very nice.  The lobby feels spa-like.  Needless to say we were nervous when the big day finally came for her to get the procedure done.  You hear that there's a high 90% success rate but a person only has one pair of eyes.  Dr. Siems and his staff made my wife as comfortable as possible (valium helped).  I was able to view the whole procedure on a television outside of the operating room and it definitely made me wince a little when they cut the lens and started shooting the lasers in her eyes. The whole procedure took less than 30 minutes.  She then took another valium and slept for about 18 hours.  She was able to see very clearly the next day and it just improved from there.  Post operation checkups are included in the price so the day after, 1 week, 1 month, 3 month, 6 month and 1 year were all taken care of.  Now that it has been well over a year, she says it's one of the best things she's ever done in life.  I've worn glasses more than half of my life and feel like the fat guy at Mr Olympia or the dude with no tattoos in a tattoo parlor when I go in there.  They always ask me when I am going to do it.  I am still on the fence about getting it done myself but if I did, I wouldn't hesitate to go with Siems.

name: South Point Hotel, Casino & Spa
text: My wife and I are "free play" whores.  If we get an offer for $10 or more in free play...unless its a ridiculous drive like Aliante...we're there. Match play?  Sure!  I'll take a one hand flyer on a singledeck 21 table! It seems like 100 pts on the video poker machine gets you on the mailing list for most places.  We were still surprised when South Point sent us $240 in combined free play for the month of March.  So we just hit up the super times nickel video poker machines, have a few drinks and cash out after hitting 15 points or so.  I did hit a club royal (2nd one ever) which was nice.  We're total free play mooches.  Whatever...they send out the offer!!  And I hope they keep coming!!  Thanks for looking out for the cheap assed locals!!

name: M Resort Spa Casino
text: OK...aside from bowling and movies, there's absolutely no reason to go to the Southpoint anymore.  This place is awesome and I can't wait until it gets warmer to fully enjoy all cool outdoor spots they have here.  We had a drink at the Ravello Lounge where a Bacardi diet and appletini came out to $9.75 total!!  What??  Awesome.  All the staff we interacted with were super friendly but we'll see how that goes in 6 months :PThere are 2 places with enomatic wine systems...Veloce and Hostile Grape.  Both were great and I am definitely taking my wine snob friends to the Hostile Grape.  Can't wait to go back.  I'll put some hours in at the poker room and maybe some pounds on at one of the Restaurant.  I guess my only gripe about the place is the parking area.  There just didn't seem to be enough of it during peak hours.  Quite a few cars just driving round and round.

name: Best Foot Spa
text: I've had less than 10 proper massages in my life.  That number will likely go up by a lot now that they're charging the ridiculously low rate of $22 an hour.  Wild!!  That's almost Thailand cheap!  Not really but still damn cheap!  I've always wanted one of those crazy Japanese massage chairs but I can live with this rate.  I had the same masseuse both times (I didn't catch her name) and tough love was the best description of my experience.  John Mellencamp's "Hurts So Good" isn't the ideal song to have stuck in your head at a spa but there's no denying it!  I felt sorry for the other patrons for my laughing during the foot massage part.  Nothing I can do.  One thing that's undeniable are the results.  I feel great after leaving there.  Those first few steps out into the parking lot and breathing in fresh air is awesome.  Some tips:- Arrive wearing shorts, t-shirt and flip flops if possible.  I showed up in jeans and a dress shirt the first time because I had somewhere to be after but it was WAY more comfortable the second go around.  - The makeshift rooms in the back are better than the front room.  It's more dimly lit and less noisy so I would request that.  - It's better to call and make an appointment.

name: Drift Spa
text: My wife and I went here for a couples massage not to long ago.  The 20% locals discount certainly helped in convincing me to come here..  While the relaxation rooms and pools are all nice...none of it compares to Qua.  But the staff, masseuses and general set up were all first rate.  I also liked the fact that I was basically the only person on the men's side since we were here on a weekday.  I imagine this place would be a nightmare on the weekends cuz it is kinda small.  The hammam was the best feature of the whole place.

name: Imperial Health Spa
text: If you need a spot to get away from it all....look no further!For a mere $20 (or less with coupons available on various sites) you have access to their facilities where you can relax and detox until they shut off the lights and security drags your naked ass out to the parking lot.  Paolo D, Regina P, David S and Julie S all give very helpful and detailed reviews on how it'll all go down so you should read them.  I have a few things to add:- Bring flip flops.  They didn't supply them for me and I walked around barefoot the whole time.  It wasn't bad but I was running out of a couple of the sauna rooms really quickly since the floor was hot.   - No option for bathing suits.  You will be naked with everyone else.  I am very near sighted so everyone looks like they've been blurred out for public television.- Be VERY careful when getting into one of the beds in the red clay ball room.  It's like walking on a hundred marbles and the floor is not forgiving.  I wiped out pretty bad and strained my MCL.  My doctor said I'll be fine in a week.  Thanks to all that laughed at me (wife included).  I am going butt in first the next time.  - The signs say to use each sauna on the 2nd floor for 3-7 minutes.  You can definitely do a little longer than that.  But one guy fell asleep in the red clay ball room (you could hear him snoring) and I am guessing he was in there for a solid hour.  He looked like a total disaster when he came out.  Stay hydrated!- I never do this but I paid $1 for the 3 minute massage chairs.  There were 2 types.  One was the standard massage which was decent and the other was the "slimming massage chair" which was ridiculous.  The latter just started shaking your butt from left to right, up and down like you were going through terrible airplane turbulence and it also crushed your calves.  Definitely avoid that one.I know it sounds like I am just complaining but there's a lot to like about Imperial.  The steam rooms are great.  I enjoyed sitting in the sheer heat of the herbal steam room only to jump into the cold tub as soon as I got out.  It felt so refreshing! I still think it's a wonderful place that I will be coming back to repeatedly despite my injury.

name: Canyon Ranch SpaClub - Las Vegas
text: As of this writing the Canyon Ranch Spa is too large and easy to get lost if you're coming from the Palazzo side.  You would think it would be great because its conveniently located right off the pool area but do yourself a favor and enter from the Venetian until they (hopefully) get all that stuff worked out.    You literally feel like you are walking through an big office complex and there is very little (and confusing) signage to help you along.    We actually had to turn around and go back to ask if we were going the right way!  When we finally made our way around to the front, things were okay.. but really just okay.   My (hugely overpriced) massage was nice enough but once again, in order to get to the massage rooms I felt like I was walking through an office building, not (what should be) a nice retreat space.  There's absolutely no atmosphere to speak of.  Very off putting.  My massage therapist told me that due to the addition of the Palazzo Tower they will eventually be the largest spa in the world at over 100,000 square feet... but that's not necessarily a good thing.   They have the requisite citrus waters and teas and yadda yadda but IMO, the money would be better spent on upgrades to the personal hygiene products they provide and lockers that don't take 4 tries to open (maybe that was just my particular locker but it sucked nonetheless)...   etc etc.   I cannot comment on their other services, like exercise, salon, et al...   but so far Bellagio still has my favorite spa, hands down.

name: Beauty Brands Salon Spa Superstore
text: This review is for the mani/pedi part of the salon only.  They also offer other salon services like waxing, cuts, color... plus a huge range of product.Honestly I don't usually expect much from a store/salon setup like this but I am happy to say that I was pleasantly surprised.  I am here visiting family for the holidays and desperately needed a pedicure.  So, my mom called and got me in for a spa pedicure and a regular manicure with Paige.I have to say, this is one of the best pedicures I've had anywhere.  It was on par with Bellagio in Las Vegas as far as the time and care taken on my poor, tired, tootsies.   Nice hot soak, salt scrub, massage, peppermint mask, wrapped my feet in warm towels...the works.  Gentle but thorough.   And for only $45!   This would have cost a fortune elsewhere.  I was really impressed. My manicure was nice as well..  I opted for simple, so nothing special to report.I would not hesitate to go back the next time I'm in the area.
