name: Supercuts
text: I was a little worried about getting a scissor cut since I'd never been to this location before.  But Denise is awesome and did a great job!  At other run of the mill cutteries that will go unnamed I've ended up looking anywhere from a 12 year old boy to Adolph Hitler.  It was better than just "the bangs and sides were good" or "I didn't look bald."  I felt great!  Thanks for being there when I needed you!  Looks like I found my new regular place.  Just like any other service, don't forget to tip!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Selwyn Barber & Style
text: Needless to say, getting a haircut at a barber is completely different from a salon!  I like paying less than $20 for a haircut and am always amazed at how fast they are.   The lack of frills at a barber shop like Selwyn's is comical.  They move so fast sometimes I can't tell if they're cutting hair or chopping wood!But the best thing about barbers is that when your usual salons are fully booked for a month you can just walk in and immediately get a haircut.   Especially for men, if you communicate what you want up front I'd wager you'll get as good a haircut as any salon.  I've been here several times and I really like Jodi.  The new guy's doing a great job too.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Shopping', 'Cosmetics & Beauty Supply', 'Hair Salons', 'Hair Stylists', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Barbers', "Men's Hair Salons"]
name: Supercuts
text: Thank goodness for Supercuts. This one is in the hideous yellow and green building adjacent to Ben & Jerry's.  But I really like this location because Angie and Janea are both the bomb.  They listen to exactly what I want and make it happen.  I've tried several places in town that are 30$ just for a cut and I can't tell any difference.  No matter who cuts your hair, remember to tip!  For a cut that's only 15$ it's well worth the extra three or four dollars to show your appreciation.  Saturdays are the busiest day so I recommend calling ahead or going during the week.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Great Clips
text: Clean shop and I get a great cut for $13.  For guys that's a steal.  I like trying new people and I don't mind getting a different person each time.  If you're picky you'll want to call ahead and ask for Stephanie or Kristie.  I've had them both several times and they are very consistent. Great Clips is on the opposite side of the parking lot from Wal-Mart. Don't go over to Wal-Mart!  Steer over to Game Stop and it's in the same row of shops as Off Broadway Shoes and Party City.  Boom!Don't forget to tip. These nice ladies ain't workin' for smiles!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Cutting Image Salon
text: Right next door to Sushi 101, and they accept walk-ins.  Men's cuts are $20.  That's inexpensive compared to other salons around town and if you're tired of getting your hair botched with random experiences at lower end barbers and cutterys it's worth the upgrade.  Remember to tip 15 to 20% especially when going to a salon.  Just like at a restaurant, the person who takes care of you will definitely appreciate it and you still haven't spent the base price at higher end salons.  And I haven't experienced a friendlier atmosphere anywhere.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Great Clips
text: Only one person ahead of me when I walked in on a Saturday afternoon.  My first time to this location the atmosphere was friendly and quiet.  There was a mix of kids and adults getting their hair cut.  Christine is great and I'll try to remember to update when I try someone else!  $14 for a scissor cut is cheap in my opinion.  They don't take appointments but you can use the online checkin to get your name on the waiting list before you hit the road.  And you can type the name of the stylist you want next to yours if you know they're working.Don't forget to tip!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Cotswold Barber Shop
text: Cash or check only - no credit cards!  Turn on Robin at the NCBT and it's on the left.  Don't forget to tip, these guys deserve it.There were four or five guys working at their barber stations when I went in and none had hair longer than a quarter of an inch so I was a little nervous.  But they handled my "prissy" hair very nicely with clippers and a comb.  Hot shaving cream and a straight razor finish for the back of the neck.  I came out looking very respectable for the wedding reception I had to go to later in the day.  It doesn't look like much on the inside but they are turning people out quickly so you won't wait long.  They finished up some dads with their sons while I was there and I'm guessing they could handle a football team in short order.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantTakeOut': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Convenience Stores', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Food', 'Shopping', 'Drugstores', 'Cosmetics & Beauty Supply', 'Photography Stores & Services']
name: Walgreens
text: I hate this Walgreens!  Usually I rate any Walgreens far above the competition.  But this specific location is so horribly organized I can never find what I want and walk out wishing I hadn't wasted the time to make a stop.  It's like it's been taken over by a former Rite Aid manager.  They're missing a lot of the items I expect to find at any Walgreens and the whole store is just backwards.Very unfortunate too because it's at a great location at South & Woodlawn and they have an easy access parking lot.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Roosters Men's Grooming Center
text: I'm not really the salon type.  I've always wanted a Flowbee, but I don't have enough hair.  I have a set of clippers at home.  I don't really shave much.  I haven't been to Emerson Joseph, but I've heard good things about them.Though located in South Park (and Ballantyne, apparently), Roosters is like the Ghetto Emerson Joseph.  You walk in, and they ask if you want something to drink - beer, wine or water.  I don't really drink much any more, so I ask for water.  The water is a tiny water bottle.  One of those six-ounce bottles.  This is a men's grooming center?  Please.There is no one else in the place.  Absolutely empty.  The lady who brought the water is nice, in an Aunt Bee-sort of way.  She and the made-up trollop who was to do the work on my for the next little bit were apparently watching the news.  News, I tell you.  No sports, no Man Show, but news.  I don't want to watch the news, and they didn't ask what I wanted to see.Then I get an uneven trim of my goatee, a luke-warm towel across the eyes and face ("hot towel coming!", she says), a shave with a disposable razor, a trim of my already pretty closely-cropped hair while riding a bouncing barber's chair.  All for $60.  What a rip-off.  If I decide that I need such a treatment again, I'll try Emerson Joseph, to see if it lives up to the hype.  No more Roosters for me.  I suggest you steer clear too.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: MasterCuts
text: For some unknown reason, we decided to get the kids' hair cut at Concord Mills.  Thought it would be a good idea and take care of everything at once.  Stupid idea.Sat down, waited a minute or two, one kid was called back.  Then the other.  Then we watched as first one person was called over to ask how to cut a kids' hair, then another, then another, and so on.  It took more than an hour and a half to complete this process.I could have learned how to do it myself in that amount of time (no insult to hairdressers intended or should be implied - only meant to address those at this location in particular).

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'RestaurantTakeOut': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Shopping', 'Food', 'Convenience Stores', 'Photography Stores & Services', 'Cosmetics & Beauty Supply', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Drugstores']
name: Walgreens
text: Walgreens - at least this location - has gone downhill.  Way downhill.  We have at least one medication that we need monthly, and while they do offer an automatic refill option (where they have it ready for you each month), they can't seem to get it right.How hard can it be?  They have shelves and shelves of bottles, but they don't know how to fill the stupid bottle on time?  They insist you get a new prescription, but they can't get it in?  Beats me.Either they don't have it at all (often), they don't have it right (occasionally), they have it, but it's not the right form (generic when it should be brand name) or they just want to mess with you (one person gets your info and then they forget about you for half an hour, at which point they don't have it any longer).After about six months of this - which came after them getting it right for going on three years - we finally just gave up.  A little incompetence I can deal with.  Too much wastes my time and I can't handle it.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Oasis Massage
text: This place is the worst of both worlds - ghetto AND expensive! I guess the prices are typical of Asian mall massages, at $1 a minute it could be worse. Options are foot massage, or body massage at $1 minute in increments of 20 minutes.

attributes: {'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1}
name: Art of Beauty
text: I order Zoya nail polish from Art of Beauty and I am very happy. I think it's some of the best nail polish you can buy and the price is perfect. The bottles are slightly smaller than most you'll find in the stores and normally cost $8. True, it's a bit more expensive than other polishes for the amount you get, but the polish is long lasting and goes on smoothly. Also, they typically have some type of special going on that makes them more affordable. I've taken advantage of their Trio specials, which are three of the mini bottles and let you try a number of colors without committing completely to a larger bottle. I just recently purchased a BOGO deal through my account with them and I was able to snag 8 bottles of polish for $32 with free shipping!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}}
name: Les Amis Salon & Spa
text: Eh. I've had better manicures in Chicago for much less, but i needed a place for a wedding and this was it. I got a french manicure and it didn't look so good once I looked at it under better light. It didn't last long either. I got my nails done 4 days ago and I'm considering taking it off soon since the tips look chipped already.Still the woman who did them was very nice and chatty (in a good way). :)Edit: Ok, screw giving more stars. A day after I wrote the original review, the polish started actually peeling off. Whole sections of polish just started coming off the nails. I'm no princess with my hands, but heck, I even wear gloves when cleaning and doing dishes when my nails are lookin' pretty. This means that they're either using a cheap base, or she didn't do a good job of preparing the nails for the polish.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Discount Drug Mart
text: If you ever want to be treated like a completely different species, visit Discount Drug Mart in August wearing a motorcycle jacket, pants and boots - and carrying your helmet in with you.  My mom wanted some paper towels - not knowing the area, I just stopped here and got some very strange looks and questions.  First, the usual "Are you on a motorcycle?"  No, actually - I'm walking.  I wear this for protection crossing Mentor Ave - it's very dangerous.Second - "Are you a cop or something?"  No, are you an idiot or something?  Okay, I didn't really say that.Third reaction was probably the best - especially given a conversation earlier that day with a cousin and her boyfriend about how they physically could NOT wear helmets because - well - helmets cause headaches.  Seriously?  What do you think a concussion is?  That's what you'll get - or worse - and then they started with the whole "it's too hot to wear gear and a helmet" and "helmets don't really save your life if you get hit by a car anyway."  So you can imagine my surprise when, after perusing the somewhat cluttered Drug Mart aisle in search of paper towels, I passed a woman and small girl in the aisle by the magazines.  The little girl had two small beanie baby style bunnies in her hands and she stopped and stared at me with her jaw open.  "What are you?"Mom immediately responded, "She's a motorcyclist, honey, and she's wearing the protective gear that everyone should always wear on a motorcycle."What?  I just heard that in OHIO?The little girl was intrigued and touched my knee - I told her to knock on it - she thought it was cool - she touched my helmet and was fascinated with my bright yellow safety fest.  Then, she recovered her composure and held up each hand high and said "These are my bunnies!"I said "Keep them safe! Make sure they get helmets if they go ride on bicycles or motorcycles!" and she nodded solemnly and promised she would.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
categories: ['Day Spas', 'Event Planning & Services', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Hotels & Travel', 'Hotels', 'Active Life', 'Golf']
name: Walden
text: I came here for a wedding the other day.  It was one of the most beautiful places that I have ever been to.  My room had a jet massage bath tube in the middle of the room with at couple shower wit h jets coming from all angles.  It was the most beautiful shower that I had ever been in.  Service was also nice.  Everyone was super friendly.  The decor gave you a homely feel and the beds were so comfortable.  There was also a lot of space in my room and each room also came with 2 very comfortable robes.  I am very impressed and if I ever go back to Ohio I will stay there again.  Very nice place to have a wedding.  It was such a beautiful wedding.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: MAC Cosmetics
text: I would give this place 0 stars if I could.  I was here for 2 hours, and not one person said hi to me or acknowledged that I was even there.  I was going to buy something, but if I have to flag someone down and be treated poorly then forget it.  I will spend my money at another mac store.I was excited to come to this Mac store in particular because it is a pro store, which has more colors, body paint, mixing mediums than any other mac store.  But I will just wait till I get back to San Francisco to buy my stuff.  Don't think I will be buying anything from this location even if I come back to Vegas.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'GoodForKids': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Great Clips
text: I had just finished paying for my lunch with change, when Lou K. said to me "If you're out of money, just let me know." I denied being broke. I went on to tell him about my day so far, and exclaimed, "I got the best hair cut of my life at Great Clips!" He replied, "so, you are broke." Yes, the lowly state of my bank account brought me into Great Clips on a Tuesday morning. But, I did get the best hair cut of my life. My stylist, Lori, has been cutting hair for 20+ years and she knows what she's doing. I brought in a picture of what I wanted, and before I knew it, my head was a blur of scissors and flying hair. She was polite, quick, non judgmental, and spot-on. We were done super fast. No wasted time with a shampoo. No upsell with products. In and out in 15 minutes with a great cut that was exactly what I asked for, executed well. Before tip, my total was $13.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'HairSpecializesIn': {'coloring': True, 'africanamerican': False, 'curly': False, 'perms': True, 'kids': False, 'extensions': True, 'asian': False, 'straightperms': True}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Dino Palmieri Salon & Spa
text: I have always had a great experience here. It is pricier than Best Cuts, but quality counts! The stylists are knowledgeable and talented. I see women of all ages here, but they all look stylish.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Crazy Mullets Lakewood
text: I agree with all the other 5 stars...this place has twice the style at 1/2 the price. I think my cut was $20. You can trust your stylist and just sit back and relax. Bravo!Although, Brett did inform me that I have grey hair. Like enough that I need to color. What? When did that happen? I have since investigated and agree, but find them to be white, which is prob why I did not notice them in my naturally dirty blonde hair that has lots of natural highlights.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Discount Drug Mart
text: Discount Drug Mart is like a mythical place in the HW, or downtown Lakewood. It has two entrances, and shopping carts with tall, vertical pipes attached so you can't take them to the parking lot. You think "this place is a wreck," as you first step in. Lesser humans might find that a turnoff, but Lakewood residents find Discount Drug Mart just as it should be.  Depending on which of the two entrances you take, you'll either wander to the front of the store, thinking you are in the back, or you'll wander to the front of the store, thinking you are in the front. I've been a Discount Drug Mart customer in downtown Lakewood for 7 years, and I still can't remember which way to go to buy my 2 liter bottle of club soda. I will say this: it has everything. Need keys made for your apartment? Discount Drug Mart. Need back to school notebooks? Discount Drug Mart. A new Mr. Coffee maker? Discount Drug Mart. Adult diapers? Potatoes? Lean Cuisines? Send a fax for $1 a page? Discount Drug mart across the board. There is not a full grocery section, so forget what you were thinking about buying ground beef or chicken breasts. You will find cheese, milk, eggs, and Bob Evans sausage.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}}
name: Les Amis Salon & Spa
text: If in a bind, this is a spot to go to.  In comparison to other nail shop in the mall that is simply frightening, this spot is very basic.  It once was a nice salon in its hey day, but the equipment is old and the shop is a dingy.If desperate, go here, but you are better off getting manicures before you go to Cleveland.

name: Fashion Nail
text: Google and Yelp claim its on Huron, but its actually in the Tower City Mall.  This place is scary.  We made an appointment to get a quick mani before we went to a wedding, and from the mall entrance you can smell the toxins running out of that store.  This place is generally for acrylics and it was very grimey with poor nail color selection.  Utimately, we walked out of there because it was so filthy.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Ulta Beauty
text: Major fan of Ulta right here, and this Ulta location in pretty Westgate Plaza didn't disappoint.I'm obsessed with dry shampoo and swear by Sexy Hair's version of the stuff, which is fantastic for simultaneously freshening the hair and adding volume.  The major downside of dry shampoo is that it's not conducive to flying:  dry shampoo is an aerosol powder, and pressure changes associated with flying in an airplane ruin the product the majority of the time.  Thus, if I'm flying somewhere and staying for more than a couple days I hunt down a place to buy Big Sexy Hair Dry Shampoo.  Enter Ulta.Stopped by this Ulta location while in town a couple weeks ago to score some dry shampoo.  Was interested in a travel size version of the stuff, but an Ulta employee informed me that the only small cans of dry shampoo in the store were Oscar Blandi brand.  Alright, I'm down to try new things.  The employee explained that the Oscar Blandi product specifically for brunettes is great because it doesn't create the fine white film associated with most dry shampoo brands (true) and adds serious volume (not true at all).  I paid $11 for the little can of Oscar Blandi product but in hindsight would gladly have paid $16.95 for the full-size Sexy Hair dry shampoo that I love so dearly.  The Oscar Blandi dry shampoo frankly didn't do its job, and I didn't like its lemon Pledge-like scent.Though the advice I received regarding the dry shampoo was inaccurate, the service my friend and I received in this nice clean store was overall good and friendly.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: CC Salon and Spa
text: Was in Cleveland this past weekend for a wedding, and on Friday my friend suggested that she and I take a break from the chaos to get pedicures.  Her choice of CC Salon & Spa--though neither she nor I had been there before Friday--was a good one.My first pedicure ever, by the way.I'm in love with the results of my pedicure and the nude-colored OPI polish ("Tickle My France-y" or some similar silly name) I chose.  During portions of my life I've been a gymnast, dancer, runner, weightlifter, and hiker.  In other words, my toes/feet/nails have pretty much always taken a beating and have never looked nearly as good as they do now.  The pedicure my friend and I received included exfoliation and massaging, but the focus was definitely on the toenails and cuticles.  Every aspect of our pedicure was relaxing and produced nice results.  Jenn did our pedicures.  She was great and seamlessly switched back and forth between me and my friend while my friend and I sat side by side.  We were in the comfortable pedicure chairs for nearly 2 hours, so my guess is that the standard Pedicure at CC Salon & Spa lasts between 45 and 60 minutes.  (Also available are the Express Pedicure for $35 and the Spa Pedicure for $55.)  The pre-gratuity price of the standard Pedicure is $45 and increases to about $50 after tax is figured in.Sanitation seemed in line with what is required at such an establishment.  The used soaking water was drained in our presence, and I also witnessed the sanitization of the various metal tools that had been in contact with our feet.CC Salon & Spa is located within a business complex of tidy little buildings that resemble houses.  There are several free parking lots in the vicinity, but note that some lots are reserved for specific business while other lots contain no parking specifications.I recommend this salon/spa to anyone who has feet in need of some TLC.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Acqua Blu Medical Spa
text: In recent months I've visited Toni at Acqua Blu Medical Spa for an IPL photofacial and microdermabrasion, both at significant discount courtesy of Groupon.First things first, have no fear, the building's interior is much nicer than the exterior.  I have to admit that when I pulled into the complex (Acqua Blu Med Spa + Premier Plastic Surgery & Dermatology) for the first time I was speechless when I saw that, well, this building is hardly the nicest or newest in the area.  And the gray-as-gray-can-be sky didn't help.In December I treated myself to a photofacial to remove or at least minimize some small capillaries on my nose and some light sun spots on my cheeks.  I'd been interested in a photofacial for years, so when the procedure only took about 15 minutes--application of gel, 2 passes of the laser (once to treat red areas, once to treat brown spots), and application of moisturizer with SPF--I was disappointed.  Turns out I didn't really need a photofacial after all.  My results were basically non-existent; perhaps those with more significantly damaged skin would benefit from this procedure.  Most of all and as stated previously, I was disappointed in how short the treatment lasted.  It would have been nice to work in a facial massage, masque, or something similar to increase the bang-for-buck.  Had I paid full price I'd have felt taken advantage of.My microdermabrasion in February, on the other hand, was really nice--a great boost for my winter blah skin.  I thought the process was gentle, and I experienced no discomfort or redness or irritation at all.  My skin was softer, clearer, and looked brighter and refreshed for several weeks following the microderm.Definitely wouldn't recommend spending full price at Acqua Blu.  There seems to be Groupons, LivingSocial deals, and/or website and email specials literally all the time.I plan to have additional experiences here but for now think I'll limit my review to 3 stars.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Ulta Beauty
text: I'm just now getting on board with these beauty super-stores. Why? Having too many options gives me anxiety. The thought of a huge, self-serve makeup and beauty shop honestly sounds like hell on wheels to me. It already takes me longer than your average human to make a decision, but wandering around a place like Ulta or Sephora--walls lined with shades of make-up only slightly different than the ones around it, eyes glazed over... no thank you. I grew up visiting beauty counters at the department stores with my Mom. She'd always take me along with her and let me get my makeup done at Clinique or Chanel. But these days I wouldn't dream about buying anything other than eye shadows and longer-lasting makeup items from those places. It's just too expensive. But I still crave that 1-on-1 service of a professional who knows his/her craft and can help me help myself. Because even if you're buying cheaper makeup, you can waste your time and money on the wrong purchases. You're still not going to get that 1:1 experience with the expertise I'm talking about at stores like Ulta, but at this particular location I got great service. I was asked if I needed help and she even checked the back for me! She also got me involved in the rewards program. I loved that I didn't have to drive out of my way to come here or go inside a mall like I've had to with Sephora. I also appreciated their vast selection of NYX products that are super-reasonably priced. Like I said, I don't mind investing in some lasting products from more expensive stores, but for my everyday makeup, Chanel and likewise really isn't in my budget. NYX is also great for trendy colors you know you won't be sporting past this season. One thing I really don't like about huge makeup places like this quality control. Because Ulta is so huge with so many nooks and crannies, I found myself unable to buy over 6 items I wanted because they had been opened already. They checked the back, too. But someone felt the need to open the last of 6 different kinds of products to try them. I'm not talking about testers here... I'm talking about people who just open anything they want to try and then put it back, without any regard for others. With a store this big, Ulta suffers from this problem A LOT. And it's gross. I think if they were better staffed and made an effort to be sure testers were readily available, this wouldn't happen as much. The last time I was there hoards of teenage girls were running around opening products and no one said a word. Lastly, like a few other Yelpers have eluded to, the inventory at Ulta is so vast that there's no way every staff member can be an expert at all the lines of products. While some Yelpers find this OK, I only find this acceptable if I'm coming for makeup I've already tried. This is why I do NOT come to Ulta to discover new products, but only to pick up what I know I love.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Crazy Mullets Lakewood
text: Again, what great experiences when coming here for both my man's haircut and a trim for the little guy. John is the man to go to here, period. I've been around salons since I was little. I like to think that I know a little bit about stlists, and this guy just rocks. I'm sure if he ever left that we'd follow him to whatever local salon he chose to work. He truly puts a lot of time and attention into his cuts and styles. I've only witnessed his expertise with mens and boys cuts, but watching his work makes me think he's great with the ladies styles, too. The little guy has really, really thick, straight hair. It can get really heavy on him, floppy and almost a little anime-ish. He's never liked getting his hair cut and went through a phase where he just wanted it long and in his eyes. But recently I feel like John slowly worked with him out of that icky style and really helped him figure out what look was really him. This past time we left the salon and the little guy said it was the best haircut ever and he really liked his hair. I've never, ever heard him say this--and he was right, it really was the cutest cut I've seen on him. John even convinced him that just a little bit of product in his hair was OK and now he's interested in styling  it. So cute!My guy has thinner hair and doesn't like his hairline. We both told John exactly what he didn't like about his grown out style and he just got to work. Long story short, the haircut was exactly what my man had in mind and he looked delicious. I'm a HUGE fan of the new 'do. He's happy and confident, I'm happy and we love John! To summarize, if you're going to Crazy Mullets, ask for John!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Ladies & Gentlemen Salon and Spa
text: Anyone who even *kind of* knows me knows that I don't joke around about hair. Well, this is where my incredibly phenomenal hair stylist worked before she moved on to where she is now. I can't help but still love L&G, if not for the hair, then the spa. (I'll never cheat on my hair stylist!!)Yes, even this thrifty lady can splurge every once in a blue moon on a lovely spa day... and I'm way overdue for another one!L&G is a very eco-friendly spa with a focus on natural products. They use Aveda, which I love. In fact, I think they put an addictive ingredient in the scent, because one you use it you're hooked! Natural oils, hour long massages, facials without abrasive chemicals, this place is right up my alley. My skin is very sensitive, so what a spa uses is of great importance to me!Want a mani/pedi? You'll get the most natural, gentle experience at L&G. Some nail places really creep me out with all their metal tools and stuff. I mean, they're reusing those on everyone! Not here. They have disposable tools that gently treat your rough skin without ripping it all off. They'll even send you home with the pumice stone for future usage. Love that! No tipping, pretty good prices, natural products and gentle procedure. Ladies and Gentlemen Salon and Spa is my kind of place!Just FYI - gift certificates here for a spa day or just a hair do make amazing gifts. Trust me! I've given them and got them!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Eddy's On Coventry
text: After 10 years (at least) of entrusting one of my very best friends with my hair styling--I was a little nervous to get my locks done after she moved to NYC. And that's even after knowing how talented every stylist is at Eddy's. I'm very, very picky about my hair and about color. No visible "streaks" or "highlights" for this gal. It has to look natural--like it wasn't purposefully "done." Well, thank goodness for Eddy's and thank goodness for Mandy. She's taken over many of my friend's clients since she moved to NYC and we're all in extremely qualified hands! Don't get me wrong--I very much miss Breanna, but Mandy kicks ass at color and totally went above and beyond to make me happy/comfortable/not anxious. She is now my go-to gal for all things hair and she should be your's, too! Well, that is if you appreciate great hair and talent! I'm OBSESSED with pumped up color, cut--everything. My hair looks much healthier, happier and it's so wonderful to know that I'm in great hands with Mandy. We chatted the whole time non-stop and it feels like all the hair planets have aligned again! I cannot recommend her enough. One suggestion? Make your appointment a couple of weeks in advance! I know guys are used to just springing on a hair appointment last minute, but most gals will tell you to get an appointment with someone really talented--some advance notice is required. This isn't Best Cuts, mmmkay? IF you're a guy, it might still be easy for you to get a last minute booking, but ladies--if you're looking for color, please give your stylists the same respect you'd want--give them some notice and call in advance! I make my next appointment when I pay at the counter. You can always reschedule it. Just do it.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: LUV Salon & Spa
text: This is a tough review to write because the girls who helped us were dolls, but this place needs to step it up a notch on just a couple of fronts....1) Although the girl who did my sister's pedi and gel mani was the sweetest ever (and did a great pedicure)--when a client calls and makes an appointment for a gel mani SPECIFICALLY, you don't give them someone who has never done one before. Period. My sister, although ultimately happy with the result, had her nails redone about 4 times. The girl who was helping her did everything she could to make sure that when my sister left, her gel mani was right, but still... poor form. 2) When I came in I told them the design I wanted on my nails, they told me they could do it. They couldn't. In fact, they have one girl there who can do nail art the way it's supposed to be done. That's it. And she wasn't there. My gal ( I will not share her name because I don't want her connected to a so-so review. She's great!) just couldn't get the help and support she needed. She could do some nail art, but there was NO ONE there to help her with what she couldn't do. She tried two different methods to get my nails done and just couldn't get it. I felt awful for her--but I also was getting really upset. By the time we left we had been there about 3.5 hours. That's WAY tooo long. I had things to do and I had not planned on more than 1.5hrs, which is more than enough for your standard pedi and gel mani. 3) I also watched them turning away multiple walk-in clients when their signage outside clearly stated "walk-ins welcome." That could seem like a positive to some, but to me I saw two customers leaving with a horrible taste in their mouths... it was visible on their faces. If I were the business owner, I WOULD NEVER want any employee of mine to treat a potential customer that way. There are so many ways to remedy that situation. But if I were a business owner, I'd offer any walk-in client who couldn't be served anytime that day a discount on their next service. But that's just me. Now on to the positives, which there are plenty. The space itself is large and very clean. Each pedicure station looked freshly cleaned--all with signage assuring you so. Their gel nail color selection is one of the best and most updated I've seen around. You'll have a hard time choosing most certainly. They have a simple and moderately priced pedicure, but be careful what you say "yes" to as it will add extra charges. They have varying scented lotions you can pick from for your pedicures and the pedi's themselves look great. My gel manicure, although not entirely what I wanted, was a well-done manicure-- and my sister's was too, after 4 tries.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Liz Nails
text: My first professional gel mani/pedi in probably about 5 years--I know... it was time.Normally you're asking to be disappointed when you're rushing around before a trip and you drop-in to grab a quick mani/pedi. But not at Liz Nails! This place was not only recommended by the Yelp community, but also from my gal friends on facey-space. So I gave them a try on a Monday afternoon... when I was in a mad rush... right before I left for a trip. Yep, I did that to myself. But the Liz Nails folks handled it perfectly. I stepped in the same time as another lady looking for the same gel mani/pedi service. I mentioned I was in a big hurry and without a minute passing the had invited both this lady and I to the back to get our pedicures started. Without skimping on service, the gentleman helping me got me through a great pedicure without delay. In fact, the longest part of the whole process was picking out the damn nail color. Then my first gel manicure was a great experience! It went quickly and has lasted well over a week at this point. He did it perfectly and I can't wait to come back to get my next manicure. One thing I think that could be improved on is the color selection. It's not that they don't have a lot of colors, but normally when I've gone to nail salons they have displays out with new, relevant and seasonal color lines. This is helpful to those of  us who don't get our nails done often and are really indecisive. I think I'll just come in better prepared next time. The price was around what I remember when I used to get my nails done more often. I think next time I"ll just get my toe nails painted (not a full pedi) when I get my gel manicure. And hopefully the service always stays this good!

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': False, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'RestaurantReservations': False, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantDelivery': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Great Lakes Mall
text: *Sad Face* my childhood mall is going down the pooper. I feel like this mall has been on the steady decline since I was a little Cara. Granted, it does have a few savior stores, but for the most part they've all come and gone. There used to be a Gap... an Aldo... all bye-bye!Don't get me wrong, Great Lakes Mall does have some redeeming qualities. For one, the quality stores they do have tend to have more of my sizes left since they're not as busy as other malls. Score! The staff at most shops seem to be nicer and willing to actually assist you. For instance, every time I go to The Limited I don't want to leave! The girls there are so wonderful and give you honest opinions. It's like having a private shopper! This mall is also doing a better job of filling in empty spaces, which is way better than hearing the echo of your own voice down the hall. One last positive that I'll mention: this mall is easy to shop. Why? Well, it's usually empty. I admit, I live to shop. But I never like a crowded store or mall... in fact, it's infuriating! Especially when I just stop in to grab something quick and it takes forever because some idiot is holding up a line over a huge return that she clearly just shoplifted. (God. I love run-on sentences.)With Great Lakes Mall, I'm usually in and out--no annoying hassles or crowds.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Riya's Nails
text: This is my last update, I promise. I just have a cool story to share. It's a great example of and shout out to their customer service and talent. In the past few weeks, Riya's has become harder and harder to get appointments within the week you call. I came back from a 10-day vacation with two missing nails from my acrylic set. For my ladies who know, missing nails make you feel like a hot mess, no matter how fancy you dress yourself up. So, I called Riya's and they couldn't get me in for TWO WEEKS! In an act of desperation, I used the Yelp app to find another place to get my nails done. The reviews were mostly about pedicures and gel manis, which should have been my first flag. Acrylic nails aren't easy. But I took a chance, brought an exact photo (from Riya's) of what I wanted and hoped for the best.Welp, that was a mistake. I walked away with animal claws. My boyfriend's reaction word was, "gross" and I'm out $45 for a crappy result. In another act of desperation, I walked in to Riya's the next day to see if they could squeeze me in to fix what the other salon had done. Kim (she's amazing) took time out of her lunch break to squeeze me in and make my nails beautiful again. It cost me only $15. These girls are talented, thoughtful and WORTH THE WAIT. I have not found another place in CLE that has better artists than Riya's.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False}
name: Cleveland Henna
text: I've worked with HennaMe numerous times in the past for events, but until a recent party I hadn't been lucky enough to actually get some done on myself. And now... I'm addicted! I may not know a ton about henna, but I do know art and Kristina is an amazing artist. Her designs seem to integrate authentic design with a modern twist--which I love. She makes her own paste from scratch using only authentic, natural ingredients, including lemon juice, sugar and essential oils. I sat down and within mere minutes she'd created something gorgeous and phenomenal on my hand (see the pics) Coming from a very pale gal who tends to be OCD about her skin (no tattoos for me) I was worried this was going to be a shock for me--it lasts 1-3 weeks! But I've been obsessed--in a good way--since I got it. And now I want her to do my entire back! Furthermore, she gives you a card with all the info you need to know about caring for your new henna piece, including day-of care and long-lasting maintenance tips. She travels to you if need her to and her charge is by the hour. I can't say more about Kristina and her henna. If you're looking to get some done or even want to have her at an event, you will NOT be disappointed.
