name: Cut Hair Studio
text: I still have nothing but genuine love for these ladies! The salon recently went through a pretty significant transition that made them even better--which I didn't think was even possible. One of the partners left and they changed their name back the original "Cut Hair Studio." The stylists are still there and working in even better harmony than before. Give these gals a try, you seriously won't regret it.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Simply Swank Salon & Spa
text: Top drawer Aveda salon & spa owned by a mega talented Mary Swank.  She was my one and only go to girl when I lived in Ohio.  I drove 45 minutes to see her because I couldn't find anybody better.  Whenever I was bored or feeling like I needed a little more sex appeal to my hair... Mary was able to give me a new option & I felt sexier walking out the door.  (She laughs at me when I tell her I'm feeling like I have soccer mom hair.)They have a beautiful spa downstairs, but I haven't had the time to try out those services. (I got the tour on my last visit.) Book in advance (or ask if you can get in for a cancellation.)

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Bella Capelli Sanctuario
text: Haven't been here in years, but used to go to Serena, one of the owners.  She was recommended to me by Mary Swank (owner of Simply Swank in Hudson, OH) when I was trying to find a place closer to my job in Avon, OH.Serena was extremely friendly & did a great job on cut & color the few times I went.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: S & T Nail Design
text: I had a really hard time finding a nail salon in Pittsburgh.  I really liked this one though because the owners were so personable and cool.  They have been at this location for over 15 years.It is a no frills type of place, but you can tell that the couple really care about their customers.  I had a really nice conversation with both of them and they did a really great job on my nails.  It's been almost 10 days and my nails still look pretty awesome.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Kenny's Nail Center
text: I mean...seriously? I should have known better given that it only had one positive review. My 600th yelp review, you think I'd've learned by now!I wandered in here looking for a pedicure. My first hint should have been the old crusty polishes on the walls - no Essie etc here. But whatever, I picked out my color and headed to the dilapidated pedicure chair. (I put my bag on the adjacent tray and it couldn't support the weight). They don't use razors here, which is fine, but I expected a thorough scrubbing of my callouses, and when she gave me a tiny little once over then unceremoniously threw my feet back into the water I thought to myself, OK there's no way on earth this is more than a $10 pedicure right? My heels still looked as bad as they did when I walked in. Then she painted my nails and sat me down at the "dryer" which consisted of two tiny fans pointed at my feet. For real. I had to sit there for over ten minutes, she proclaimed my toes dry, then I paid - $25?!!!! For $25 in Boston where I'm from I could get a legit pedicure. I was dumbfounded. I paid, walked home, and lo and behold two of my toes already had smudged polish. ARGH!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': True}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: INGLOT Cosmetics
text: The assistant was very nice, took time to help us, but given we were the only customers it wasn't too hard to do that.  Sadly, many of the samples were messy, gouged, didn't look appealing, or just were missing, and the assistant said they were out or they just hadn't been restocked from the supply in the store, which is sad.  How can I buy it if I can't see it?  Otherwise the store was clean and modern.  Odd location but convenient if you come in end of shops, on the far right of the Cesaer's Building.  The makeup is well priced, good quality, and the freedom system lets you put together a palette that suits you.  I have so much other makeup I decided to skip the palettes.  I couldn't pass up the liquid blush, which is so pretty and easy to apply, and the liquid highlighter.  I spend buku bucks for Benefit's high beam, posietint, benetint, and cha cha, and the inglot line isn't identical, but has similar products.  If the highlighter works out, it's cheaper to mail order it and get a larger quantity than I would get by buying high beam.  I'd definitely return next time in Vegas.  Go with a clean face and you can really try the foundations and blushes.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Loova
text: It's a cute store, but I didn't see anything original or interesting that I haven't seen at Lush.  The ducky soaps are cute.  It has a "homemade" feel to the products, which doesn't quite match the price point.  Still, it smells good and the staff are nice.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Mirage Spa & Salon
text: Massage plus tip, 160 bucks.  It was ok, nothing to go back for again.  It was pleasant enough but certainly not the best massage ever.  BUT with your massage you get all day access to the spa, which includes four different temperature jacuzzis, a shower area with everything you need, vanity area with free products (although none for curly haired girls, would it kill them to have a little mousse or gel?  And how about some moisturizer with sunscreen?), a steam room, dry sauna, and lounging areas with non alcohol drinks and snacks.  If you go in the am you can get your massage and then use the facilities until 7:30 that night.   My friends and I enjoyed hanging out and chatting, looking ultra cool in our silly white bathrobes (and they have regular and plus size, so nobody need feel uncomfortable) and funny rubber massagey slippers.  I would go back with girlfriends, it was fun.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
name: Timothy's of Squirrel Hill
text: Miss Rose does a great job with kids.  She has nintendo, movies, cartoons, and a big play room for waiting kids and siblings.  She is pleasantly chatty with parents.  She wasn't even mad we were late (although I don't recommend being late).  Great place for kids, and she'll even do a "princess" style at the end; the little one I accompanied got the "Belle" from "Beauty and the Beast," it was very cute.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Sephora
text: Pleasant helpful staff, products are stocked, and it's really convenient.  And it's huge!  I was messing with the body paints, not knowing what they were or how to use them, and a staff member stopped by to show me how they are used, knowing full well I wasn't going to buy anyway.  Fun place to get your girlie on.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Jo Malone
text: I get why another review said service was unpleasant.  The lady had a whiny, annoyed voice and didn't seem happy to see me.  However, once I started sampling perfume she became very helpful and even friendly, sharing her favorites and asking what I liked.  I didn't buy anything because I just spent all my yearly discretionary income at Saks on a Bond #9 sampler set, and the Jo Malone scents aren't really my thing, but the experience was actually ok.  Im not sure if you will run into this same lady, but if she seems annoyed just smile and spray and she will warm up to you.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Judit European Visage
text: Okay, so I never thought I'd be into the whole "hot stone massage" thing. I like basic massages for my sore, stressed neck and love a good foot, hand, face, and everything-in-between massage. However, here I was in Pittsburgh, visiting the folks, and needing a bit of stress-relief. In comes google and Yelp to the rescue! I received an absolutely amazing hot stone massage for a very reasonable price ($70/hour) at Judit European Visage. I learned that the hot stones help my muscles relax, and that being pressed with them (they're smooth) is very relaxing and calming. I also run cold (circulation issues), so the warmth from the stone felt amazing! Calming music, a quiet room, (a chance to be massaged with my partner also getting a massage in the same room), and a strong and gentle massage therapist, and I left feeling like a new person in our newly cleaned car (see review for CleanTown below). The owner also offered bottles of spring water and homemade walnut bread. It was really sweet of her.It's been a great week, and Judit European Visage is part of that greatness! ;) I highly recommend them for a beautiful experience.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Above All Grand Salon & Spa
text: Since my previous review, a lot has changed at Above All Grand Salon and Spa. Haircuts are less expensive (I got mine done by one of the owners, so perhaps that's why it was more expensive), and they've widened their types of massages. The current owner wrote me and was very responsive to my previous reviews, and I have to say that attentiveness like this reflects the quality of the business.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Hairsmith
text: I went to Brandy back when she was at Mint on Ellsworth. She was my favorite stylist to date in Pittsburgh, and unfortunately she left and started cutting hair on the Southside - a bit too far for me to make the trek regularly.After a long, long time of wandering between salons, trying to find a stylist and salon that could meet expectations - I never did. I finally searched Yelp for "brandy hair" and Hairsmith popped up. Apparently, she's been here, operating her own place for a year! I wish I'd known!The place is awesome, historic, and feels like a good cross between a barber shop and a salon. It is totally Brandy.Online booking is so convenient and awesome. I don't know why not everywhere offers this service. I do wish that it sent a calendar event so it would appear in my Google Calendar. Perhaps in the future.Regarding the haircut - I explained what I was kind of going for, and she listened, paid close attention to the shape of my head, the directions my hair grows, assessed potential issues with the cut ahead of time, was vocal about her plan and precisely what she was going to do, and what she was doing while she was cutting. She's detailed, but efficient about it. Her training was  clearly excellent (I've had consistently good cuts from stylists who studied at Toni & Guy) and she seems to take pride in her work. She seems to particularly excel in short cuts, men's cuts, and asymmetric or European-inspired cuts. I haven't been this happy with a haircut is a long, long, time. It is good to be back :-)

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'HairSpecializesIn': {'coloring': True, 'africanamerican': False, 'curly': True, 'perms': True, 'kids': False, 'extensions': True, 'asian': True, 'straightperms': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Nail Salons', 'Massage', 'Hair Extensions', 'Hair Salons', 'Barbers', 'Hair Stylists', 'Blow Dry/Out Services', 'Beauty & Spa', "Men's Hair Salons"]
name: Whitehouse Salon
text: There is a lot to lake about Whitehouse Salon. It is a clean, friendly and chic atmosphere. There's a bit of confusion as to what door is the entrance, and they seem utterly confused and not set up for people taking the stairs up instead of the elevator. Some signage in the stairwells would help.I went to two stylists here - Sharon and LaVerne. Both seemed quite competent, but my frustrations primarily come with timeliness of this place. I think I came here 3 or 4 times. None of the times did my appointment start within 15 minutes of when it was supposed to. With Sharon, I was always double-booked while she was doing a coloring of another client's hair, so I usually ended up with an assistant washing my hair, waiting, and then getting my hair cut while the other client was waiting for color to set, and they continued their conversation. It is kind of awkward, and feels like you're not getting 100% attention from the stylist.Sharon is extremely meticulous in her work, making sure there is not a stray hair out of place, following the grain of my hair, and taking great care to make everything even. If I were getting married or going to appear on TV, I'd probably want this level of care. But, when it's a random Tuesday and I'm trying to meet up for dinner with friends, or make it back to work without spending 2 hours at the salon - it is a bit overkill.One time when I was in dire need of a cut, and Sharon wasn't available, I went to LaVerne. LaVerne did a good job, but my cut didn't quite turn out how I wanted - and was quite a bit shorter than I was going for. I'd try going to her again, though.I'm not completely against this place because there's a lot to like, but I'm not totally in love with it, either, as I've had better. It is above average for Pittsburgh, and if I'd definitely recommend it over some other places for somebody looking for a cut. I'd like to check out their nail services, too.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Mint Salon & Gallery
text: Unfortunately, I can no longer recommend Mint salon.I liked it very much when they were on Ellsworth. I first went to Haley, and she was great. But then she left. So I started going to Brandy, and she was great. Then she left. Hmm, a trend?So I  then tried Danielle, and wasn't so impressed with her cut. At this point, the trend of good stylists leaving was enough of a concern that I started looking elsewhere to get my haircut.MCN, Avenue E, Whitehouse Salon, Alder Barber, and some others later - I've never come to find anybody I've liked as much as Haley or Brandy. So, I thought I'd come back to Mint's new location and get a cut from Kelley. It just wasn't a great experience. The door was open on a warm humid rainy day, so it was damp and uncomfortable inside. Kelley was friendly, but didn't come across as very professional. In the end, she cut off a lot more hair than I'd wanted, and left the sides pretty bushy and uneven, and kind of shrugged her shoulders, said my hair was hard to deal with, and that was that.Sad, but I won't be back.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Zhang's Relaxation Centre
text: I finally decided to go to Zhang's after some recommendations from some co-workers, as well as reading reviews here.Honestly, this is probably one of the best massages that I've ever gotten. Relaxing? Maybe.. for... parts of it. Effective? Deep tissue? Absolutely.Mary figured out exactly what was wrong with my back without me even telling her that my shoulders/back hurt. She could just tell from feeling it. The combination of ashiatsu, deep tissue, Swedish, Thai, hot stone, and Chinese massages was wonderful. I left feeling aligned, loosened, and overall just great. She put a ton of work and muscle into kneading the knots out of my back, legs, etc. Prices are very reasonable. 60 minutes was $60 at the time of this writing. And, it was *actually* 60 full minutes, not like a 50-minute hour. Most places are far more expensive or require some shady contract.There were a few downsides, but none enough to lose a star for me:1) Its cash-only. They didn't warn me, so I had to go get some cash from an ATM afterwards.2) The table was a bit short for me. But, I'm a pretty tall guy. The face cutout was also a little tiny for my head - squishing my nose a bit. I'd prefer a different table.3) As others mentioned, there is a bit of a different attitude towards modesty. I opted to completely disrobe, as I've found most therapists can do a much better job on the glutes (and after doing squats, lunges, deadlifts, rowing, skiing, biking, running, etc I need them to do a good job) with no clothing in the way. Ultimately, I was glad I made that decision, as she was indeed able to massage the hell out of my butt muscles and lower back without obstruction. I was covered in a towel which was displaced as necessary, but it most certainly wasn't always covering all the manbits at all times. Oh well. At the end of the day, I completely didn't care, though, because she was absolutely professional about it and I was in such a state of zen muscular submission that the towel wasn't even necessary. I could see this may bother others, though, so keep that in mind.4) I called ahead to make an appointment, but I don't think they actually took my name. So, I'm not quite sure how that's supposed to work.I'll be back, for certain.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
name: Nadia Salon
text: Though my haircut wasn't terrible, I won't be back here. It just doesn't live up to standards that I am used to in a nice salon. I've certainly been to worse.My appointment started about 30 minutes late, which stinks. I was about ready to walk out of the place, and then finally was available.There's one couch to sit on and wait. Not a huge deal, but I imagine it could get uncomfortable if there were more people waiting.The atmosphere looks amazing in photos, but feels not-so-great in person. The overhead lights are fluorescent and cold/sterile. There was some guy going around painting or something. The owner was shouting across the room at the other stylists and the painter guy - and had a bit of a rougher personality. It wasn't calming.My stylist, Anthony, was a pretty nice guy. Not quite what I was expecting, for some reason. We made some small-talk, and he seemed to take his time and was detailed for the most part. However, I didn't quite end up with the cut that I wanted despite what I thought were clear directions - the back of my hair ended up pretty clean/ cropped, rather than fringes. It wasn't botched or bad - just not what I wanted. Granted, I didn't even know that until I got home because he never showed me in the mirror. Then, when it came time to pay, they charged $40 instead of $33 like I had been told on the phone. I could have haggled or said something, but my mind was already made up that this was a 2-star place and I wouldn't be coming back, so I just payed it. But, watch out for bait-and-switch if you do go.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Alder Street Barber
text: Two stars seems harsh, but honestly I'm not sure I'd rate my experience here A-OK.Firstly - I quite liked the space. It was well designed, kind of quirky and cool, and very open (literally, the garage door was open).The haircut I got was good - it just wasn't quite what I asked for. I asked for a mohawk - including the tail in the back. I didn't realize until the end of the haircut that the back was entirely shaved, and I only had length left on the top. At least it was cut evenly and only cost $20. Now I just have to wait to grow it out to get the look I wanted to begin with.The experience during the cut wasn't my favorite. While I prefer the person cutting my hair to be focused on my hair, not conversation, I also don't want to be entirely bored. The barber started blasting music as soon as I sat down, and then tried to converse with me over the music, constantly asking me to repeat myself because he couldn't hear me. Wtf? Do you want me to shut up and listen to your jams, or to have a conversation? I can't do both!I wanted to give them a try given all of the hype on here, but at the end of the day, I think I'm more comfortable in the right quiet salon where the stylist washes my hair, blow dries away all the little hair clippings so I'm not covered in them all day, and seems to give a shit about what I asked for.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Avenue E Salon
text: This is hard to update after such a great review I'd written before, but unfortunately, as much as I liked the cuts from Tim K, I couldn't stand the conversation anymore and I had to stop going. What I was hoping was just the awkward first-time-client phase that I mentioned in the first review never really ended. Some comments were fairly insensitive - particularly a bit sexist, and some comments were directed at people being too sensitive about his comments.When I found myself anxious to just get the hell out of the chair so it could end, I decided it was no longer the place for me :-/

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'HairSpecializesIn': {'coloring': True, 'africanamerican': False, 'curly': True, 'perms': False, 'kids': False, 'extensions': True, 'asian': True, 'straightperms': True}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Hair Stylists', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Hair Salons', 'Skin Care', 'Blow Dry/Out Services', 'Hair Removal', 'Waxing', 'Makeup Artists']
name: Sognatore
text: I was staying at the Pennsylvanian in Pittsburgh for a business trip, so it pleased me that there was a place for me to get a haircut in the same building.  Jeanie did a great job on my hair.  She offered me a robe, so that my hair would not devour my clothes.  My stylist took time to cut my hair the way I wanted it and I could not be happier with the end result.  The view from my chair outlooking the window was a sight to behold.  The cleanliness of a salon is high on my list of priorities and Sognatore passed that test.The price for a men's haircut is $26, so it is rather steep for some.  Sognatore is closed Sunday & Monday.  I would also recommend making a reservation.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Massage Heights Bakery Square
text: As someone who travels weekly for business, including working long hours and bringing all luggage via carry-on, it takes a toll on my body, and I also tend to hold all this stress in my shoulders and back. While I was initially staying at the Marriott Springhill Suites at Bakery Square, I saw this establishment and called to inquire and make an appointment back on October 16th. I scheduled a 90 minute deep tissue massage with Jessica. Including tip, I paid $89.98. Great price for a first time visitor special!However, though I was happy with both the facility and the price, I found Jessica to be rather cold and short - no matter what I did to make small talk, build rapport, and/or explain my pain points in order to best mitigate. I almost felt as though I was the customer service professional providing the service, rather than the reverse - this was how far I had to go to establish a bond, and even then I felt more judged by Jessica than the reverse. Her attitude and demeanor were not something I'd want to experience again, and this is unfortunate given her chosen profession - helping people relax and feel comfortable.Also, the massage was decent - good when she got to my back, but the front leg and arm and neck massage was slightly awkward and uncomfortable, I recall. Also, though she asked about aromatherapy, I found it weird that she called it something like "smelly stuff" - unprofessional. Also, I wish I'd been offered hot stones, as I would have (and had planned to) happily add that to my service. All in all, I wasn't too impressed or pleased, but it wasn't terrible.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Jay Design
text: If you like natural soap with no dyes or artificial perfumes that can make some people like me break out in hives, Jay's Design makes some awesome soap. I bought one bar wrapped in a fancy package with vintage postcard art on it for a gift. Then I got several unwrapped bars for me. Their soap lathers nicely and I was pleased with their product. I would definitely go back and get some more soap another day.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
name: Oliverio Hair & Nails
text: Its not closed but it is lacking a bit in professionalism. I got a "style out" a couple weeks ago and was amused the brush he chose to use was missing most of its bristles. The stylist did have my hair looking better than when I walked in but I daresay the owner is a cheapskate. In addition to the sad brush, the owner is reluctant to use the credit card machine or accept checks so I paid cash. Fortunately I had the cash on me because normally I don't roll with greenbacks and debit everything.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Dean of Shadyside Salon
text: My sister insisted we go here for wedding hair.  I told her the horrible experience I had last time. She told her stylist about the horrible stuff that happened last time and said not to worry, that none of those people work there anymore (it was in Dec 2001 that they made my hair a frizzy mess for my brother's wedding).I am fairly certain, that due to my bad experience last time, they made sure I got the best hair guy. This is only the second time I've had a guy do my hair but he seemed to be one of the head honchos around. Short, nice fellow with a mustache whose name escapes me. Ed? possibly. He took the time to discuss what I wanted and took his time creating.I walked out with great curls. Not too poofy, not too tight, long pretty model on a runway curls. He also took the time to re position my rhinestone starfish (hey it was an aquarium wedding reception) three times to make sure it was perfect and pinned that sucker so it wouldn't move. So why four stars? Well one bridesmaid had to sit for 20 minutes and had to raise a ruckus before they started working on her hair and we were on a time crunch. I guess they were short a stylist but still, not nice to give my sister and mom a minor heart attack because they are whipcrackers when there's a time schedule. In the end, it all ended up ok. Parking is still difficult over there but the salon has improved. I believe our bridesmaid hair styles cost $40 a piece.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Avalon Lifestyles Nails & Spa
text: Not the best place to get nails, even though it's conveniently in the mall.  Yes they do the basics,  but they're not careful.  In fact, my nail technician nicked me a few times when cutting my cuticles.  When she applied the polish, it wasn't smooth and all over my cuticles.  For $17, I want a great manicure that can do better than myself.  Instead I got under average nails.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: L.A. Studio Nail & Spa
text: I still haven't found a decent nail salon in the Pittsburgh area.  This place is like the others.  They carry OPI and China Glaze polish, and they do manicures, pedicures, acrylic, gel, and waxing. SERCVICE: I had the regular mani and pedi.  The guy cut my cuticles too much, botched on the polish, and wasn't very helpful with suggestions on polish color.  Plus they overcharged me. If I'm paying to get my nails done, then I want them near perfect.  And this place did not add up.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Nail Studio II
text: I wasn't too impressed with this place.  It's clean but their nail techniques is old fashioned.  My mani was dull and my cuticles looked ragged.  For $15, I'm sure there are other nail places that does a much better job.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Creative Nails
text: I was a little unsure about a nail salon with all Vietnamese men workers.  Usually it's women.  I was referred through a friend, so I gave it a try.  I came here for a mani and pedi which is $45.  I thought the price was a little steep.  I was offered a variety of pedicures, but I chose a regular pedi.  First of all, he didn't clean up all the skin/cuticle area like I wanted.  Next he didn't apply the polish neatly, therefore it was streaky.  Finally, the instruments he used were not sanitized and used customer after customer.  I wouldn't come here again.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Great Clips
text: This Great Clips is downstairs in the plaza and backs up to the comic shop. My inexpensive haircut was good in my eyes, but more importantly, Mrs K. was impressed and she almost never says anything about my haircuts. So that should make this review count *twice.*Tip: When you're on the way, check in with their app and you'll be at the front of the line when you arrive.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': False, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Great Clips
text: If you're not using the Great Clips app on your phone to check in before you drive over to the salon, you're taking a chance that you'll have a long wait. I was driving past and decided to pop in. Oh, there's only one person waiting, so I parked my car and headed inside. While I was waiting, one of the online check-in people arrived. They're ahead of me. And then another online check-in person arrived. They're also ahead of me.Nope, I headed out.They were very nice about it, but the online check in is your place in line. Even if there are people who walk in ahead of you. It's a good system if you use it.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Shopping', 'Cosmetics & Beauty Supply', 'Hair Salons', 'Hair Stylists', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Barbers', "Men's Hair Salons"]
name: Supercuts
text: Easy and fast. While there was no one else waiting when I arrived, I was still glad that I had checked in with the app. It told me that there was no wait.My haircut was quick, it was good, and it was inexpensive. What more would you need? My stylist listened to my specifications and followed them perfectly. I have a haircut that I like.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantTakeOut': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Convenience Stores', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Food', 'Shopping', 'Drugstores', 'Cosmetics & Beauty Supply', 'Photography Stores & Services']
name: Walgreens
text: A very tight parking lot for this Walgreens and I would seriously recommend that you monitor your surroundings when you're going from the store to your car. It is a very tight parking lot.I didn't go in on this particular visit - we used the drive-through and had a great clerk taking care of our prescription. Top notch and just for her, she gets a star. Otherwise it would have been a one star visit.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Great Clips
text: Great Clips is a regular go to for me. I like that I can check-in when I'm on my way and see how long a wait that it's going to be. And this time, the wait was exactly what it said on the app - when I arrived at the store, I was next to be seen.Amanda did a fine job of cutting my hair, having reviewed the notes on file and then confirming them with me first. I have pretty simple needs for haircuts and this was exceeded today.I'm starting to get a little bugged by spending $14 for ten minutes of work, but when the cut is good like today, it's not too bad.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Walgreens
text: Another formulaic execution of the Walgreens system. This is a perfect store with the usual aisles of personal care, over-the-counter medications, a pharmacy, snacks and drinks and a seasonal aisle. I was able to purchase the cold meds I needed, a bottle of water with which to wash it down and a box of tissues for blowing my stuffed nose very quickly.It's a good store that is in the middle of absolutely nowhere.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Great Clips
text: Very simple haircut and they honored the $6.99 coupon that one of the other GC's had sent me. The gal did a good job and I'm pleased with it.Tip: Use the app to check in and you'll be ahead of the line.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Sport Clips
text: I've popped into here a couple of times. They do a decent job and sometimes it's nice to get a little bit more than the usual Supercuts or Great Clips. The massage doodad was a bit much but I did like the hot towel service. The stylist did a fine job. No complaints!$25 is a bit much for 25 minutes though.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'GoodForKids': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Great Clips
text: I'm sure I saw another Great Clips in this neighborhood. Yep, I did. There's one here in the plaza next to the Harris Teeter and there is another one on the other side of South Tryon next to the SuperTarget. This one here is brand new. Brand. New.But as with all of the Great Clips, they follow the same exact format and style. So no surprises here.Actually, one surprise. They were running a $5.99 February special. That's more than half off! And they took off what seemed like half of my hair too. (Bah-dum-pum.)Hey, I have simple needs for hair cuts and this place met them.

attributes: {'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}}
name: Great Clips
text: Quick and easy, this Great Clips is located in the same strip as Mama Ricotta's. I had checked in with their phone app and that let me know how long the wait would be, put me on the list and even gave me directions to the salon. When I arrived, I was the next to be seen.Great Clips has an internal database with my specifics in it. When the stylist brought me back, she confirmed that was still how I wanted my hair styled and she dug right in. I'm very pleased with the cut, which is exactly on my specifications.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Baxter Barber Shop
text: Great cut, great experience.They have 4 chairs and they stay busy.Convenient location in Baxter Village, you'll need to park on the street.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Petey's Barber Shop
text: If you're in Gastonia, you need to go by and check out Petey's.It's the gathering place to get your hair cut and talk sports. They have twolarge HD Plasmas.They also have a unique collection of framed stadiums from around the south, ACC, SEC, Southern Conf...you'll find them here.Ask for Bubba, he'll do you right.Appointments or walk-in's.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Tips & Toes
text: Hands down the best place in the area to get a mani and pedi that lasts until your nails grow!! Call in advance to make an appointment. The owner is nice, clean and used great quality polishes and preps to make a fantastic mani pedi!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Spa at Ballantyne
text: If you want a great spa in Charlotte with amenities.. this is your place.Steam roomGymOutdoor poolIndoor jacuzzi and poolsI had a body treatment that left my skin feeling super soft after the summer. Pricy, but worth it as I spent 4-5 hours there... perfect relaxing day.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Elements Massage
text: Michelle is the best therapist I have been to in Charlotte. No frills at Elements, in and out massage and in return they offer reasonable pricing. The staff is always very friendly and the location is easy.Michelle is amazing if you enjoy deep tissue massages.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Elegant Nail
text: Renovated a month ago. Quick, easy, friendly clean staff. A great selection of OPI and Essie colors. I had Lienn who was great! Quick dryers and easy check out. I will definitely go more :)Note: Cash tip only

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Skin Care', 'Shopping', 'Cosmetics & Beauty Supply', 'Local Flavor', 'Makeup Artists', 'Beauty & Spa']
name: Jeffre Scott
text: I came in for my brows and Jeffre took his time and worked perfection! To the point where I haven't even been in for months and I don't feel like a furry gremlin!The cosmetics are all very high quality. I tried the double creamy lip pensil to start (we all know they dry your lips out) this one does not.  I always use a variety of make up  lines, so I am going back for more.Jeffre use to be a buyer for Barney's in NYC and it shows. He has excellent taste in the products he selects for his stores.

name: Parvin Spa
text: Very disappointing. I was searching for a new salon moving to Clt and this was a recommendation. Not sure if the lady who typically does these was out, but the one who did wiped me the wrong way after she was done and well....ladies we know what a series of problems that causes.Would never go back after that experience!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Hand & Stone Massage and Facial Spa
text: Despite living near this place and often seeing their ads, I just recently tried it.  I have always been leary of chain massage places after hearing stories of pushy up sells for memberships that override the importance of the actual massage.  At a recent Yelp event, my wife won a gift card for a 50 minute relaxation gift card.  She gave the gift card to me since she has yet to use a massage gift card I gave to her for another place.  Apart from fearing the chain massage locations, I have almost always received awesome massages from independent therapists and local massage businesses which is another reason I was hesitant to try this place.  Hand and Stone is a nice place.  The lobby is mostly inviting and relaxing, but the placement of products for sale deters somewhat from the relaxation experience.  The rooms are nicely equipped, clean, and smell very nice.  This is one of those reviews where the cliched "I want to give 5 stars  but..." comes into play.  Was my massage decent?  Yes.  Have I had better massages?  Yes.  I left relaxed, but not feeling like jello s I usually do after a massage. Would I go back here?  Maybe, based on proximity and atmosphere.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Serendipity Massage
text: Finally, there is a place in Fort Mill that specializes in massages.  There are other places to get a massage, but they are almost all in salons or chiropractic offices.I purchased a 60 minute massage through Groupon, which is always good when trying a place for the first time.  The business is in a small office park near the intersection of Gold Hill Rd and Hwy 160 (about 2 miles from the current Charlotte Knights stadium or 2 miles from the Rivergate shopping center in Steele Creek).  The small waiting area is dimly lit and very relaxing, which was nice.  They have many therapists here, and mine for this session was Sonja.  She was very good and worked out quite a few kinks.  The whole setting was very good and relaxing.  I could hear little else outside the room during the massage and almost fell asleep a couple of times.  I felt very refreshed and relaxed after the massage.  The only reason the review is only four stars is that although this massage was very good, I have had better.  On a scale of 1-10, I would give the massage and 8.  Would I go back here?  Definitely.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Eden Therapy & Massage
text: This is a very nice place with several good therapists offering a variety of services.  It's not a large chain, or a chain at all for that matter.  The owner is one of the therapists.  I would patronize them more if I lived a little closer.  Last time I went, Crystal gave me an amazing deep tissue massage.  Those aren't always relaxing and can be temporarily painful, but after walking the streets of NYC for a few days, I really needed it and it didn't hurt at all.  I am not sure if she still works there, but there also was another girl named Jennifer that was very good too.  The waiting area is very calming and relaxing too.  If you're in the South End/Dilworth/Uptown area and need a good massage at a reasonable price without pressures of a membership, I would definitely recommend Eden.

name: Great Clips
text: I know that at a franchised "salon",  it's all about the stylist you get, but there aren't many good ones here.  One of the worst haircuts I received.  They rushed it even though they weren't busy.  I've had much better luck at the one on Johnston Rd next to Lowe's Foods.

text: The massages are good but they advertise 60 minutes and only give you 45. Not really worth it with the other places around that actually give you what they say and what you pay for. Hours are very limited too - no weekends.

categories: ['Hair Stylists', 'Hair Salons', 'Shopping', "Men's Hair Salons", 'Cosmetics & Beauty Supply', 'Beauty & Spa']
name: Supercuts
text: Right over the state line on Hwy 521 is this relatively new Supercuts.  They sent us some coupons in the mail so I decided to give them a shot.  I almost always get my hair buzzed short with the same length all the way around.  Although their normal adult haircut is $14.95, they charge only $10 for this cut, so I have returned a few times.  Although it's possible to mess up a buzz cut, they have yet to do it here, so I will keep returning.  They also do color, highlights, etc, for reasonable prices.  One negative is that a child's haircut is $13.95 - only a dollar cheaper than the adult haircut as the dad in front of me found out.  I've never seen a franchised salon charge that much for a kids cut.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Carmen Carmen Salon & Spa
text: I'm bald and I know it, so why you ask am I reviewing a trip to Carmen Carmen?  My wife asked me to take my 6 year old daughter because they were having a special on kids cuts for $25.00.  I called for an appointment at around 10:30 and they asked me to bring her in at 12:00.  Awesome, away we go.When we arrived we were greeted promptly by a nice welcoming receptionist who called my daughter by name.  She offered us something to drink and asked us to wait in the nice waiting area.  While I was there I checked the place out since I've clearly never had a reason to grace these halls.  It was a hip, salon type place with loud bumping music giving Carmen Carmen a great vibe.  The reading material was not geared for bald middle aged men which is to be expected.  We waited about 30 minutes past our appointment time which was kind of annoying, but it was passed by people watching and internet surfing.We were brought back by our "young stylist" (listed on her card) Lia.  She was great and I immediately thought that this experience was going to be MUCH better than Pigtais and Crewcuts or wherever we've taken my daughter before.  She said my daughter down in the chair and asked what we were doing with her hair.  She then took her over to the wash station and shampooed and conditioned her hair.  Then she took about 30 minutes to give her the best cut that she's ever had.  She layered, cut, trimmed and roller brushed her heart out.  She conversed with my daughter the whole time and made her feel special.  When we were done everyone was happy.  Like I said, I don't do salons for obvious reasons.  I liked it here and think that even for full price $35.00 my daughter will keep coming back to Lia for her cuts.  You just don't get this type of personal service at the other haircut factories.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Baxter Nails and Spa
text: Alright I'm a guy, and comfortable enough with my manhood to get a manicure so there.  I had a meeting down the road and had about 30 minutes to spare so in we go for a quick manicure.I've only done this one other time in my life so let's face it, I'm not going to be a regular but on the surface it was a great experience.  My nails are generally bitten so this lady had her work cut out for her....but she handled it like a pro.  Nice clipping, filing, soaking and hand massaging.  All in all, nice!  The lady was pleasant and worked efficiently to get me out of there in the alotted time.  I will say this, my nails have never been so shiny.I think it was like $15.00 and for a bit of "me" time it was worth it.

name: Pigtails & Crewcuts
text: I took my 5 year old daughter here this past week after work.  Just so you know, Tuesday's and Saturdays are the busiest days since they do a rewards program and offer double stamps.  I walked in and the receptionist was honest about a 15 minute wait, and there were tons of people there.  Always a good sign right?  After our wait my daughter was welcomed by the lady who was going to trim her hair to sit in the race car chair which she helped her climb into.  She asked me what I wanted done and followed my (or what my wife told me) wishes to a tee.  It was a great experience and I perceived it as better than going to a Great Clips or something.It was a bit pricey ($18.00 + tip) for a kids cut IMO but hey what isn't expensive for kids these days?  I checked in on the YELP App and got $1.00 off my cut so be sure to take advantage of that.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: My Bella Spa
text: Ok, here it goes....I was attending an event last Saturday night and my friend, another male, was wearing open toed shoes.  He suggested a mani / pedi and since I'm always open for an adventure I figured what the hay.  We got a recommendation from a neighbor and set out for Blakeney.  I am a happily married man, comfortable in myself so despite the ribbing from my friends I had a good experience here.We were welcomed at the front desk and ordered the "deluxe spa" mani pedi.  We were offered a drink and escorted to a group of comfy massage chairs.  Never before did I know what went on in these places, but it was pretty relaxing.  Hot water foot bath and personal attention what could be better?  The chairs were arranged in a big circle so you can see everyone else.  My never attended to before feet and fingers left happy.  The "wax" that they dipped my feet in was a little weird, but I guess it did some good :-)

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Classy Nails
text: Asian family run.  Wife likes friendly atmosphere and good detailed work.  And can get there in golf cart from Sun City.Hard working with everyone making the family successful.  Even dad is at the nails.  It is so impressive to walk in as you are warmly greeted and treated as a special guest as a guy waiting for his wife.  Lots of shy smiles...charming.My wife says that she likes that they insist that your nails are dry before you leave.  But as sometimes ladies do leave with wet polish, Classy Nails very kindly will touch you up...with out lecture.A classy place, with a classy attitude.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Avalon Nail Salon
text: Kindness.We were wheeling my 96 year old dad through Southpark Mall and he complained about a torn thumb nail.  The nail needed to be trimmed and filed.Passing Avalon, I went inside and explained my father's nail condition, asking if they would do a one nail job.  Reluctantly, the older woman scowled a yes and said, "One dollar."  And then assigned one of the young women the task.OK...I went outside, got my dad out of the wheel chair and, holding his arm, brought him inside.  The staff reaction was immediate.  The designated woman indicated, graciously, a seat and returned with a sterile pack of instruments.  She studied the nail, clipped and filed it to perfection.  As I reached for my wallet she said, "No charge."  But I gave her two dollars "for luck," thanked her, nodded to the old lady and helped my dad out.I was very favorable impressed with their courtesy, the sanitized pack of instruments, the cleanliness of the interior, the nice tables, dryers and foot soak-er chairs and especially with their courtesy and considerations.Asian cultures revere ancestors and are very respectful and accommodating to seniors, so this was culture in action.Thank you very much Avalon.  You are a classy operation well beyond nails.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': False, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Carmel Span Family Barber Shop
text: Have been coming here over twelve years.  Son married and moved his family to the Charlotte area in 2003 so came here whenever timing had me needing a haircut while visiting.  Then we moved into a senior Del Webb community in Fort Mill, SC and I started to be a bi-weekly customer in 2012.Charlie is my regular barber and is now my 99 year old dad's barber.  He gives a good haircut, man-style with eyebrow, ear and nose hairs trimmed and hair cut as you like.  For dad, his visits include a shampoo along with his haircut. The shop is closed on Sundays and all the barbers have different schedules as to which days they work.  Saturdays is mostly a kid day, but is a first-come first-served situation.  When a barber opens up, you get cut.  Otherwise, you make an appointment  for the barber of your choice or with whomever is available when you want to come in.A few years ago Carmel Span became a family affair as my wife started to get her haircuts from Vickie Penny.  And she has quite a long-time following of regulars, so you need to call for an appointment in advance.  And Vickie is a very nice lady.Prices are reasonable and the shop is clean.  Ample parking out back.They have a good crew here.

name: Regency Beauty Institute
text: Excited to announce that the instructor, Ms. Barbara, does a phenomenal job in keeping the students on their A game while balancing the client needs. How so? 1) She ensures that each student over-stand the importance of cleanliness and clean while you go;2) she checks in often to ensure the work is at the professional level although these are students. She's not micromanaging and over bearing. She strikes a balance that affords the student confidence yet makes sure the client being serviced feels comfortable then excited about the finished work. 3) From booking to shampooing and in the chair service.... The instructor is everywhere helping each person stay as efficient as possible. You're not going to wait without being addressed; you won't have to sit and feel as if you're being forgotten; you will get what you're after and you'll still get an honest consult. 4) They have the DESIGN essential honey nectar relaxer system here. This is soooo essential because a lot of folks around here may have Design Essential but not the nectar time release system. This matter because of the pH balance, extra conditioning, A1c attention to re balancing the hair after such a strong chemical. I've asked shops to get this specific one and to no avail. I tried empire but they only have the basic offering. This offering is the reason I don't know what strength to use because it's standard and I'm not overly sensitive but can be with each relaxer retouch. Well, this avoids all that.5 stars for DE NECTAR RELEASE RELAXER4.2 stars for the music is a good mix. Old and new pop with a hint of R&B3.9 stars for the lobby and skittish reception and the cash only as of the last 6 weeks. 5 stars for finding a caring instructor that strikes the proper balance of professionalism and caring for clients + students. 4.5 stars for the stlying. I see decent work consistently. Why not the full 5? Pricing. 2.2 stars on pricing. Relaxers should provide for add-on or included styling. Roller sets are $12 extra. Just like if you only got a la carte. A wrap is included in a retouch and it takes forever for my hair to dry without a rod or roller in it. 2.7 hours later I had to go. Thermal add-ons are reasonableCuts are $9 (pretty much the same everywhere).Manicures have simple stations. Pedicures have a basic station. No massaging chairs. Facials are offered here. Receive a discount or free service after the 5th or 6th visit. Winning~~THE PLACE IS CLEAN, ORDERLY, & TRYING TO GET YOU TO A HAPPY PLACE. I THINK EVERY ONE CAN APPRECIATE EFFORT LIKE THIS.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Sparrsh Massage & Facial Spa
text: I loved my massuse. Her name is Kandance/Candance ... I forgot ask but she's thorough, attentive, prompt with her start time and also executed my back facial.  I found this place via Groupon. And I am glad because it was a good find I purchased a massage back facial and a facial. Candice took care of the massage and back facial with very good detail to her work and when the pressure was a bit much for me as only twice but she had just it accurately actually superbly. Now she start as soon as I walked in and I must admit I was a bit caught off guard no one had me complete any paperwork but I'm more appreciative that we started immediately and I arrived ten minutes before my appointment to complete paperwork.I was told for the facial that I was just a basic facial with the Groupon so it would not include a mask and extractions I upgraded or another $40 which is a bit pricey and I don't have to have it again. The owner completed my facial and she was nice enough.  The place and Decor is very aesthetically pleasing.  Water is offered in a wine glass and the robes are provided as you go between the rooms; however, the owner could stand to replace the sheets. As the sheets on the table for the facial room or estheticians room wasn't dirty but you could tell they had been stained.Anywho, I had every intention on giving five stars after getting my massage but that facial left a lot to be desired she was throwing her extractions but literally I think the group hunt yeah the group was $100 then another 40 to upgrade the face show I feel like it was a Hustle and with that being said I've had better facials I mean kneaded relief is great. Nonetheless; I will give kudos for the extractions on my face so that was done very well. I had to hold my mask longer than the five minutes I was initially told (she left me for 15m) this would not have been a big deal had I not needed to make a trip to Rock Hill and return to work.All in all the prices have increased because there's a manual change on the menu but I will return for services from Candace as again...I  applaud her effort, her pressure, her professionalism and her bedside manner. Also, she does a great job stretching the neck and I usually have to find people to do that. She did it without me saying a word about it. Love it!!They are right off exit 90 past the QT in the shopping strip. So you can get some cheap gas and go get a massage and facial and there's a nail shop next door and a gym so it's a win-win all around.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Envy Nails
text: Ok. They opened in January 2011 and they have been running deals every since. I first visited in Feb. 2011 and I love that (a) they are new so service is still optimal, (b) family owned, (c) the husband and wife genuinely get along, (d) they were smart to invest in some of the BEST MASSAGE CHAIRS, (e) nicely decorated, (f) always clean, (g) good/great location - close to campus/capitol and westside, (h)the DEALS KEEP ME HOOK BUT THE (i) GREAT WORK ON MY TOES KEEP ME LOYAL. Additional Kudos: I was actually educated on what I needed to keep my feet happy & healthy without any sales pitch. 1b) My Sorority sister was educated as well that she didn't need the razor to her feet and was given steps to keep it that way. 2) I asked for an extra massage on my feet the 1st visit and got it. Think it's a fluke?? Well.. no on my return visit I have had different people and each time I was provided exactly what I asked for. 3) I will admit the Husband worked on me today and he didn't take out as much time as all the other women but he did some reflexology work on my feet that was well appreciated. 4) They are respectful when addressing clients. 5) Although English may not be everyone's first language they are mindful to speak in English as much as possible when in front of customers. 6) Great color options, of course OPI, and I've never been in pain. 7) I've worn a dress twice which went to my ankles but before I could even ask for a towel to cover my lap one was provided....BOTH TIMES. I love manners as most Southerners do but when it's given and it's unexpected it just touches something in you. :-) IN SHORT: It's so easy to tip & over-tip. I pray they have a long and successful business journey - here in Madison. P.S. I posted the coupon link which includes a photo. Hope you use it.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Cool and Cute Nails
text: Completed my appointment and went to update the review and alas found another reviewer commentary and I wish her the best in finding someone as I know the struggles. That being said, let me explain what I like: The clean place. It's not jam-packed full of things and nice appointed. It's in a shared building space and it works. The signage tells you she's in Suite #8, complete the forms at the desk (I missed this because my appt was for 5pm and I thought I should just walk straight back), she asked me to return and complete a form then I read the instructions to take a seat. What I don't like: I was rescheduled, texted and was told I'm a priority so do just that - when I arrive... I don't expect to see anyone getting serviced - just you waiting on me. Nope~ I had to wait. I must be getting old or enough Judges have drilled on about punctuality that I don't care for the tardiness - not from me or anyone else. It just says my time is more valuable than the person you have waiting for you. Moving along.... I thought about leaving and just getting a refund. Glad I stayed because we talked. She acknowledged it and learned about my nail preferences, just clear please and keep my length. No need to even each nail length just square them off. She has a lot of color options and I've been to enough nail places to last me. She's educated about her profession and willing to teach you whatever she can to help you achieve what you want. I'm not interested in the latest looks; I simply want healthy nails and want to avoid breakage as much as possible. Not too talkative - this I like. Considerate enough. Working hard to establish a loyal clientele. Didn't speak ill of any other places that I named or explained my experiences. She's overly booked due to a GroupOn deal and looking for help. Across from the westside Raddisson Hotel. Uses an online booking service via GroupOn. Takes cards but I will bring cash next time to cut down on service fees. I'm conscientious of such when it's a small business and she's trying to grow her business. Has full massage chairs for the pedicures. Two in place. WIll host ladies nights or have a group event. In acknowledging me as being a priority - I didn't want any freebie upgrades, I just want my appointment to start and end on time. She received this well and the proof will come at the next appointment so we'll see. Drawback: She didn't massage the lotion in my hands once she squirted this on. Now, maybe I'm wrong but everyone else does this especially the Asian-owned salons but hey~ I know next time to watch and see if she'll complete it with others. Maybe Kim D. was the patron getting serviced when I called a few months back to schedule but that's what happens when you're small and new - you dont' have enough folks around to do everything. She offers a loyalty program - prepay and get 2 shellac mani's for $30. Book before you leave or book at your next appointment. I hope she does well and grow her business.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Vip Nails & Spa
text: This is really  a 2.5 star review. Why?It's an ok place so there's 3.  ** No Building Signage on the Moniker **But I've experienced better so there's 2. Would I go again? Only if someone else was paying and my regular spot was closed for good. Hence 2.5 plus the average of 3+2/2=2.5 (call me for a mean)Here's the deal: Went on Friday for a Bridal Party extravaganza. The bride wanted us to have the same color polish and this would be our treat. I could've went without. They opened at 9am. I think they normally open at 9:30am. She's all in love with these folks and has been going here for years - I think it was because she lived directly across the street like most grad students and went out of convenience. I know she's a tipper because she does hair on the side so she believes in big tips coming back to her. BUT ERGH maybe I just go the girl that partied tooooooo hard the night before.Only 3 of us. 1 getting her mani. The bride is dealing with the one that seems to be in charge. She preps for the pedi station. It appears clean and the place is brightly lit - I will admit I was shocked it was in disarray or disrepair like a nail shop I used to patronize on the westside. I get the last pedastal. Young thin girl comes in with her body hugging dress and it's short. She preps, I'm put in the water and it's luke -tepid at best. I like it to be warm - not scalding hot but warm. I make do. The massager controls are super glued to the arm of the chair. It's somewhat broken down so they have to prop it for me. When the other 4-5 folks start getting pedi's I noticed that my girl didn't "bang my legs" like the older women were doing. Cute young boy came back to town and he was being made fun of by an older woman (it was for our benefit to laugh and we did). Back to my pedi: she did the most basic job and polished my toes. One side of their drying station doesn't work. I tipped and that was that. If you can go to the shorter middle age woman or the average height but taller lady with long black hair (she wore two French braids and the hair length was in the middle of her back) as they seem to be attentive and detailed. I didn't have to deal with the "hood" matters such as the previous Yelper wrote. BUT there was a note taped to the drying station that you will be asked to leave if (1) you talk to loud, (2) disturb others, (3) try to fight. And there's another sign that says no children unless they are being serviced. I was shocked how many folks stopped in at 9:30am trying to get work done. She had to turn away everyone until noon. Sidebar: POSITIVE ON EVERYONE SPEAKING ENGLISH IN FRONT OF US. 1 TV & it's angled that you'll never see it while in the pedicure pedastals. but there's a sofa for folks to wait in front of the pedi station along with 2 folding chairs.

name: Kneaded Relief Day Spa & Wellness
text: Colored me surprised and shocked that I never wrote a review on KRDS. 1st, for everyone looking for a deal... this is the place. Buy the packages, get the monthly deals offered and always and I MEAN ALWAYS BUYYY THE Gift certificate offerings. 2nd, I always bought the gift certificates to gift to professors and classroom teachers and used the 1/12 to ensure I saw them monthly. Otherwise, I wouldn't have made such diligent efforts to self-care. 3rd, I like Nicole & Duke for their vision and hiring good people while actually being honorable. How so? Yo!! I started with them on S. Park and it wasn't the ohhh lalala place yet the service was beyond reproach. 4th, They find some of the best and most attentive therapists. I never got a manicure in the new Fitchburg place but I definitely found my trademark OPI Chicago Toast color via them while on S. Park and 5th, they listen to their clientele. I haven't made it back while in town but I hated those benches for pedicures. Looked online to book my upcoming appointment and they've got the individual massage thrones for pedicures. Now I can't wait to experience it all. 6th, The locker room and robe and process and waiting room helps EVEN ME unwind and prepare to receive "kneaded relief" no pun intended but yoooo. I don't meditate and "clear my mind" but I practice yoga and can say - I'm just designed to run in auto pilot yet the therapy room even works for after the massage and facial. MOST IMPORTANTLY: I am and have been judging and measuring places based on this location and all my experiences with the company since 2004. I must admit: Sundara in the Dells don't compare (it's like judging pineapples to apples - sounds the same but Sundara can work for overnight and when there's a snowfall + for coupling but Kneaded Relief wins for everything). I am comfortable bringing the kid here. Bioelements work but I would rather have CellexC. I did stop uying the products once I switched over to CellexC but I still came here for application even though the guys on Odana, RZ, use CellexC but they don't have the touch KRDS provides and I've come to expect. Inbox for more details but Nicole & Duke stand with their team members if they have family issues, some have endured and survived cancer treatments, give back to the community and all the while bringing up their own family. Look! I respect that. Oh! and I would recommend Duke for working out (EXERCISE) although I didn't choose him - it was simply a matter of convenience and I'm the only everything in my family so it just couldn't work. Well, my reviews show where I go/went and exactly why.

name: Myles's Nails
text: 3 stars for $26 pedicure and cleaniness of the shop. That's were the fun stopsWent in with a sorority sister and couldn't justify sitting and watching her get a pedi to pass the time. So I saw $26 and thought ok. Checked for tools and cleanliness and felt ok~ I'll give them a shot. Why she goes here? I forgot but she won't again. So she says!The good:1) They were busy so we soaked for some time as requested2) They have wi-fi. They pay the Library to teether and it works well3)THEY HAVE LITTLE KID MASSAGE CHAIRS & ALL. SOOOOO CUTE.IT'S ADORABLE.  4) THAI APPEARED TO BE KNOWLEDABLE AND HE'S A NATIVE ENGLISH SPEAKER. 5) NICE COLOR SELECTION. UP TO DATE ON NEW TECHNIQUES6) APPARENTLY THEY WAX AND EVERYTHING ELSE. What could improve: 1) Upfront pricing. I had on my Shellac Pedicure from VDazzle and he charged an extra $5 for removal. Really? He didn't tell me this when he started solely when we finished. 1b- To remove the polish all he did was use the tool (name aludes me now) and a bunch of acetone. I don't think this is healthy for my nail bed but whatever.2) No pedi parafin like ENVY Nails. The more I write the more I'm reliving my experience and thinking a 2 star should be here but I'll proceed. 3) The mani turned to Shellac so of course the price goes up and I ask how much...4) Agree to the shellac mani but how about this. More drilling then soaking in ACETONE to get rid of the Shellac. Now this is my 1st Shellac removal. Maybe everyone is doing this. If they are - I'm no longer getting shellac. I normally only wear clear on my nails because I don't like when the polish doesn't last but Shellac appeared to be the remedy. 5) I got a clear Shellac. Sounds nice in theory & it is glossy BUT it just won't work for me. The obvious issue: dirty nails under the tips on my bed. So I'm always pickingto  make sure they are clean. 6) He cut down my nails without asking. He tried this during the pedi but I caught him. This time I didn't. So my right hand is shorter. I prefer to be asked what length do you want. My nails are long & I prefer them to be that way. I don't care about wearing my nails short but people pay for length - WHY WOULD YOU THINK I WANT THEM SHORT WHEN WOMEN DO PAY FOR LONG FAKE NAILS?? When I asked, he said - because one was shorter so he was making them all the same length. I'm like - nope! that one will just have to be short. These are my human nails I could care less about an even appearance. Anywhoo, I'm not upset about it that I'd argue or something...this is simply my typing or touchscreen hand now. Moving on. What should have been a $38 experience based on the posted price ($26 Spa Pedi or $38 Spa Pedi/Mani) turned into a $56 ordeal before tip. WTh!Here's the itemization:$26 spa pedi$5 pedi removalthe remainder for your mani. I asked well aren't you going to cut my cuticles around my fingernail bed? He said that will be extra. THAT COMMENT WILL NOW MAKE THIS A 2 STAR REVIEW. Any guy off the street nows a manicure is a manicure. That entails clipping away old skin around the nail bed and pushing back the cuticle. Yeah~ 2 stars is all that is needed. No 2.5, especially not a 3. I'll update this if my regular place does the same because maybe this is the industry standard and I'm simply unlearned in this matter.
