name: V'Dazzled Nail Spa & Boutique
text: 5 Stars for the Effort & Concept4 stars for her work (Shellac Pedicure is what I got) 3 Stars for the furniture and ambiance (I simply prefer the massage chairs at any and every nail salon)It's a clean and friendly place. She's decorated well and I'm respecting the fact that a start up budget is small and money has to spread to cover so much in such a little amount of time. I came because of the GROUPON and will return because of her designs and STUDENT discount for the kid. Her pedicure seats are on raised platforms with a view of the LCD TV. Up to date magazines. Clean and comfortable. I AM JUST A LOYALIST TO THE MASSAGE CHAIRS. I trust when she grows and her clientele roll is longer then she'll upgrade. Until then, what's in place is good enough. She's a one woman operation (when I visited) so I wish she would have told me so and I would have arrived later than booked because I had to wait 17-20minutes before we got started as she was winding down on a manicure. Again, a clean environment makes me happy so I don't have to worry about infection. The boutique side has clothing for sale. A few pieces are nice but the jeans are super cute.Respect the fact that she's young and trying to establish a respectable business. That's worth supporting in my book.

name: Paul Mitchell The School Charlotte
text: The director is Ms. Hunter and she's anything but polite, responsive nor professional in the customer service arena. Our student, Cleveland, will be the stand out star in this review. The floor under the receptionist booth is dirty. See pictures. The issue I have is a simple rod set as booked on the phone, reiterated at confirmation and consult could not be performed as it would "take too long." Now all this was said outside of my presence but today it wasn't a matter of taking too long but a matter of it couldn't be performed as the service requested, A roller set, wouldn't look right. This is maybe a c4 texture that's curly naturally. Just pull the hair and rod it. Well, now Ms. Hunter's premise is she wouldn't rod it based on how tightly curled the natural hair is...so the service would not have ever been performed because "it would NOT look done." Thank you for that but just give what's requested. We literally didn't want heat on the hair and so long as it was rolled we would have been perfectly happy. How would this have been known?? If this was the "true" issue then it could have been presented to me and I would have signed off on it. That's how. Well,TODAY, I was caught at the door my a leader supervising (after speaking with Hunter and the other employee instructor that was present) to sign off on the hair work. This is new as it wasn't asked before. I then run the theory that was just provided to me by Hunter. If the style won't look right will it be omitted? He was confused. I restated and then he provided the taught outcomes: Never say no to a client. but you can say no to a service. sounds reasonable. He provides: if a service can't be performed then they will offer two (2) alternatives. He goes on to say he wasn't here so he doesn't know what happened last time. My point: if that's the policy then it's immaterial who's present or not. Everyone should execute said policy and process. Whoa!!! Now, I'm decidedly disgusted. On top of that I learned today...it's $12 for the wash and dryThen another $12 for the flat iron. Quit it....This is why Regency is out of business AND EXACTLY WHY I believe Paul Mitchell has  limited their students to only a few types of texture hair. What I mean? If you only get to practice on 2 or 3 hair types.... when will you ever learn how to do all hair textures/types? S/N: Our fully licensed salon and separate stylists only charge $30/for cut, style and that includes sit under dryers. It's just that she's allllllllll the wayyyy over by UNCC and this is really right on the Gold line and coming from Uptown this location works for me. Price aside... I don't care for the apathetic attitude and rudeness encountered with Hunter.

name: Aamavi Africa Hair Salon
text: Okay, so here's the deal. 5 stars for the atmosphere and the ladies. I love that they lock the doors. Sunlight or evening - locked! 1 star for braids slipping out the 1st week. Like day 3 and 4 several (meaning more than six - 6) braids slid or fell out. I did return and the ladies that didn't do the initial work were not present. No one complained they simply got to work - no waiting. When I went to ask why is this happening as I read the other reviews - they summoned over someone who could speak English so I broke out my patois and carry on. It was explained it could be a few things - short hair, braided too loose, something else and I had to break into Frenglish because I can't say somethings in patois plus it's Creole French at best not even Haitian creole french so I struggle more than any other speaker. IN short we had to establish the hair isn't short and we've been wearing braids for at least eight years and only experienced this for the first time. Anywhoo, the braids fell out again plus 2 more. MY WORD!!! I pleaded upon this return that "Look, I like y'all and want this to work but for $160 this can't be acceptable"Upon entry I didn't realize or know they want you to pay before service. I was going to swipe until she mentioned the fee. She offered the ATM but it has a fee as well so I went to Publix. I paid at the finish. I tipped as they used two ladies and got the work done in 3 hours maybe 3.45 hours. Well, tonight 11/21 - we finally got the missing braids redone and the braider was shocked that her first braids put in SLID OUT WHILE the client was still in the chair. I was sooo excited this happened as it stopped everything and made the ladies all get involved to figure out the possibilities of what's going on. I am starting to believe it's the hair. Look y'all, we don't allow tight braiding as we still have edges in this family. Folks have been braiding this hair from Wisconsin to Aabie's in the Queen City. Braids just don't slide out. Also, they talked the kid out of the big box braids and I get it they didn't want things to look old and cost a lot of $$ before the time should be up for a rebraid. At the end of the day - I'd like to give higher stars but I'm stretching with the 3 because I like the safety, cleaniness, ladies that work here and location.

name: Solar Nails
text: My sister and I stopped in for a manicure/pedicure.  I enjoyed my time there as I had never had a waxed manicure/pedicure.  It was a different experience and fun.  My pedicure was nice, would have preferred better massaging, but it was good and my toenails look excellent - had a flower put on my big toes and they did a fabulous job.My only complaint is my fingers are already chipped and the nail polish has come off on quite a few fingers since Saturday.  My own doings could do a better job.

name: Sanctuary Massage and Facial Spa
text: Oh my goodness!Kevin and I had not been to a couple massage in a couple of years and we were overdue.  All of our places that we had been too previously were on the other side of town so it was a matter of finding something closer to home.  After reviewing multiple reviews on Yelp and looking at pricing of different places, we finally decided on Sanctuary Massage.We knew we wanted a Saturday or Sunday (yes they have Sunday appointments!!) appointment with two females so I called in to book.   It took a little while to find something available, I believe we had a month and half to two month wait before we could get something scheduled.  It was worth the wait!Kevin had Irma giving him his massage and I had Pam giving me my massage.  Kevin thought that was the best massage he has had yet!!  I would rank mine right up there as well.  I really enjoyed it because it was a true full body message and they gave us a full 60 minute message, not cheating us out of 5 minutes to relax and get changed!  We both thought our therapists gave the right intensity at the right time.I think my only complaint...very small one...is that the rooms are not on the interior of the building like at other places I have been to.  While they have room darkening curtains, that doesn't stop you from hearing outside noises.  They are in a relatively quiet business park (especially for a Sunday), but I did hear a car horn at one point.The messages were so great that we booked to go back later in the year.  Looking forward to making this a quarterly event as Sanctuary has some of the best pricing with the best massages!

name: Forever Young Salon & Spa
text: After coming here for 2 years, I am ready to look for a new stylist.  It really pains me to say this, but I'm tired of my experiences.I've had my hair colored 3 times now since last November, and it has been what I have asked for and fantastic!  That is one area that I can't complain about, but I hope to find someone that can duplicate.My cuts have really been the issue.  The last time was the only time that I truly loved my cut.  All others have been good, but not exactly what I have wanted.  This time was just bad.I think the issue is that my stylist blow dries out my hair so big, not at all how I style it, so it is hard for me to see the actual length and layers.  It's styled for her instead of me.  So, I like it at the time, but when I get home, I immediately straighten it out, then I see what it really looks like and how I would see it on a day to day basis.I like my main length and then my layers to be very different.  Typically, my current stylist and any other stylist I've been to create the layers too close to my main length for my liking.  This week, I asked for my main hair to be just below the shoulders and my layers to be chin length.  My stylist did not want to go that short, so I said fine, don't cut it that much.  She proceeds to blow dry it big after the cut, but in the end, I ask for it to be cut more.  She again didn't think that was a good idea, but cut it to my liking.  She mentioned she liked it, but liked my hair longer (really inappropriate to say to a client).  Thanks though.This is the issue with blow drying out the hair big.  I get home, straighten it, and looking at the main length, there were two small sections that were longer than everything else.  They did not look right at all, as if they had been missed.  Then looking at my layers, which are not chin length, they are longer and closer to my main layer.Just in the end I am frustrated I did not get what I asked for and I want to go to someone who can ultimately be willing to give what I ask for.

name: Great Clips
text: I went back for a haircut yesterday, unfortunately Jewell was not there, but I decided to go for this Great Clips again.  Had I had another hair stylist, this could have possibly been another 4 star review.  My review with Jewell still stands, but my experience yesterday needs to be mentioned.  Most of my 1 star reviews are because of bad customer service, and this is no different.I walked in and was told it was a 30-40 minute wait.  I decided to wait it out, it actually did not take that long to wait, but here is my issue...  There were only two stylist working and they were super busy after the work day was over for most people.  I had just watched them finish with 3-4 people and there were still three people waiting at the store and three people had just signed in online, so you knew it was going to be continuously busy.  At that time, one of the hair stylist went out back.  One of the guys that checked in online came in and asked if there was just one stylist there.  The other stylist said "there is another one here but she went out back, not sure why she went out back, but she did."  Not only did this one stylist make it look bad for Great Clips to go take a smoke break when you have essentially 6 people waiting, but she also made it bad for her coworker to have to give an excuse to incoming customers about her break.  Just great, I was the next in line for this person because the other two in front of me wanted to wait for the other stylist.  I could have done the same, but I decided to go ahead with her.  Of course after having a smoke break, she reeked of smoke.  Not everyone appreciates that smell or wants your smoke hands to be working with their hair.There is a time and place for smoke breaks, but not when you have six people waiting and have a haircut to do immediately after.Aside from all of that, my haircut was pretty good, but she did not really like it when I wanted to cut my hair a little bit more than originally requested.  So not the greatest attitude either, but at least my hair does not look bad.West Town Market - Please work with L****n and her customer service if you are going to employ her.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Massage Envy - Ballantyne
text: Awful awful awful!  Kevin and I decided to get a couple's massage for our birthdays.  This is the 3rd couples massage that we have had together (three different places).I really hate how this business is run.  We were asked both by the receptionist and by our massage therapists when the last time we had had a massage - a year.  They both had the snotty response, really? Why are you not having more?  We need to fix that.  Massages are a treat for us, and they need to accept that is what we want.The massages themselves were the worst of the three.  I asked for medium pressure, but heck I would love to know what hard pressure is.  My girl apparently was worse than Kevins.  When she would use her hands, it was good, but when she used her thumb or elbow, the pressure was too much and painful.  She really used the elbow way too much, from my back to my legs.  Also, did not get the use of the thumbs around the jaw line with pressure, really??  My back was in pain to the touch a day later, Kevin said the same thing - not the good oooh I just had a nice relaxing massage type - it actually hurts!  Happy Birthday us right?!Back to the sales pitch when we were checking out.  Would you like to schedule more massages?  No.  We can easily do that.  Still No.  We can also get you signed up for membership so that you can have a discounted rate for your massages.  Still No!  Will **never** go back there!!

name: Nails Garden
text: I was in the market for a pedicure and wasn't feeling like going to my usual place, so I scanned the Yelp reviews and stumbled upon Nails Garden.  Not only were the reviews great, but it was also 0.2 miles from my house.  Sold!It's in the strip mall with Auto Zone, Nakato and Bailey's Sports Bar, so a little sketchy, but the other reviews said don't be fooled, and I trust y'all.  The interior was completely different from the exterior - tranquil colors, helpful staff, massage chairs and TVs all help set the experience.The woman who did my pedicure was so nice and so thorough!  It was fairly quiet for a Saturday afternoon, which I really appreciated since many nail salons are loud and all about moving people in and out quickly, but I got her undivided attention.  The pedicure itself was $28, which I thought was a smidgen steep but they also give you the cute pedicure flips flops, so I'll deal with it.  I was in and out in 45 minutes, and they were the most relaxing 45 minutes I've had in a long time.  I'll be back!Update 4/24/15 - This place is still awesome, and I take back my thought on saying the prices were steep. I got a mani/pedi today, and it was $35, so there must be a group discount? Awesome service, very thorough, and a great price.

name: Blue Sky Nail Bar
text: Blue Sky just opened, and I was excited to have a new go-to nail salon so close to my house since my usual place is in south Charlotte. I stopped in around noon on a Friday for a polish change since I thought that would be an easy, less intense way to check it out than a manicure or pedicure.Blue Sky is on the far end of a strip mall-ish facility, so the inside definitely felt very sterile to me (and not sterile like you want a nail salon to feel); the walls were white, the floor was tile, there was nothing on the walls, and there was no TV. It looked like they were planning to install one, so maybe they're still getting their decor down. However, it did seem very clean, and I saw a couple of rooms that were used for waxing. But I digress!When I walked in, I told the two women behind the front desk that I needed a polish change. They asked hands or toes; I said hands, and that was the last time anyone spoke to me in English. They appeared to have a gel bar, which was pretty cool, but I'm a basic polish girl, so I I started looking for a color. Their selection was a seriously limited for natural/nude colors. They had OPI and another brand I didn't recognize, and the first color I picked looked like White Out on my nails. The technician nicely let me change and came up to the wall to help me pick. I wound up going with Bubble Bath - the only nude-ish color they had - which still isn't my favorite, but I wasn't sure how to leave halfway into a service.The technician was nice enough, and I appreciated that she filed and buffed my nails and used cuticle oil since some other places literally just change your polish on a polish change.When I left, there were two different women at the front desk/cash register. Neither of them spoke to me - they spoke to each other, trying to figure out their computer system and how much I owed them. There's a huge menu on the wall, so I pointed at it and said, "It looks like I owe $8, right?" The woman nodded and opened the cash register. I gave her a $20 and asked for $10 back, which she silently gave me, and I walked out.Maybe they're still trying to get their feet under them and learn their systems, but customer service was pretty crummy and the ambiance leaves a little to be desired. There were a couple of other women getting pedicures/manicures, and one of them had wine (perk!) and the other was having all kinds of conversation with her technician, so maybe my experience was a one-off?

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': True}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Day Spas', 'Permanent Makeup', 'Waxing', 'Nail Salons', 'Eyelash Service', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Hair Removal']
name: Nue' Brows to Brazilians + Beaute Bar
text: My usual super fun, super nice waxer moved away from Charlotte, so I decided to try out Nue after seeing a coupon online.  Like the other businesses in the 1315 building, parking can be a little tricky, but at 4:00 p.m. on a Wednesday, there were a ton of spaces in the parking deck attached.Upon entering, I have to agree with the other reviewers that it was very modern and sleek and white and clean.  I wasn't sure I was cool enough to be there!  The very nice male receptionist greeted me as I walked in the door.  The owner/waxer, Olivia, came out and introduced herself not long after, and then took me back to the waxing room, which was very bright and white and sterile.  Half of me appreciated that and half of me felt like I was in a lab, not a spa.  Olivia was very nice and tried to make conversation, but I just felt like it was... forced?She explained that the wax she uses is cold wax (whereas I've done hot wax for 15 years).  Allegedly the cold wax is supposed to adhere to the hair and not the skin making it less painful, but this was the loooongest waxing experience of my life.  Yowza.  I had my usual redness for a day or two after, but now less than two weeks later, the hair is already growing back and the skin is almost more irritated.  Apparently cold wax (or waxers) is not for me.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Anthony Vince Nail Spa
text: My friends decided to treat me to a manicure for my birthday, and they found this salon on Yelp. With such great ratings and a location that was convenient for all of us (they're in the Specialty Shops across from SouthPark Mall behind BrickTops), we decided to give it a whirl. It was easy to call and make an appointment, and we appreciated that they opened early on a Saturday morning (9:30 a.m.).When we arrived, they immediately greeted us and asked us to pick out a color. I was feeling a little less boring than my usual Bubble Bath color, and they even gave me tips on what would look good with my skin color. The three of us were able to get manicures at the same time sitting right next to each other, and the place was gorgeous inside; it was also huge. There were at least 4 alcoves with 6 pedicure chairs in each one so you could have a semi-private group area if you wanted, and I think there were 4 or 5 rows of manicure tables with 4 chairs each. I also appreciated the "Sterilization Room" in the back. They carried OPI and Essie brands.I'm not sure if it was because it was early and not busy yet, but they let us bring in our own champagne, even though they have their own there, and they even took pictures of us before we left. My friends paid for my manicure, so I can't speak to the cost, but I know they have different levels and packages. The staff were incredibly gracious and accommodating, and we loved it so much that we planned our next trip already.

name: European Wax Center
text: I recently moved to a new part of town and needed a bikini wax. I've followed my usual waxer around town for about 12 years, but I finally decided I needed someone closer. Nothing like diving in to a brand new place and new waxer with a bikini wax!The only reason I'm not giving EWC 5 stars is because the woman who greeted me talked so fast that I had to ask her 3 different times to repeat herself. Sheesh. She also didn't explain a lot of the questions she was asking. When she asked for my license, I skeptically handed it over... a few minutes later, she told me that my wax was half off since it was my first time and I was local. Would've been nice to know from the get-go!The waiting room was small but clean, and Kylie came to get me about 5 minutes after I sat down. She was so nice and normal and talked to me during the whole wax, which I appreciated to lessen the awkwardness. EWC uses a type of wax that goes on hot, then hardens as it cools, so there are no paper strips (which is what I've always had). I was a little skeptical at first, but it was fantastic - way less painful than hot wax slathered on your skin and then papers rubbed on! It took maybe 15-20 minutes to do the whole thing, and I never felt uncomfortable. Kylie said she'd been an aesthetician for 12 years, and I completely trusted her.When it comes to waxing, it's realllly hard to find 1) a good waxer who's 2) normal and comfortable 3) at a salon 4) with a website that lists all their services/prices and 5) accepts bookings online and 6) takes credit cards. This might be the holy grail of waxing!

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Tips & Toes
text: The fella lives in Fort Mill, and I was in the market for a pedicure, so I found Tips & Toes thanks to Yelp. I stopped in after work on a Friday around 5:00, and the woman told me it would just be a few minutes while she finished up a manicure. I quickly realized she's a one-woman show, and it was good thing I got there when I did because they close at 6:00, and no one else had an appointment at 5:00.The pedicure was spot-on - massage chair, clean utensils, leg massage, heel scrub, $24 - and there was a small TV in the corner along with some magazines by the pedicure chairs. Conversation was great and helped pass the time; the pedicure took about 35-40 minutes. When I got home, I noticed there was a little polish on the skin around my big toe even though she was pretty thorough with using nail polish remover to get rid of an excess, but it was pretty easy to pick off myself. I had my work shoes on, and it was nice that she sold flip flops for $1! I just wore the pedicure flips out, but it was a nice touch. I'll be back, and I'll definitely make an appointment. And they do take credit cards... phew.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Modern Nails
text: Some friends and I were looking for a centrally-located place to meet for pedicures, and we choose Modern after reading the Yelp reviews. I called on Monday to make reservations for Saturday morning for three pedicures, and they were ready for us when we arrived.The place is a little small, but there are 4 massaging pedicure chairs in the back. They're across from the staff fridge and washer/dryer, so I had to dock a star for ambiance. The decor is still fairly modern, and the place felt very clean. We all went with the deluxe pedicure ($40) over the regular ($25), and it was divine! Rubbing, scrubbing, lotion, paraffin... I wasn't even sure what some of it was, but it was so relaxing and heavenly.The whole pedicure took about an hour, and the staff was fun and talked with us about great Restaurant in Charlotte - my favorite topic! Oh, and they take credit cards, but there's a sign suggesting cash tips.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
categories: ['Beauty & Spa', 'Skin Care', 'Medical Spas', 'Health & Medical', 'Laser Hair Removal', 'Hair Removal']
name: Sona Dermatology & MedSpa of Charlotte - Ballantyne
text: Man, I'm really surprised to see all the negative reviews! I visited Sona a few years ago after a girlfriend told me how happy she was with their laser hair removal. They were running a 2-for-1 deal (as they usually seem to do), so I got two areas for the price of one (around $1,000, but they were two small-ish areas). I believe their package included 6 treatments, which took a little over a year to complete since your hair grows in cycles. My hair is really dark and coarse, and my skin is very fair, so it was pretty darn painful. But beauty hurts! The staff couldn't have been more helpful, patient, and pleasant, and I never had any problems with getting right in on the schedule.I needed a few more treatment after the six were over, and those were included. Since then, I've gone back about once a year for touch-ups at 75% of the typical price. My last visit was just a few months ago, and the service was spot-on.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Lacquer Lounge Nail Bar
text: Lacquer Lounge is in the newly-developed (and still-being-developed) Kingsley neighborhood right across from Panera and Starbucks. Parking is a little tricky, but I went during lunch on a Friday, so it wasn't too hard to find a spot, and the place wasn't too busy.When I walked in, I was promptly greeted, and the man behind the counter asked what service I needed and if I wanted something to drink. I went with the Express Pedicure ($25) and a water, and when I asked about picking a color, he brought a basket over to me. Ok, y'all, I'm admittedly old school (and just old), but I like perusing the wall of bottles, flipping them over to see the name, and holding onto a couple before I make my final decision. Lacquer Lounge has a basket full of plastic nails painted in colors with a number on the back; you pick the color you like and I assume they match it up based on the number (gel or regular). This OCD lady had a bit of a panic moment - do they have OPI Koala Berry? what if I accidentally pick OPI Red because it looks good on the nail but definitely not on my pale, translucent skin? Thankfully, he saw my panic and asked what colors I usually get. I blurted out OPI Cajun Shrimp, and they had it. Phew.The rest of the pedicure was much less neurotic than the beginning. The woman who did it was incredibly nice and engaging when I wanted to talk but didn't force me to talk, which I appreciated. The Express Pedicure is definitely quick - I was in an out in less than 30 minutes - and not a bad price but still gives you the hot towel, shaping, and callus/cuticle removal. The place itself is spotless and brand new with air dryers built into the manicure stands and the massage controller built into the armrest on the pedicure chairs - fancy! According to their menu of services, they also do waxing, eyelash extensions, relaxation facial masks, and reflexology foot massages. And I was a walk-in, but I could see that having an appointment would be helpful during busy times. I'll definitely be back!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
name: Parvin Spa
text: Parvin is AMAZING. I've been going to her for 10+ years; for a long time, she was the only person in town who could do threading, and she was a pro at it. I agree with everyone else that she is a waxing guru - fast, efficient, and professional. Once or twice I've had to go somewhere else for a wax, and I'm horrified by how much longer it takes and how much more painful it is. I've been going to her so long now that I can just text her to set an appointment, and she's incredibly flexible and responsive... not to mention her prices can't be beat (cash or check only).

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'Caters': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'RestaurantTakeOut': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Walgreens
text: Located in what seems like the middle of nowhere is a walgreens that doesn't stay open 24 hours and the pharmacy had wicked hours of operation. I'm learning that Fort Mill is still the country which I'm fine with but I would love the walgreens to be open 24 hours. I did ask about the funky hours and the staff told me it's because there's not enough doctor offices in the area and the traffic isn't enough to warrant staying open all the time. Nonetheless I like coming here because everyone is friendly and ready to accommodate excellent customer service. If I want 24 hours I would have to drive to Rock Hill...no thanks.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Spa Alexis Massage & Bodywork
text: Alexis is very knowledgeable and very professional.  Great location.  I have visited several times for treatment for a very specific issue and Alexis has been helpful each time.  I highly recommend her.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Spa Alexis Massage & Bodywork
text: Excellent massage with firm strokes that provides a magical cure for aching backs, arms and knees. Alexis is very, very skilled at her work and I really like the fact that she goes to work straight on the area requested instead of spending 50% of the time on other areas. The one issue - she is comparatively pricier  than almost everyone else that I have seen in Houston.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Spa Alexis Massage & Bodywork
text: Alexis is amazing! Over the years I have been to a few different massage therapists and she is by far the best. She is the only one in her office, so it is always quiet and her focus is on you. Most massages I've had feel great during, but then I leave basically feeling the same as when I walked in. With Alexis, this is not the case. She really listens to you and massages what you need her to, instead of other places where they just go thru their typical 30 min massage and kind of ignore whatever you tell them is bothering you (or at least that has been my experience ). She is a little pricey, which is probably the only thing that keeps me from going every week. Parking can be difficult - I always have to park across the street and cross Sage to get to her office. But it is definitely worth the money - trust me. Best massage therapist hands down.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Spa Alexis Massage & Bodywork
text: Parking is a bit difficult but I was much less pleased with her attitude and  treatment towards me than anything else. We had a  misunderstanding about the massage I was requesting, which I was willing to let go, however she kept defending what she claimed to have said as opposed to just letting it go as a misunderstanding. Despite knowing I very specifically asked her twice (I had to ask her twice because what she was saying about extending the massage seemed to contradict her saying there was no need for it) if extending my massage time to 90 minutes from 60 minutes would allow the entire time for lymphatic massage and her answering yes I was willing to go with the flow. She did however offer to do the entire thing lymphatic. I agree, go to the bathroom, come back to fill out the paper work and she is being abrasively pushy about INSISTING I sit down instead of stand. It was just word and very hostile. I do sit down and mutter "wow" to myself.After this she did suggest we just not go through with it free of charge so I appreciate that as good business.  However I would've been much happier to have just been able to get a word in edge wise without feeling like she was talking down to me and defending what I had decided to chalk up to a misunderstanding. She made it a much bigger deal and worse experience than it needed to be by feeling the need to prove she was right.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'HairSpecializesIn': {'coloring': True, 'africanamerican': False, 'curly': True, 'perms': True, 'kids': True, 'extensions': True, 'asian': True, 'straightperms': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: ANiU Salon Spa
text: My boss's boss and I came here today-- had a really good experience! Elizabeth ('Level 2') cut my hair, and she was very responsive and had some good suggestions. She was friendly but not too chatty.I like the straightforward price guide.Jennifer got a massage from Veronica, and said that it was perfect, just the way she likes them.All in all, a successful way to make my boss totally jealous. And feel good.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Alan Koa Salon & Spa
text: I got into town early and needed a pedicure for my meeting and shoes for tomorrow.  The hotel recommended that I try Cameo (which has moved and is at 10 w. Mifflin St  phone 608-284-1956).  They were able to get me in for their last appointment, beginning at 8:15 pm.  I am so thrilled that they could.  I have a new home away from home spa! I lucked out and had Marina as my technician.  Despite it being the end of the day, Marina did not rush me.  I had a chance to chill in the quiet room before- great chaise lounges, crackling simulated fire going in the fireplace and relaxing music.  Once it was my turn, the good things kept coming!  They offer new massage chairs, and Aveda products.My feet are dancing with joy.  I had an outstanding paraffin pedicure- my toes have not looked better in a long time.  To top it off, I received coupons for my next visit- 10% off.  It was well worth the price (45$, but I think I got a special deal) and much less than I would have paid at home.  I am now working my schedule to make sure I have time to visit when I am back in town in a couple of weeks.THANKS CAMEO and Marina especially!  It was outstanding!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Princeton Club
text: I am kind of surprised at the number of negative reviews. As is often the case, I feel the polar opposite. After moving to the Madison area and using a pay per go option at a local high school pool, I stopped here to check out memberships. To my surprise, a monthly membership (I chose the two-year plan) was less than what I was paying per month just to swim at the high school, with limited hours and access. And coming from the Chicago area, where a huge club like this one would cost twice as much as I'm paying, I am now happy to be using not only a non-crowded pool, but the adjacent sauna/steam/small resistance pool and "hanging out" area. Not to mention the 1/10th mile track and the plethora of exercise equipment. This will make winter in Madison  a lot more tolerable. I've had limited interaction with staff, nor have I taken classes. There is a great selection of those to choose from. And my interactions with the membership rep, Matt, were seamless, easy and quick.  . The Locker room facility is spacious and lockers are the real "adult" full length ones. All areas are kept very clean, as well. I'm really happy to have found this gym.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: La Vie Nails & Spa
text: My best friend is cooler than your best friend!  Why?  because she skipped the traditional bachelorette party nonsense, and instead, her whole bridal party got pampered.  I love pedicures.  My nail tech was super.  She spent a lot of time getting my nails perfect.  And the leg rubdown was awesome!I had my first ever manicure here and it was sooo relaxing.  My nails looked incredible!   I did the french manicure, and it did not make me look like a hooker.  It was extremely neat and very flattering.We should have investigated if they are byob or not.  We didn't bring anything, but it'd be something to ask about.   I mean, alcohol does make things entertaining, but the array of celebrity magazines kept me hooked.  (Snooki's baby is actually cute!)I can't comment on the cost of said services, bc my friend paid for all of us.  yup, she really is cooler than your bestie!

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Anaala Salon & Spa
text: I love Aveda salons, so when I moved to Madison, I sought out one and ended up making Anaala my salon of choice. Easy appointment making online or by phone. Different levels of stylists at different prices for a haircut (typically for most Aveda salons). Stylists are usually punctual with appointment times. My old salon did a bit more in terms of services that accompanied a haircut (head massage, hand massage), but Anaala definitely meets the expectations of a great Aveda salon.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Union Hair Parlor
text: I had a great hair experience (hair-perience?) here. The staff here is very friendly and welcoming, and they also have a variety of complimentary beverages (alcoholic and non-alcoholic). So far, I've had two visits here...the first was a color consult with Jessica. I expressed my interest in bleaching all/part of my hair, and she talked me through the whole process and brought up issues that my hair might have after the process. After talking it through with her, I decided to go with some ombre instead of whole head bleaching. As I made an appointment, she advised me to bring in some looks next time, which I did. Since I have dark hair, it took me two appointments to bleach and tone my hair to the color I wanted, and Jessica even stayed way after the salon closed on the second appointment to finish my hair. I received a lot of compliments on my new ombre hair, so I would definitely recommend Jessica and Union Hair Parlor for your hair coloring needs! Also, there's a 10% discount if you have a Bicycle Benefits sticker :)

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 1, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
categories: ['Nail Salons', 'Specialty Schools', 'Beauty & Spa', 'Hair Salons', 'Cosmetology Schools', 'Skin Care', 'Education']
name: Aveda Institute Madison Salon
text: Vici is conveniently (for students, at least) located at 333 East Campus Mall. Their salon is upstairs and looks pretty nice. They have a wide range of Aveda hair products, as well as nail polish and makeup. As far as services go, I was satisfied with my haircut. It wasn't anything too complicated, just a trim, but it did take an hour. The head massage was nice but very brief. I also had a color service which was two foils. The color I asked for and the color I got were not the same, but I was satisfied with the result nonetheless. It did take twice as long as I was expecting, which was annoying.Summary: cheap, but will take a long time; also don't ask for anything too complicated.

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'HairSpecializesIn': {'coloring': True, 'africanamerican': False, 'curly': True, 'perms': False, 'kids': False, 'extensions': False, 'asian': False, 'straightperms': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: THORPS haircuts & color
text: Booked a haircut with Sadie through their online booking system, which was easy to use. Showed up on time, was not offered any beverages. Sadie was professional, but not very chatty. Wash, dry, cut all happened in about 40 minutes. Haircut turned out fine, but it was a really simple cut (long bob). I really like the products Thorps carries (Davines), but did not get a very welcoming overall vibe. Maybe I'm not cool enough? Bikers do receive a 10% off discount with their Bike Benefits sticker. Haircut prices are reasonable ($25-$30) but also depend on how much experience your stylist has. If you're looking to spend less money, take a gamble on their intern(s).

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: SolEscape Healing Arts
text: I had a 30 min massage appointment on Oct 11 with Kirsten Martin for muscle soreness and tension in my neck and shoulders, which I let her know about. During the massage, Kirsten used a lot of force to the point where it was very painful at times. I didn't speak up at the time because I thought this was normal, but speaking to colleagues and friends afterward about my experience, they told me that massage shouldn't be painful. I left last night feeling some relief from the muscle soreness and tension, but woke up this morning feeling worse. My neck, where she focused a lot of pressure, is tender to the touch and I am feeling soreness moving my neck around. I felt worse after the massage than I did going in.I emailed SolEscape with this information/feedback on Oct. 12 and they never responded.

attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Fabulous Nails & Spa
text: 2 stars because the guy who did my Mom's mani/pedi was so patient and nice, but I can't see ever returning to this dimly lit salon at West Towne. Wayyy overpriced. Tired and grungy. And I tipped way too much because I always feel guilty for what shouldn't be a big deal -- mom is paralyzed on the left and can't move her own arm and leg on that side. A better nail salon would take it all in stride. My nail tech yawned and stretched the whole time, making me feel guilty for her being a nail tech. Not cool! I wanted to say "suck it up! I'm a nurse and you should try THAT for 12 hours!" It just felt unprofessional the whole time, and why would you pay $47 each for that? And that's for Mom not getting any polish and me only getting my toes polished! I'm dumb. But only once.

attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'WheelchairAccessible': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Cha Cha Beauty & Barber
text: This place is super hip, so if that's not your thing....I've been here twice so far, and I'll keep coming. The staff is cool & laid back. The interior is pretty fun. I personally wouldn't bother with the buzz club on Fridays - it takes a lot of time, but they do a good job of course :).

attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Blues A Cut & Color Studio
text: Went in for the first time a couple weeks ago, and got the one of the best haircuts of my life from Chloxc3xa9 for only $25. She even sent a follow up thank you note and coupon. I'm not picky about where I get my haircut, but I'll definitely be back!

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Soap Opera
text: Bath and Body works makes you smell like a gang of teenage prostitute, while L'Occitane makes you feel even poorer than you are, and Crabtree and Evelyn makes you feel you should only put their stuff out for overnight guests. And all three make guys feel like total pansies for being even within five feet of the doorway.Soap Opera is that happy medium, my friends.  It always smells good in there, but in a non-distracting, general way. They have a decent men's grooming section - razors, brushes, other manly grooming items - but more importantly, they have a lot of interesting toothpastes, soaps, and oils. It feels a little like an apothecary.They also have a lot of perfume oils you can buy, which you can then use as perfume, in lotions, in shampoo, as a room freshener, or what have you. You can blend your own scents or choose a pre-made one. The fig/moss scent is the best and I don't even wear fragrance.Service is always good. They're nice and helpful even if you have a dumb question. If you need a gift in a pinch, this is the place to go. Also if this is important to you, they're local.

attributes: {'DogsAllowed': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: The Soap Opera
text: I was quite overwhelmed with the amount of soap in this store. I'd hate to see the bubbly mess if the store was flooded. Whatever it is you are searching for it has to be in this store. It has many of your natural brands that can be hard to find in certain towns.
